english_source: The ancestral homeland of Umuguma was located on the banks of the Nwaorie river, where Holy Ghost College (Arugo High School) Owerri is now located. Oratta's offspring include Ekwema and Arugo. Ekwema begat Owerre and Arugo begat Umuguma. Since Umuguma endured suffering due to the actions of Owerre, many boundaries were redrawn in the latter's favor and thus most of the area is now known as "New Owerri."[3] This term was created by recent settlers and non-indigenous individuals. Others however, take a different stance, believing the Owerri Municipal Local Government relied on the moniker to usurp some Owerri West or Umuguma land for their use.
target1_text: Gidan kakannin Umuguma ya kasance a gaɓar bakin Kogin Nwaorie, inda Kwalejin Ruhi Mai Tsarki (Arugo High School) Owerri theake yanzu. Yaran Oratta sun haɗa da Ekwema da Arugo . Ekwema ta haifi Owerre kuma Arugo ta haifi Umuguma. Tun lokacin da Umuguma ta jure da wahala saboda ayyukan Owerre, an sake zana iyakoki da yawa a cikin ni'imar na ƙarshe kuma ta haka ne yawancin yankin yanzu aka sani da "Sabon Owerri". [1] Wannan kalmar ta samo asali ne daga mazauna kwanan nan da waɗanda ba ƴan asalin ƙasar ba. Sauran duk da haka, suna ɗaukar matsayi daban, suna gaskata cewa ƙaramar hukumar Owerri ta dogara da sunan don kwace wasu ƙasashen Owerri West ko Umuguma don amfani da su.
target2_text: Gidan kakannin Umuguma ya kasance a bakin Kogin Nwaorie, inda Kwalejin Ruhu Mai Tsarki (Arugo High School) Owerri yake yanzu. Yaran Oratta sun hada da Ekwema da Arugo . Ekwema ta haifi Owerre kuma Arugo ta haifi Umuguma. Tun lokacin da Umuguma ta jimre da wahala saboda ayyukan Owerre, an sake zana iyakoki da yawa a cikin ni'imar na ƙarshe kuma ta haka ne yawancin yankin yanzu aka sani da "Sabon Owerri". [1] Wannan kalmar ta samo asali ne daga mazauna kwanan nan da wadanda ba 'yan asalin ƙasar ba. Sauran duk da haka, suna ɗaukar matsayi daban, suna gaskata cewa karamar hukumar Owerri ta dogara da sunan don kwace wasu ƙasashen Owerri West ko Umuguma don amfani da su.

english_source: The affairs of the Town Union are presided over by the President-General, who oversees other Umuguma Town Union branch presidents, and is the custodian of the Town Union at home. The President-General is elected at a general assembly - the present elected President-General is Engineer Uzoma Kenneth Osuagwu (elected 2014).
target1_text: Shugaban-Janar ne ke jagorantar al'amuran Tarayyar Birnin, wanda ke kula da sauran shugabannin reshen Rundunar Jama'a, kuma shine mai kula da Tarayyar Garin a gida. Ana zaɓar Shugaban-Janar a babban taro - Shugaban-Jar da aka zaɓa a yanzu shine Injiniya Uzoma Kenneth Osuagwu (wanda aka zaɓa.
target2_text: Shugaban-Janar ne ke jagorantar al'amuran Tarayyar Birnin, wanda ke kula da sauran shugabannin reshen Rundunar Jama'a, kuma shine mai kula da Tarayyar Garin a gida. Ana zabar Shugaban-Janar a babban taro - Shugaban-Jar da aka zaba a yanzu shine Injiniya Uzoma Kenneth Osuagwu (wanda aka zaba a shekarar 2014).

english_source: Brahim Chergui (1922 – 7 January 2016), known as H'mida was a revolutionary during the Algerian war of independence. He was the first leader of the Zone Autonome d'Alger (ZAA).[1] Chergui was captured by French paratroopers on 23 February 1957. He was placed into the cell next door to Larbi Ben M'hidi. Chergui was severely tortured and was imprisoned in the Serkadji prison in Algiers until being released when Algeria gained independence in 1962.[2] Chergui died at the age of 94 in Hôpital Militaire Aïn Naâdja, Algiers on 6 January 2016.
target1_text: Brahim Chergui (1922 - 7 ga Janairu 2016), wanda aka fi sani da H'mida ɗan juyin-juya hali ne a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya . Shi ne shugaban farko na Zone Autonome d'Alger (ZAA). [1] Sojojin Faransa sun kama Chergui a ranar 23 ga Fabrairun 1957. An sanya shi a cikin tantanin da ke kusa da Larbi Ben M'hidi . An azabtar da Chergui mai tsanani kuma an tsare shi a kurkukun Serkadji a Algiers har zuwa lokacin da aka sake shi lokacin da Aljeriya ta sami 'yancin kai a 1962. [2] Chergui ya mutu yana da shekaru 94 a asibitin Militaire Ain Naâdja, Algiers a ranar 6 ga Janairu 2016.
target2_text: Brahim Chergui (1922 - 7 ga watan Janairu 2016), wanda aka fi sani da H'mida ɗan juyin-juya hali ne a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya. Shi ne shugaban farko na Zone Autonome d'Alger (ZAA). [1] Sojojin Faransa sun kama Chergui a ranar 23 ga watan Fabrairun 1957. An sanya shi a cikin tantanin da ke kusa da Larbi Ben M'hidi. An azabtar da Chergui da a zaba mai tsanani kuma an tsare shi a kurkukun Serkadji a Algiers har zuwa lokacin da aka sake shi lokacin da Aljeriya ta sami 'yancin kai a shekarar 1962. [2] Chergui ya mutu yana da shekaru 94 a asibitin Militaire Ain Naâdja, Algiers a ranar 6 ga watan Janairu 2016.

english_source: Omar Derdour (Arabic: عمر دردور), full name Abou El Kacem Omar Derdour (13 October 1913 – 19 March 2009), was an Algerian Muslim leader, nationalist, and political worker.
target1_text: Omar Derdour ( Arabic ), cikakken suna Abou El Kacem Omar Derdour (13 Oktoba 1913 - 19 Maris 2009), shugaban musulmin Aljeriya ne, mai kishin kasa, kuma ma'aikacin siyasa.
target2_text: Omar Derdour cikakken suna Abou El Kacem Omar Derdour (13 Oktoba 1913 - 19 Maris 2009), shugaban musulmin Aljeriya ne, mai kishin ƙasa, kuma ma'aikacin siyasa.

english_source: In 1936 Omar Derdour and a group of fellow students founded a division of the Algerian Muslim Scholars Association and became active in education in the fields of religious and national awareness.[3] In 1937, Derdour returned to his village to establish a madrasa for the education of children and adults.[1] Ben Badis considered him the "soul of the Islahiste[a] movement in the Aures".[2] At the end of 1937, the French authorities became aware of his activities and imprisoned him in Batna for "inciting the population to civil disobedience".[5] Derdour was released on 6 January 1938, but was imprisoned a second time in August 1939 to complete his four-month sentence and was fined 8,000 francs. He was released in September 1939 upon the outbreak of World War II (1939-1945).[6] During the war the authorities suppressed all political activities, and he was forced to limit himself to non-political education.[3]
target1_text: A shekara ta 1936 Omar Derdour tare da wasu gungun ɗalibai sun kafa wani ɓangare na kungiyar malaman musulmi ta Aljeriya kuma suka kasance masu fafutuka a fannin ilimi a fagen ilimin addini da na ƙasa. [ 3 ] A shekara ta 1937, Derdour ya koma ƙauyensa don kafa makarantar koyar da yara da manya. [ 1 ] Ben Badis ya ɗauke shi a matsayin "rai na Islahiste [ a ] motsi a cikin Aures". [ 2 ] A ƙarshen shekarar 1937, hukumomin Faransa sun fahimci ayyukansa kuma suka ɗaure shi a Batna saboda "tunanin jama'a ga rashin biyayya". [ 5 ] An saki Derdour a ranar 6 ga watan Janairun 1938, amma an ɗaure shi a karo na biyu a watan Agustan 1939 don kammala hukuncin ɗaurin watanni huɗu kuma an ci tarar 8,000 francs. An sake shi a watan Satumba na 1939 a lokacin ɓarkewar yakin duniya na biyu (1939-1945). [ 6 ] A lokacin yakin hukumomi sun dakile duk wasu harkokin siyasa, kuma an tilasta masa ya takaita kan ilimin da ba na siyasa ba. [ 3 ]
target2_text: A shekara ta 1936 Omar Derdour tare da wasu gungun dalibai sun kafa wani bangare na kungiyar malaman musulmi ta Aljeriya kuma suka kasance masu fafutuka a fannin ilimi a fagen ilimin addini da na kasa. [ 3 ] A shekara ta 1937, Derdour ya koma ƙauyensa don kafa makarantar koyar da yara da manya. [ 1 ] Ben Badis ya dauke shi a matsayin "rai na Islahiste [ a ] motsi a cikin Aures". [ 2 ] A ƙarshen 1937, hukumomin Faransa sun fahimci ayyukansa kuma suka ɗaure shi a Batna saboda "tunanin jama'a ga rashin biyayya". [ 5 ] An saki Derdour a ranar 6 ga Janairun 1938, amma an daure shi a karo na biyu a watan Agustan 1939 don kammala hukuncin daurin watanni hudu kuma an ci tarar 8,000 francs. An sake shi a watan Satumba na 1939 a lokacin barkewar yakin duniya na biyu (1939-1945). [ 6 ] A lokacin yakin hukumomi sun dakile duk wasu harkokin siyasa, kuma an tilasta masa ya takaita kan ilimin da ba na siyasa ba. [ 3 ]

english_source: After Algeria gained independence, Omar Derdour devoted himself to teaching Islam and Arabic. He founded the first Islamic institute in Batna in May 1963, followed by the creation of similar institutions in several cities across the country, reaching 10,000 students.[2] In 1981, Derdour was appointed director of the institute in Sidi Okba for training imams and regional inspectors of religious affairs in Batna, Khenchela and Oum El Bouaghi, holding this position until his retirement.[9] In 1986, Derdour was appointed regional inspector of Religious Affairs in Batna and Khenchela provinces.[3] In the 2000s he built a mosque and a zawiya in the locality of El Hamza in the municipality of Oued Taga and a school in the village of his birth.[9]
target1_text: Bayan da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai, Omar Derdour ya dukufa wajen koyar da addinin Musulunci da Larabci. Ya kafa cibiyar Musulunci ta farko a garin Batna a watan Mayun shekarar 1963, sannan ya samar da irin waɗannan cibiyoyi a garuruwa da dama na ƙasar, inda ya kai ɗalibai 10,000. [ 2 ] A cikin shekarar 1981, an naɗa Derdour darektan cibiyar da ke Sidi Okba don horar da limamai da masu kula da harkokin addini na yankin Batna, Khenchela da Oum El Bouaghi, yana riƙe da wannan muƙamin har sai da ya yi ritaya. [ 9 ] A cikin shekarar 1986, an naɗa Derdour mai kula da harkokin addini na yanki a lardunan Batna da Khenchela. [ 3 ] A cikin shekarun 2000 ya gina masallaci da zawiya a unguwar El Hamza da ke ƙaramar hukumar Oued Taga da kuma makaranta a ƙauyen da aka haife shi. [ 9 ]
target2_text: Bayan da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai, Omar Derdour ya dukufa wajen koyar da addinin Musulunci da Larabci. Ya kafa cibiyar Musulunci ta farko a garin Batna a watan Mayun shekarar 1963, sannan ya samar da irin wadannan cibiyoyi a garuruwa da dama na kasar, inda ya kai dalibai 10,000. [ 2 ] A cikin 1981, an nada Derdour darektan cibiyar da ke Sidi Okba don horar da limamai da masu kula da harkokin addini na yankin Batna, Khenchela da Oum El Bouaghi, yana rike da wannan mukamin har sai da ya yi ritaya. [ 9 ] A cikin 1986, an nada Derdour mai kula da harkokin addini na yanki a lardunan Batna da Khenchela . [ 3 ] A cikin shekarun 2000 ya gina masallaci da zawiya a unguwar El Hamza da ke karamar hukumar Oued Taga da kuma makaranta a kauyen da aka haife shi. [ 9 ]

english_source: Following the descent of "Rehaim" on March 18, 1950; the dismantling of a large part of the organization's network, which resulted in the arrest of 130 people and the discovery of his responsibilities in the structure; and the failure of the French administration to capture him, a judgment was entered against him in absentia that sentenced him to 10 years in prison. In 1952, with Ben Boulaïd, he created the core of a clandestine movement in Algiers, whose mission was to make bombs in anticipation of the outbreak of the "National Revolution".
target1_text: Bayan saukar "Rehaim" a ranar 18 ga watan Maris, 1950; tarwatsa wani babban ɓangare na hanyoyin sadarwa na kungiyar, wanda ya yi sanadin kama mutane 130 tare da gano nauyin da ke kansa a cikin tsarin; da gazawar gwamnatin Faransa wajen kama shi, an yanke masa hukuncin ɗaurin shekaru 10 a gidan yari ba ya nan. A cikin shekarar 1952, tare da Ben Boulaïd, ya kirkiro ginshiƙan motsi na ɓoye a Algiers, wanda manufarsa ita ce yin bama-bamai a cikin tsammanin ɓarkewar "Juyin Juyin Hali na Ƙasa".
target2_text: Bayan saukar "Rehaim" a ranar 18 ga Maris, 1950; tarwatsa wani babban bangare na hanyoyin sadarwa na kungiyar, wanda ya yi sanadin kama mutane 130 tare da gano nauyin da ke kansa a cikin tsarin; da gazawar gwamnatin Faransa wajen kama shi, an yanke masa hukuncin daurin shekaru 10 a gidan yari ba ya nan. A cikin 1952, tare da Ben Boulaïd, ya kirkiro ginshiƙan motsi na ɓoye a Algiers, wanda manufarsa ita ce yin bama-bamai a cikin tsammanin barkewar "Juyin Juyin Halitta na Ƙasa".

english_source: On January 18, 1955, when he was not yet 28 years old, he died at the Battle of Douar Souadek, (Conde-Smendou), near Constantine. He was the first wilaya leader to fall.
target1_text: Ranar 18 ga Janairu, 1955, lokacin da bai kai shekara 28 ba, ya mutu a yakin Douar Souadek, (Conde-Smendou), kusa da Constantine . Shi ne shugaban wilaya na farko da ya fadi.
target2_text: Ranar 18 ga watan Janairu, 1955, lokacin da bai kai shekara 28 ba, ya mutu a yakin Douar Souadek, (Conde-Smendou), kusa da Constantine. Shi ne shugaban wilaya na farko da ya faɗi.

english_source: From the creation in 1947 of the Special Organization (OS), he was one of its founding and most active members.
target1_text: Daga halittar a 1947 na Special Organisation (OS), ya kasance daya daga cikin kafa da kuma mafi m membobi.
target2_text: Daga ƙirƙirar a shekarar 1947 na Special Organisation (OS), ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin wanda ya kafa da kuma mafi inganci acikin membobin.

english_source: Ighilahriz was born in Oujda to a Berber family and her family moved to Algiers in 1948. Though she was born in Morocco, the Ighilahriz family originated from the Kabylie region of Algeria, whose Berber tribes had been some of the fiercest opponents of French rule in Algeria. Ighilahriz "describes herself as coming from a whole family of nationalists," calling her mother "illiterate but hyperpoliticised" and saying that her maternal grandfather clandestinely manufactured guns for "revolutionaries."[2] When hearing about the beginning of the Algerian War on 1 November 1954, her father, who worked as a baker, told her: "It is the end of the humiliation".[3]
target1_text: An haifi Ighilahriz a Oujda ga dangin Berber kuma danginta sun ƙaura zuwa Algiers a shekarar 1948. Ko da yake an haife ta a Maroko, dangin Ighilahriz sun samo asali ne daga yankin Kabylie na Aljeriya, wanda ƙabilar Berber suka kasance daga cikin masu adawa da mulkin Faransa a Aljeriya. Ighilahriz "ta bayyana kanta a matsayin ta fito daga dukan dangin 'yan kishin ƙasa," tana mai kiran mahaifiyarta "marasa rubutu amma mai yawan siyasa" tare da cewa kakanta na uwa ya kera bindigogi a ɓoye don "masu juyin juya hali." [1] Lokacin da aka ji labarin farkon yakin Aljeriya a ranar 1 ga watan Nuwamba 1954, mahaifinta, wanda ya yi aiki a matsayin mai burodi, ya gaya mata: "Wannan shine ƙarshen wulakanci". [2]
target2_text: An haifi Ighilahriz a Oujda ga dangin Berber kuma danginta sun ƙaura zuwa Algiers a 1948. Ko da yake an haife ta a Maroko, dangin Ighilahriz sun samo asali ne daga yankin Kabylie na Aljeriya, wanda kabilar Berber suka kasance daga cikin masu adawa da mulkin Faransa a Aljeriya. Ighilahriz "ta bayyana kanta a matsayin ta fito daga dukan dangin 'yan kishin kasa," tana mai kiran mahaifiyarta "marasa rubutu amma mai yawan siyasa" tare da cewa kakanta na uwa ya kera bindigogi a boye don "masu juyin juya hali." [1] Lokacin da aka ji labarin farkon yakin Aljeriya a ranar 1 ga Nuwamba 1954, mahaifinta, wanda ya yi aiki a matsayin mai burodi, ya gaya mata: "Wannan shine ƙarshen wulakanci". [2]

english_source: After Algeria gained independence, Zbiri was appointed to command the 5th Military Region and was actively engaged in the reorganization of the newly formed Algerian People's National Army (ANP). In 1963, Zbiri was promoted to chief of staff of the People's National Army, while maintaining the rank of colonel, which was the highest military rank at the time. During this period, Colonel Houari Boumédiène held the position of minister of Defense.[1] Zbiri played a central role in the 1965 military coup, which overthrew president Ahmed Ben Bella and brought Houari Boumédiène to power. Following the coup, Zbiri became a member of the Council of the Revolution, the governing body established by Boumédiène's regime.[3]
target1_text: Bayan da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai, an nada Zbiri ya zama kwamandan yankin soji na 5 kuma ya taka rawar gani wajen sake fasalin sabuwar rundunar sojojin kasar Aljeriya (ANP). A shekarar 1963, Zbiri ya samu mukamin babban hafsan hafsoshin sojojin kasa, yayin da yake rike da mukamin Kanal, wanda shi ne mafi girman mukamin soja a lokacin. A wannan lokacin, Kanar Houari Boumédiène ya rike mukamin ministan tsaro . [1] Zbiri ya taka muhimmiyar rawa a juyin mulkin soja na 1965, wanda ya hambarar da shugaba Ahmed Ben Bella kuma ya kawo Houari Boumédiène kan mulki. Bayan juyin mulkin, Zbiri ya zama mamba na majalisar juyin juya hali, hukumar da gwamnatin Boumédiène ta kafa. [1]
target2_text: Bayan da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai, an naɗa Zbiri ya zama kwamandan yankin soji na 5 kuma ya taka rawar gani wajen sake fasalin sabuwar rundunar sojojin ƙasar Aljeriya (ANP). A shekarar 1963, Zbiri ya samu muƙamin babban hafsan hafsoshin sojojin kasa, yayin da yake riƙe da muƙamin Kanal, wanda shi ne mafi girman muƙamin soja a lokacin. A wannan lokacin, Kanar Houari Boumédiène ya riƙe muƙamin ministan tsaro. [1] Zbiri ya taka muhimmiyar rawa a juyin mulkin soja na shekarar 1965, wanda ya hambarar da shugaba Ahmed Ben Bella kuma ya kawo Houari Boumédiène kan mulki. Bayan juyin mulkin, Zbiri ya zama mamba na majalisar juyin juya hali, hukumar da gwamnatin Boumédiène ta kafa. [1]

english_source: Following the failed coup, Zbiri spent several years in hiding and exile.[1] There is limited information on his activities during this period, though he reportedly spent time in neighboring countries.[9] Eventually, Zbiri was allowed to return to Algeria, although his influence on national politics significantly diminished after the failed coup.[9]
target1_text: Bayan juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba, Zbiri ya kwashe shekaru da dama yana ɓuya da gudun hijira. [1] Akwai taƙaitaccen bayani game da ayyukansa a wannan lokacin, kodayake an ba da rahoton cewa ya shafe lokaci a ƙasashe makwabta. [1] Daga karshe dai an kyale Zbiri ya koma ƙasar Aljeriya, duk da cewa tasirinsa a siyasar ƙasar ya ragu matuka bayan juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba. [1]
target2_text: Bayan juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba, Zbiri ya kwashe shekaru da dama yana buya da gudun hijira . [1] Akwai taƙaitaccen bayani game da ayyukansa a wannan lokacin, kodayake an ba da rahoton cewa ya shafe lokaci a ƙasashe makwabta . [1] Daga karshe dai an kyale Zbiri ya koma kasar Aljeriya, duk da cewa tasirinsa a siyasar kasar ya ragu matuka bayan juyin mulkin da bai yi nasara ba. [1]

english_source: Zbiri was regarded as one of the notable figures in Algerian history due to his attempt to challenge the political establishment and military during a period of consolidation for the newly independent state.[10] His role was often viewed in the broader context of the power struggles and factionalism that characterized Algeria's early post-independence years.[11]
target1_text: An ɗauki Zbiri a matsayin ɗaya daga cikin fitattun mutane a tarihin ƙasar Aljeriya saboda yunkurinsa na ƙalubalantar kafa siyasa da soja a lokacin da ake samun haɗin kai ga sabuwar ƙasa mai cin gashin kanta. [1] Ana kallon rawar da ya taka a fagen gwagwarmayar mulki da ɓangaranci wanda ya nuna farkon shekarun da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai. [2]
target2_text: An dauki Zbiri a matsayin daya daga cikin fitattun mutane a tarihin kasar Aljeriya saboda yunkurinsa na kalubalantar kafa siyasa da soja a lokacin da ake samun hadin kai ga sabuwar kasa mai cin gashin kanta. [1] Ana kallon rawar da ya taka a fagen gwagwarmayar mulki da bangaranci wanda ya nuna farkon shekarun da Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai. [2]

english_source: This band presents songs of different themes, much more popular, until 1954 when all cultural activity is prohibited. Just after the strike of eight days of January 28, 1957, these artists which were forbidden to perform in their country regain Tunisia, and others among them, joined the maquis. Among the members of the troupe are Mustapha Sahnoun, Mustapha Kateb, Boualem Raïs, Sid Ali Kouiret
target1_text: Wannan ruƙunin yana gabatar da waƙoƙin jigogi daban-daban, waɗanda suka fi shahara, har zuwa shekara ta 1954 lokacin da aka haramta duk ayyukan al'adu. Bayan yajin aikin kwanaki takwas na ranar 28 ga watan Janairu, 1957, waɗannan mawakan da aka hana yin wasan kwaikwayo a ƙasarsu sun dawo Tunisia, da wasu daga cikinsu, sun shiga cikin maquis. Daga cikin mambobin kungiyar akwai Mustapha Sahnoun, Mustapha Kateb, Boualem Raïs, Sid Ali Kouiret.
target2_text: Wannan rukunin yana gabatar da waƙoƙin jigogi daban-daban, waɗanda suka fi shahara, har zuwa 1954 lokacin da aka haramta duk ayyukan al'adu. Bayan yajin aikin kwanaki takwas na ranar 28 ga Janairu, 1957, wadannan mawakan da aka hana yin wasan kwaikwayo a kasarsu sun dawo Tunisia, da wasu daga cikinsu, sun shiga cikin maquis . Daga cikin mambobin kungiyar akwai Mustapha Sahnoun, Mustapha Kateb, Boualem Raïs, Sid Ali Kouiret.

english_source: Mohamed Rahmoune (1940 – 4 February 2022), commonly known as Si Rabah or simply as Rahmoune, was a prominent revolutionary leader during the Algerian war of independence as a member of the Front de Libération Nationale (FLN; National Liberation Front) that launched an armed revolt throughout Algeria and issued a proclamation calling for a sovereign Algerian state.[1][2]
target1_text: Mohamed Rahmoune (1940 - 4 ga watan Fabrairu 2022), wanda aka fi sani da Si Rabah ko kuma kawai a matsayin Rahmoune, ya kasance fitaccen jagoran juyin juya hali a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya a matsayin memba na Front de Liberation Nationale (FLN; National Liberation Front) wanda ya kaddamar da tawaye ɗauke da makamai a duk faɗin Aljeriya tare da fitar da sanarwar kira ga ƙasar Aljeriya mai cin gashin kanta. [1] [2]
target2_text: Mohamed Rahmoune (1940 - 4 ga Fabrairu 2022), wanda aka fi sani da Si Rabah ko kuma kawai a matsayin Rahmoune, ya kasance fitaccen jagoran juyin juya hali a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya a matsayin memba na Front de Liberation Nationale (FLN; National Liberation Front) wanda ya kaddamar da tawaye dauke da makamai a duk fadin Aljeriya tare da fitar da sanarwar kira ga kasar Aljeriya mai cin gashin kanta. [1] [2]

english_source: After his brother Djilali Rahmoune died as a martyr (shahid) in the field of honor in 1957, he joined the ranks of the National Liberation Army (ALN) in the third district, the first region, in the fourth historical wilaya, where he participated in many battles.[23][24]
target1_text: Bayan da ɗan uwansa Djilali Rahmoune ya rasu a matsayin shahidi (shahid) a fagen girmamawa a shekarar 1957, ya shiga sahun rundunar sojojin 'yantar da ƙasa (ALN) a gunduma ta uku, yankin farko, a wilaya ta huɗu na tarihi, inda ya halarci yakoki da dama. [1] [2]
target2_text: Bayan da dan uwansa Djilali Rahmoune ya rasu a matsayin shahidi ( shahid ) a fagen girmamawa a shekarar 1957, ya shiga sahun rundunar sojojin 'yantar da kasa (ALN) a gunduma ta uku, yankin farko, a wilaya ta hudu na tarihi, inda ya halarci yakoki da dama. [1] [2]

english_source: Moudjahid Rahmoune died on February 4, 2022, at the home of his family in Thénia at the age of 82.[1]
target1_text: Moudjahid Rahmoune ya mutu a ranar 4 ga watan Fabrairu, 2022, a gidan danginsa a Thénia yana da shekaru 82. [1]
target2_text: Moudjahid Rahmoune ya mutu a ranar 4 ga Fabrairu, 2022, a gidan danginsa a Thénia yana da shekaru 82. [1]

english_source: On 26 November 1957, Peschard and 10 other rebels were killed by the French army near the town of Medjana. Following the end of the Algerian War for Independence, Peschard was declared a martyr of the conflict.[3][2] According to Jean-Luc Einaudi, she was the only Algerian of European descent to be named as a martyr of the conflict.[4]
target1_text: A ranar 26 ga watan Nuwamban 1957, sojojin Faransa sun kashe Peschar da wasu 'yan tawaye 10 a kusa da garin Medjana. Bayan kawo ƙarshen yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya, an ayyana Peschard a matsayin shahidiya a wannan rikici. [1] [2] A cewar Jean-Luc Einaudi, ita kaɗai ce ‘yar ƙasar Aljeriya ‘yar asalin Turai da aka bayyana sunanta a matsayin shahidan rikicin. [3]
target2_text: A ranar 26 ga Nuwamban 1957, sojojin Faransa sun kashe Peschar da wasu 'yan tawaye 10 a kusa da garin Medjana . Bayan kawo karshen yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya, an ayyana Peschard a matsayin shahidan wannan rikici. [1] [2] A cewar Jean-Luc Einaudi, ita kadai ce ‘yar kasar Aljeriya ‘yar asalin Turai da aka bayyana sunanta a matsayin shahidan rikicin. [3]

english_source: Zoulikha Oudai was an Algerian Chenouas woman who died during the Algerian War of Independence.[1][2] She was born 7 May 1911 in Hadjout, and grew up in Cherchell. She had five children; after her husband and one of her sons were executed by French forces, she became committed to the independence cause and joined the National Liberation Front (Algeria) as the Cherchell regional head. She then went underground and became a noted intelligence operative for the Front. She was captured by French forces in 1957 and executed after 10 days of unfruitful torture. Her body was not recovered until 1984; she is now interred in a martyrs' cemetery in Menaceur.[3][4][5]
target1_text: Zoulikha Oudai wata 'yar ƙasar Chenouas ce kuma 'yar ƙasar Algeria da ta mutu a lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Aljeriya. [1] [2] An haife ta a ranar 7 ga Mayu 1911 a Hadjout, kuma ta girma a Cherchell. Ta haifi 'ya'ya biyar; Bayan da sojojin Faransa suka kashe mijinta da ɗaya daga cikin 'ya'yanta, ta kasance mai himma ga neman 'yancin kai kuma ta shiga cikin National Liberation Front (Algeria) a matsayin shugabar yankin Cherchell. Daga nan sai ta shiga ƙarƙashin ƙasa ta zama fitacciyar jami’ar leken asiri a banygaren Front. Sojojin Faransa sun kama ta a shekara ta 1957 kuma aka kashe ta bayan kwanaki 10 na azabtarwa ba tare da amfani ba. Jikinta bai sake dawowa ba sai a shekarar 1984; Yanzu haka tana cikin makabartar shahidai da ke Menaceur. [3] [4] [5]
target2_text: Zoulikha Oudai wata 'yar kasar Chenouas ce 'yar kasar Algeria da ta mutu a lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Aljeriya . [1] [2] An haife ta a ranar 7 ga Mayu 1911 a Hadjout, kuma ta girma a Cherchell . Ta haifi 'ya'ya biyar; Bayan da sojojin Faransa suka kashe mijinta da daya daga cikin 'ya'yanta, ta kasance mai himma ga neman 'yancin kai kuma ta shiga cikin National Liberation Front (Algeria) a matsayin shugabar yankin Cherchell. Daga nan sai ta shiga karkashin kasa ta zama fitacciyar jami’ar leken asiri a bangaren Front. Sojojin Faransa sun kama ta a shekara ta 1957 kuma aka kashe ta bayan kwanaki 10 na azabtarwa ba tare da amfani ba. Jikinta bai sake dawowa ba sai a shekarar 1984; Yanzu haka tana cikin makabartar shahidai da ke Menaceur . [3] [4] [5]

english_source: Mohamed Mechkarini (1896–1935) is a Kabyle rebel who attacked colonial administrators in the early twentieth century. Finally captured, he was arrested on January 6, 1929.
target1_text: Mohamed Mechkarini (1896-1935) ɗan tawayen Kabyle ne wanda ya kai hari ga masu mulkin mallaka a farkon ƙarni na ashirin. A ƙarshe aka kama shi, an kama shi a ranar 6 ga watan Janairu, 1929.
target2_text: Mohamed Mechkarini (1896-1935) ɗan tawayen Kabyle ne wanda ya kai hari ga masu mulkin mallaka a farkon karni na ashirin. A ƙarshe aka kama shi, an kama shi a ranar 6 ga Janairu, 1929.

english_source: Having been taken prisoner in Germany, Zemmouri soon suffered the effects of the propaganda which was made in the native prison camps for the recruitment of the Turkish army, and consented to serve in the enemy ranks.
target1_text: Bayan da aka kai shi fursuna a Jamus, ba da daɗewa ba Zemmouri ya sha wahala sakamakon farfagandar da aka yi a sansanonin fursunoni na ƙasar don ɗaukar sojojin Turkiyya, kuma ya yarda ya yi aiki a cikin sahun abokan gaba.
target2_text: Bayan da aka kai shi a matsayin fursuna a Jamus, ba da daɗewa ba Zemmouri ya sha wahala sakamakon farfagandar da aka yi a sansanonin fursunoni na ƙasar don ɗaukar sojojin Turkiyya, kuma ya yarda ya yi aiki a cikin sahun abokan gaba.

english_source: The Feminist movement of the 1940s combined with the Revolution gave Algerian women like Lavalette the confidence to challenge societal values, break social taboos, assert their independence, and showcase their political importance.[1] Manipulating gendered expectations empowered them to control their identities and assert their independence. In Lavalette’s case, she held power as an officer and fighter of the FLN and resisted French colonial abuse.[13] She fought her oppression as a Pied-Noir by realizing her stories were valuable and interesting, which motivated her to break her silence.
target1_text: Yunkurin mata na shekarun 1940 tare da juyin juya hali ya baiwa matan Aljeriya irinsu Lavalette kwarin guiwar ƙalubalantar ɗabi'un al'umma, karya haramtattun al'umma, tabbatar da 'yancin kansu, da nuna muhimmancinsu na siyasa. [1] Yin amfani da tsammanin jinsi ya ba su ikon sarrafa ainihin su da tabbatar da 'yancin kansu. A cikin shari'ar Lavalette, ta riƙe madafun iko a matsayin jami'a kuma mayaƙin FLN kuma ta yi tsayayya da cin zarafi na Faransa. [2] Ta yi yaƙi da zaluncinta a matsayinta na Pied-Noir ta hanyar gane labarunta suna da kima da ban sha'awa, wanda ya motsa ta ta karya shirun.
target2_text: Yunkurin mata na shekarun 1940 tare da juyin juya halin Musulunci ya baiwa matan Aljeriya irinsu Lavalette kwarin guiwar kalubalantar dabi'un al'umma, karya haramtattun al'umma, tabbatar da 'yancin kansu, da nuna muhimmancinsu na siyasa. [1] Yin amfani da tsammanin jinsi ya ba su ikon sarrafa ainihin su da tabbatar da 'yancin kansu. A cikin shari'ar Lavalette, ta rike madafun iko a matsayin jami'a kuma mayaƙin FLN kuma ta yi tsayayya da cin zarafi na Faransanci. [2] Ta yi yaƙi da zaluncinta a matsayinta na Pied-Noir ta hanyar gane labarunta suna da kima da ban sha'awa, wanda ya motsa ta ta karya shirun.

english_source: Women were central to Algerian resistance efforts. The FLN's strategic use of women in their bombings and attacks was a result of French stereotypes about Muslim women as innocent, submissive, and oppressed.[11] When Algerian militants formed the FLN in 1954, thousands of women, including Lavalette, joined in their anticolonial struggle.[2][3][4] Like other women at the time, but unlike other Pied-Noirs, Lavalette distributed resources (like pamphlets), transported messages, and provided food and housing to freedom fighters as they infiltrated rural mountain villages to kill French sympathizers and workers.[8][10][12]
target1_text: Mata sun kasance tsakiyar yunƙurin juriya na Aljeriya. Dabarar da FLN ta yi na amfani da mata wajen kai hare-haren bama-bamai da hare-harensu ya samo asali ne sakamakon ra'ayin Faransawa game da matan musulmi a matsayin marasa laifi, masu biyayya, da zalunci. [1] Lokacin da mayakan Aljeriya suka kafa FLN a shekara ta 1954, dubban mata, ciki har da Lavalette, sun shiga gwagwarmayar kin jinin mulkin mallaka. [2] [3] [4] Kamar sauran mata a lokacin, amma ba kamar sauran Pied-Noirs ba, Lavalette ta rarraba albarkatu (kamar ƙasidu), jigilar sakonni, da kuma ba da abinci da gidaje ga mayakan 'yanci yayin da suke kutsawa cikin ƙauyukan masu tsaunuka don kashe masu goyon bayan Faransa da ma'aikata. [3] [4] [5]
target2_text: Mata sun kasance tsakiyar yunƙurin juriya na Aljeriya. [1] Lokacin da mayakan Aljeriya suka kafa FLN a shekara ta 1954, dubban mata, ciki har da Lavalette, sun shiga gwagwarmayar kin jinin mulkin mallaka. [3] [4] [5]

english_source: Following the death of her husband, increasing violence, and forced homelessness, Lavalette moved back to Médéa to live amongst her friends. She died in 2014, one year after publishing her memoir.[1] Civilian’s narratives such as Lavalette’s are important because they explain the suffering of the general people who are not actively fighting in the war. Furthermore, her generation of women are particularly hesitant to publicly talk about their experiences due to their continued fights for equality under an Islamic Fundamentalist regime.[10] Lavalette has explained her own reluctance to share her experiences for fear of violence.[10][2] Eveline Safir Lavalette’s importance, as both a fighter and an everyday citizen, explores the psychological impacts of the war, untold by common narratives of war that are male-centric and focused on political conflict instead of personal turmoil. As a result, her memoir has scholarly importance. She has been referenced by multiple researchers, scholars, and historians since her death in 2013.
target1_text: Bayan mutuwar mijinta, ƙara tashin hankali, da tilasta rashin matsuguni, Lavalette ta koma Medéa don ta zauna tare da abokanta. Ta rasu a shekara ta 2014, shekara guda bayan buga littafin tarihinta. [1] Bayanan farar hula irin su Lavalette suna da mahimmanci saboda suna bayyana wahalar da jama'ar da ba sa yin gwagwarmaya a yakin. Bugu da ƙari kuma, tsararrakinta mata ba su da shakku musamman a bainar jama'a game da abubuwan da suka faru a bainar jama'a saboda ci gaba da fafutukar da suke yi na tabbatar da daidaito a ƙarƙashin tsarin mulkin Musulunci. [1] Lavalette ta bayyana nata rashin son raba abubuwan da ta faru saboda tsoron tashin hankali. [1] [2] Muhimmancin Eveline Safir Lavalette, a matsayin mayaƙi da ɗan ƙasa na yau da kullum, yana bincika tasirin tunani na yaƙin, wanda ba a bayyana shi ta hanyar labarun yaƙi na gama-gari waɗanda ke da alaƙa da maza kuma suna mai da hankali kan rikicin siyasa maimakon tashin hankali na mutum. Sakamakon haka, tarihinta yana da mahimmancin ilimi. Masu bincike da yawa, masana, da masana tarihi sun yi magana da ita tun mutuwarta a cikin shekarar 2013.

english_source: He was convicted for theft of military effects in 1943, and for intentional assault and battery against an officer in 1952. In 1954, when the Algerian War broke out, he escaped from the Barberousse prison, where he was serving a two-year sentence for attempted murder, and joined the National Liberation Front (FLN). The FLN militants explained to him that Algeria was a victim of colonialism and recruited him to their cause.[1] He later was caught and transferred to a prison in Damiette, now known as Aïn Deheb, where he would escape again.[9] He returned to Algiers and made contact a few months later with Yacef Saadi.
target1_text: An same shi da laifin satar tasirin soji a 1943, da kuma harin ganganci da batir a kan wani jami'in a 1952. A shekara ta 1954, lokacin da yakin Aljeriya ya barke, ya tsere daga gidan yarin Barberousse, inda yake zaman daurin shekaru biyu saboda yunkurin kisan kai, sannan ya shiga kungiyar 'yantar da kasa ta kasa (FLN). Mayakan na FLN sun bayyana masa cewa, Aljeriya ta yi fama da ‘yan mulkin mallaka, inda suka dauke shi aiki domin yakar su. [1] Daga baya an kama shi kuma aka tura shi gidan yari a Damiette, wanda yanzu ake kira Ain Deheb, inda zai sake tserewa. [2] Ya koma Algiers kuma ya yi tuntuɓar 'yan watanni tare da Yacef Saadi .

A shekara ta 1954, lokacin da yakin Aljeriya ya ɓarke, ya tsere daga gidan yarin Barberousse, inda yake zaman ɗaurin shekaru biyu saboda yunkurin kisan kai, sannan ya shiga kungiyar 'yantar da ƙasa ta (FLN). Mayakan na FLN sun bayyana masa cewa, Aljeriya ta yi fama da ‘yan mulkin mallaka, inda suka ɗauke shi aiki domin yakar su. english_source: On 30 September 1956, two bombs exploded in two public places in Algiers, the Milk Bar and the Cafétaria, killing four and wounding fifty-two. They were planted by Zohra Drif and Samia Lakhdari respectively, while a third bomb, planted by Djamila Bouhired at the Air France terminal, did not explode.[17] These events mark the beginning of the battle of Algiers.[18] These three women, along with Djamila Bouazza, also planted a bomb on 26 January 1957 at the Coq Hardi brewery, part of the “bombs network” headed by Yacef Saâdi, assisted by Ali la Pointe.[19]
target1_text: A ranar 30 ga Satumbar 1956, bama-bamai biyu sun fashe a wurare biyu na jama'a a Algiers, Bar Milk da Cafétaria, inda suka kashe hudu tare da raunata hamsin da biyu. Zohra Drif da Samia Lakhdari ne suka dasa su, yayin da bam na uku, wanda Djamila Bouhired ya dasa a tashar jirgin saman Air France, bai fashe ba. [1] Wadannan al'amura sun nuna farkon yakin Algiers . [2] Wadannan mata guda uku, tare da Djamila Bouazza, sun kuma dasa bam a ranar 26 ga Janairu 1957 a Coq Hardi Brewery, wani ɓangare na "cibiyar bama-bamai" wanda Yacef Saâdi ke jagoranta, wanda Ali la Pointe ya taimaka. [3]
target2_text: A ranar 30 ga watan Satumbar 1956, bama-bamai biyu sun fashe a wurare biyu na jama'a a Algiers, Bar Milk da Cafétaria, inda suka kashe huɗu tare da raunata hamsin da biyu. Zohra Drif da Samia Lakhdari ne suka dasa su, yayin da bam na uku, wanda Djamila Bouhired ya dasa a tashar jirgin saman Air France, bai fashe ba. [1] Waɗannan al'amura sun nuna farkon yakin Algiers. [2] Waɗannan mata guda uku, tare da Djamila Bouazza, sun kuma dasa bam a ranar 26 ga watan Janairu 1957 a Coq Hardi Brewery, wani ɓangare na "cibiyar bama-bamai" wanda Yacef Saâdi ke jagoranta, wanda Ali la Pointe ya taimaka. [3]

english_source: With the independence of Angola in 1975, Alves was appointed to head the Ministry of Interior [pt]. He used the position to place his loyal followers - known as Nitistas - into positions of power in the new state. But the Nitistas ended up causing a supply chain crisis after stockpiling food, prompting the government to dissolve Alves' ministry. Alves supported fractionism, opposing Neto's foreign policy of nonalignment, evolutionary socialism, and multiracialism.
target1_text: Tare da samun 'yancin kai na Angola a shekarar 1975, an naɗa Alves ya jagoranci Ministry of Interior [ pt ] . Ya yi amfani da wannan matsayi wajen sanya mabiyansa masu aminci - wanda aka fi sani da Nitistas - a cikin muƙamai a sabuwar jihar. Amma Nitistas ya kawo ƙarshen matsalar samar da kayayyaki bayan tara abinci, lamarin da ya sa gwamnati ta rusa ma'aikatar Alves. Alves ya goyi bayan ɓangaranci, yana adawa da manufofin Neto na ketare na rashin daidaituwa, zamantakewar juyin halitta, da bambancin launin fata.
target2_text: Tare da samun 'yancin kai na Angola a 1975, an nada Alves ya jagoranci Ministry of Interior [ pt ] . Ya yi amfani da wannan matsayi wajen sanya mabiyansa masu aminci - wanda aka fi sani da Nitistas - a cikin mukamai a sabuwar jihar. Amma Nitistas ya kawo karshen matsalar samar da kayayyaki bayan tara abinci, lamarin da ya sa gwamnati ta rusa ma'aikatar Alves. Alves ya goyi bayan bangaranci, yana adawa da manufofin Neto na ketare na rashin daidaituwa, zamantakewar juyin halitta, da bambancin launin fata.

english_source: After the overthrow of the Estado Novo in the Carnation Revolution, in 1974, Alves returned to the Angolan capital. In Luanda, he made contact with other anti-colonial figures, such as José Jacinto Van-Dúnem, and the Portuguese Communist Party, who came to see him as a "genuine revolutionary leader".[3] By this time, the MPLA was beset by factional infighting, with a Congress being held in Lusaka to resolve the conflict through an organisational solution.[4]
target1_text: Bayan hambarar da Estado Novo a cikin juyin juya halin Carnation, a cikin shekarar 1974, Alves ya koma babban birnin Angola. A Luanda, ya yi hulɗa da wasu masu adawa da mulkin mallaka, irin su José Jacinto Van-Dúnem, da Jam'iyyar Kwaminisanci ta Portugal, wanda ya zo ya gan shi a matsayin "shugaban juyin juya hali na gaskiya". [ 3 ] Ya zuwa wannan lokaci, MPLA ta fuskanci rikicin ɓangaranci, inda aka gudanar da wani taro a Lusaka domin warware rikicin ta hanyar sasantawa tsakanin kungiyoyi. [ 4 ]
target2_text: Bayan hambarar da Estado Novo a cikin juyin juya halin Carnation, a cikin 1974, Alves ya koma babban birnin Angola. A Luanda, ya yi hulɗa da wasu masu adawa da mulkin mallaka, irin su José Jacinto Van-Dúnem, da Jam'iyyar Kwaminisanci ta Portugal, wanda ya zo ya gan shi a matsayin "shugaban juyin juya hali na gaskiya". [ 3 ] Ya zuwa wannan lokaci, MPLA ta fuskanci rikicin bangaranci, inda aka gudanar da wani taro a Lusaka domin warware rikicin ta hanyar sasantawa tsakanin kungiyoyi. [ 4 ]

english_source: In 1945, Nito Alves was born in the Northern Angolan town of Piri. He started his education at an evangelical mission near his hometown, before moving to the Angolan capital of Luanda in 1960 to continue his education. In 1965, he joined the anti-colonial movement, while in his sixth year at school. After a number of his fellow activists were arrested and imprisoned in 1966, he left the capital and joined the MPLA in the forests of Dembos, where anti-colonial guerrillas had been fighting since the outbreak of the Angolan War of Independence.[1]
target1_text: A cikin shekarar 1945, an haifi Nito Alves a garin Piri na Arewacin Angola. Ya fara karatunsa ne a wata wa'azin bishara kusa da garinsu, kafin ya koma babban birnin Angola na Luanda a shekara ta 1960 don ci gaba da karatunsa. A shekarar 1965, ya shiga kungiyar masu adawa da mulkin mallaka, yayin da yake shekara ta shida a makaranta. Bayan da aka kama wasu ’yan uwansa da aka ɗaure shi a shekarar 1966, ya bar babban birnin ƙasar ya koma jam’iyyar MPLA a dazuzzukan Dembos, inda ‘yan daba masu adawa da mulkin mallaka suka yi ta gwabzawa tun bayan ɓarkewar yakin ‘yancin kai na Angola. [ 1 ]
target2_text: A cikin 1945, an haifi Nito Alves a garin Piri na Arewacin Angola. Ya fara karatunsa ne a wata wa'azin bishara kusa da garinsu, kafin ya koma babban birnin Angola na Luanda a shekara ta 1960 don ci gaba da karatunsa. A shekarar 1965, ya shiga kungiyar masu adawa da mulkin mallaka, yayin da yake shekara ta shida a makaranta. Bayan da aka kama wasu ’yan uwansa da aka daure shi a shekarar 1966, ya bar babban birnin kasar ya koma jam’iyyar MPLA a dazuzzukan Dembos, inda ‘yan daba masu adawa da mulkin mallaka suka yi ta gwabzawa tun bayan barkewar yakin ‘yancin kai na Angola . [ 1 ]

english_source: Mendes died in combat, at 27 years old, during a raid on the headquarters of the Portuguese colonial army in Karipande, Moxico, Angola, on April 14, 1968.[1] He was buried near the river Lundoji 50 kilometres (30 mi) from the then headquarters of Karipande, from the Front East of the Third Political-Military Region.[2] In August 1968, the People's Liberation Movement of Angola (MPLA) assigned Hoji-ya-Henda the title of "dear son of the Angolan people and heroic fighter of the MPLA".
target1_text: Mendes ya mutu a cikin yaki, yana da shekaru 27, a lokacin wani samame a hedkwatar sojojin mulkin mallaka na Portugal a Karipande, Moxico, Angola, a ranar 14 ga Afrilu, 1968. [1] An binne shi kusa da kogin Lundoji mai 50 kilometres (30 mi) daga hedkwatar Karipande a lokacin, daga Gabashin Gabas na Yankin Siyasa-Soja (Political-Military Region) na Uku. [2] A watan Agustan 1968, jam'iyyar 'yantar da jama'ar Angola ( MPLA ) ta ba Hoji-ya-Henda laƙabin "ɗan ƙaunataccen ɗan al'ummar Angola kuma jarumin gwagwarmaya na MPLA".
target2_text: Mendes ya mutu a cikin fada, yana da shekaru 27, a lokacin wani samame a hedkwatar sojojin mulkin mallaka na Portugal a Karipande, Moxico, Angola, a ranar 14 ga Afrilu, 1968. [1] An binne shi kusa da kogin Lundoji mai 50 kilometres (30 mi) daga hedkwatar Karipande a lokacin, daga Gabashin Gabas na Yankin Siyasa-Soja na Uku. [2] A watan Agustan 1968, jam'iyyar 'yantar da jama'ar Angola ( MPLA ) ta ba Hoji-ya-Henda lakabin "ɗan ƙaunataccen ɗan al'ummar Angola kuma jarumin gwagwarmaya na MPLA".

english_source: Surrounded by Africans, African Americans felt that they could be reunited with long-lost relatives in their homeland. However, some argue that these perceptions of Africa by African Americans were detrimental to African American experiences in Ghana. According to Derek Catsam, "the African American image of Africa has historically been no less warped [than the White American image] but has been characterized by romanticism, fetishism, and nostalgia. Black Americans have often perpetuated an uncomplicated view of Africa as a vestigial homeland awaiting the return of its lost souls."[6]
target1_text: Da 'yan Afirka ke kewaye da su, 'yan Afirka na Amurka sun ji cewa za a iya sake haɗuwa da dangi da suka ɓace a ƙasarsu. Koyaya, wasu suna jayayya cewa waɗannan ra'ayoyin Afirka ta Afirka na Afirka sun kasance masu lahani ga abubuwan da Afirka ta Amirka ta samu a Ghana. A cewar Derek Catsam, "hoton Afirka na Afirka a tarihi bai kasance ba wanda ya lalace [kamar hoton White American] amma an nuna shi da soyayya, fetishism, da nostalgia. Baƙar fata Amurkawa galibi suna ci gaba da ra'ayi mara rikitarwa game da Afirka a matsayin ƙasar da ke jiran dawowar rayukan da suka ɓace. "[1]

english_source: On 16 November 1955, Mohammed V arrived in Morocco. He announced the end of the French protectorate, and by proxy, the end of the "minor jihad" (Arabic: الجهاد الأصغر), which was primarily related to securing independence. At the same time, he announced the beginning of the "major jihad" (Arabic: الجهاد الأكبر), which was aimed at collectively building the new Morocco.[1][17] Negotiations between France and Morocco continued in February and March 1956, with the former suggesting that Morocco become "an independent state united with France by permanent ties of interdependency," while the latter pushed for a complete annulment of the 1912 Treaty of Fes.[3] The Franco-Moroccan Declaration of Independence was signed on 2 March 1956, although about 100,000 French troops remained on Moroccan land at the time.[3]
target1_text: A ranar 16 ga Nuwamba 1955, Mohammed V ya isa Maroko. Ya sanar da ƙarshen kariya ta Faransa, kuma ta hanyar wakili, ƙarshen "ƙananan jihadi" (Arabic: ), wanda ya danganta da samun 'yancin kai. A lokaci guda, ya sanar da farkon "babban jihadi" (Arabic: ), wanda aka yi niyya ne don gina sabuwar Morocco. Tattaunawar tsakanin Faransa da Maroko ta ci gaba a watan Fabrairu da Maris na shekara ta 1956, tare da tsohon ya ba da shawarar cewa Maroko ta zama "jiha mai zaman kanta da ke da alaƙa da Faransa ta hanyar dindindin na dogaro da juna," yayin da ƙarshen ya tura don soke Yarjejeniyar Fes ta 1912. An sanya hannu kan sanarwar 'yancin kai ta Franco-Moroccan a ranar 2 ga Maris 1956, kodayake kimanin sojojin Faransa 100,000 sun kasance a ƙasar Morocco a lokacin.

A lokaci guda, ya sanar da farkon "babban jihadi" (Arabic: ), wanda aka yi niyya ne don gina sabuwar Morocco.[1][2] Tattaunawar tsakanin Faransa da Maroko ta ci gaba a watan Fabrairu da Maris na shekara ta 1956, tare da tsohon ya ba da shawarar cewa Maroko ta zama "jiha mai zaman kanta da ke da alaƙa da Faransa ta hanyar dindindin na dogaro da juna," yayin da ƙarshen ya tura don soke Yarjejeniyar Fes ta 1912.[1] An sanya hannu kan sanarwar 'yancin kai ta Franco-Moroccan a ranar 2 ga Maris 1956, kodayake kimanin sojojin Faransa 100,000 sun kasance a ƙasar Morocco a lokacin.[1]

english_source: General João Rodrigues Lopes, known by his nom de guerre Ludy Kissassunda (27 September 1932[1] – 6 January 2021) was an Angolan general and politician. Born in 1932 in N'zeto, Zaire Province, he held important ranks during the Angolan War of Independence and the Angolan Civil War, holding a particularly important role with the reorganization of troops of, as well as the overall logistics of, the People's Liberation Army of Angola, which would later become the People's Armed Forces of Liberation of Angola (FAPLA).[2]
target1_text: Janar João Rodrigues Lopes, wanda aka fi sani da sunan sa Ludy Kissassunda (27 Satumba 1932 [1] - 6 Janairu 2021) Janar ne kuma ɗan siyasa na Angola. An haife shi a shekara ta 1932 a N'zeto, lardin Zaire, ya rike mukamai masu muhimmanci a lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Angola da yakin basasar Angola, yana da muhimmiyar rawa tare da sake tsara sojojin, da kuma dukkanin kayan aiki na rundunar 'yantar da jama'ar Angola, wanda daga bisani za ta zama rundunar sojojin Angola ta FAPLA. [2]
target2_text: Janar João Rodrigues Lopes, wanda aka fi sani da sunan sa Ludy Kissassunda (27 Satumba 1932 [1] - 6 Janairu 2021) Janar ne kuma ɗan siyasa na Angola. An haife shi a shekara ta 1932 a N'zeto, lardin Zaire, ya riƙe muƙamai masu muhimmanci a lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na kasart Angola da yakin basasar Angola, yana da muhimmiyar rawa tare da sake tsara sojojin, da kuma dukkanin kayan aiki na rundunar 'yantar da jama'ar Angola, wanda daga bisani za ta zama rundunar sojojin Angola ta FAPLA. [2]

english_source: During his political career, he was a member of the Politburo of the Central Committee of the People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA), being one of Agostinho Neto's closest associates.[3] He was the founder and director of the Department of Information and Security of Angola (DISA), the MPLA's (and later Angola's) intelligence agency, from 1975 to 1979. He was also the governor of Malanje Province from 1980 to 1986, and of Zaire Province from 1995 to 2004.[4]
target1_text: A lokacin aikinsa na siyasa, ya kasance memba a ofishin siyasa na kwamitin tsakiya na jam'iyyar People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA), kasancewarsa ɗaya daga cikin makusantan Agostinho Neto. [1] Shi ne wanda ya kafa kuma darekta na Sashen Watsa Labarai da Tsaro na ƙasar Angola (DISA), hukumar leken asiri ta MPLA (da kuma Angola), daga shekarun 1975 zuwa 1979. Ya kuma kasance gwamnan lardin Malanje daga shekarun 1980 zuwa 1986, da na lardin Zaire daga shekarun 1995 zuwa 2004. [2]
target2_text: A lokacin aikinsa na siyasa, ya kasance memba a ofishin siyasa na kwamitin tsakiya na jam'iyyar People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA), kasancewarsa daya daga cikin makusantan Agostinho Neto . [1] Shi ne wanda ya kafa kuma darekta na Sashen Watsa Labarai da Tsaro na Angola (DISA), hukumar leken asiri ta MPLA (da kuma Angola), daga 1975 zuwa 1979. Ya kuma kasance gwamnan lardin Malanje daga 1980 zuwa 1986, da na lardin Zaire daga 1995 zuwa 2004. [2]

english_source: He was elected at the first conference of the MPLA party, in December 1962, as secretary of the organization and cadres and as a member of the central committee of the MPLA.[1][11] In 1963, with its expulsion from Democratic Republic of Congo/Zaire, and its flight across the river to Congo-Brazzaville, the MPLA fell into a state of total disarray and might have ceased to exist had Lara's brilliant organizational skills and cunning political decisions not saved it.[12]
target1_text: An zabe shi a taron farko na jam'iyyar MPLA, a watan Disamba na shekarar 1962, a matsayin sakataren kungiyar da 'yan kadarori kuma a matsayin memba na kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA. [1] [2] A cikin 1963, tare da fitar da ita daga Jamhuriyar Dimokuradiyyar Kwango/Zaire, da kuma jirgin da ta yi ta haye kogin zuwa Kongo-Brazzaville, MPLA ta fada cikin wani yanayi na rudani kuma mai yiwuwa ta daina wanzuwa idan har hazikan kungiyar Lara da dabarun siyasa ba su cece ta ba. [3]
target2_text: An zaɓe shi a taron farko na jam'iyyar MPLA, a watan Disamba na shekarar 1962, a matsayin sakataren kungiyar da 'yan kadarori kuma a matsayin memba na kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA. [1] [2] A cikin shekarar 1963, tare da fitar da ita daga Jamhuriyar Dimokuraɗiyyar Kwango/Zaire, da kuma jirgin da ta yi ta haye kogin zuwa Kongo-Brazzaville, MPLA ta faɗa cikin wani yanayi na ruɗani kuma mai yiwuwa ta daina wanzuwa idan har hazikan kungiyar Lara da dabarun siyasa ba su cece ta ba. [3]

english_source: On 10 December 1977, despite the tragic results of the purge, Lara was re-elected to the central committee of the MPLA, which made him the second most important member of the political bureau (after only Neto) and vice-president of the party, being responsible for the organization and the ideological sector.[1]
target1_text: A ranar 10 ga Disamba 1977, duk da mummunan sakamakon tsarkakewa, an sake zabar Lara a cikin kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA, wanda ya sanya shi zama memba na biyu mafi mahimmanci a ofishin siyasa (bayan Neto kawai) kuma mataimakin shugaban jam'iyyar, wanda ke da alhakin kungiyar da kuma bangaren akida. [1]
target2_text: A ranar 10 ga watan Disamba 1977, duk da mummunan sakamakon tsarkakewa, an sake zaɓar Lara a cikin kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA, wanda ya sanya shi zama memba na biyu mafi mahimmanci a ofishin siyasa (bayan Neto kawai) kuma mataimakin shugaban jam'iyyar, wanda ke da alhakin kungiyar da kuma ɓangaren akida. [1]

english_source: In 1980 he was re-elected member of the MPLA's central committee, political bureau and secretary of organization. In addition, he was elected chairman of the intergovernmental council of the Pan-African News Agency (PanaPress), a position he held for 5 years. In the same year, he was elected deputy representing the province of Moxico. While in this term, he was responsible for the special parliamentary commission for coffee production and the permanent parliamentary health commission.[1]
target1_text: A cikin shekarar 1980 an sake zaɓe shi mamba a kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA, ofishin siyasa da sakataren ƙungiya. Bugu da ƙari, an zaɓe shi a matsayin shugaban majalissar gudanarwa ta kamfanin dillancin labarai na Pan-African Pan-African News Agency (PanaPress), muƙamin da ya riƙe tsawon shekaru 5. A wannan shekarar, an zaɓe shi mataimakin wakilin lardin Moxico. Yayin da yake cikin wannan wa'adin, shi ne ke da alhakin kwamitin majalisar dokoki na musamman kan samar da kofi da kuma hukumar lafiya ta majalisar din-din-din. [1]
target2_text: A cikin 1980 an sake zaɓe shi mamba a kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA, ofishin siyasa da sakataren ƙungiya. Bugu da kari, an zabe shi a matsayin shugaban majalissar gudanarwa ta kamfanin dillancin labarai na Pan-African Pan-African News Agency (PanaPress), mukamin da ya rike tsawon shekaru 5. A wannan shekarar, an zabe shi mataimakin wakilin lardin Moxico . Yayin da yake cikin wannan wa'adin, shi ne ke da alhakin kwamitin majalisar dokoki na musamman kan samar da kofi da kuma hukumar lafiya ta majalisar din-din-din. [1]

english_source: In 1985, Angolan President José Eduardo dos Santos removes him from the MPLA's political bureau, remaining only on the party's central committee, in what is called an Edwardian internal political purge against adversaries. In March 1986, he assumed the functions of 1st secretary of the National Assembly, which he remained until 1992.[1]
target1_text: A shekara ta 1985, shugaban Angola José Eduardo dos Santos ya tsige shi daga ofishin siyasa na MPLA, wanda ya rage kawai a cikin kwamitin tsakiya na jam'iyyar, a wani abu da ake kira kawar da siyasar cikin gida ta Edwardian kan abokan adawa. A cikin Maris 1986, ya karbi aikin sakatare na 1 na Majalisar Dokoki ta kasa, wanda ya kasance har zuwa 1992. [1]
target2_text: A shekara ta 1985, shugaban Angola José Eduardo dos Santos ya tsige shi daga ofishin siyasa na MPLA, wanda ya rage kawai a cikin kwamitin tsakiya na jam'iyyar, a wani abu da ake kira kawar da siyasar cikin gida ta Edwardian kan abokan adawa. A cikin watan Maris 1986, ya karbi aikin sakatare na 1 na Majalisar Dokoki ta ƙasa , wanda ya kasance har zuwa shekara ta 1992. [1]

english_source: He decided to leave public life for health reasons in November 2003, when he resigned from the legislative mandate he had held since 1975.[19] The Angolan Ministry of Defense retired him as an army general in 2004, but he refused to use the rank because he did not consider himself a military professional.[2]

[1] Ma'aikatar tsaron Angola ta yi masa ritaya a matsayin Janar na soja a shekara ta 2004, amma ya ki yin amfani da wannan mukamin saboda bai dauki kansa a matsayin kwararren soja ba. [2]

english_source: On 8 January 2010, while being escorted by Angolan forces through the disputed territory of Cabinda, the team bus of the Togo national football team was attacked by gunmen belonging to FLEC/PM as it travelled to 2010 Africa Cup of Nations tournament. The ensuing gunfight resulted in the deaths of the assistant coach, team spokesman and bus driver, as well as injuring several others. Mingas expressed "condolences", saying the team was attacked by mistake.[9]
target1_text: A ranar 8 ga watan Janairun 2010, yayin da sojojin Angola ke rakiyar su ta yankin Cabinda da ake takaddama a kai, wasu 'yan bindiga na kungiyar FLEC/PM sun kai wa motar bas ɗin tawagar 'yan wasan kwallon kafa ta Togo hari a lokacin da suke tafiya gasar cin kofin ƙasashen Afirka ta shekarar 2010. Rikicin da ya biyo baya ya yi sanadiyar mutuwar mataimakin kocin, kakakin kungiyar da direban bas, tare da jikkata wasu da dama. Mingas ya bayyana "ta'aziyya", yana mai cewa an kai wa tawagar hari ne bisa kuskure. [1]
target2_text: A ranar 8 ga watan Janairun 2010, yayin da sojojin Angola ke rakiyar su ta yankin Cabinda da ake takaddama a kai, wasu 'yan bindiga na kungiyar FLEC/PM sun kai wa motar bas din tawagar 'yan wasan kwallon kafa ta Togo hari a lokacin da suke tafiya gasar cin kofin kasashen Afirka ta 2010 . Rikicin da ya biyo baya ya yi sanadiyar mutuwar mataimakin kocin, kakakin kungiyar da direban bas, tare da jikkata wasu da dama. Mingas ya bayyana "ta'aziyya", yana mai cewa an kai wa tawagar hari ne bisa kuskure. [1]

english_source: Lucrécia Paim (Caxito, October 16, 1939 - Quincuzo, Congo Quinxassa, March 1967) was an Angolan feminist, human rights defender and nationalist activist, considered a martyr of the country's decolonization process. She was a member of the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) and co-founder of its women's wing, the Organization of Angolan Women (OMA).[1] She was captured,[2] tortured and executed by the National Front for the Liberation of Angola (FNLA) in the context of the fratricidal struggle between the MPLA and the UPA/FNLA.[3]
target1_text: Lucrécia Paim ( Caxito, Oktoba 16, 1939 - Quincuzo, Kongo Quinxassa, Maris 1967) yar Angola ce mai ra'ayin mata, mai kare haƙƙin ɗan adam kuma mai fafutukar kishin ƙasa, wanda ake ɗauka a matsayin shahidi na tsarin mulkin ƙasar. Ta kasance memba na Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) kuma wacce ta kafa reshen mata, Kungiyar Matan Angolan (OMA). [1] An kama ta, [2] ta azabtar da ita kuma ta kashe ta a hannun National Front for the Liberation of Angola (FNLA) a cikin mahallin gwagwarmayar 'yan uwantaka tsakanin MPLA da UPA/FNLA. [3]
target2_text: Lucrécia Paim (Caxito, Oktoba 16, 1939 - Quincuzo, Kongo Quinxassa, Maris 1967) 'yar Angola ce mai kare 'yancin mata, sannan mai kare haƙƙin ɗan adam kuma mai fafutukar kishin ƙasa, wacce ake ɗauka a matsayin shahidiya na tsarin mulkin ƙasar. Ta kasance memba na Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) kuma wacce ta kafa reshen mata, Kungiyar Matan Angolan (OMA). [1] An kama ta, [2] tare da azabtar da ita kuma ta mutu ta a hannun National Front for the Liberation of Angola (FNLA) a cikin mahallin gwagwarmayar 'yan uwantaka tsakanin MPLA da UPA/FNLA. [3]

english_source: Jonas Malheiro Sidónio Sakaita Savimbi (Portuguese: [ˈʒɔnɐʃ ˈsavĩbi]; 3 August 1934 – 22 February 2002) was an Angolan revolutionary, politician, and rebel military leader who founded and led the National Union for the Total Independence of Angola (UNITA). UNITA was one of several groups which waged a guerrilla war against Portuguese colonial rule from 1966 to 1974. Once independence was achieved, it then became an anti-communist group which confronted the ruling People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) during the Angolan Civil War. Savimbi had extensive contact with anti-communist activists in the United States, including Jack Abramoff and was one of the leading anti-communist voices in the world.[1] Savimbi was killed in a clash with government troops in 2002.[2]
target1_text: Jonas Malheiro Sidónio Sakaita Savimbi  ; 3 ga Agusta 1934 - 22 ga Fabrairu 2002) ɗan juyin juya hali ne na Angola, ɗan siyasa, kuma jagoran sojan tawaye wanda ya kafa kuma ya jagoranci Ƙungiyar Ƙungiyar Ƙasa ta Ƙasar Angola ( UNITA ). UNITA na daya daga cikin kungiyoyi da dama da suka gudanar da yakin neman zabe da mulkin mallaka na Portugal daga 1966 zuwa 1974. Da zarar an samu 'yancin kai, sai ta zama wata kungiya mai adawa da gurguzu wacce ta fuskanci jam'iyyar People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola ( MPLA ) mai mulki a lokacin yakin basasar Angola . Savimbi ya yi mu'amala mai yawa da masu adawa da kwaminisanci a Amurka, ciki har da Jack Abramoff kuma yana daya daga cikin manyan masu adawa da kwaminisanci a duniya. [1] An kashe Savimbi a wata arangama da sojojin gwamnati a shekara ta 2002. [2]
target2_text: Jonas Malheiro Sidónio Sakaita Savimbi (3 ga Agusta 1934 - 22 ga Fabrairu 2002) ɗan juyin juya hali ne na Angola, ɗan siyasa, kuma jagoran sojan tawaye wanda ya kafa kuma ya jagoranci Ƙungiyar Ƙungiyar Ƙasa ta Ƙasar Angola (UNITA). UNITA na day6a daga cikin kungiyoyi da dama da suka gudanar da guerrilla war da mulkin mallaka na Portugal daga shekarun 1966 zuwa 1974. Da zarar an samu 'yancin kai, sai ta zama wata kungiya mai adawa da gurguzu wacce ta fuskanci jam'iyyar People's Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA) mai mulki a lokacin yakin basasar Angola. Savimbi ya yi mu'amala mai yawa da masu adawa da kwaminisanci a Amurka, ciki har da Jack Abramoff kuma yana ɗaya daga cikin manyan masu adawa da kwaminisanci a duniya. [1] An kashe Savimbi a wata arangama da sojojin gwamnati a shekara ta 2002. [2]

english_source: There are considerable differences in the source material about the date of Savimbi's official induction into the UPA. Fred Bridgland, who wrote a much-cited biography of Savimbi, says that Savimbi was "inducted into the UPA" on 1 February 1961.[8] Nonetheless, he may not have officially joined the UPA until late 1961.[b]
target1_text: Akwai bambance-bambance masu yawa a cikin kayan tushe game da ranar shigar da Savimbi a hukumance a cikin UPA. Fred Bridgland, wanda ya rubuta tarihin rayuwar Savimbi da aka ambata da yawa, ya ce Savimbi an "shigar da shi cikin UPA" a ranar 1 ga watan Fabrairu 1961. [ 8 ]. Duk da haka, ƙila bai shiga UPA bisa hukuma ba har zuwa ƙarshen i 1961. [ b ]
target2_text: Akwai bambance-bambance masu yawa a cikin kayan tushe game da ranar shigar da Savimbi a hukumance a cikin UPA. Fred Bridgland, wanda ya rubuta tarihin rayuwar Savimbi da aka ambata da yawa, ya ce Savimbi an "shigar da shi cikin UPA" a ranar 1 ga Fabrairu 1961. [ 8 ]. Duk da haka, ƙila bai shiga UPA bisa hukuma ba har zuwa ƙarshen 1961. [ b ]

english_source: It certainly seems that Savimbi was not in the inner circle of UPA activists in early 1961. He took no part in planning the uprising of March 1961, nor did he participate in it.
target1_text: Tabbas da alama Savimbi baya cikin da'irar masu fafutukar UPA a farkon shekara ta 1961. Bai shiga cikin shirin tashin watan Maris na 1961 ba, bai kuma shiga ciki ba.
target2_text: Tabbas da alama Savimbi baya cikin da'irar masu fafutukar UPA a farkon 1961. Bai shiga cikin shirin tashin watan Maris na 1961 ba, bai kuma shiga ciki ba.

english_source: Holden Roberto and the UPA wanted a student organization affiliated with their party. In December 1961, Roberto chaired a meeting at Camp Green Lane near Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Savimbi attended this meeting and became one of a number of organizers who created the UNEA, (União Nacional dos Estudantes Angolanos) in March 1962 at Lucerne, Switzerland. Savimbi was elected Secretary-General.[11]
target1_text: Holden Roberto da UPA sun buƙaci ƙungiyar ɗalibai da ke da alaƙa da jam'iyyarsu. A cikin watan Disamba 1961, Roberto ya jagoranci taro a Camp Green Lane kusa da Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Savimbi ya halarci wannan taron kuma ya zama ɗaya daga cikin masu shiryawa da yawa waɗanda suka ƙirƙira UNEA, (União Nacional dos Estudantes Angolanos) a cikin watan Maris 1962 a Lucerne, Switzerland. An zaɓi Savimbi a matsayin Sakatare-Janar. [ 11 ]
target2_text: Holden Roberto da UPA sun bukaci ƙungiyar dalibai da ke da alaƙa da jam'iyyarsu. A cikin Disamba 1961, Roberto ya jagoranci taro a Camp Green Lane kusa da Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Savimbi ya halarci wannan taron kuma ya zama ɗaya daga cikin masu shiryawa da yawa waɗanda suka ƙirƙira UNEA, (União Nacional dos Estudantes Angolanos) a cikin Maris 1962 a Lucerne, Switzerland. An zabi Savimbi a matsayin Sakatare-Janar. [ 11 ]

english_source: In a very short time, he was a member of the Executive Committee of the UPA. It was he who encouraged the PDA (Partido Democrático de Angola) to join in a united front with the UPA, creating the FNLA (Frente Nacional de Libertação de Angola) and when these parties formed the GRAE (Govêrno Revolucionário de Angola no Exílio) on April 3, 1962, Savimbi became Foreign Minister of this organization.
target1_text: A cikin kankanin lokaci, ya kasance memba na kwamitin zartarwa na UPA. Shi ne wanda ya karfafa PDA (Partido Democrático de Angola) don shiga cikin haɗin kai tare da UPA, ya haifar da FNLA (Frente Nacional de Libertação de Angola) kuma lokacin da waɗannan jam'iyyun suka kafa GRAE (Govêrno Revolucionário de Angola no Exílio) a ranar 3 ga Afrilu, 1962, Ministan Harkokin Waje na wannan kungiyar Savimbi.
target2_text: A cikin kankanin lokaci, ya kasance memba na kwamitin zartarwa na UPA. Shi ne wanda ya karfafa PDA (Partido Democrático de Angola) don shiga cikin haɗin kai tare da UPA, ya haifar da FNLA (Frente Nacional de Libertação de Angola) kuma lokacin da waɗannan jam'iyyun suka kafa GRAE (Govêrno Revolucionário de Angola no Exílio) a ranar 3 ga watan Afrilu, 1962, Ministan Harkokin Waje na wannan kungiyar Savimbi.

english_source: While there, probably in August 1960,[6] he met Holden Roberto, who was already a rising star in émigré circles. Roberto was a founding member of the UPA ( União das Populaçoes de Angola) and was already known for his efforts to promote Angolan independence at the United Nations. He tried to recruit Savimbi who seemed to have been undecided whether to commit himself to the cause of Angolan independence at that point in his life.
target1_text: Yayin da yake can, mai yiwuwa a cikin watan Agusta 1960, [ 6 ] ya haɗu da Holden Roberto, wanda ya riga ya kasance tauraro mai tasowa a cikin da'irar émigré. Roberto ya kasance memban na kafa UPA (União das Populaçoes de Angola) kuma an riga an san shi da ƙoƙarinsa na inganta 'yancin Angola a Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya. Ya yi ƙoƙari ya ɗauki Savimbi wanda da alama bai yanke shawarar ko zai sadaukar da kansa ga fa'idar samun 'yancin kai na Angola a wancan lokacin a rayuwarsa ba.
target2_text: Yayin da yake can, mai yiwuwa a cikin Agusta 1960, [ 6 ] ya sadu da Holden Roberto, wanda ya riga ya kasance tauraro mai tasowa a cikin da'irar émigré. Roberto ya kasance memban kafa UPA ( União das Populaçoes de Angola ) kuma an riga an san shi da ƙoƙarinsa na inganta 'yancin Angola a Majalisar Dinkin Duniya . Ya yi ƙoƙari ya ɗauki Savimbi wanda da alama bai yanke shawarar ko zai sadaukar da kansa ga fa'idar samun 'yancin kai na Angola a wancan lokacin a rayuwarsa ba.

english_source: He was born on July 14, 1927,[1] at the mission of San Jose de Luali in the region of Dinge,[7] or in Mboma Lubinda,[3] Cabinda, into a modest family.[7]
target1_text: An haife shi a ranar 14 ga Yuli, 1927, [1] a aikin San Jose de Luali a yankin Dinge, [2] ko kuma a cikin Mboma Lubinda, [3] Cabinda, cikin dangi mai girman kai. [2]
target2_text: An haife shi a ranar 14 ga watan Yuli, 1927, [1] a aikin San Jose de Luali a yankin Dinge, [2] ko kuma a cikin Mboma Lubinda, [3] Cabinda, cikin dangi mai girman kai. [2]

english_source: In 1963, he co-founded the Front for the Liberation of the Enclave of Cabinda (FLEC), a political organization that fought, at the time, against Portuguese colonial rule.[1] Because he was part of the FLEC, he was arrested in 1970 by the colonial PIDE.[8] He served his sentence in the São Nicolau jail in Bentiaba.[9] He was released in 1974, opened a FLEC office in Tchiowa, the capital of Cabinda;[9] and a year later, he was appointed chairman of the FLEC.[10]
target1_text: A shekara ta 1963, ya kafa kungiyar 'yantar da 'yantar da yankin Cabinda (FLEC), kungiyar siyasa da ta yi yaki, a lokacin, da mulkin mallaka na Portugal. [1] Domin yana cikin FLEC, an kama shi a cikin 1970 ta PIDE na mulkin mallaka. [2] Ya yanke hukuncin ne a gidan yarin São Nicolau da ke Bentiaba . [3] An sake shi a cikin 1974, ya bude ofishin FLEC a Tchiowa, babban birnin Cabinda; [3] kuma bayan shekara guda, an nada shi shugaban FLEC. [4]
target2_text: A shekara ta 1963, ya kafa kungiyar 'yantar da 'yantar da yankin Cabinda (FLEC), kungiyar siyasa da ta yi yaki, a lokacin, 'yan mulkin mallaka na ƙasar Portugal. [1] Domin yana cikin FLEC, an kama shi a cikin shekarar 1970 ta PIDE na mulkin mallaka. [2] Ya yanke hukuncin ne a gidan yarin São Nicolau da ke Bentiaba. [3] An sake shi a cikin shekarar 1974, ya buɗe ofishin FLEC a Tchiowa, babban birnin Cabinda; [3] kuma bayan shekara guda, an naɗa shi shugaban FLEC. [4]

english_source: He went into exile to France.[1] N'zita died in Paris on June 3, 2016.[2][3] His funeral was on June 10.[6] Upon his death, his son, Emmanuel N'zita, succeeded him as Commander of the Armed Forces of Cabinda a few days later.[11][2]
target1_text: Ya tafi gudun hijira zuwa Faransa. [1] N'zita ya mutu a birnin Paris ranar 3 ga Yuni, 2016. [2] [3] An yi jana'izarsa a ranar 10 ga Yuni. [4] Bayan mutuwarsa, dansa, Emmanuel N'zita, ya gaje shi a matsayin kwamandan sojojin Cabinda bayan 'yan kwanaki. [5] [2]

english_source: José Jacinto da Silva Vieira Dias Van-Dúnem, also known as Zé Van-Dúnem Filósofo[1] (29 August 1939 – 8 July 1977) was an Angolan militant, politician, and anticolonial activist.
target1_text: José Jacinto da Silva Vieira Dias Van-Dúnem, kuma aka sani da Zé Van-Dúnem Filósofo [1] (29 Agusta 1939 - 8 Yuli 1977) ɗan gwagwarmayar Angola ne, ɗan siyasa, kuma mai fafutukar yaƙi da mulkin mallaka.
target2_text: José Jacinto da Silva Vieira Dias Van-Dúnem, wanda kuma akafi sani da Zé Van-Dúnem Filósofo [1] (29 Agusta 1939 - 8 Yuli 1977) ɗan gwagwarmayar Angola ne, ɗan siyasa, kuma mai fafutukar yaƙi da 'yan mulkin mallaka.

english_source: In March 1975, Agostinho Neto named him the national political commissioner and sub-chief of the general staff of FAPLA.[2] In his post, he was the third in command of the military hierarchy of the party, after Armed Forces head Iko Carreira and head of general staff João Luís Xietu. On 11 November 1975, Angola's independence was declared, with the MPLA as the ruling party. A long civil war began afterwards between the new Angolan state and various rival groups. Van-Dúnem actively participated in the battles of 1975 and 1976.[2]
target1_text: A cikin watan Maris 1975, Agostinho Neto ya naɗa shi kwamishinan siyasa na ƙasa da kuma babban hafsan hafsoshin FAPLA. [1] A cikin muƙaminsa, shi ne na uku a kan muƙamin kwamandan manyan jami'an soji na jam'iyyar, bayan shugaban rundunar soji Iko Carreira da kuma babban hafsan hafsoshin João Luís Xietu. A ranar 11 ga watan Nuwamban 1975, aka ayyana ‘yancin kai na Angola, tare da MPLA a matsayin jam’iyya mai mulki. Bayan haka ne aka fara wani dogon yakin basasa tsakanin sabuwar ƙasar Angola da kungiyoyi daban-daban masu gaba da juna. Van-Dúnem ya halarci yaƙe-yaƙe na shekarar 1975 da 1976. [1]
target2_text: A cikin Maris 1975, Agostinho Neto ya nada shi kwamishinan siyasa na kasa da kuma babban hafsan hafsoshin FAPLA. [1] A cikin mukaminsa, shi ne na uku a kan mukamin kwamandan manyan jami'an soji na jam'iyyar, bayan shugaban rundunar soji Iko Carreira da kuma babban hafsan hafsoshin João Luís Xietu . A ranar 11 ga Nuwamban 1975, aka ayyana ‘yancin kai na Angola, tare da MPLA a matsayin jam’iyya mai mulki. Bayan haka ne aka fara wani dogon yakin basasa tsakanin sabuwar kasar Angola da kungiyoyi daban-daban masu gaba da juna. Van-Dúnem ya halarci yaƙe-yaƙe na 1975 da 1976. [1]

english_source: He became a member of the MPLA's delegation to the 25th Congress of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union, held from 24 February to 5 March 1976, led by Nito Alves.[2] Van-Dúnem became even more ideologically aligned with the Soviet model and advocated for a more orthodox form of communism.[2]
target1_text: Ya zama memba na tawagar MPLA zuwa babban taro na 25 na Jam'iyyar Kwaminis ta Tarayyar Soviet, wanda aka gudanar daga 24 ga Fabrairu zuwa 5 ga Maris 1976, karkashin jagorancin Nito Alves. [1] Van-Dúnem ya zama ma fi dacewa a akida tare da tsarin Soviet kuma ya ba da shawarar samar da tsarin gurguzu na al'ada. [1]
target2_text: Ya zama memba na tawagar MPLA zuwa babban taro na 25 na Jam'iyyar Kwaminis ta Tarayyar Soviet, wanda aka gudanar daga 24 ga watan Fabrairu zuwa 5 ga watan Maris 1976, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Nito Alves. english_source: The first child of Antónia Vieira Dias and Mateus Van-Dúnem,[2] José Jacinto Van-Dúnem came from a family connected to the founding members of the modern Angolan nationalist movement,[2] especially with regards to his grandfather, Manuel Pereira dos Santos Van-Dúnem,[2] and his great-uncle, Manuel Inácio dos Santos Torres Vieira Dias.[2] His sister, Francisca Van Dunem, was the first Black government minister in Portugal, serving as the Minister of Internal Administration and Minister of Justice.[5]
target1_text: Ɗan fari ne a wurin mahaifinsa mai suna Antónia Vieira Dias da Mateus Van-Dúnem, [1] José Jacinto Van-Dúnem ya fito ne daga dangin da ke da alaƙa da waɗanda suka kafa ƙungiyoyin kishin ƙasa na Angolan na zamani, [1] musamman game da kakansa, Manuel Pereira dos Santos Van-Dúnem, [1] da kuma babban kawunsa, Dia Manuel Iná. [1] 'Yar'uwarsa, Francisca Van Dunem, ita ce ministar gwamnatin Baƙar fata ta farko a Portugal, tana aiki a matsayin Ministan Harkokin Cikin Gida da Ministan Shari'a. [2]
target2_text: Ɗan fari na Antónia Vieira Dias da Mateus Van-Dúnem, [1] José Jacinto Van-Dúnem ya fito ne daga dangin da ke da alaƙa da waɗanda suka kafa ƙungiyoyin kishin ƙasa na Angolan na zamani, [1] musamman game da kakansa, Manuel Pereira dos Santos Van-Dúnem, [1] da kuma babban kawunsa, Dia Manuel Iná. [1] 'Yar'uwarsa, Francisca Van Dunem, ita ce ministar gwamnatin Baƙar fata ta farko a Portugal, tana aiki a matsayin Ministan Harkokin Cikin Gida da Ministan Shari'a . [2]

english_source: With the Carnation Revolution in Portugal on 25 April 1974, the decolonization process had begun.[2] Van-Dúnem was freed, and he became, along with Nito Alves and Daniel Chipenda, the most influential figures in the MPLA for their participation and leadership in the fight for independence.[2] With Alves, both him and Van-Dúnem initiated the reforms of the 1st Military Police Region (Luanda, Dembos and Norte Angolano) of the MPLA and the reactivation of the 4th region (Malanje and Cuanza).[2] They were also able to reactive the important cell organizations in Luanda,[3] the Operational Command of Luanda (COL), and partially stabilize the situation in the capital,[3] organizing patrols to maintain order, feats that would guarantee the success of the Agostinho Neto wing of the party during the Lundoji Conference.[3] In the conference in July 1974, Van-Dúnem was elected to the party's Central Committee and became the youngest member of MPLA's leadership.[2]
target1_text: Tare da juyin juya halin Carnation a Portugal a ranar 25 ga watan Afrilu 1974, an fara aiwatar da tsarin mulkin mallaka. [1] An 'yantar da Van-Dúnem, kuma ya zama, tare da Nito Alves da Daniel Chipenda, manyan mutane masu tasiri a cikin MPLA don shiga da jagoranci a yakin neman 'yancin kai. [1] Tare da Alves, shi da Van-Dúnem sun fara gyare-gyaren gyare-gyare na Yanki na 1st Soja (Luanda, Dembos da Norte Angolano) na MPLA da sake kunnawa yankin na 4 (Malanje da Cuanza). [1] Har ila yau, sun sami damar mayar da martani ga muhimman kungiyoyin tantanin halitta a Luanda, [2] Dokar Ayyuka na Luanda (COL), da wani ɓangare na daidaita al'amura a babban birnin ƙasar, [2] shirya sintiri don tabbatar da tsari, abubuwan da za su tabbatar da nasarar reshen Agostinho Neto na jam'iyyar yayin taron Lundoji. [2] A taron da aka yi a watan Yulin 1974, an zaɓi Van-Dúnem a matsayin Babban Kwamitin Jam’iyyar kuma ya zama ɗan ƙarami a cikin shugabancin MPLA. [1]

[1] Tare da Alves, shi da Van-Dúnem sun fara gyare-gyaren gyare-gyare na Yanki na 1st Soja (Luanda, Dembos da Norte Angolano) na MPLA da sake kunnawa yankin na 4 (Malanje da Cuanza). english_source: Tudun Wada is a suburb in Kaduna South Local Government Area located in the city of Kaduna, the capital of Kaduna State in Northern Nigeria, Nigeria.[1] The postal code of the area is 800.[2]
target1_text: Tudun Wada wata unguwa ce dake cikin karamar hukumar Kaduna ta kudu dake cikin garin Kaduna babban birnin jihar Kaduna a Arewacin Najeriya, Nijeriya. [1] Lambar gidan waya na yankin ita ce 800. [2]
target2_text: Tudun Wada wata unguwa ce dake cikin karamar hukumar Kaduna ta kudu dake cikin garin Kaduna babban birnin jihar Kaduna a Arewacin Najeriya . [1] Lambar gidan waya na yankin ita ce 800. [2]

english_source: Saminaka is a town and headquarters of Lere Local Government Area[2] and of Saminaka chiefdom of the Akurmi people[3] in southern Kaduna state in the Middle Belt region of Nigeria.[1][4] The postal code of the area is 811.[5]
target1_text: Saminaka birni ne kuma hedkwatar karamar hukumar Lere [1] kuma na masarautar Saminaka ta al'ummar Akurmi [2] a kudancin jihar Kaduna a yankin Middle Belt a Najeriya . [3] [4] Lambar gidan waya na yankin ita ce 811. [5]
target2_text: Saminaka birni ne kuma hedkwatar karamar hukumar Lere [1] kuma saminaka masarautar al'ummar Akurmi ne[2] a kudancin jihar Kaduna a yankin Middle Belt a Najeriya. [3] [4] Lambar gidan waya na yankin ita ce 811. [5]

english_source: Lake Léré is a lake in the Mayo-Kebbi Ouest Region in southwestern Chad about 6 km east of the border with Cameroon. It is fed by the Mayo Kébbi that leaves near Léré the smaller Lake Tréné.[1]
target1_text: Tafkin Léré tafki ne a yankin Mayo-Kebbi Ouest a kudu maso yammacin Chadi kimanin kilomita 6 a gabashin iyakar da Kamaru .  Mayo Kébbi ne ke ciyar da shi wanda ke barin kusa da Lere karamin Tafkin Tréné . [1]
target2_text: Tafkin Léré tafki ne a yankin Mayo-Kebbi Ouest a kudu maso yammacin Chadi kimanin nisan kilomita 6 da gabashin iyakar da Kamaru.  Tafkin Mayo Kébbi ne ke bashi ruwa, wanda ke ɓarin kusa da Lere karamin Tafkin Tréné . [1]

english_source: Liceu's parents, José Vieira Dias and Jaquenita do Aniceto de Carvalho, were originally from northern Angola and were of Kongo origin. They migrated to Luanda, where Liceu was born on 1 May 1919.[1] Liceu was one of the couples ten children, the others being Fernando Torres Vieira Dias, Domingas Torres Vieira Dias, José Vieira Dias Filho, Antónia Diniz de Aniceto Vieira Dias, Joaquim Militão Vieira Dias, Zita Vieira Dias, Manuel Helder Vieira Dias, Novato Vieira Dias, and Bernardo Vieira Dias.
target1_text: Iyayen Liceu, José Vieira Dias da Jaquenita do Aniceto de Carvalho, sun fito ne daga arewacin Angola kuma ƴan asalin Kongo ne. Sun yi ƙaura zuwa Luanda, inda aka haifi Liceu a ranar 1 ga Mayu 1919. [1] Liceu yana ɗaya daga cikin ma'auratan yara goma, sauran su ne Fernando Torres Vieira Dias, Domingas Torres Vieira Dias, José Vieira Dias Filho, Antónia Diniz de Aniceto Vieira Dias, Joaquim Militão Vieira Dias, Zita Vieira Dias, Manuel Helder Vieira Dias, Novatoe.
