Sun yi ƙaura zuwa Luanda, inda aka haifi Liceu a ranar 1 ga watan Mayu 1919. [1] Liceu yana ɗaya daga cikin 'ya'yan ma'auratan yara goma, sauran su ne Fernando Torres Vieira Dias, Domingas Torres Vieira Dias, José Vieira Dias Filho, Antónia Diniz de Aniceto Vieira Dias, Joaquim Militão Vieira Dias, Zita Vieira Dias, Manuel Helder Vieira Dias, Novatoe.

english_source: He began his musical career while a government employee at the National Bank of Angola in the 1930s, a position he held until he was imprisoned in 1959. He was forced out of the institution in 1962, after a disciplinary process claimed that he frequently did not show up for work despite having been imprisoned during that time period.[1]

An tilasta masa ficewa daga makarantar a shekarar 1962, bayan da tsarin ladabtarwa ya yi ikirarin cewa ba ya zuwa aiki akai-akai duk da cewa an ɗaure shi a lokacin. [1]
target2_text: Ya fara harkar waka ne a lokacin da yake ma’aikacin gwamnati a babban bankin kasar Angola a shekarun 1930, mukamin da ya rike har aka daure shi a shekarar 1959. An tilasta masa ficewa daga makarantar a shekarar 1962, bayan da tsarin ladabtarwa ya yi ikirarin cewa ba ya zuwa aiki akai-akai duk da cewa an daure shi a lokacin. [1]

english_source: Liceu was also one of the co-founders of the Movement for the Independence of Angola (MIA) and MPLA.[4] He was later imprisoned for more than a decade at Tarrafal concentration camp in Cape Verde, being implicated in the Trial of Fifty.[5] By the time he had left prison in 1969, Liceu attempted to reunite the members of Ngola Ritmos again beginning in the 1970s, but encountered major difficulties due to political persecution. They were effectively blocked out of public performances or political activities. After the war for Angola's independence ended in 1975, the subsequent civil war brought a rapid decline to musical productions in Angola. In 1978, Ngola Ritmos made their last public appearance with all of their members. Liceu began performing solo afterwards.[6]
target1_text: Liceu kuma ya kasance daya daga cikin wadanda suka kafa kungiyar Movement for the Independence of Angola (MIA) da MPLA. [1] Daga baya an daure shi fiye da shekaru goma a sansanin taro na Tarrafal da ke Cape Verde, ana tuhumar sa a cikin shari'ar hamsin . [2] A lokacin da ya bar gidan yari a shekarar 1969, Liceu ya yi yunkurin sake haduwa da mambobin Ngola Ritmos tun daga shekarun 1970, amma ya ci karo da manyan matsaloli saboda tsanantar siyasa. An toshe su yadda ya kamata daga ayyukan jama'a ko ayyukan siyasa. Bayan yakin neman 'yancin kai na Angola a shekarar 1975, yakin basasar da ya biyo baya ya kawo koma baya ga ayyukan kade-kade a Angola. A cikin 1978, Ngola Ritmos sun fito fili na ƙarshe tare da dukkan membobinsu. Liceu ya fara yin solo daga baya. [3]
target2_text: Liceu kuma ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka kafa kungiyar Movement for the Independence of Angola (MIA) da MPLA. [1] Daga baya an ɗaure shi fiye da shekaru goma a sansanin taro na Tarrafal da ke Cape Verde, ana tuhumar sa a cikin shari'ar hamsin. [2] A lokacin da ya bar gidan yari a shekarar 1969, Liceu ya yi yunkurin sake haɗuwa da mambobin Ngola Ritmos tun daga shekarun 1970, amma ya ci karo da manyan matsaloli saboda tsanantar siyasa. An toshe su yadda ya kamata daga ayyukan jama'a ko ayyukan siyasa. Bayan yakin neman 'yancin kai na Angola a shekarar 1975, yakin basasar da ya biyo baya ya kawo koma baya ga ayyukan kaɗe-kaɗe a Angola. A cikin shekarar 1978, Ngola Ritmos sun fito fili na ƙarshe tare da dukkan membobinsu. Liceu ya fara yin solo daga baya. [3]

english_source: Liceu married Maria Natércia de Almeida Vieira Dias in 1949, having 4 children with her: Carlitos Vieira Dias, Luzia Zizi, Ferdinando "Xinito" Vieira Dias, and Felipe de Nery "Pino" Vieira Dias.[1]
target1_text: Liceu ta auri Maria Natércia de Almeida Vieira Dias a 1949, tana da yara 4 tare da ita: Carlitos Vieira Dias, Luzia Zizi, Ferdinando "Xinito" Vieira Dias, da Felipe de Nery "Pino" Vieira Dias. [1]

english_source: Cassava was one of the crops imported from Latin America through the Manila galleons from at least the 16th century.[2][3] Cassava cake is a type of bibingka (traditional baked cakes), having its origins from adopting native recipes but using cassava instead of the traditional galapong (ground glutinous rice) batter. It is also known more rarely as cassava bibingka or bibingkang kamoteng kahoy, although the English name is more commonly used.[3][5] In Quezon, cassava cake is more commonly known as budin.[6][7]
target1_text: Cassava na ɗaya daga cikin amfanin gona da aka shigo da su daga Latin Amurka ta hanyar Manila galleons daga akalla karni na 16. [1][2] Cassava cake wani nau'in bibingka ne (keke na gargajiya), wanda ya samo asali ne daga karɓar girke-girke na asali amma ta amfani da cassava maimakon galapong na gargajiya (shinkafa mai laushi). Har ila yau, an san shi da wuya a matsayin cassava bibingka ko bibingkang kaatuang casso, kodayake ana amfani da sunan Ingilishi mafi yawa.[3][4] A Quezon, cake cassava an fi sani da budin.[5][6]
target2_text: Rogo na ɗaya daga cikin amfanin gona da aka shigo da su daga Latin Amurka ta hanyar Manila galleons daga akalla karni na 16. [1][2] wainar rogo (Ďan Narogo) wani nau'in bibingka ne (keke na gargajiya), wanda ya samo asali ne daga karɓar girke-girke na asali amma ta amfani da cassava maimakon galapong na gargajiya (shinkafa mai laushi). Har ila yau, an san shi da wuya a matsayin cassava bibingka ko bibingkang kaatuang casso, kodayake ana amfani da sunan Ingilishi mafi yawa.[3][4] A Quezon, cake cassava an fi sani da budin.[5][6]

english_source: Mahe was born in 1951 in Ilorin, Ilorin South Local Government Area of Kwara State, Nigeria. He studied Business Administration at the University of Calabar, where he obtained his master's degree. Additionally, he earned an Ordinary National Diploma and a Higher National Diploma in Marketing from Kaduna Polytechnic and Kwara State Polytechnic, respectively.[1]
target1_text: An haifi Mahe a shekarar 1951 a Ilorin, karamar hukumar Ilorin ta kudu a Jihar Kwara, kasar Najeriya. Ya karanta Business Administration a Jami'ar Calabar, inda ya samu digiri na biyu. Bugu da kari, ya samu takardar shaidar kammala difloma ta kasa(ND) da kuma babbar difloma(HND)a fannin kasuwanci daga Kaduna Polytechnic da kuma Kwara State Polytechnic, bi da bi. [1]
target2_text: An haifi Mahe a shekarar 1951 a Ilorin, karamar hukumar Ilorin ta kudu a jihar Kwara, Najeriya. Ya karanta Business Administration a Jami'ar Calabar, inda ya samu digiri na biyu. Bugu da kari, ya samu takardar shaidar kammala difloma ta kasa da kuma babbar difloma a fannin kasuwanci daga Kaduna Polytechnic da Kwara State Polytechnic, bi da bi. [1]

english_source: In September 2023, Mahe was appointed the State Secretary to the Government of Kwara State, a position he held prior to his appointment as Chief of Staff to the Executive Governor of Kwara State, Mallam AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq. Mahe, a retired permanent secretary, also served as the former Clerk at the Kwara State House of Assembly.[1][3][4]
target1_text: A watan Satumbar 2023, an zaɓi Mahe a matsayin sakataren gwamnatin jihar Kwara, mukamin da ya rike kafin a nada shi a matsayin shugaban ma’aikatan gwamnan jihar Kwara, Mallam AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq. Mahe, wanda ya kasance sakataren dindindin wanda yayi ritaya, ya kuma taba zama tsohon magatakarda a majalisar dokokin Jihar Kwara. [1] [2] [3]
target2_text: A watan Satumbar 2023, an nada Mahe a matsayin sakataren gwamnatin jihar Kwara, mukamin da ya rike kafin a nada shi a matsayin shugaban ma’aikatan gwamnan jihar Kwara, Mallam AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq. Mahe, wanda ya kasance sakataren dindindin mai ritaya, ya kuma taba zama tsohon magatakarda a majalisar dokokin jihar Kwara. [1] [2] [3]

english_source: Avelino Henrique Saíde Vieira Dias Rodrigues Mingas (13 February 1934 – 27 May 1977) was an Angolan revolutionary, economist, writer, and politician who was a notable figure in the anti-colonial struggle for independence in Angola. He was the first Minister of Finance of Angola and one of the ten members of the first national legislature, the Revolutionary Council of the People (or the "Council of the Revolution"). He was also a member of the Central Committee of the Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA). A close associate of Agostinho Neto and Lúcio Lara, he was killed by people associated with the fractionists during the 1977 Angolan coup attempt.
target1_text: Avelino Henrique Saíde Vieira Dias Rodrigues Mingas (13 Fabrairu 1934 – 27 May 1977) ɗan juyin juya hali ne, masanin tattalin arziki, marubuci, kuma ɗan siyasa ɗan ƙasar Angola wanda ya yi fice a gwagwarmayar neman ‘yancin kai a Angola. Shi ne ministan kudi na farko na Angola kuma daya daga cikin goma na majalisar dokoki ta farko ta kasa, majalisar juyin juya hali ta al'umma (ko "majalisar juyin juya hali"). Ya kuma kasance memba na kwamitin tsakiya na Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA). Wani makusancin Agostinho Neto da Lúcio Lara, mutanen da ke da alaka da ' yan ta'adda sun kashe shi a lokacin yunkurin juyin mulkin Angola na 1977 .
target2_text: Avelino Henrique Saíde Vieira Dias Rodrigues Mingas (13 Fabrairu 1934 – 27 May 1977) ɗan juyin juya hali ne, masanin tattalin arziki, marubuci, kuma ɗan siyasa ɗan ƙasar Angola wanda ya yi fice a gwagwarmayar neman ‘yancin kai a Angola. Shi ne ministan kuɗi na farko na Angola kuma ɗaya daga cikin goma na majalisar dokoki ta farko ta ƙasa, majalisar juyin juya hali ta al'umma (ko "majalisar juyin juya hali"). Ya kuma kasance memba na kwamitin tsakiya na Popular Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA). Wani makusancin Agostinho Neto da Lúcio Lara, mutanen da ke da alaka da ' yan ta'adda sun kashe shi a lokacin yunkurin juyin mulkin Angola na shekarar 1977.

english_source: In the middle of the Carnation Revolution and the expectations of the decolonization of Angola, he was invited by Neto in July 1974 to serve in as a party representative at the Organisation of African Unity to discuss and attempt one last solution to split the Active Revolt and the Eastern Revolt.[8] Frustrated and obliged to, he received permission with other commanders to reformulate the EPLA and transformed it into the People's Armed Forces of Liberation of Angola (FAPLA).[9]
target1_text: A tsakiyar juyin juya hali na Carnation da kuma tsammanin da za a yankewa Angola mulkin mallaka, Neto ya gayyace shi a cikin Yuli 1974 don zama wakilin jam'iyya a Ƙungiyar Hadin Kan Afirka don tattaunawa da ƙoƙarin warwarewa ta ƙarshe don raba Tawayen Aiki da Tawayen Gabas. [1] Cike da takaici kuma ya zama dole, ya sami izini tare da wasu kwamandoji don sake fasalin EPLA kuma ya canza ta zuwa Rundunar Sojojin Yantar da Angola (FAPLA). [2]
target2_text: A tsakiyar juyin juya hali na Carnation da kuma tsammanin da za a yankewa Angola mulkin mallaka, Neto ya gayyace shi a cikin watan Yuli 1974 don zama wakilin jam'iyya a Ƙungiyar Haɗin Kan Afirka don tattaunawa da ƙoƙarin warwarewa ta ƙarshe don raba Tawayen Aiki da Tawayen Gabas. [1] Cike da takaici kuma ya zama dole, ya sami izini tare da wasu kwamandoji don sake fasalin EPLA kuma ya canza ta zuwa Rundunar Sojojin Yantar da Angola (FAPLA). [2]

english_source: On 8 November 1974 he lodged with the “delegation of 26” of the party, led by secretary-general Lara. His participation contributed to his rapid ascension into leadership positions in the MPLA, including being elected to the Central Committee of the Movement.[6] In January 1975, at the Alvor Agreement, he organized the Presidential Council on the Transition of Government as the minister of Planning and Finances.[10]
target1_text: A ranar 8 ga watan Nuwamba, 1974 ya zauna tare da "wakilan 26" na jam'iyyar, wanda babban sakataren Lara ya jagoranta. Shigar da ya yi ya taimaka wajen hawan sa cikin gaggawa zuwa muƙaman shugabanci a cikin MPLA, ciki har da zaɓen da aka yi masa a kwamitin tsakiya na kungiyar. [1] A cikin shekarar Janairu 1975, a Yarjejeniyar Alvor, ya shirya Majalisar Shugaban Ƙasa akan Canjin Gwamnati a matsayin Ministan Tsare-tsare da Kuɗi. [2]
target2_text: A ranar 8 ga Nuwamba, 1974 ya zauna tare da "wakilan 26" na jam'iyyar, wanda babban sakataren Lara ya jagoranta. Shigar da ya yi ya taimaka wajen hawan sa cikin gaggawa zuwa mukaman shugabanci a cikin MPLA, ciki har da zaben da aka yi masa a kwamitin tsakiya na kungiyar. [1] A cikin Janairu 1975, a Yarjejeniyar Alvor, ya shirya Majalisar Shugaban Kasa akan Canjin Gwamnati a matsayin Ministan Tsare-tsare da Kuɗi. [2]

english_source: He became a militant in the nationalist movements, influenced by his uncle. However, as a result of both his uncle and his father being arrested in the beginning of the 1960s, he moved to Portugal for his studies.[6] There, he came to be known as an excellent athlete and sportsman. While playing for a local sports team, he was warned that he would be arrested. He was able to outsmart the Portuguese police under the pretext of participating in a sports competition in Spain, and subsequently fled to Paris.[6] He took refuge with Mário Pinto de Andrade,[2] owing to his formal affiliation with the MPLA.[6]
target1_text: Ya zama mai fafutuka a harkar kishin kasa, wanda kawunsa ya yi tasiri. Koyaya, sakamakon kama kawunsa da mahaifinsa a farkon shekarun 1960, ya koma Portugal don karatunsa. [1] A can, an san shi a matsayin ƙwararren ɗan wasa da ɗan wasa. Yayin da yake taka leda a kungiyar wasanni na gida, an gargade shi cewa za a kama shi. Ya sami damar wuce gona da iri a 'yan sandan Portugal a karkashin zargin shiga gasar wasanni a Spain, kuma daga baya ya gudu zuwa Paris . [1] Ya fake da Mário Pinto de Andrade, [2] saboda kasancewarsa na yau da kullun tare da MPLA. [1]

english_source: On their side, during a meeting with the Central Committee of the MPLA in February 1977, Mingas was one of those who accused the nitistas of “fractionalism”.[13] Along with this, on 21 May 1977, he became aware of documents relating to the expulsion of Nito Alves and José Jacinto Van-Dúnem from the party.[13] At the same time, his youngest brother, Zé Mingas, a police commander in the Directory of Information and Security of Angola (DISA), had become a supporter of the nitistas and informed Alves of plans to dismantle the coup attempt against the state.[16]
target1_text: A nasu ɓangaren, yayin ganawa da kwamitin tsakiya na MPLA a watan Fabrairun 1977, Mingas yana ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka zargi nitistas da "rashin ra'ayi". [1] Tare da wannan, a ranar 21 ga watan Mayu 1977, ya fahimci takardun da suka shafi korar Nito Alves da José Jacinto Van-Dúnem daga jam'iyyar. [1] A lokaci guda kuma, ƙannensa, Zé Mingas, wani kwamandan 'yan sanda a cikin Directory of Information and Security of Angola (DISA), ya zama mai goyon bayan nitistas kuma ya sanar da Alves game da shirin wargaza yunkurin juyin mulkin da aka yi wa jihar. [2]

[1] Tare da wannan, a ranar 21 ga Mayu 1977, ya fahimci takardun da suka shafi korar Nito Alves da José Jacinto Van-Dúnem daga jam'iyyar. [1] A lokaci guda kuma, ƙannensa, Zé Mingas, wani kwamandan 'yan sanda a cikin Directory of Information and Security of Angola (DISA), ya zama mai goyon bayan nitistas kuma ya sanar da Alves game da shirin wargaza yunkurin juyin mulkin da aka yi wa jihar. [2]

english_source: On 27 May 1977, the nitistas attempted to overthrow the state.[13] Various national leaders were taken hostage, among them Mingas, who had driven to meet with Neto and lead a group to attempt to retake the 9th Brigade headquarters and take control of the mutinous troops.[13] Mingas was captured by the nitistas from DISA and was taken, along with Eugénio Nzaji and other military personnel against the revolt, to Sambizanga, where they were later burned alive.[13] Zé Mingas was not aware of the plans of the nitistas to kidnap and kill his brother, and himself was ultimately killed during the violent repression by the state against the coup attempt.
target1_text: A ranar 27 ga Mayu 1977, nitistas sun yi yunkurin hambarar da jihar. [1] An yi garkuwa da shugabannin kasar daban-daban, ciki har da Mingas, wanda ya tuka motar Neto don ganawa da Neto, ya jagoranci wata kungiyar da ta yi yunkurin kwato hedikwatar Brigade ta 9 da kuma kwace iko da sojojin da suka yi kaca-kaca da su. [1] An kama Mingas daga nitistas daga DISA kuma an dauke su tare da Eugénio Nzaji da wasu jami'an soji da ke adawa da tawayen zuwa Sambizanga, inda daga baya aka kona su da ransu. [1] Zé Mingas bai san shirin nitistas na yin garkuwa da kuma kashe dan uwansa ba, kuma a karshe an kashe shi a lokacin da ake muzgunawa jihar a kan yunkurin juyin mulkin.
target2_text: A ranar 27 ga watan Mayu 1977, nitistas sun yi yunkurin hambarar da jihar. [1] An kama Mingas daga nitistas daga DISA kuma an ɗauke su tare da Eugénio Nzaji da wasu jami'an soji da ke adawa da tawayen zuwa Sambizanga, inda daga baya aka kona su da ransu. [1] Zé Mingas bai san shirin nitistas na yin garkuwa da kuma kashe ɗan uwansa ba, kuma a ƙarshe an kashe shi a lokacin da ake muzgunawa jihar a kan yunkurin juyin mulkin.

english_source: In 2019, president of Angola João Lourenço ordered the revision of the official history of the events of the 1977 coup attempt inside the “Reconciliation Plan in Memory of Victims of Armed Conflict in Angola”.[20] Mingas’ daughter, lawyer Xissole Madeira Vieira Dias Mingas, received, in June 2021, her father's official death certificate.[21]
target1_text: A cikin shekarar 2019, shugaban Angola João Lourenço ya ba da umarnin sake duba tarihin hukuma na abubuwan da suka faru na yunƙurin juyin mulkin 1977 a cikin "Shirin sulhu don tunawa da waɗanda rikicin ya rutsa da su a Angola". [1] Ɗiyar Mingas, lauya Xissole Madeira Vieira Dias Mingas, ta samu, a watan Yuni 2021, takardar shaidar mutuwar mahaifinta a hukumance. [2]
target2_text: A cikin 2019, shugaban Angola João Lourenço ya ba da umarnin sake duba tarihin hukuma na abubuwan da suka faru na yunƙurin juyin mulkin 1977 a cikin "Shirin sulhu don tunawa da waɗanda rikicin ya rutsa da su a Angola". [1] Diyar Mingas, lauya Xissole Madeira Vieira Dias Mingas, ta samu, a watan Yuni 2021, takardar shaidar mutuwar mahaifinta a hukumance. [2]

english_source: Djorf Torba Dam is a dam in Kenadsa District, Béchar Province, Algeria, crossing the Oued Guir about 50 kilometres (31 mi) west of the capital, Béchar.[3][4] It is used for the purposes of irrigation and water supply.[2] The area around the head of the dam features a number of notable ancient monuments.[5] The dam has resulted in a significant reduction in the flow of Oued Guir and Oued Saoura in locations downstream of the dam.[1]
target1_text: Djorf Torba Dam wani madatsar ruwa ne a cikin Gundumar Kenadsa, Lardin Bechar, Aljeriya, yana haye Oued Guir kimanin kilomita 50 (31 yammacin babban birnin, Béchar .[1][2] Ana amfani dashi don dalilai na ban ruwa da samar da ruwa.[3] Yankin da ke kusa da shugaban madatsar ruwan yana da wasu sanannun abubuwan tunawa na dā.[4] Dam din ya haifar da raguwa mai yawa a cikin kwararar Oued Guir da Oued Saoura a wuraren da ke ƙasa da madatsar ruwan.
target2_text: Djorf Torba Dam wani madatsar ruwa ne a cikin Gundumar Kenadsa, Lardin Bechar, Aljeriya, yana hayin Oued Guir kimanin nisan kilomita 50 (31 daga yammacin babban birnin, Béchar .[1][2] Ana amfani dashi don dalilai na ban ruwa da samar da ruwa.[3] Yankin da ke kusa da shugaban madatsar ruwan yana da wasu sanannun abubuwan tunawa na dā.[4] Dam ɗin ya haifar da raguwa mai yawa a cikin kwararar Oued Guir da Oued Saoura a wwuraren da ke ƙasa da madatsar rruwan.

english_source: On 31 July 1981, while Jawara was abroad, a 12-member National Revolutionary Council (NRC) headed by Sanyang seized control of the country. The leftist NRC accused Jawara's government of being "corrupt, tribalistic, and despotic". They also announced the suspension of the country's constitution and proclaimed their intention to establish a "dictatorship of the proletariat".
target1_text: A ranar 31 ga Yulin 1981, yayin da Jawara yake kasar waje, wata majalisar juyin juya hali ta kasa (NRC) mai wakilai 12 karkashin jagorancin Sanyang ta kwace iko da kasar. Jam'iyyar NRC ta hagu ta zargi gwamnatin Jawara da " cin hanci da rashawa, kabilanci, da kuma son zuciya ". Har ila yau, sun sanar da dakatar da kundin tsarin mulkin kasar tare da bayyana aniyarsu ta kafa " mulkin kama-karya na masu ra'ayin rikau ".
target2_text: A ranar 31 ga Yulin 1981, yayin da Jawara yake ƙasar waje, wata majalisar juyin juya hali ta kasa (NRC) mai wakilai 12 ƙarƙashin jagorancin Sanyang ta kwace iko da ƙasar. Jam'iyyar NRC leftist ta zargi gwamnatin Jawara da "cin hanci da rashawa, kabilanci, da kuma son zuciya". Har ila yau, sun sanar da dakatar da kundin tsarin mulkin ƙasar tare da bayyana aniyarsu ta kafa "mulkin kama-karya na masu ra'ayin rikau".

english_source: In early June 2006, shortly before the Gambian presidential elections, he was along with some of his men put in detention “at the house of a military officer in Bissau" during a visit to that country.[2] He was detained at the Masuang Military Camp "in maximum military detention” on 12 May 2007.[3] On January 30, some military officers in Bissau blocked their own government in its attempts to hand Kukoi Sanyang over to the authorities in Banjul.[2] That government has spent close to three million US dollars in its attempts at extradition, wanting to arrange for Sanyang's repatriation to Banjul against Casamance hard-line rebel leader being handed over to Senegal.[3] It has been suggested that Sanyang may have been preparing an attack on Yahya Jammeh prior to the elections, and then seize power.[citation needed]
target1_text: A farkon watan Yuni na shekara ta 2006, jim kadan kafin zaben shugaban kasar Gambia, yana tare da wasu mutanensa da aka tsare a “gidan wani jami’in soja da ke Bissau ” a wata ziyara da ya kai kasar. [1] An tsare shi a sansanin soji na Masuang "a iyakar tsare soja" a ranar 12 ga Mayu 2007. [2] A ranar 30 ga watan Janairu, wasu jami’an soji a Bissau sun tare gwamnatinsu a yunkurinta na mika Kukoi Sanyang ga hukuma a Banjul. [1] Wannan gwamnati ta kashe kusan dalar Amurka miliyan uku wajen yunkurin tasa keyar kasar, inda take son shirya mayar da Sanyang zuwa Banjul a kan mika shugaban 'yan tawayen Casamance ga Senegal. [2] An dai bayyana cewa, mai yiwuwa Sanyang ya shirya kai hari kan Yahya Jammeh kafin zaben, sannan ya kwace mulki. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

english_source: During the Congress of Vienna on 21 January 1815 the British agreed to pay the Portuguese Prince Regent £300,000 in reparations for Portuguese ships seized by the British "cruizers" prior to 1 June 1814, on the basis that they were engaged in the slave trade.[5]: 73  The next day they entered into a further treaty which prohibited Portuguese ships from engaging in the slave trade along the coast of Africa north of the equator.[5]: 77 This was tied to a loan of £600,000 and the treaty was to be ratified within five months.[5]: 79  Over two years later on 28 July 1817 an Additional Convention was added which included the first provision for Mixed Commissions formed of an equal number of individuals of the two nations. One was to be located in a British possession and the other in a Portuguese possession, with one on the coast of Africa, and the other on the coast of Brazil.[5]: 89  A further Mixed Commission was also set up on a similar basis in London. While the treaty allowed Portuguese slave traders to continue their business south of the equator, the trade was forbidden to the north. The £300,000 mentioned in 1815 had not been paid, but the British agreed to pay it in two instalments of £150,000, as well as 5% interest since the earlier convention in January 1815. Full documentation of the treaty was to be available in English and Portuguese on all British ships. Further regulations governing the Mixed Commissions:
target1_text: A lokacin Majalisa ta Vienna a ranar 21 ga watan Janairun shekara ta 1815 Birtaniya ta amince da biyan Yarima Regent na Portugal £ 300,000 a matsayin fansa ga jiragen ruwa na Portugal da 'yan Birtaniya suka kwace kafin 1 ga Yuni 1814, bisa ga cewa suna cikin cinikin bayi. [1]: 73 Kashegari sun shiga wani yarjejeniya wanda ya hana jiragen ruwa na Portugal shiga cinikin bayi a bakin tekun Afirka a arewacin ma'auni.[1]: 77 Wannan an ɗaure shi da rancen £ 600,000 kuma za a tabbatar da yarjejeniyar cikin watanni biyar.[1]: 79 Fiye da shekaru biyu bayan haka a ranar 28 ga Yuli 1817 an kara wani Ƙarin Yarjejeniya wanda ya haɗa da tanadi na farko don Kwamitin Haɗin gwiwa wanda aka kafa na daidaitattun mutane na ƙasashe biyu. Ɗaya zai kasance a cikin mallakar Burtaniya ɗayan kuma a cikin mallakarsa ta Fotigal, tare da ɗaya a bakin tekun Afirka, ɗayan kuma a bakin tekon Brazil.[1]: 89 An kuma kafa wani hadin gwiwa a kan irin wannan tushe a London. Duk da yake yarjejeniyar ta ba da damar 'yan kasuwa na bayi na Portugal su ci gaba da kasuwancin su a kudancin ma'auni, an haramta cinikin zuwa arewa. Ba a biya £ 300,000 da aka ambata a 1815 ba, amma Birtaniya sun amince da biyan shi a kashi biyu na £ 150,000, da kuma kashi 5% tun lokacin da aka yi taron da ya gabata a watan Janairun 1815. Cikakken takardun yarjejeniyar za su kasance a cikin Turanci da Portuguese a duk jiragen ruwa na Burtaniya. Ƙarin ƙa'idodi da ke kula da Kwamitin Haɗin Kai:

english_source: Lamia Fathi Abusedra (26 January 1974) is a Libyan engineer, revolutionary, and political ambassador. From May 2022, she has served as the Permanent Representative of Libya to the United Nations at Geneva.
target1_text: Lamia Fathi Abusedra (26 Janairu 1974) injiniyar Libya ce, 'yar juyin juya hali, kuma jakadiyar siyasa. Daga watan Mayu 2022, ta yi aiki a matsayin wakilin dindindin na Libya a Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya a Geneva.
target2_text: Lamia Fathi Abusedra (26 Janairu 1974) injiniyan Libya ce, mai neman sauyi, kuma jakadiyar siyasa. Daga Mayu 2022, ta yi aiki a matsayin wakilin dindindin na Libya a Majalisar Dinkin Duniya a Geneva .

english_source: Abusedra achieved her Bachelor of Science and Master of Science degrees at the University of Garyounis in Benghazi. After achieving her PhD at the University of Exeter in the United Kingdom, Abusedra worked as an associate researcher at Exeter's School of Engineering, Computer Science and Mathematics from 2007 to 2009.[1]
target1_text: Abusedra ta samu digirin farko na Kimiyya da Digiri na biyu a Jami'ar Garyounis da ke Benghazi . Bayan ta sami digiri na uku a Jami'ar Exeter a Burtaniya, Abusedra ta yi aiki a matsayin abokiyar bincike a Makarantar Injiniya, Kimiyyar Kwamfuta da Lissafi daga 2007 zuwa 2009. [1]

english_source: Abusedra then became the Head of International Relations Administration under the new de facto government of Libya, serving with the National Transitional Council’s Office for Culture and Civil Society.[1] From March 2013 to December 2014, she served as Deputy Minister of Information of Libya. From June 2017 to June 2020, she served as an advisor to the Minister of State for Institution Reform.[2][3]

[1] Daga Maris 2013 zuwa Disamba 2014, ta yi aiki a matsayin mataimakiyar ministar yada labarai na Libya. Daga watan Yuni 2017 zuwa Yuni 2020, ta yi aiki a matsayin mai ba da shawara ga Karamar Ministar Ma'aikatar Gyaran Hukumomi. [2] [3]

english_source: In this role, Abusedra has supported and cooperated with the UN's independent fact-finding mission, which had a mandate to investigate human rights, in Libya. The mission found "reports of torture, extrajudicial killings, enforced disappearances and sexual and gender-based violence" and "political division, insecurity, the proliferation of weapons and the increasing phenomenon of irregular migration and external intervention." A national human rights plan has been implemented in Libya to address the issues and violations of international human rights law.[7][8]
target1_text: A cikin wannan rawar, Abusedra ya ba da goyon baya tare da ba da haɗin kai tare da tawagar bincike mai zaman kanta ta Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya, wacce ke da alhakin binciken 'yancin ɗan adam, a Libya. Ofishin ya gano "rahotanni na azabtarwa, kisan gilla, tilasta ɓacewar mutane da cin zarafi na jima'i da jinsi" da "rarrabuwar siyasa, rashin tsaro, yaɗuwar makamai da kyaruwar al'amuran ƙaura ba bisa ka'ida ba da kuma shiga tsakani na waje." An aiwatar da wani shiri na kare hakkin ɗan Adam na ƙasa a Libya don magance batutuwa da take hakki na dokokin ƙasa da ƙasa. [1] [2]

Ofishin ya gano "rahotanni na azabtarwa, kisan gilla, tilasta bacewar mutane da cin zarafi na jima'i da jinsi" da "rarrabuwar siyasa, rashin tsaro, yaduwar makamai da karuwar al'amuran ƙaura ba bisa ka'ida ba da kuma shiga tsakani na waje." english_source: After independence, while commanding the National Liberation Army of the South, he helped found the UNFP, a socialist party that split from the Istiqlal party in 1959, and headed its daily newspaper, Al-Tahrir.

target2_text: Bayan samun 'yancin kai, a lokacin da yake jagorantar rundunar 'yantar da 'yancin kai ta Kudu, ya taimaka wajen kafa UNFP, jam'iyyar gurguzu wacce ta ɓalle daga jam'iyyar Istiqlal a shekarar 1959, kuma ta jagoranci jaridarta ta Al-Tahrir.

english_source: Victim of a heart attack, Basri died in Chefchaouen on October 14, 2003, soon after a Paris surgical operation. He was buried on 15 October.

target2_text: Wanda ya kamu da ciwon zuciya, Basri ya mutu a Chefchaouen a ranar 14 ga watan Oktoba, 2003, jim kaɗan bayan wani aikin tiyata a Paris. An binne shi a ranar 15 ga watan Oktoba.

english_source: Festus Olanrewaju Akingbaso commonly known as Fessy West (Born 6 June 1970) is a Nigerian entrepreneur and politician, he is currently serving as the representative for the Idanre/Ifedore Federal Constituency in the 10th House of Representatives under the platform of the Peoples Democratic Party.[1][2][3]
target1_text: Festus Olanrewaju Akingbaso wanda aka fi sani da Fessy West (an haife shi a ranar 6 ga watan Yunin shekara ta 1970) ɗan kasuwa ne kuma ɗan siyasan ƙasar Najeriya, a halin yanzu yana aiki a matsayin wakilin mazaɓar Tarayya ta Idanre / Ifedore a cikin Majalisar Wakilai ta 10 a ƙarƙashin inuwar jam'iyyar Peoples Democratic Party . [1] [2][3]

english_source: At an All Progressives Congress campaign event in Lagos in 2019, MC Oluomo was stabbed by someone thought to be loyal to the then outgoing Lagos State governor, Akinwumi Ambode whose re-election bid had been thwarted.[6]
target1_text: A wani taron yakin neman zabe na All Progressives Congress a Legas a shekarar 2019, wani da ake zaton yana da aminci ga Gwamnan Jihar Legas mai barin gado, Akinwumi Ambode wanda aka hana sake zabensa.[1]
target2_text: A wani taron yaƙin neman zaɓe na jam'iyyar All Progressives Congress a Legas a shekarar 2019, wani da ake zaton yana da aminci ga Gwamnan Jihar Legas mai barin gado, Akinwumi Ambode wanda aka hana sake zaɓensa.[1]

english_source: In 1976, he appeared in Ola Balogun's Ajani Ogun and later produced and starred Ija Ominira (1979), also directed by Balogun. Kadara, also called Destiny in English was the first movie he wrote, produced and also starred as the leading actor. The movie was shown at the ninth Tashkent film festival for African and Asian cinema. Afolayan went on to produce and star in other productions such as Ija Orogun, Taxi Driver and Iya ni Wura.[1]
target1_text: A shekara ta 1976, ya bayyana a cikin Ola Balogun's Ajani Ogun kuma daga baya ya samar da kuma fito da Ija Ominira (1979), wanda Balogun ya jagoranta. Kadara, wanda kuma ake kira Destiny a Turanci shine fim na farko da ya rubuta, ya samar ya fito a matsayin babban ɗan wasan kwaikwayo. An nuna fim ɗin a bikin fim na Tashkent na tara don fina-finai na Afirka da nahiyar Asiya. Afolayan ya ci gaba da samarwa da kuma fitowa a wasu shirye-shirye kamar Ija Orogun, Taxi Driver da Iya ko Wura . [1]
target2_text: A shekara ta 1976, ya bayyana a cikin Ola Balogun's Ajani Ogun kuma daga baya ya samar da kuma fito da Ija Ominira (1979), wanda Balogun ya jagoranta. An nuna fim din a bikin fim na Tashkent na tara don fina-finai na Afirka da Asiya. Afolayan ya ci gaba da samarwa da kuma fitowa a wasu shirye-shirye kamar Ija Orogun, Taxi Driver da Iya ko Wura . [1]

english_source: Adeyemi Ambrose Afolahan (born 26 December 1949) was appointed the first Administrator of Taraba State, Nigeria in August 1991 after the state was created from part of the old Gongola State during the military regime of General Ibrahim Babangida. He handed over to the elected civilian governor Jolly Nyame in January 1992 at the start of the Third Nigerian Republic.[1]
target1_text: Adeyemi Ambrose Afolahan (an haife shi a ranar 26 ga watan Disamba na shekara ta 1949) an nada shi mai gudanarwa na farko na Jihar Taraba, Najeriya a watan Agustan shekara ta 1991 bayan an kirkiro jihar daga wani ɓangare na tsohuwar Jihar Gongola a lokacin mulkin soja na Janar Ibrahim Babangida .Ya mika wuya ga zababben gwamnan farar hula Jolly Nyame a watan Janairun 1992 a farkon Jamhuriyar Najeriya ta Uku. [1]

[1]

english_source: Afolahan was born on 26 December 1949 in Ibadan, Oyo State. He studied in Nigeria and the United Kingdom. Posts included deputy commandant, National War College, Abuja, Chief of Naval Operations and Chief of Naval Plans.[2]
target1_text: An haifi Afolahan a ranar 26 ga watan Disambae shekarar 1949 a Ibadan, Jihar Oyo . Ya yi karatu a Najeriya da ƙasar Ingila. Matsayin da ya riƙe sun haɗa da mataimakin kwamandan, Kwalejin Yaƙin Ƙasa, Abuja, Shugaban Ayyukan Sojan Ruwa da Shugaban Shirye-shiryen Sojan Rukunin.[1]
target2_text: An haifi Afolahan a ranar 26 ga watan Disamba 1949 a Ibadan, Jihar Oyo . Ya yi karatu a Najeriya da Ingila.Matsayi sun hada da mataimakin kwamandan, Kwalejin Yakin Kasa, Abuja, Shugaban Ayyukan Sojan Ruwa da Shugaban Shirye-shiryen Sojan Rukunin.[1]

english_source: Speaking at a seminar in Lagos in May 2000, Afolahan called on Nigerian youths to abstain from sex or at least use condoms to ensure an AIDS-free society.[3]
target1_text: Da yake magana a wani taro a jihar Legas a watan Mayu na shekara ta 2000, Afolahan ya yi kira ga matasa na Najeriya da su guji yin jima'i ko aƙalla amfani da kwaroron roba don tabbatar da al'umma marar cutar kanjamau.[1]
target2_text: Da yake magana a wani taro a Legas a watan Mayu na shekara ta 2000, Afolahan ya yi kira ga matasa na Najeriya da su guji yin jima'i ko aƙalla amfani da kwaroron roba don tabbatar da al'umma marar cutar kanjamau.[1]

english_source: Involved in politics since his youth, Bouabid became one of the youngest activists and politicians to sign the Proclamation of Independence of Morocco, a manifesto presented by the Independence party on 11 January 1944 demanding full independence from France and Spain, national reunification, and a democratic constitution.
target1_text: Tun yana matashi Bouabid ya tsunduma cikin harkokin siyasa tun yana matashi, ya zama daya daga cikin matasa 'yan gwagwarmaya da 'yan siyasa da suka rattaba hannu kan ayyana 'yancin kai na Maroko, takardar da jam'iyyar 'yancin kai ta gabatar a ranar 11 ga watan Janairun 1944 tana neman cikakken 'yancin kai daga Faransa da Spain, hadewar kasa, da tsarin mulkin demokradiyya.
target2_text: Tun yana matashi Bouabid ya tsunduma cikin harkokin siyasa tun yana matashi, ya zama ɗaya daga cikin matasa 'yan gwagwarmaya da 'yan siyasa da suka rattaba hannu kan ayyana 'yancin kai na Maroko, takardar da jam'iyyar 'yancin kai ta gabatar a ranar 11 ga watan Janairun 1944 tana neman cikakken 'yancin kai daga Faransa da Spain, haɗewar ƙasa, da tsarin mulkin Demokraɗiyya.

english_source: On 28 January 1944, Bouabid led a big demonstration in Salé denouncing the arrest of some influential figures of his party. He was jailed alongside a number of Istiqlal leaders before being released a year later. In 1946 he joined his friend Mehdi Ben Barka in France to write a report on the Moroccan situation and submit it to the United Nations. While living in France, he pursued his law studies at university and became a lawyer in 1949.[2]
target1_text: A ranar 28 ga watan Janairun 1944, Bouabid ya jagoranci wata babbar zanga-zanga a Salé yana yin tir da kama wasu masu faɗa a ji na jam'iyyarsa. An ɗaure shi ne tare da wasu shugabannin Istiklal kafin a sake shi bayan shekara guda. A cikin shekarar 1946 ya shiga tare da abokinsa Mehdi Ben Barka a Faransa don rubuta rahoto game da halin da Morocco ke ciki kuma ya miƙa shi ga Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya. Yayin da yake zaune a Faransa, ya ci gaba da karatunsa na shari'a a jami'a kuma ya zama lauya a shekarar 1949. [1]
target2_text: A ranar 28 ga Janairun 1944, Bouabid ya jagoranci wata babbar zanga-zanga a Salé yana yin tir da kama wasu masu fada a ji na jam'iyyarsa. An daure shi ne tare da wasu shugabannin Istiklal kafin a sake shi bayan shekara guda. A cikin 1946 ya shiga tare da abokinsa Mehdi Ben Barka a Faransa don rubuta rahoto game da halin da Morocco ke ciki kuma ya mika shi ga Majalisar Dinkin Duniya. Yayin da yake zaune a Faransa, ya ci gaba da karatunsa na shari'a a jami'a kuma ya zama lauya a 1949. [1]

english_source: Tumu is a town located in Gombe State, Nigeria's Akko Local Government Area. The distance between Gombe and Tumu is roughly 36 kilometers / 23 mi. The capital of Nigeria, Abuja, is located about 399 kilometers (248 miles) away from Tumu.[1]
target1_text: Tumu wani gari ne da ke cikin Jihar Gombe, Yankin Karamar Hukumar Akko ta Najeriya . Tsakanin Gombe da Tumu kusan kilomita 36 ne / 23 mi. Babban birnin Najeriya, Abuja, yana da nisan kilomita 399 (248 miles) daga Tumu.[1]
target2_text: Tumu wani gari ne da ke cikin Jihar Gombe, a Yankin Karamar Hukumar Akko ta Najeriya . Tsakanin cikin garin Gombe zuwa garin Tumu akwai kusan kilomita 36 ne / 23 mi. Daga Babban birnin Najeriya, Abuja, yana da nisan kilomita 399 (248 miles) daga Tumu.[1]

english_source: In Tumu, the weather is hot all year round, with a partly cloudy dry season and an unpleasant, overcast wet season. The average yearly temperature is rarely lower or higher than 25°F or 31°F; it often ranges above 100°F.[3]
target1_text: A garin Tumu, yanayi yana da zafi a duk shekara, tare da wani ɓangare na lokacin fari da kuma mummunan lokacin rigar. Matsakaicin zafin jiki na shekara-shekara ba ya da ƙasa da 25 ko sama da ° F ko 31 ° F; sau da yawa yana sama da 100 ° F.[1]
target2_text: A Tumu, yanayi yana da zafi a duk shekara, tare da wani ɓangare na lokacin fari da kuma mummunan lokacin rigar. Matsakaicin zafin jiki na shekara-shekara ba ya da ƙasa ko sama da 25 ° F ko 31 ° F; sau da yawa yana sama da 100 ° F.[1]

english_source: El Hamouti was born in Beni Ensar, in the Rif region of northern Morocco. He belonged to the Hamouti clan of the Mazzuja lineage, part of the larger Guelaya tribe. His father, Khader Muhand u Hamou, was a prominent trader who distributed goods from Melilla throughout the region.[1]
target1_text: An haifi El Hamouti a Beni Ensar, a yankin Rif na arewacin Maroko. Ya kasance dan kabilar Hamouti na zuriyar Mazzuja, wani yanki na babban kabilar Guelaya . Mahaifinsa, Khader Muhand u Hamou, hamshakin dan kasuwa ne da ke rarraba kayayyaki daga Melilla a duk fadin yankin. [1]
target2_text: An haifi El Hamouti a Beni Ensar, a yankin Rif na arewacin Maroko. Ya kasance ɗan ƙabilar Hamouti na zuriyar Mazzuja, wani yanki na babban ƙabilar Guelaya. Mahaifinsa, Khader Muhand u Hamou, hamshakin ɗan kasuwa ne da ke rarraba kayayyaki daga Melilla a duk faɗin yankin. [1]

english_source: Abdellah Zakour (in Tachelhit: ⵄⴱⴷⵍⵍⴰⵀ ⵣⴰⴳⵓⵔ), also known as "Amghar Gou Ablla" (Ait Abdallah, 1885 - 1972)[1] was a Moroccan Berber military leader who opposed the French conquest of Morocco in the early 20th century.
target1_text: Abdellah Zakour (a cikin Tachelhit), wanda aka fi sani da "Amghar Gou Ablla" (Ait Abdallah, 1885 - 1972) [1] ya kasance shugaban soja na Berber na Maroko wanda ya yi adawa da nasarar Faransa a Maroko a farkon ƙarni na 20.
target2_text: Abdellah Zakour (a cikin Tachelhit), wanda aka fi sani da "Amghar Gou Ablla" (Ait Abdallah, 1885 - 1972) [1] ya kasance shugaban soja na Berber na Maroko wanda ya yi tsayayya da nasarar Faransa a Maroko a farkon karni na 20.

english_source: In 2021, the High Commissioner for Former Resistants and Former Members of the Liberation Army in Morocco has released a 257-page book entitled "The Battle of Ait Abdallah against the French Colonization.".[4] The film "Words of Lead" (2020) by Ahmed Baidou relating the story of the Battle.[5]
target1_text: A cikin 2021, Babban Kwamishinan Tsaffin 'Yan adawa da Tsoffin Membobin Sojojin 'Yanci a Maroko ya fitar da wani littafi mai shafuka 257 mai suna "Yakin Ait Abdallah da Turawan mulkin mallaka na Faransa." [1] Fim ɗin " Kalmomin Jagoranci " (2020) na Ahmed Baidou yana ba da labarin Yaƙin. [2]

english_source: After independence, Nkunda was involved in various roles related to women's equality and education. Following the end of the civil war, from 1996 to 2011, she was secretary-general of the Organization of Mozambican Women (OMM).[1] Between 2006 and 2012, she served on the Political Commission of FRELIMO, the party's highest body.[3] She was elected to the Assembly of the Republic in 2009, serving there until her death in 2013.
target1_text: Bayan samun 'yancin kai, Nkunda ta shiga cikin ayyuka daban-daban da suka shafi daidaito da ilimin mata. Bayan kawo ƙarshen yakin basasa, daga shekarun 1996 zuwa 2011, ta kasance babbar sakatariyar kungiyar mata ta Mozambique (OMM). [1] A tsakanin shekarar 2006 zuwa 2012, ta yi aiki a hukumar siyasa ta FRELIMO, babbar hukuma ta jam'iyyar. [2] An zaɓe ta a Majalisar Dokokin Jamhuriyar a shekarar 2009, inda ta yi aiki a can har zuwa mutuwarta a shekarar 2013.
target2_text: Bayan samun 'yancin kai, Nkunda ta shiga cikin ayyuka daban-daban da suka shafi daidaito da ilimin mata. Bayan kawo karshen yakin basasa, daga 1996 zuwa 2011, ta kasance babbar sakatariyar kungiyar mata ta Mozambique (OMM). [1] A tsakanin shekarar 2006 zuwa 2012, ta yi aiki a hukumar siyasa ta FRELIMO, babbar hukuma ta jam'iyyar. [2] An zabe ta a Majalisar Dokokin Jamhuriyar a 2009, inda ta yi aiki a can har zuwa mutuwarta a 2013.

english_source: Samuel Maharero was a son to Maharero, an important Herero warrior and cattle raider. He was baptised in 1869[1][2] and went to the local Lutheran schools, where he was seen as a potential priest. When his father died in 1890, he gained the chieftainship in the area of Okahandja, although he did not gain much of his father's wealth and cattle according to Herero inheritance customs. Initially, he maintained fairly good relations with the German colonial administration under Theodor Leutwein. However, increasing problems, involving attacks by German farmers, economic difficulties and pests, and the use of Herero land for railroads, all led to diminished relations. Angered by the ill-treatment of the Herero people by German settlers and colonial administrators, who viewed the tribes as a cheap source of labor for cotton and other export crops, Maharero secretly planned a revolt with the other chiefs against the German presence, though he was well aware of the odds against him. In a famous letter to Hendrik Witbooi, the Nama chief, Maharero sought to build alliances with the other tribes, exclaiming "Let us die fighting!"[3]
target1_text: Samuel Maharero ɗa ne ga Maharero, babban jarumin Herero kuma barayin shanu. An yi masa baftisma a cikin 1869 [1] [2] kuma ya tafi makarantun Lutheran na gida, inda aka gan shi a matsayin babban firist. Lokacin da mahaifinsa ya rasu a shekara ta 1890, ya sami sarauta a yankin Okahandja, duk da cewa bai sami dukiyar mahaifinsa da shanu da yawa ba bisa ga al'adun gado na Herero. Da farko, ya ci gaba da kyakkyawar dangantaka da gwamnatin mulkin mallaka na Jamus a ƙarƙashin Theodor Leutwein . Sai dai karuwar matsalolin da suka hada da hare-haren da manoman Jamus ke kai wa, da matsalolin tattalin arziki da kwari da kuma amfani da filin Herero wajen hanyoyin jiragen kasa, duk sun haifar da raguwar dangantaka. Da yake fusata da cin zarafin al'ummar Herero da Jamusawa mazauna da masu mulkin mallaka suka yi, wadanda suke kallon kabilun a matsayin wata hanya mai arha wajen yin sana'ar auduga da sauran amfanin gona da ake fitarwa zuwa kasashen waje, Maharero a asirce ya shirya tayar da kayar baya tare da sauran sarakunan kan kasancewar Jamusawa, duk da cewa yana sane da rashin jituwar da ke tattare da shi. A cikin wata sanannen wasiƙa zuwa Hendrik Witbooi, shugaban Nama, Maharero ya nemi kulla kawance da sauran kabilu, yana cewa "Bari mu mutu muna fada!" [3]
target2_text: Samuel Maharero ɗa ne ga Maharero, babban jarumin Herero kuma ɓarayin shanu. An yi masa baftisma a cikin shekarar 1869 [1] [2] kuma ya tafi makarantun Lutheran na gida, inda aka gan shi a matsayin babban firist. Lokacin da mahaifinsa ya rasu a shekara ta 1890, ya sami sarauta a yankin Okahandja, duk da cewa bai sami dukiyar mahaifinsa da shanu da yawa ba bisa ga al'adun gado na Herero. Da farko, ya ci gaba da kyakkyawar dangantaka da gwamnatin mulkin mallaka na Jamus a ƙarƙashin Theodor Leutwein. Sai dai ƙaruwar matsalolin da suka haɗa da hare-haren da manoman Jamus ke kai wa, da matsalolin tattalin arziki da kwari da kuma amfani da filin Herero wajen hanyoyin jiragen ƙasa, duk sun haifar da raguwar dangantaka. Da yake fusata da cin zarafin al'ummar Herero da Jamusawa mazauna da masu mulkin mallaka suka yi, waɗanda suke kallon ƙabilun a matsayin wata hanya mai arha wajen yin sana'ar auduga da sauran amfanin gona da ake fitarwa zuwa ƙasashen waje, Maharero a asirce ya shirya tayar da kayar baya tare da sauran sarakunan kan kasancewar Jamusawa, duk da cewa yana sane da rashin jituwar da ke tattare da shi. A cikin wata sananniyar wasiƙa zuwa Hendrik Witbooi, shugaban Nama, Maharero ya nemi kulla ƙawance da sauran ƙabilu, yana cewa "Bari mu mutu muna faɗa!" [3]

english_source: Samuel Maharero is one of nine national heroes of Namibia that were identified at the inauguration of the country's Heroes' Acre near Windhoek. Founding president Sam Nujoma remarked in his inauguration speech on 26 August 2002 that:

english_source: Kambonde II kaMpingana (1865 – June 22, 1909) was the King of Ondonga from 1884 until his death in 1909. He was the brother of King Nehale lyaMpingana, with whom he shared a prolonged power struggle over control of Ondonga. His reign was marked by political divisions within Ondonga and increasing European influence in the region.[1]
target1_text: Kambonde II kaMpingana (1865 - Yuni 22, 1909) shine Sarkin Ondonga daga 1884 har zuwa mutuwarsa a 1909. Shi ɗan'uwan Sarki Nehale lyaMpingana ne, tare da wanda suka yi doguwar gwagwarmayar iko akan iko da Ondonga. Mulkinsa ya kasance alama ce ta rarrabuwar kawuna a cikin Ondonga da karuwar tasirin Turai a yankin. [1]
target2_text: Kambonde II kaMpingana (1865 - Yuni 22, 1909) shine Sarkin Ondonga daga shekara ta 1884 har zuwa mutuwarsa a shekarar 1909. Shi ɗan'uwan Sarki Nehale lyaMpingana ne, tare da wanda suka yi doguwar gwagwarmayar iko akan iko da Ondonga. Mulkinsa ya kasance alama ce ta rarrabuwar kawuna a cikin Ondonga da ƙaruwar tasirin Turai a yankin. [1]

english_source: Following the death of King Iitana yaNekwiyu on September 26, 1884, Kambonde became the king of Ondonga. However, his younger brother, Nehale, refused to acknowledge his authority. This led to the division of Ondonga into two separate territories: western Ondonga, ruled by Kambonde, and eastern Ondonga, ruled by Nehale.[2][2] Kambonde maintained diplomatic relations with missionaries and European settlers, in contrast to Nehale’s resistance to foreign influence. The Finnish Missionary Society, viewing Nehale as an obstacle to their work, supported Kambonde with weapons and ammunition to strengthen his position.[citation needed]
target1_text: Bayan rasuwar Sarki Itana yaNekwiyu a ranar 26 ga watan Satumba, 1884, Kambonde ya zama sarkin Ondonga. Duk da haka, ƙanensa, Nehale, ya ƙi amincewa da ikonsa. Wannan ya kai ga rarraba Ondonga zuwa yankuna biyu: yammacin Ondonga, wanda Kambonde ke mulki, da kuma gabashin Ondonga, wanda Nehale ya yi mulki. [1] [2] Kambonde ya ci gaba da kulla hulɗar diflomasiyya da ‘yan mishan da turawa, saɓanin yadda Nehale ya bijirewa tasirin ƙasashen waje. Ƙungiyar Mishan ta Finnish, suna kallon Nehale a matsayin mai hana su aiki, sun tallafa wa Kambonde da makamai da harsasai don ƙarfafa matsayinsa. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]
target2_text: Bayan rasuwar Sarki Itana yaNekwiyu a ranar 26 ga Satumba, 1884, Kambonde ya zama sarkin Ondonga. Duk da haka, ƙanensa, Nehale, ya ƙi amincewa da ikonsa. Wannan ya kai ga rarraba Ondonga zuwa yankuna biyu: yammacin Ondonga, wanda Kambonde ke mulki, da kuma gabashin Ondonga, wanda Nehale ya yi mulki. [1] [2] Kambonde ya ci gaba da kulla huldar diflomasiyya da ‘yan mishan da turawa, sabanin yadda Nehale ya bijirewa tasirin kasashen waje. Ƙungiyar Mishan ta Finnish, suna kallon Nehale a matsayin mai hana su aiki, sun tallafa wa Kambonde da makamai da harsasai don ƙarfafa matsayinsa. [ abubuwan da ake bukata ]

english_source: As German influence in Ovamboland increased, Kambonde maintained a diplomatic stance. By 1898, he was in favor of Ovamboland becoming part of the German protectorate. Finnish missionary Martti Rautanen, a key advisor, played a role in influencing Kambonde's decision. During the Ovaherero War (1904–1908), Samuel Maharero attempted to rally Ovambo kings to fight against the Germans. An Ovaherero envoy sought Kambonde’s assistance, but Finnish missionaries advised him to remain neutral. The only major act of resistance from Ondonga came from Nehale’s attack on Fort Namutoni in January 1904.[5]
target1_text: Yayin da tasirin Jamus a Ovamboland ya karu, Kambonde ya ci gaba da kasancewa a matsayin diflomasiyya. A shekara ta 1898, ya kasance yana goyon bayan Ovamboland ya zama wani ɓangare na kariyar Jamus. Wani ɗan mishan Finnish Martti Rautanen, babban mai ba da shawara, ya taka rawa wajen yin tasiri ga shawarar Kambonde. A lokacin Yaƙin Ovaherero (1904-1908), Samuel Maharero ya yi ƙoƙari ya tara sarakunan Ovambo don yaƙar Jamusawa. Wani wakilin Ovaherero ya nemi taimakon Kambonde, amma masu wa’azi a ƙasashen waje na Finland sun ba shi shawarar ya daina saka hannu. Babban aikin juriya daya tilo daga Ondonga ya fito ne daga harin Nehale a Fort Namutoni a cikin Janairu 1904. [1]
target2_text: Yayin da tasirin Jamus a Ovamboland ya ƙaru, Kambonde ya ci gaba da kasancewa a matsayin diflomasiyya. A shekara ta 1898, ya kasance yana goyon bayan Ovamboland ya zama wani ɓangare na kariyar Jamus. Wani ɗan mishan Finnish Martti Rautanen, babban mai ba da shawara, ya taka rawa wajen yin tasiri ga shawarar Kambonde. A lokacin Yaƙin Ovaherero (1904-1908), Samuel Maharero ya yi ƙoƙari ya tara sarakunan Ovambo don yaƙar Jamusawa. Wani wakilin Ovaherero ya nemi taimakon Kambonde, amma masu wa’azi a ƙasashen waje na Finland sun ba shi shawarar ya daina saka hannu. Babban aikin jajircewa ɗaya tilo daga Ondonga ya fito ne daga harin Nehale a Fort Namutoni a cikin watan Janairu 1904. [1]

english_source: He owns several small businesses in and around Onayena. Nashandi married Kauna Nashandi, a former mayor of Ondangwa, who died in Windhoek in 2013.[3]
target1_text: Ya mallaki kananan sana'o'i da dama a cikin Onayena da kewaye. Nashandi ya auri Kauna Nashandi, tsohon magajin garin Ondangwa, wanda ya mutu a Windhoek a 2013. [1]
target2_text: Ya mallaki ƙananan sana'o'i da dama a cikin Onayena da kewaye. Nashandi ya auri Kauna Nashandi, tsohuwar magajiyar garin Ondangwa, wacce ta mutu a Windhoek a 2013. [1]

english_source: Herman Andimba Toivo ya Toivo (22 August 1924 – 9 June 2017) was a Namibian anti-apartheid activist, politician and political prisoner. Ya Toivo was active in the pre-independence movement, and is one of the co-founders of the South West African People's Organisation (SWAPO) in 1960, and before that, its predecessor the Ovamboland People's Organization (OPO) in 1959.
target1_text: Herman Andimba Toivo ya Toivo (22 ga Agusta 1924 - 9 ga watan Yuni 2017) ɗan gwagwarmayar wariyar launin fata ne na Namibiya, ɗan siyasa kuma ɗan fursuna na siyasa. Ya Toivo ya kasance mai fafutuka a yunkurin samun 'yancin kai, kuma yana ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka kafa kungiyar jama'ar Kudu maso yammacin Afirka (SWAPO) a shekarar 1960, kuma kafin nan, ita ce kungiyar Ovamboland People's Organisation (OPO) a shekarar 1959.
target2_text: Herman Andimba Toivo ya Toivo (22 ga Agusta 1924 - 9 ga Yuni 2017) ɗan gwagwarmayar wariyar launin fata ne na Namibiya, ɗan siyasa kuma ɗan fursuna na siyasa . Ya Toivo ya kasance mai fafutuka a yunkurin samun 'yancin kai, kuma yana daya daga cikin wadanda suka kafa kungiyar jama'ar Kudu maso yammacin Afirka (SWAPO) a shekarar 1960, kuma kafin nan, ita ce kungiyar Ovamboland People's Organisation (OPO) a shekarar 1959.

english_source: Andimba grew up in the northern part of Namibia, however he spent some time in Cape Town in the 1950s. He became politicised there and joined the African National Congress (ANC). Back in Namibia he became one of the early petitioners to the United Nations, advocating for the independence of Namibia. Due to his political activism he was tried in 1966 under the Terrorism Act, and sentenced to 20 years in prison. He served 16 years in Robben Island in the same section as Nelson Mandela, to whom he was a personal friend. He was released in 1984 and rejoined SWAPO as secretary general in exile in Lusaka, Zambia. Ya Toivo returned to Namibia in 1989 in the wake of the country's independence and served as a member of parliament and as cabinet minister in Sam Nujoma's first government. He retired from active politics in 2006. Ya Toivo is a national hero of Namibia.
target1_text: Andimba ya girma a arewacin Namibiya, duk da haka ya yi ɗan lokaci a Cape Town a cikin 1950s. Ya shiga siyasa a can ya koma jam’iyyar African National Congress (ANC). A baya a Namibiya ya zama daya daga cikin wadanda suka fara kokewa Majalisar Dinkin Duniya, mai fafutukar neman ' yancin kai na Namibiya . Saboda gwagwarmayar siyasarsa an yi masa shari'a a shekarar 1966 a karkashin dokar ta'addanci, kuma aka yanke masa hukuncin daurin shekaru 20 a gidan yari. Ya yi shekaru 16 a tsibirin Robben a cikin sashe daya da Nelson Mandela, wanda abokinsa ne. An sake shi a cikin 1984 kuma ya koma SWAPO a matsayin babban sakatare a gudun hijira a Lusaka, Zambia. Ya Toivo ya koma Namibiya ne a shekarar 1989 bayan samun 'yancin kai a kasar, ya kuma taba zama dan majalisa da minista a gwamnatin farko ta Sam Nujoma . A shekara ta 2006 ya yi ritaya daga siyasa. Ya Toivo gwarzon kasa ne na Namibiya.
target2_text: Andimba ya girma a arewacin Namibiya, duk da haka ya yi ɗan lokaci a Cape Town a cikin shekarar 1950s. Ya shiga siyasa a can ya koma jam’iyyar African National Congress (ANC). A baya a Namibiya ya zama ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka fara kokewa Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya, mai fafutukar neman 'yancin kai na Namibiya. Saboda gwagwarmayar siyasarsa an yi masa shari'a a shekarar 1966 a ƙarƙashin dokar ta'addanci, kuma aka yanke masa hukuncin ɗaurin shekaru 20 a gidan yari. Ya yi shekaru 16 a tsibirin Robben a cikin sashe ɗaya da Nelson Mandela, wanda abokinsa ne. An sake shi a cikin shekarar 1984 kuma ya koma SWAPO a matsayin babban sakatare a gudun hijira a Lusaka, Zambia. Ya Toivo ya koma Namibiya ne a shekarar 1989 bayan samun 'yancin kai a ƙasar, ya kuma taɓa zama ɗan majalisa da minista a gwamnatin farko ta Sam Nujoma. A shekara ta 2006 ya yi ritaya daga siyasa. Ya Toivo gwarzon ƙasa ne na Namibiya.

english_source: He joined the African National Congress (ANC) at Cape Town in 1957. Later that year, he co-founded the Ovamboland People's Congress (OPC), forerunner of the Ovamboland People's Organization (OPO). He also established close contacts with the two South African parties the Congress of Democrats and the Liberal Party. The OPC sought to fight for the rights of migrant workers, some of whom had defected from the South West African Native Labour Association (SWANLA). The organisation also mobilised against the incorporation of Namibia into South Africa, and therefore shared a political allegiance with other organisations in South Africa.
target1_text: Ya shiga jam'iyyar African National Congress (ANC) a Cape Town a shekarar 1957. A wannan shekarar, ya kafa jam'iyyar Ovamboland People's Congress (OPC), wadda ta kasance ta farko a Ovamboland People's Organisation (OPO). Ya kuma kulla alaka ta kut-da-kut da jam'iyyun Afirka ta Kudu biyu wato Congress of Democrats da Liberal Party . Kungiyar ta OPC dai ta yi kokarin fafutukar kwato ‘yancin ma’aikatan bakin haure, wadanda wasu daga cikinsu sun fice daga kungiyar kwadago ta Afirka ta Kudu (SWANLA). Kungiyar ta kuma yi wani yunkuri na nuna adawa da shigar kasar Namibiya cikin Afirka ta Kudu, don haka ta yi mubayi'a ta siyasa da sauran kungiyoyi a Afirka ta Kudu.
target2_text: Ya shiga jam'iyyar African National Congress (ANC) a Cape Town a shekarar 1957. A wannan shekarar, ya kafa jam'iyyar Ovamboland People's Congress (OPC), wacce ta kasance ta farko a Ovamboland People's Organisation (OPO). Ya kuma kulla alaka ta kut-da-kut da jam'iyyun Afirka ta Kudu biyu wato Congress of Democrats da Liberal Party. Kungiyar ta OPC dai ta yi kokarin fafutukar kwato ‘yancin ma’aikatan baƙin haure, waɗanda wasu daga cikinsu sun fice daga kungiyar kwadago ta Afirka ta Kudu (SWANLA). Kungiyar ta kuma yi wani yunkuri na nuna adawa da shigar ƙasar Namibiya cikin Afirka ta Kudu, don haka ta yi mubayi'a ta siyasa da sauran kungiyoyi a Afirka ta Kudu.

english_source: In December 1958, Toivo, with the assistance of Goldberg, sent a tape to Mburumba Kerina and Michael Scott documenting human rights violations in South West Africa, after Chief Hosea Kutako was refused permission by the South African authorities to represent his people at the United Nations.[9] This was used to petition the United Nations. Consequently, he was deported from Cape Town, first to Keetmanshoop and Windhoek and later to Ovamboland, where he was placed under house arrest in his home village Okaloko.[10]
target1_text: A watan Disamba 1958, Toivo, tare da taimakon Goldberg, ya aika da wani kaset zuwa Mburumba Kerina da Michael Scott da ke tattara bayanan take haƙƙin ɗan adam a Afirka ta Kudu maso Yamma, bayan da Cif Hosea Kutako ya ki amincewa da izinin hukumomin Afirka ta Kudu ya wakilci mutanensa a Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya. [1] An yi amfani da wannan don kai ƙarar Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya. Saboda haka, an kore shi daga Cape Town, da farko zuwa Keetmanshoop da Windhoek daga baya zuwa Ovamboland, inda aka tsare shi a gidan kurkuku a ƙauyen su Okaloko. [2]
target2_text: A watan Disamba 1958, Toivo, tare da taimakon Goldberg, ya aika da wani kaset zuwa Mburumba Kerina da Michael Scott da ke tattara bayanan take haƙƙin ɗan adam a Afirka ta Kudu maso Yamma, bayan da Cif Hosea Kutako ya ki amincewa da izinin hukumomin Afirka ta Kudu ya wakilci mutanensa a Majalisar Dinkin Duniya. [1] An yi amfani da wannan don kai ƙarar Majalisar Dinkin Duniya . Saboda haka, an kore shi daga Cape Town, da farko zuwa Keetmanshoop da Windhoek daga baya zuwa Ovamboland, inda aka tsare shi a gidan kurkuku a kauyensu Okaloko. [2]

english_source: Witbooi was educated at Rhenish Missionary and Wesleyan Methodist Schools in Namibia as well as at the Wilberforce Institute in Evaton, South Africa. First, he took up employment as a teacher in 1856 at Keetmanshoop, transferred in 1859 to Maltahöhe, and returned in 1865 to Gibeon at the request of the community and the Church to build on the foundations laid by his aging father.
target1_text: Witbooi ya yi karatu a Makarantar Mishan ta Rhenish da Wesleyan Methodist a Namibiya da kuma Cibiyar Wilberforce da ke Evaton, Afirka ta Kudu. Na farko, ya ɗauki aiki a matsayin malami a shekarar 1856 a Keetmanshoop, canjawa wuri a shekarar 1859 zuwa Maltahöhe, kuma ya dawo a t 1865 zuwa Gibeyon bisa ga buƙatar da al'umma da kuma Church don gina a kan tushen ɗage farawa daga tsohon mahaifinsa.
target2_text: Witbooi ya yi karatu a Makarantar Mishan ta Rhenish da Wesleyan Methodist a Namibiya da kuma Cibiyar Wilberforce da ke Evaton, Afirka ta Kudu. Na farko, ya ɗauki aiki a matsayin malami a 1856 a Keetmanshoop, canjawa wuri a 1859 zuwa Maltahöhe, kuma ya dawo a 1865 zuwa Gibeyon bisa ga bukatar da al'umma da kuma Church don gina a kan tushen dage farawa daga tsohon mahaifinsa.

english_source: Witbooi moved north on 16 May 1884, with a faction of the ǀKhowesin tribe. This was against the wishes of his father, Moses, who remained opposed to Hendrik's plans. As evidenced by his diaries (which contain a large portion of the surviving documents of Witbooi) he still admired his father greatly, despite their political difference. On 22 February 1887, Moses' chief rival, his subchief Paul Visser, had Moses killed and deposed.
target1_text: Witbooi ya koma arewa a ranar 16 ga Mayu 1884, tare da wani yanki na kabilar ǀKhowesin. Wannan ya saba wa burin mahaifinsa, Musa, wanda ya kasance yana adawa da shirye-shiryen Hendrik. Kamar yadda littattafan littattafansa suka tabbatar (waɗanda ke ɗauke da babban kaso na takaddun da suka tsira na Witbooi) har yanzu yana sha'awar mahaifinsa sosai, duk da bambancin siyasa. A ranar 22 ga Fabrairun 1887, babban abokin hamayyar Musa, babban shugabansa Paul Visser, ya kashe Musa kuma ya tsige shi.
target2_text: Witbooi ya koma arewa a ranar 16 ga watan Mayu 1884, tare da wani yanki na ƙabilar ǀKhowesin. Wannan ya saɓa wa burin mahaifinsa, Moses, wanda ya kasance yana adawa da shirye-shiryen Hendrik. Kamar yadda littattafan littattafansa suka tabbatar (waɗanda ke ɗauke da babban kaso na takaddun da suka tsira na Witbooi) har yanzu yana sha'awar mahaifinsa sosai, duk da bambancin siyasa. A ranar 22 ga watan Fabrairun 1887, babban abokin hamayyar Moses, babban shugabansa Paul Visser, ya kashe Moses kuma ya tsige shi.

english_source: Hendrik Witbooi held leadership at Gibeon in 1888, long after the death of Jonker Afrikaner in 1861 causing a power struggle among the various groups for paramount leadership. Several combats incorporated various leaders ensured until Hendrik finally defeated his last chief rival, Paul Visser, in July 1888 and took over leadership at Gibeon. Hendrik retaliated on 12 July 1888, shooting Visser. This led to Hendrik becoming chief of the ǀKhowesin people. He began to unite other Nama tribes under his control as well. By 1890, Hendrik Witbooi was signing all his letters, 'Chief of Great Namaqualand'.
target1_text: Hendrik Witbooi ya gudanar da shugabanci a Gibeon a shekara ta 1888, bayan mutuwar Jonker Afrikaner a shekara ta 1861 wanda ya haifar da gwagwarmayar mulki tsakanin kungiyoyi daban-daban don jagoranci mafi girma. Yaƙe-yaƙe da yawa sun haɗa da shugabanni daban-daban sun tabbatar har sai Hendrik ya ci nasara a kan babban abokin hamayyarsa na ƙarshe, Paul Visser, a cikin Yuli 1888 kuma ya karɓi jagoranci a Gibeon. Hendrik ya rama a ranar 12 ga Yuli 1888, yana harbi Visser. Wannan ya haifar da Hendrik ya zama shugaban mutanen ǀKhowesin. Ya fara hada kan sauran kabilun Nama da ke karkashinsa su ma. A shekara ta 1890, Hendrik Witbooi yana sanya hannu kan duk wasiƙunsa, 'Shugaban Babban Namaqualand'.
target2_text: Hendrik Witbooi ya gudanar da shugabanci a Gibeon a shekara ta 1888, bayan mutuwar Jonker Afrikaner a shekara ta 1861 wanda ya haifar da gwagwarmayar mulki tsakanin kungiyoyi daban-daban don jagoranci mafi girma. Yaƙe-yaƙe da yawa sun haɗa da shugabanni daban-daban sun tabbatar har sai Hendrik ya ci nasara a kan babban abokin hamayyarsa na ƙarshe, Paul Visser, a cikin watan Yuli 1888 kuma ya karɓi jagoranci a Gibeon. Hendrik ya rama a ranar 12 ga watan Yuli 1888, yana harbi Visser. Wannan ya haifar da Hendrik ya zama shugaban mutanen ǀKhowesin. Ya fara haɗa kan sauran ƙabilun Nama da ke ƙarƙashin sa su ma. A shekara ta 1890, Hendrik Witbooi yana sanya hannu kan duk wasiƙunsa, 'Shugaban Babban Namaqualand'.

english_source: In the early morning of 12 April 1893, the ǀKhowesin were attacked by the Germans at Hornkranz. Many were killed, although Hendrik managed to escape with most of his fighting men. [citation needed] He campaigned against the Germans for two years, until the treaty of Gurus on 15 September 1894 where he agreed to a conditional surrender. Witbooi also decided to render military support for the Germans against other smaller tribes, such as the eastern Mbanderu Herero, Afrikaners, and Swartbooi.[3]
target1_text: A safiyar ranar 12 ga Afrilun 1893, Jamusawa sun kai wa Khowesin hari a Hornkranz. An kashe da yawa, ko da yake Hendrik ya yi nasarar tserewa tare da yawancin mayakansa. Ya [ yaƙi ] Jamusawa na tsawon shekaru biyu, har zuwa yarjejeniyar Gurus a ranar 15 ga Satumba 1894 inda ya amince da mika wuya. Witbooi ya kuma yanke shawarar ba da goyon bayan soji ga Jamusawa kan wasu kananan kabilu, kamar gabashin Mbanderu Herero, Afrikaners, da Swartbooi. [1]
target2_text: A safiyar ranar 12 ga watan Afrilun 1893, Jamusawa sun kai wa Khowesin hari a Hornkranz. An kashe da yawa, ko da yake Hendrik ya yi nasarar tserewa tare da yawancin mayakansa. Ya [ yaƙi ] Jamusawa na tsawon shekaru biyu, har zuwa yarjejeniyar Gurus a ranar 15 ga watan Satumba 1894 inda ya amince da miƙa wuya. Witbooi ya kuma yanke shawarar ba da goyon bayan soji ga Jamusawa kan wasu ƙananan ƙabilu, kamar gabashin Mbanderu Herero, Afrikaners, da Swartbooi. [1]

english_source: Witbooi is the subject of Conny Braam's 2016 Dutch language novel Ik ben Hendrik Witbooi depicting his struggle against German colonialism.[8] Witbooi is depicted in the 1989 South African Boer War miniseries Arende where he is the leader of a group that ambushes the protagonist, Sloet Steenkamp, party of Boer exiles in the final episode of the last season.[9]
target1_text: Witbooi batu ne na littafin Conny Braam na 2016 yaren Dutch Ik ben Hendrik Witbooi wanda ke nuna gwagwarmayar sa da mulkin mallaka na Jamus. [1] An nuna Witbooi a cikin 1989 na Afirka ta Kudu Boer War miniseries Arende inda shi ne shugaban kungiyar da suka yi wa jarumin kwanton bauna, Sloet Steenkamp, jam'iyyar Boer gudun hijira a wasan karshe na kakar wasa ta karshe. [2]
target2_text: Witbooi batu ne na littafin Conny Braam na 2016 yaren Dutch Ik ben Hendrik Witbooi wanda ke nuna gwagwarmayar sa da 'yan mulkin mallaka na Jamus. [1] An nuna Witbooi a cikin shekara ta 1989 na Afirka ta Kudu Boer War miniseries Arende inda shi ne shugaban kungiyar da suka yi wa jarumin kwanton ɓauna, Sloet Steenkamp, jam'iyyar Boer gudun hijira a wasan karshe na kakar wasa ta karshe. [2]

english_source: Yakubu Nabame (c. 1819–1854) was the King of Argungu and leader of the Kebbawa resistance from 1849 until his death in 1854. He is best known for reigniting and leading the struggle for independence against the Sokoto Caliphate, which had conquered Kebbi during its early 19th-century jihad. After years of exile at the Caliph's palace in Sokoto, Nabame returned to Kebbi, declared himself Sarkin Kebbi ('Lord of Kebbi') in 1849, and initiated a revolt that marked the first major territorial loss for the Caliphate outside Bornu. His resistance ended an 18-year truce and continued until the fall of the Caliphate in 1903, cementing Kebbi's independence as an irreversible reality. Nabame is remembered as a heroic figure in Kebbi's history.[1][2]
target1_text: Yakubu Nabame (1819-1854) shi ne Sarkin Argungu kuma jagoran gwagwarmayar Kebbawa daga shekarun 1849 har zuwa rasuwarsa a shekarar 1854. Ya shahara wajen jan ragamar mulki da jagorantar gwagwarmayar neman yancin kai da Daular Sakkwato wacce ta mamaye Birnin Kebbi a lokacin jihadin farko na ƙarni na 19. Bayan ya kwashe shekaru yana gudun hijira a fadar Halifa da ke Sakkwato, Nabame ya koma Kebbi, ya ayyana kansa a matsayin Sarkin Kebbi ('Ubangijin Kebbi') a shekarar 1849, sannan ya tayar da bore wanda ya zama babban hasarar farko ga Khalifanci a wajen Bornu. Juriya da ya yi ya kawo ƙarshen zaman lafiya na tsawon shekaru 18, ya ci gaba har zuwa faɗuwar Halifanci a shekarar 1903, inda ya tabbatar da ’yancin kai na Kebbi a matsayin haƙiƙanin da ba za a iya jurewa ba. Ana tunawa da Nabame a matsayin jarumi a tarihin Kebbi. [1] [2]
target2_text: Yakubu Nabame (1819-1854) shi ne Sarkin Argungu kuma jagoran gwagwarmayar Kebbawa daga 1849 har zuwa rasuwarsa a 1854. Ya shahara wajen jan ragamar mulki da jagorantar gwagwarmayar neman yancin kai da Daular Sakkwato wacce ta mamaye Birnin Kebbi a lokacin jihadin farko na karni na 19. Bayan ya kwashe shekaru yana gudun hijira a fadar Halifa da ke Sakkwato, Nabame ya koma Kebbi, ya ayyana kansa a matsayin Sarkin Kebbi ('Ubangijin Kebbi') a 1849, sannan ya tayar da bore wanda ya zama babban hasarar farko ga Khalifanci a wajen Bornu . Juriya da ya yi ya kawo karshen zaman lafiya na tsawon shekaru 18, ya ci gaba har zuwa faduwar Halifanci a 1903, inda ya tabbatar da ’yancin kai na Kebbi a matsayin haƙiƙanin da ba za a iya jurewa ba. Ana tunawa da Nabame a matsayin jarumi a tarihin Kebbi. [1] [2]
