english_source: In the 1810s, Yakubu Nabame was born to Samaila (better known as Karari), a prince of the Hausa kingdom of Kebbi. He was raised during a period of great instability in the region. Kebbi had fallen to the Sokoto Caliphate during its jihad from 1804 to 1809. Under Nabame's uncle, Muhammadu Hodi, the Kebbawa waged fierce resistance against Gwandu, the vassal state of the Caliphate overseeing the area.[1]
target1_text: A cikin shekarun 1810, an haifi Yakubu Nabame ga Samaila (wanda aka fi sani da Karari), basaraken masarautar Hausa ta Kebbi . Ya taso ne a lokacin da ake fama da rashin zaman lafiya a yankin. Kebbi ta fada hannun Khalifancin Sokoto a lokacin jihadin ta daga 1804 zuwa 1809. Karkashin kawun Nabame, Muhammadu Hodi, 'yan kabilar Kebbawa sun yi turjiya mai tsanani ga Gwandu, daular halifanci mai kula da yankin. [1]
target2_text: A cikin shekarun 1810, an haifi Yakubu Nabame ga Samaila (wanda aka fi sani da Karari), basaraken masarautar Hausa ta Kebbi. Ya taso ne a lokacin da ake fama da rashin zaman lafiya a yankin. Kebbi ta faɗa hannun Khalifancin Sokoto a lokacin jihadin ta daga shekarun 1804 zuwa 1809. Ƙarƙashin kawun Nabame, Muhammadu Hodi, 'yan ƙabilar Kebbawa sun yi turjiya mai tsanani ga Gwandu, daular halifanci mai kula da yankin. [1]

english_source: After Hodi's death in 1826, his brother Karari, Nabame's father, adopted the title of Sarkin Kebbi ("Lord of Kebbi") and established himself in Argungu, continuing the struggle for independence. Argungu soon became the capital town for the Kebbawa and their center of resistance. In 1831, a combined force from Gwandu and Sokoto besieged Argungu. The Kebbawa held out for some time, but after the Gwandu forces set fire to their houses, they were forced to capitulate.[1][3]
target1_text: Bayan rasuwar Hodi a 1826, dan uwansa Karari, mahaifin Nabame, ya karbi sarautar Sarkin Kebbi ("Ubangijin Kebbi") ya kafa kansa a Argungu, ya ci gaba da gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin kai. Ba da jimawa ba Argungu ya zama babban birnin Kebbawa da cibiyar gwagwarmayarsu. A shekara ta 1831, rundunar hadin gwiwa daga Gwandu da Sokoto suka yiwa Argungu kawanya. ‘Yan kabilar Kebbawa sun dade, amma bayan da sojojin Gwandu suka kona gidajensu, aka tilasta musu kwacewa. [1] [2]
target2_text: Bayan rasuwar Hodi a shekarar 1826, ɗan uwansa Karari, mahaifin Nabame, ya karɓi sarautar Sarkin Kebbi ("Ubangijin Kebbi") ya kafa kansa a Argungu, ya ci gaba da gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin kai. Ba da jimawa ba Argungu ya zama babban birnin Kebbawa da cibiyar gwagwarmayarsu. A shekara ta 1831, rundunar haɗin gwiwa daga Gwandu da Sokoto suka yiwa Argungu ƙawanya. ‘Yan ƙabilar Kebbawa sun daɗe, amma bayan da sojojin Gwandu suka kona gidajensu, aka tilasta musu kwacewa. [1] [2]

english_source: Following his father's death, Nabame spent a year or two hiding among the Arewa, who protected him from Sokoto. Eventually, he decided to surrender to Gwandu. After some deliberation, it was agreed to spare his life, and he was exiled to Sokoto in 1831.[1][2] Nabame was said to be about 12 years old at the time of his exile.[4]
target1_text: Bayan rasuwar mahaifinsa, Nabame ya shafe shekara daya zuwa biyu yana buya a cikin Arewa, wadanda suka kare shi daga Sakkwato. Daga karshe dai ya yanke shawarar mika wuya ga Gwandu. Bayan an yi shawara aka amince da a bar rayuwarsa, aka yi hijira zuwa Sakkwato a shekara ta 1831. [1] [2] An ce Nabame yana da kimanin shekara 12 a lokacin da yake gudun hijira. [3]
target2_text: Bayan rasuwar mahaifinsa, Nabame ya shafe shekara ɗaya zuwa biyu yana ɓuya a cikin Arewa, waɗanda suka ƙare shi daga Sakkwato. Daga ƙarshe dai ya yanke shawarar miƙa wuya ga Gwandu. Bayan an yi shawara aka amince da a bar rayuwarsa, aka yi hijira zuwa Sakkwato a shekara ta 1831. [1] [2] An ce Nabame yana da kimanin shekara 12 a lokacin da yake gudun hijira. [3]

english_source: Caliph Ali's retreat marked the first surrender of territory by the Sokoto Caliphate outside of Bornu since its original conquests. Following Nabame's revival of the Kebbawa struggle for independence, the Kebbawa continued to harass the Caliphate for over fifty years until its collapse in 1903, solidifying Kebbi's independence as an irreversible reality. The Kebbawa frequently organised raiding parties and engaged in guerrilla warfare, preventing the Caliphate from ever fully subduing them. Nabame was eventually killed during one of these raids in 1854.[1][7][8][9][10]
target1_text: Komawar da Halifa Ali ya yi ita ce miƙa wuya na farko da Daular Sakkwato ta yi a wajen Bornu tun bayan da ta fara ci. Bayan da Nabame ya farfaɗo da gwagwarmayar neman ‘yancin kai na Kebbawa, Kebbawa sun ci gaba da takurawa Halifanci sama da shekaru hamsin har zuwa lokacin da ta ruguje a shekarar 1903, wanda hakan ya tabbatar da ‘yancin kai na Kebbi a matsayin gaskiya da ba za a iya dawo da ita ba. Kebbawa akai-akai suna shirya ƙungiyoyin mamaya da yaƙin neman zaɓe, tare da hana halifanci samun galaba a kansu. Daga ƙarshe an kashe Nabame a ɗaya daga cikin waɗannan hare-hare a shekarar 1854. [1] [2] [3] [4] [5]
target2_text: Komawar da Halifa Ali ya yi ita ce mika wuya na farko da Daular Sakkwato ta yi a wajen Bornu tun bayan da ta fara ci. Bayan da Nabame ya farfado da gwagwarmayar neman ‘yancin kai na Kebbawa, Kebbawa sun ci gaba da takurawa Halifanci sama da shekaru hamsin har zuwa lokacin da ta ruguje a shekarar 1903, wanda hakan ya tabbatar da ‘yancin kai na Kebbi a matsayin gaskiya da ba za a iya dawo da ita ba. Kebbawa akai-akai suna shirya ƙungiyoyin mamaya da yaƙin neman zaɓe, tare da hana halifanci samun galaba a kansu. Daga karshe an kashe Nabame a daya daga cikin wadannan hare-hare a shekarar 1854. [1] [2] [3] [4] [5]

english_source: Flag Marutle Boshielo (born 1920; disappeared 20 August 1970) was a South African anti-apartheid activist, trade unionist, and communist. He went into exile with the African National Congress (ANC) after the party was banned in 1960 and served as political commissar of Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) from 1969 until his disappearance in 1970. He went missing in August 1970 during an unsuccessful MK operation after his contingent was ambushed. He is presumed to have died in 1970 or soon afterwards.
target1_text: Tuta Marutle Boshielo (an haife shi a shekara ta 1920; ya ɓace 20 ga Agusta 1970) ɗan gwagwarmayar yaƙi da wariyar launin fata ne na Afirka ta Kudu, ɗan ƙungiyar kasuwanci, kuma ɗan gurguzu . Ya tafi gudun hijira tare da jam’iyyar ANC bayan da aka dakatar da jam’iyyar a shekarar 1960 sannan ya rike mukamin kwamishinan siyasa na Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) daga 1969 har zuwa lokacin da ya bace a 1970. Ya bace ne a watan Agustan shekarar 1970 a yayin wani aikin MK da bai yi nasara ba bayan an yi wa tawagarsa kwanton bauna. Ana kyautata zaton ya mutu a shekara ta 1970 ko kuma jim kadan bayan haka.
target2_text: Tuta Marutle Boshielo (an haife shi a shekara ta 1920; ya ɓace 20 ga watan Agusta 1970) ɗan gwagwarmayar yaƙi da wariyar launin fata ne na Afirka ta Kudu, ɗan ƙungiyar kasuwanci, kuma ɗan gurguzu. Ya tafi gudun hijira tare da jam’iyyar ANC bayan da aka dakatar da jam’iyyar a shekarar 1960 sannan ya riƙe muƙamin kwamishinan siyasa na Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) daga shekarun 1969 har zuwa lokacin da ya ɓace a shekarar 1970. Ya ɓace ne a watan Agustan shekarar 1970 a yayin wani aikin MK da bai yi nasara ba bayan an yi wa tawagarsa kwanton ɓauna. Ana kyautata zaton ya mutu a shekara ta 1970 ko kuma jim kaɗan bayan haka.

english_source: Boshielo was renowned as a prolific recruiter to the CPSA and ANC.[1][2] Among those he recruited was his close friend John Nkadimeng.[5][4] Around 1957, Nkadimeng and Boshielo met with Nelson Mandela on a fortnightly basis to discuss politics. Nkadimeng later recalled that Boshielo and Mandela often had vociferous arguments: while Mandela wanted white activists excluded from leadership positions in the anti-apartheid struggle, Boshielo supported a non-racialist position inspired by materialist analysis.[5]
target1_text: Boshielo ya shahara a matsayin ƙwararren ma'aikacin CPSA da ANC. [1] [2] Daga cikin waɗanda ya ɗauka har da amininsa John Nkadimeng. [3] [4] A cikin shekarar 1957, Nkadimeng da Boshielo sun gana da Nelson Mandela a kowane mako biyu don tattaunawa akan siyasa. Daga baya Nkadimeng ya tuna cewa Boshielo da Mandela sau da yawa suna da muhawara mai ma'ana: yayin da Mandela ya so a cire masu fafutukar farar fata daga muƙaman jagoranci a gwagwarmayar yaki da wariyar launin fata, Boshielo ya goyi bayan matsayin da ba na wariyar launin fata ba wanda aka yi wahayi zuwa ga binciken jari-hujja. [3]
target2_text: Boshielo ya shahara a matsayin ƙwararren ma'aikacin CPSA da ANC. [1] [2] Daga cikin wadanda ya dauka har da amininsa John Nkadimeng . [3] [4] A cikin 1957, Nkadimeng da Boshielo sun gana da Nelson Mandela a kowane mako biyu don tattaunawa akan siyasa. Daga baya Nkadimeng ya tuna cewa Boshielo da Mandela sau da yawa suna da muhawara mai ma'ana: yayin da Mandela ya so a cire masu fafutukar farar fata daga mukaman jagoranci a gwagwarmayar yaki da wariyar launin fata, Boshielo ya goyi bayan matsayin da ba na wariyar launin fata ba wanda aka yi wahayi zuwa ga binciken jari-hujja . [3]

english_source: In the early 1960s, Boshielo went into exile with the ANC, which was banned by the apartheid government in 1960. He received political and military training in Moscow as a recruit to Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK), the new joint armed wing of the ANC and CPSA, and then joined MK at its Kongwa camp in Tanzania.[1] At the ANC's 1969 Morogoro Conference, Boshielo was the foremost defender of a new proposal to open ANC membership to people of all race groups.[6][7] The proposal was adopted and, in addition, Boshielo was appointed as MK's overall political commissar.[6]
target1_text: A farkon shekarun 1960, Boshielo ya tafi gudun hijira tare da ANC, wanda gwamnatin wariyar launin fata ta haramta a 1960. Ya sami horon siyasa da na soja a Moscow a matsayin wanda zai dauka aiki zuwa Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK), sabon reshen hadaka na ANC da CPSA, sannan ya koma MK a sansanin Kongwa da ke Tanzaniya. [1] A taron Morogoro na ANC na 1969, Boshielo shine babban mai kare wata sabuwar shawara don buɗe membobin ANC ga mutanen kowane nau'in jinsi. [2] [3] An amince da shawarar kuma, bugu da kari, an nada Boshielo a matsayin kwamishanan siyasa na MK gaba daya. [2]
target2_text: A farkon shekarun 1960, Boshielo ya tafi gudun hijira tare da ANC, wanda gwamnatin wariyar launin fata ta haramta a shekarar 1960. Ya sami horon siyasa da na soja a Moscow a matsayin wanda zai ɗauka aiki zuwa Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK), sabon reshen haɗaka na ANC da CPSA, sannan ya koma MK a sansanin Kongwa da ke Tanzaniya. [1] A taron Morogoro na ANC na shekarar 1969, Boshielo shine babban mai kare wata sabuwar shawara don buɗe membobin ANC ga mutanen kowane nau'in jinsi. [2] [3] An amince da shawarar kuma, bugu da ƙari, an naɗa Boshielo a matsayin kwamishanan siyasa na MK gaba ɗaya. [2]

english_source: Boshielo disappeared on 20 August 1970 during an MK operation which aimed to infiltrate a small group of cadres across Rhodesia into Sekhukhuneland. The group was ambushed while crossing the Zambezi River near the Caprivi Strip, and two other cadres died in a shoot-out.[1][2] Speaking at the University of Lagos in 1971, ANC president Oliver Tambo, calling for a pan-African campaign to find and rescue Boshielo, said that he was presumed wounded and captured.[8]
target1_text: Boshielo ya ɓace a ranar 20 ga watan Agustan 1970 yayin wani aiki na MK wanda ke da nufin kutsawa wasu ƙananan gungun 'yan sanda a faɗin Rhodesia zuwa Sekhukhuneland. An yi wa kungiyar kwanton ɓauna ne a lokacin da suke tsallaka kogin Zambezi kusa da gabar tekun Caprivi, kuma wasu ‘yan bindiga biyu sun mutu a wani harbi da aka yi. [1] [2] Da yake magana a Jami'ar Legas a shekarar 1971, shugaban ANC, Oliver Tambo, yana kira ga yakin Afirka baki ɗaya don nemo da ceto Boshielo, ya ce an yi zaton ya samu rauni kuma an kama shi. [3]

english_source: Prior to the events in Sharpville, Chiba was an activist in the Transvaal Indian Congress in the late 1950s and the South African Communist Party in 1960.[1][2] After the Sharpeville massacre in 1960, he concluded that peaceful protest had failed and military action was necessary, so he joined the ANC's armed wing, Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) in 1961.[3]
target1_text: Kafin abubuwan da suka faru a Sharpville, Chiba ya kasance mai fafutuka a cikin Transvaal Indian Congress a ƙarshen shekarar 1950s da Jam'iyyar Kwaminisanci ta Afirka ta Kudu a shekarar 1960. [1] [2] Bayan kisan kiyashin da aka yi a Sharpeville a shekarar 1960, ya yanke shawarar cewa zanga-zangar lumana ta gaza kuma matakin soji ya zama dole, don haka ya shiga reshen jam'iyyar ANC mai ɗauke da makamai, Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) a shekarar 1961. [2]

[1] [2] Bayan kisan kiyashin da aka yi a Sharpeville a 1960, ya yanke shawarar cewa zanga-zangar lumana ta gaza kuma matakin soji ya zama dole, don haka ya shiga reshen jam'iyyar ANC mai dauke da makamai, Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) a 1961. [2]

english_source: He was a platoon commander in 1962 and a member of the group's High Command by 1963.[1] He was captured and tortured after a failed attempt to sabotage a railway line.[3] He was arrested on the 6 July 1964 for sabotage. He and the rest of the group were sentenced as members of a banned organisation and sent to Robben Island.[3] Released in 1982, he continued the work of the ANC as a member of the United Democratic Front.[3] In 1983, he became one of the vice-presidents of the Transvaal Indian Congress.[2] He was rearrested in July 1985 and released without a trial in March 1986, after which he went into hiding so he could continue his work for the ANC.[2]

english_source: Vusumzi L. Make (1931 – 15 April 2006)[1] was a South African civil rights activist and lawyer.[2] He and the American poet Maya Angelou met in 1961,[3][4] lived together in Cairo, Egypt, before parting ways in 1962.[3][5] He was a professor at the University of Liberia in Monrovia, Liberia, from 1968 to 1974.[1]

[2] Shi da mawakiyar Amurka Maya Angelou sun haɗu a shekara ta 1961, [3] [4] sun zauna tare a birnin Alkahira na ƙasar Masar kafin su rabu a shekarar 1962. [3] [5] Farfesa ne a Jami'ar Laberiya a Monrovia, Laberiya, daga shekarun 1968 zuwa 1974. [1]

english_source: Make died on 15 April 2006 in the HF Verwoerd hospital in Pretoria at the age of 75.[1] He was survived by his widow Alma Liziwe Make and daughter Titise.[citation needed]

english_source: Clarence Mlami Makwetu (6 December 1928 – 1 April 2016) was a South African anti-apartheid activist, politician, and leader of the Pan Africanist Congress of Azania (PAC) during the historic 1994 elections.[1][2]
target1_text: Clarence Mlami Makwetu (6 Disamba 1928 - 1 Afrilu 2016) ɗan gwagwarmayar yaƙi da wariyar launin fata ne, ɗan Afirka ta Kudu, ɗan siyasa, kuma shugaban jam'iyyar Pan Africanist Congress of Azania (PAC) a lokacin zaɓen 1994 mai tarihi. [1] [2]
target2_text: Clarence Mlami Makwetu (6 Disamba 1928 - 1 Afrilu 2016) ɗan gwagwarmayar yaƙi da wariyar launin fata ne, ɗan Afirka ta Kudu, ɗan siyasa, kuma shugaban jam'iyyar Pan Africanist Congress of Azania (PAC) a lokacin zaɓen shekarar 1994 mai tarihi. [1] [2]

english_source: In April 1992, Makwetu declared at his political party's Annual Congress that the PAC was now not opposed to taking part in the negotiations to end the apartheid, so long the negotiations were held in a "neutral venue under a neutral chairman."[7] The PAC unsuccessfully argued during the Codesa negotiations that any settlement that did not tackle the land question was flawed, and this failure lead the party to be divided over whether to participate in the 1994 elections. Makwetu argued for participation, and ordered the party's military wing, the Azanian People's Liberation Army (Apla), to end its armed struggle, but with the party not fully behind the campaign, the party only won five seats in the historic first non-racial election. In 1994, he became one of the PAC's three MPs in South Africa's first democratic Parliament.
target1_text: A cikin Afrilu 1992, Makwetu ya bayyana a taron shekara-shekara na jam'iyyar siyasa cewa PAC a yanzu ba ta adawa da shiga cikin tattaunawar kawo karshen mulkin wariyar launin fata, don haka an gudanar da tattaunawar a cikin "wuri na tsaka-tsaki a karkashin wani shugaba mai tsaka tsaki." [1] PAC ba ta yi nasara ba yayin tattaunawar Codesa cewa duk wani sulhu da ba a magance batun kasa ba yana da kurakurai, kuma wannan gazawar ta sa jam’iyyar ta rabu kan ko za ta shiga zaben 1994 . Makwetu ya bayar da hujjar shiga, sannan ya umarci reshen soja na jam’iyyar, Apla, da ya kawo karshen gwagwarmayar da ta ke yi, amma kasancewar jam’iyyar ba ta da cikakken goyon bayan yakin neman zabe, jam’iyyar ta lashe kujeru biyar ne kawai a zaben farko mai cike da tarihi wanda ba na kabilanci ba. A cikin 1994, ya zama ɗaya daga cikin ƴan majalisa uku na PAC a Majalisar Demokraɗiyya ta farko ta Afirka ta Kudu.

english_source: Makwetu was unseated as leader in 1996, being accused of bringing the party into disrepute, and retired.[8] Following his expulsion from the PAC in 1997, Makwetu went on to form and lead the Pan Africanist Movement (PAM). Makwetu's nephew, Mazwi, said his uncle resorted to land activism in his home town of Cofimvaba in the former Transkei where he had a farm, livestock and several fields.[2]
target1_text: A shekarar 1996 ne aka kwance Makwetu a matsayin shugaba, inda aka zarge shi da kawo wa jam’iyyar kunya, kuma ya yi ritaya. [1] Bayan fitarsa daga PAC a shekarar 1997, Makwetu ya ci gaba da kafa kungiyar Pan Africanist Movement (PAM). Dan uwan Makwetu, Mazwi, ya ce kawun nasa ya yi yunkurin neman filaye ne a garinsu na Cofimvaba a tsohuwar Transkei inda yake da gonaki da dabbobi da gonaki da dama. [2]

english_source: In 2004, Makwetu was awarded the Order of Luthuli in Silver by President Thabo Mbeki for his contribution to the struggle for a non-racial‚ non-sexist‚ just and democratic South Africa.[9]

english_source: He later became a member of the ANC and consequent party organiser in the areas of Benoni and Atteridgeville. He was one of the initial recruits of the Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK) organisation, which was founded in December 1961. Maphotho became involved in underground activities of the ANC prior to him leaving the country to go to Dar es Salaam, Tanzania on 28 February 1961. The ANC deployed him to the Beirut International School in 1962. He returned to Dar es Salaam in 1963 and was soon sent for military training in the now-dissolved Soviet Union.[4]
target1_text: Daga baya ya zama memba na ANC kuma sakamakon haka ya shirya jam'iyyar a yankunan Benoni da Atteridgeville . Ya kasance daya daga cikin wadanda aka fara daukar ma'aikata na kungiyar Umkhonto we Sizwe (MK), wacce aka kafa a watan Disamba 1961. Maphotho ya shiga cikin ayyukan karkashin kasa na ANC kafin ya bar kasar don zuwa Dar es Salaam, Tanzania a ranar 28 ga Fabrairun 1961. ANC ta tura shi makarantar kasa da kasa ta Beirut a 1962. Ya koma Dar es Salaam a shekara ta 1963 kuma nan da nan aka tura shi horon soji a cikin Tarayyar Soviet da ta wargaje yanzu . [1]
target2_text: Daga baya ya zama memba na ANC kuma sakamakon haka ya shirya jam'iyyar a yankunan Benoni da Atteridgeville. Maphotho ya shiga cikin ayyukan ƙarƙashin ƙasa na ANC kafin ya bar ƙasar don zuwa Dar es Salaam, Tanzania a ranar 28 ga watan Fabrairun 1961. ANC ta tura shi makarantar ƙasa da ƙasa ta Beirut a shekarar 1962. Ya koma Dar es Salaam a shekara ta 1963 kuma nan da nan aka tura shi horon soji a cikin Tarayyar Soviet da ta wargaje yanzu . [1]

english_source: Clarence Mazwangwandile Mini (6 November 1951 – 12 May 2020) was a South African doctor, anti-apartheid activist, freedom fighter, human rights activist. Mini was regarded as a pioneer of the medical industry in South Africa, especially for his crucial contributions in eliminating the HIV/AIDS from the country.[1] He also actively advocated against apartheid during his career and also voiced against corruption which mounted during the presidency of Jacob Zuma.[2] He served on the Board of Healthcare Funders, at times as its chair.[3][4] He died on 12 May 2020 due to COVID-19 complications at the age of 68 while serving as the chairperson of the Council of Medical Schemes.[5] His term as chairperson of CMS was due to end by September 2020.[6]
target1_text: Clarence Mazwangwandile Mini (6 Nuwamba 1951 - 12 ga Mayu 2020) likita ne ɗan Afirka ta Kudu, mai fafutukar yaki da wariyar launin fata, mai fafutukar 'yanci, mai fafutukar kare hakkin ɗan Adam. An ɗauki Mini a matsayin majagaba na masana'antar likitanci a Afirka ta Kudu, musamman saboda muhimmiyar gudummawar da ya bayar wajen kawar da cutar kanjamau daga ƙasar. [1] Ya kuma bayar da himma wajen yaki da wariyar launin fata a lokacin aikinsa sannan kuma ya nuna adawa da cin hanci da rashawa da ya taso a lokacin shugabancin Jacob Zuma. [2] Ya yi aiki a Hukumar Kula da Kiwon Lafiya, a wasu lokuta a matsayin shugabanta. [3] [4] Ya mutu a ranar 12 ga watan Mayu 2020 sakamakon rikice-rikice na COVID-19 yana da shekaru 68 yayin da yake aiki a matsayin shugaban Majalisar Shirye-shiryen Likita. [5] Wa'adinsa na shugaban CMS ya kamata ya ƙare zuwa watan Satumba 2020. [6]
target2_text: Clarence Mazwangwandile Mini (6 Nuwamba 1951 - 12 ga Mayu 2020) likita ne dan Afirka ta Kudu, mai fafutukar yaki da wariyar launin fata, mai fafutukar 'yanci, mai fafutukar kare hakkin dan Adam. An dauki Mini a matsayin majagaba na masana'antar likitanci a Afirka ta Kudu, musamman saboda muhimmiyar gudummawar da ya bayar wajen kawar da cutar kanjamau daga kasar. [1] Ya kuma bayar da himma wajen yaki da wariyar launin fata a lokacin aikinsa sannan kuma ya nuna adawa da cin hanci da rashawa da ya taso a lokacin shugabancin Jacob Zuma . [2] Ya yi aiki a Hukumar Kula da Kiwon Lafiya, a wasu lokuta a matsayin shugabanta. [3] [4] Ya mutu a ranar 12 ga Mayu 2020 sakamakon rikice-rikice na COVID-19 yana da shekaru 68 yayin da yake aiki a matsayin shugaban Majalisar Shirye-shiryen Likita. [5] Wa'adinsa na shugaban CMS ya kamata ya ƙare zuwa Satumba 2020. [6]

english_source: His return to South Africa was crucial when the country was confronted with AIDS epidemic which was at its peak and he pioneered the fight to combat the spread of the AIDS virus. He also co-chaired the first national meeting of organisations at Nasrec in 1992 highlighting the importance of tackling HIV.[9] Mini also faced a backlash for his statements about HIV/AIDS by many members of the African National Congress, as most facts regarding the virus were denied by the African National Congress. Mini along with his wife Nancy opened an HIV clinic in Germiston and started treating patients with AIDS for free when Thabo Mbeki served as the President of the country from 1999 to 2008, who consistently denied the spread of AIDS and refused to distribute life saving antiretroviral medicine to treat patients living with AIDS.[2] He was appointed chairperson of Council of Medical Schemes in 2010 by the then minister of health, Aaron Motsoaledi.
target1_text: Komawarsa Afirka ta Kudu na da matukar muhimmanci a lokacin da ƙasar ta fuskanci ɓullar cutar kanjamau wacce ta kai kololuwarta kuma ya jajirce wajen yaki da yaɗuwar cutar kanjamau. Ya kuma jagoranci taron farko na kungiyoyi a Nasrec a shekarar 1992 inda ya bayyana mahimmancin magance cutar kanjamau. [1] Mini ya kuma fuskanci koma baya kan kalaman da ya yi game da cutar kanjamau da yawa daga cikin mambobin majalisar dokokin Afirka, saboda yawancin hujjojin da ke tattare da kwayar cutar, Majalisar Tarayyar Afirka ta musanta. Mini tare da matarsa Nancy sun buɗe asibitin yaki da cutar kanjamau a Germiston kuma sun fara jinyar marasa lafiya da ke ɗauke da cutar kanjamau kyauta a lokacin da Thabo Mbeki ya zama shugaban ƙasar daga shekarun 1999 zuwa 2008, wanda ya yi watsi da yaɗuwar cutar kanjamau kuma ya ki rarraba magungunan ceton rai don kula da marasa lafiya da ke ɗauke da cutar kanjamau. [2] Ministan lafiya na lokacin, Aaron Motsoaledi ya naɗa shi shugaban majalisar tsare-tsaren lafiya a shekarar 2010 .

Ya kuma jagoranci taron farko na kungiyoyi a Nasrec a shekarar 1992 inda ya bayyana mahimmancin magance cutar kanjamau. [1] Mini ya kuma fuskanci koma baya kan kalaman da ya yi game da cutar kanjamau da yawa daga cikin mambobin majalisar dokokin Afirka, saboda yawancin hujjojin da ke tattare da kwayar cutar, Majalisar Tarayyar Afirka ta musanta . [2] Ministan lafiya na lokacin, Aaron Motsoaledi ya nada shi shugaban majalisar tsare-tsaren lafiya a shekarar 2010 .

english_source: He was arrested on 31 March 1963, along with seven colleagues, sentenced to twenty years in prison, and transferred to Robben Island. On the island, he suffered abuse from prison warders, including being buried alive to his neck, and urinated on. This and other forms of ill-treatment were exposed to the international community, came before the United Nations General Assembly, and led to some improvements in conditions.[2]
target1_text: An kama shi a ranar 31 ga watan Maris 1963, tare da abokan aiki bakwai, an yanke masa hukuncin ɗaurin shekaru 20 a gidan yari, kuma aka kai shi tsibirin Robben. A tsibirin, ya fuskanci cin zarafi daga masu kula da kurkuku, ciki har da binne shi da rai har zuwa wuyansa, kuma ya yi fitsari. Wannan da sauran nau'ikan musgunawa an fallasa su ga al'ummomin duniya, sun zo gaban babban taron Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya, kuma sun haifar da wasu gyare-gyare na yanayi. [1]

english_source: After his release on 20 June 1983, he rejoined the PAC, and spent about ten days with his family before leaving the country to join the PAC in exile. He was appointed Secretary for Foreign Affairs and, after the death of John Nyathi Pokela, was appointed chairman and commander in chief of the Azanian People's Liberation Army (APLA), the PAC's military wing, from 12 August 1985 until 1990.[3] He served as Deputy President of the PAC from 1990 to 1994.[2]
target1_text: Bayan an sake shi a ranar 20 ga watan Yuni 1983, ya koma PAC, kuma ya shafe kusan kwanaki goma tare da iyalinsa kafin ya bar ƙasar ya shiga PAC a gudun hijira. An naɗa shi Sakataren Harkokin Waje kuma, bayan mutuwar John Nyathi Pokela, an naɗa shi shugaba da kwamandan rundunar sojojin 'yantar da jama'ar Azaniya (APLA), reshen soja na PAC, daga ranar 12 ga watan Agusta 1985 har zuwa shekara ta 1990. [1] Ya yi Mataimakin Shugaban Hukumar PAC daga shekarun 1990 zuwa 1994. [2]
target2_text: Bayan an sake shi a ranar 20 ga Yuni 1983, ya koma PAC, kuma ya shafe kusan kwanaki goma tare da iyalinsa kafin ya bar ƙasar ya shiga PAC a gudun hijira. An nada shi Sakataren Harkokin Waje kuma, bayan mutuwar John Nyathi Pokela, an nada shi shugaba da kwamandan rundunar sojojin 'yantar da jama'ar Azaniya (APLA), reshen soja na PAC, daga 12 ga Agusta 1985 har zuwa 1990. [1] Ya yi Mataimakin Shugaban Hukumar PAC daga 1990 zuwa 1994. [2]

english_source: He died of COVID-19 during the COVID-19 pandemic in South Africa, on the morning of 9 January 2021, after being admitted to hospital the day before.[5][6]
target1_text: Ya mutu sakamakon COVID-19 yayin ɓarkewar cutar ta COVID-19 a Afirka ta Kudu, da safiyar ranar 9 ga watan Janairu, 2021, bayan an kwantar da shi a asibiti ranar da ta gabata. [1] [2]
target2_text: Ya mutu sakamakon COVID-19 yayin barkewar cutar ta COVID-19 a Afirka ta Kudu, da safiyar 9 ga Janairu, 2021, bayan an kwantar da shi a asibiti ranar da ta gabata. [1] [2]

english_source: Mlangeni was born in Bethlehem, Orange Free State. After having to give up his studies owing to poverty, after 1946 he experienced worker exploitation as a factory worker. When working as a bus driver, he was active in a strike for better working conditions and a living wage, and in 1951, joined the African National Congress Youth League (ANCYL). In 1954, he joined the African National Congress (ANC).[3] In 1961, he was sent for military training outside the country, but on his return in 1963 was arrested, after being accused of recruiting and training an armed force. He was found guilty in the Rivonia Trial and sentenced to life imprisonment on Robben Island, where he was Prisoner 467/64.[3]
target1_text: An haifi Mlangeni a Baitalami, Jihar Orange Free State. Bayan ya daina karatunsa saboda talauci, bayan shekarar 1946 ya fuskanci cin zarafin ma'aikata a matsayin ma'aikacin masana'anta. Lokacin da yake aiki a matsayin direban bas, ya kasance yana cikin yajin aiki don ingantacciyar yanayin aiki da albashi, kuma a cikin shekarar 1951, ya shiga kungiyar matasa ta National Congress Youth League (ANCYL). A shekarar 1954 ya shiga jam'iyyar ANC. [1] A shekarar 1961, an tura shi horon soji a wajen ƙasar, amma bayan dawowarsa a shekarar 1963 aka kama shi, bayan da aka zarge shi da ɗaukar ma’aikata da horar da sojoji. An same shi da laifi a cikin Kotun Rivonia kuma aka yanke masa hukuncin ɗaurin rai da rai a tsibirin Robben, inda yake fursuna 467/64. [1]

english_source: In 2017, Mlangeni [9] appeared with fellow defendants at the Rivonia Trial, Denis Goldberg and Ahmed Kathrada, along with lawyers Joel Joffe, George Bizos and Denis Kuny in a documentary film entitled Life is Wonderful, directed by Sir Nicholas Stadlen,[10] which tells the story of the trial. (The title reflects Goldberg's words to his mother at the end of the trial on hearing that he and his comrades had been spared the death sentence).[11][12][13][14]
target1_text: A cikin shekarar 2017, Mlangeni [1] ya bayyana tare da abokan aikinsa a Kotun Rivonia, Denis Goldberg da Ahmed Kathrada, tare da lauyoyi Joel Joffe, George Bizos da Denis Kuny a cikin wani fim mai suna Life is Wonderful, wanda Sir Nicholas Stadlen ya jagoranta, [2] wanda ya ba da labarin shari'ar. (Laƙabin yana nuna kalaman Goldberg ga mahaifiyarsa a ƙarshen shari'ar da suka ji cewa an kare shi da 'yan uwansa daga hukuncin kisa). [3] [4] [5] [6]
target2_text: A cikin 2017, Mlangeni [1] ya bayyana tare da abokan aikinsa a Kotun Rivonia, Denis Goldberg da Ahmed Kathrada, tare da lauyoyi Joel Joffe, George Bizos da Denis Kuny a cikin wani fim mai suna Life is Wonderful, wanda Sir Nicholas Stadlen ya jagoranta, [2] wanda ya ba da labarin shari'ar. (Lakabin yana nuna kalaman Goldberg ga mahaifiyarsa a karshen shari'ar da suka ji cewa an kare shi da 'yan uwansa daga hukuncin kisa). [3] [4] [5] [6]

english_source: Mlangeni died on 21 July 2020 in 1 Military Hospital in Pretoria after complaining of abdominal related issues. He was 95 and was the last surviving Rivonia Trialist following the death of Denis Goldberg on 29 April same year. President Cyril Ramaphosa expressed his condolences on behalf of the government, stating: "The passing of Andrew Mokete Mlangeni signifies the end of a generational history and places our future squarely in our hands".[21] He was given a special state funeral on 29 July 2020 and he was buried at Roodepoort cemetery next to his wife June.
target1_text: Mlangeni ya mutu ne a ranar 21 ga watan Yuli, 2020 a Asibitin Soja na 1 da ke Pretoria bayan ya koka da matsalolin ciki. Ya kasance ɗan shekara 95 kuma shine na ƙarshe da ya tsira daga Rivonia Trialist bayan mutuwar Denis Goldberg a ranar 29 ga watan Afrilu a wannan shekarar. Shugaba Cyril Ramaphosa ya bayyana ta'aziyyarsa a madadin gwamnati, yana mai cewa: "Rasuwar Andrew Mokete Mlangeni na nuni da ƙarshen tarihin tsararraki da kuma sanya makomarmu a hannunmu". [1] An yi jana'izar ta musamman a ranar 29 ga watan Yuli, 2020 kuma an binne shi a makabartar Roodepoort kusa da matarsa June.

[1] An yi jana'izar ta musamman a ranar 29 ga Yuli, 2020 kuma an binne shi a makabartar Roodepoort kusa da matarsa June.

english_source: In July 1963, he was arrested at Liliesleaf Farm along with Walter Sisulu, Govan Mbeki, Ahmed Kathrada, Denis Goldberg, Raymond Mhlaba, and Andrew Mlangeni. At the Rivonia Trial, all of the men and Nelson Mandela (who had been imprisoned earlier) were found guilty and sentenced to life imprisonment.[3]

A Kotun Rivonia, dukkan mutanen da Nelson Mandela (wanda aka daure a kurkuku) an same su da laifi kuma an yanke musu hukuncin daurin rai da rai. [1]
target2_text: A cikin watan Yuli 1963, an kama shi a Liliesleaf Farm tare da Walter Sisulu, Govan Mbeki, Ahmed Kathrada, Denis Goldberg, Raymond Mhlaba, da Andrew Mlangeni. A Kotun Rivonia, dukkan mutanen da Nelson Mandela (wanda aka ɗaure a kurkuku) an same su da laifi kuma an yanke musu hukuncin ɗaurin rai da rai. [1]

english_source: She and her husband were forced to leave Potchefstroom in 1931, and they moved to Johannesburg.[1] She joined the Communist Party's Political Bureau in 1937 and then its Central Committee. She also became a member of the party's Johannesburg committee in the 1940s and was a leader in the women's section of the party.[2][3]

[1] Ta shiga Ofishin Siyasa na Jam'iyyar Kwaminis a shekarar 1937 sannan ta shiga kwamitin tsakiya. Ta kuma zama mamba a kwamitin jam'iyyar Johannesburg a shekarun 1940 kuma ta kasance jagora a ɓangaren mata na jam'iyyar. [2] [3]

Ta kuma zama mamba a kwamitin jam'iyyar Johannesburg a shekarun 1940 kuma ta kasance jagora a bangaren mata na jam'iyyar. [2] [3]

english_source: In 1972, when Nxumalo was only 15, he was detained without trial for his participation in a school boycott. The following year, only 16, he was arrested again. Being charged with public violence for his role in student and worker strikes. Nxumalo would study law at the University of Natal. Continuing his activism, he would join and participate heavily in the South African Student Organization (SASO).
target1_text: A cikin 1972, lokacin da Nxumalo yana ɗan shekara 15 kawai, an tsare shi ba tare da shari'a ba saboda halartar kauracewa makaranta. A shekara mai zuwa, 16 kawai, an sake kama shi. Ana tuhumarsa da cin zarafin jama'a saboda rawar da ya taka a yajin aikin dalibai da ma'aikata. Nxumalo zai karanci shari'a a Jami'ar Natal. A ci gaba da fafutukarsa, zai shiga kuma ya taka rawa sosai a cikin kungiyar dalibai ta Afirka ta Kudu (SASO).
target2_text: A cikin shekarar 1972, lokacin da Nxumalo yana ɗan shekara 15 kawai, an tsare shi ba tare da shari'a ba saboda halartar ƙauracewa makaranta. A shekara mai zuwa, 16 kawai, an sake kama shi. Ana tuhumarsa da cin zarafin jama'a saboda rawar da ya taka a yajin aikin ɗalibai da ma'aikata. Nxumalo zai karanci shari'a a Jami'ar Natal. A ci gaba da fafutukarsa, zai shiga kuma ya taka rawa sosai a cikin kungiyar ɗalibai ta Afirka ta Kudu (SASO).

english_source: Nxumalo would play a large role in the Soweto uprising, which were a series of student-led protests in response to the Apartheid and the introduction of Afrikaans into the school curriculum.[4] The students believed Afrikaans to be the “language of the oppressor”.[2] It is estimated that 20,000 students would participate, protests would begin on June 16, 1976. The students would be met with police brutality, with anywhere from 176 to 700 killed.[4]
target1_text: Nxumalo zai taka rawa sosai a yunkurin Soweto, wanda ya kasance jerin zanga-zangar da dalibai suka jagoranta don mayar da martani ga wariyar launin fata da kuma shigar da Afrikaans a cikin manhajar makaranta. [1] Daliban sun yi imanin Afrikaans shine "harshen azzalumi". [2] An kiyasta cewa dalibai 20,000 za su shiga, za a fara zanga-zangar a ranar 16 ga Yuni, 1976. Daliban za su fuskanci cin zarafi na 'yan sanda, inda aka kashe daga 176 zuwa 700. [1]

[1] Ɗaliban sun yi imanin Afrikaans shine "harshen azzalumi". [2] An kiyasta cewa ɗalibai 20,000 za su shiga, za a fara zanga-zangar a ranar 16 ga watan Yuni, 1976. english_source: Later, Nxumalo would hold a leading position in the ranks of Umkhonto weSizwe. Lending his services around Africa, serving in nations like Angola, and Swaziland.[1] While at Funda Camp, which was an Umkhonto weSizwe preparation camp on the outskirts of Luanda, Angola, Nxumalo was seriously injured by a bullet mistakenly shot by a new recruit. Nxumalo however would go on to make a full recovery.[2]
target1_text: Daga baya, Nxumalo zai rike babban matsayi a cikin sahu na Umkhonto weSizwe. Bayar da lamuni a Afirka, yana aiki a ƙasashe kamar Angola, da Swaziland. [1] Yayin da yake a sansanin Funda, wanda wani sansanin shiri ne na Umkhonto weSizwe da ke wajen Luanda, Angola, Nxumalo ya ji rauni sosai sakamakon wani harsashi da wani sabon ma'aikaci ya harbe shi da kuskure. Nxumalo duk da haka zai ci gaba da yin cikakken murmurewa. [2]

[1] Yayin da yake a sansanin Funda, wanda wani sansanin shiri ne na Umkhonto weSizwe da ke wajen Luanda, Angola, Nxumalo ya ji rauni sosai sakamakon wani harsashi da wani sabon ma'aikaci ya harbe shi a bisa kuskure. Nxumalo duk da haka zai ci gaba da yin cikakken murmurewa. [2]

english_source: Under Pokela, the use of funds was set, with 50% set aside for military operations, 30% going to administration, and 20% used for propaganda; the idea of members submitting annual financial reports about their use of PAC funds was also floated. Nevertheless, money went missing at various points in time, and the PAC ran out of funds between March and November 1981.[1]
target1_text: A karkashin Pokela, an saita amfani da kudade, tare da 50% da aka kebe don ayyukan soja, 30% za a yi mulki, kuma 20% ana amfani da su don farfaganda; ra'ayin membobin da ke gabatar da rahoton kuɗi na shekara-shekara game da amfani da su na kuɗin PAC an kuma yi ta iyo. Duk da haka, kuɗi ya ɓace a wurare daban-daban a cikin lokaci, kuma PAC ta ƙare tsakanin Maris da Nuwamba 1981. [1]

english_source: In June 1977, Schoon married Jeanette Curtis,[4] a banned student and trade union activist, the sister of Neville Curtis.[5] The couple feared for their safety in South Africa and moved to Botswana, first to the capital Gaborone, then to Molepolole, teaching at Kgari Sechele Secondary School, and later back to Gaborone where they jointly ran the Botswana branch of the [International Voluntary Service],[6] all the while continuing to work for the anti-apartheid movement. They had two children: Katryn (1978) and Fritz (1981). During this time, internally within the African National Congress, the Schoons broke Craig Williamson's cover. He was an apartheid government spy named later publicly confirmed as a highly successful infiltrator of the liberation movements.[7] This allowed the ANC leadership to attempt to manipulate Williamson covertly for the movement's ends for a time. Later, following a warning from the United Kingdom's High Commissioner (ambassador) in Botswana that Marius was a target for assassination by the apartheid government security forces, the Schoon family moved to Angola via Lusaka, Zambia.
target1_text: A cikin Yuni 1977, Schoon ya auri Jeanette Curtis, [1] ɗalibi da aka dakatar kuma mai fafutukar kasuwanci, 'yar'uwar Neville Curtis . [2] Ma'auratan sun ji tsoro don kare lafiyarsu a Afirka ta Kudu kuma sun koma Botswana, da farko zuwa Gaborone babban birnin kasar, sannan zuwa Molepolole, suna koyarwa a makarantar sakandare ta Kgari Sechele, daga bisani kuma suka koma Gaborone inda suka yi aiki tare da reshen Botswana na [Ma'aikatar Sa-kai ta kasa da kasa], [3] duk yayin da suke ci gaba da aiki don gwagwarmayar yaki da wariyar launin fata. Suna da 'ya'ya biyu: Katryn (1978) da Fritz (1981). A cikin wannan lokacin, a cikin Majalisar Tarayyar Afirka, Schoon ya karya murfin Craig Williamson . Shi ɗan leƙen asirin gwamnatin wariyar launin fata ne da aka ambata daga baya aka tabbatar da shi a matsayin wanda ya yi nasarar kutsa kai cikin ƙungiyoyin 'yantar da jama'a. [4] Wannan ya baiwa shugabancin ANC damar yin yunƙurin yin amfani da Williamson a ɓoye don ƙarshen motsi na ɗan lokaci. Bayan haka, bayan gargadin da babban jakadan Burtaniya (jakadar) a Botswana ya yi cewa jami'an tsaron gwamnatin wariyar launin fata ne suka kashe Marius, dangin Schoon sun koma Angola ta hanyar Lusaka na kasar Zambia.

english_source: Schoon filed a civil suit against Williamson, seeking damages for his son Fritz. However, the suit was suspended pending Williamson’s Amnesty hearing. Schoon testified at Williamson’s hearing and[9] is remembered for his strong stance against[10] amnesty for the killer. He favoured justice over the Truth and Reconciliation Commission’s call for forgiveness, reconciliation and an amnesty. Williamson was granted amnesty in June 2000, a year after Schoon’s death, a decision his son appealed.[11]
target1_text: Schoon ya shigar da kara a kan Williamson, yana neman diyya ga dansa Fritz. Sai dai kuma an dakatar da karar har sai an saurari karar da Williamson zai yi. Schoon ya ba da shaida a sauraron Williamson kuma ana tunawa da [1] saboda matsayarsa mai karfi a kan [2] afuwa ga wanda ya kashe. Ya fifita adalci fiye da kiraye-kirayen da hukumar gaskiya da sulhu ta yi na neman gafara, sulhu da yin afuwa. An yi wa Williamson afuwa a watan Yuni 2000, shekara guda bayan mutuwar Schoon, shawarar da dansa ya daukaka kara. [3]
target2_text: Schoon ya shigar da ƙara a kan Williamson, yana neman diyya ga ɗansa Fritz. Sai dai kuma an dakatar da ƙarar har sai an saurari ƙarar da Williamson zai yi. Schoon ya ba da shaida a sauraron Williamson kuma ana tunawa da [1] saboda matsayarsa mai karfi a kan [2] afuwa ga wanda ya kashe. An yi wa Williamson afuwa a watan Yuni 2000, shekara guda bayan mutuwar Schoon, shawarar da ɗansa ya ɗaukaka kara. [3]

english_source: He was hanged for treason on August 4, 1905.[1][2] His brother continued Kinjikitile's work and the rebellion continued until 1907, with over 100,000[11] or 200-300,000 Africans killed in the German suppression of the revolt.[4] Present-day Tanzanians consider the failed rebellion to have been the first stirring of nationalism, and Kinjikitile "Bokero" Ngwale a proto-national hero.[4]
target1_text: An rataye shi da laifin cin amanar kasa a ranar 4 ga Agusta, 1905. [1] [2] Dan uwansa ya ci gaba da aikin Kinjikitile kuma tawayen ya ci gaba har zuwa 1907, inda aka kashe sama da 100,000 [3] ko 200-300,000 na Afirka a cikin murkushe tawayen Jamus. [4] 'Yan Tanzaniya na yau suna ɗaukar tawayen da bai yi nasara ba shi ne farkon abin da ya haifar da kishin ƙasa, kuma Kinjikitile "Bokero" Ngwale jarumi ne na ƙasa. [1]
target2_text: An rataye shi da laifin cin amanar ƙasa a ranar 4 ga watan Agusta, 1905. [1] [2] Ɗan uwansa ya ci gaba da aikin Kinjikitile kuma tawayen ya ci gaba har zuwa shekara ta 1907, inda aka kashe sama da 100,000 [3] ko 200-300,000 na Afirka a cikin murkushe tawayen Jamus. [4] 'Yan Tanzaniya na yau suna ɗaukar tawayen da bai yi nasara ba shi ne farkon abin da ya haifar da kishin ƙasa, kuma Kinjikitile "Bokero" Ngwale jarumi ne na ƙasa. [1]

english_source: Daniel Nyamayaro Madzimbamuto was born in Murehwa, on October 8, either 1929[1] or 1930.[2] This was a rural area north of Salisbury, Southern Rhodesia (now Harare, Zimbabwe).[3] He was the son of a Tribal Trust Land farmer, and the eighth child of a family of 10.[2]
target1_text: An haifi Daniel Nyamairo Madzimbamuto a Murehwa, a ranar 8 ga watan Oktoba, ko dai 1929 [1] ko 1930. [2] Wannan yanki ne na karkara a arewacin Salisbury, Kudancin Rhodesia (yanzu Harare, Zimbabwe). [3] Ya kasance ɗan wani manomin Land Trust Land, kuma ɗa na takwas a cikin iyali 10. [2]
target2_text: An haifi Daniel Nyamairo Madzimbamuto a Murehwa, a ranar 8 ga Oktoba, ko dai 1929 [1] ko 1930. [2] Wannan yanki ne na karkara a arewacin Salisbury, Kudancin Rhodesia (yanzu Harare, Zimbabwe). [3] Ya kasance ɗan wani manomin Land Trust Land, kuma ɗa na takwas a cikin iyali 10. [2]

english_source: After Zimbabwe's independence in 1979–80, Madzimbamuto became Deputy Postmaster General at the Zimbabwe Posts and Telecommunications Corporation.[1][6] He held this post until retirement in 1998.[1]
target1_text: Bayan da Zimbabwe ta samu 'yancin kai a shekarar 1979–80, Madzimbamuto ya zama Mataimakin Babban mai Watsa Labarai a Kamfanin Wasika da Sadarwa na Zimbabwe. [1] [2] Ya riƙe wannan muƙamin har sai da ya yi ritaya a shekarar 1998. [1]
target2_text: Bayan da Zimbabwe ta samu 'yancin kai a 1979–80, Madzimbamuto ya zama Mataimakin Babban Malamin Watsa Labarai a Kamfanin Wasika da Sadarwa na Zimbabwe. [1] [2] Ya rike wannan mukamin har sai da ya yi ritaya a shekarar 1998. [1]

english_source: The Manifesto of N'sele (French: Manifeste de la N'sele) was a political document issued in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (later renamed Zaire) on 19[1] or 20[2] May 1967 which set out the official political stance of the Popular Movement of the Revolution (Mouvement Populaire de la Révolution, MPR), a political party which had been founded by Joseph-Désiré Mobutu in 1966. The manifesto was created at an MPR meeting in N'sele, Kinshasa where it was based.[2]
target1_text: Manifesto na N'sele (Faransanci: Manifeste de la N'sele) takarda ce ta siyasa da aka bayar a Jamhuriyar Demokradiyyar Kongo (daga baya aka sake masa suna Zaire) a ranar 19 [1] ko 20 [2] Mayu 1967 wanda ya bayyana matsayin siyasa na Movement Popular of the Revolution (Mouvement Populaire de la Révolution, MPR), Jam'iyyar siyasa da Joseph-Désiré Mobutu ya kafa a 1966. An kirkiro wannan takardar ne a wani taron MPR a N'sele, Kinshasa inda aka kafa ta.[2]
target2_text: Jawabin Manufar N'sele (Faransanci: Manifeste de la N'sele) takarda ce ta siyasa da aka bayar a Jamhuriyar Demokradiyyar Kongo (daga baya aka sake masa suna Zaire) a ranar 19 [1] ko 20 [2] Mayu 1967 wanda ya bayyana matsayin siyasa na Movement Popular of the Revolution (Mouvement Populaire de la Révolution, MPR), Jam'iyyar siyasa da Joseph-Désiré Mobutu ya kafa a 1966. An kirkiro wannan takardar ne a wani taron MPR a N'sele, Kinshasa inda aka kafa ta.[2]

english_source: Tavarwisa worked as a primary school teacher until she left to join the Zimbabwe African National Liberation Army (ZANLA) to fight for the country's liberation. She was one of the early cadres and first female commanders of the movement.[1] Her initial responsibility was to carry and supply arms from Zambia to Mozambique to the frontlines in Zimbabwe (formerly Rhodesia). She was also responsible for disseminating the movement. She cooperated particularly among the peasants to gather their support.[4] Tavarwisa also ensured that women in the camps were not being sexually harassed or exploited.[3]
target1_text: Tavarwisa ta yi aiki a matsayin malamar makarantar firamare har sai da ta tafi ta shiga kungiyar 'yantar da 'yancin kai ta Zimbabwe (ZANLA) domin fafutukar kwato ƙasar. Ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin jiga-jigan farko kuma mata na farko kwamandojin tafiyar. [1] Aikinta na farko shi ne ɗaukar makamai daga Zambiya zuwa Mozambique zuwa fagen daga a Zimbabwe (tsohuwar Rhodesia). Ita ce kuma ta ɗauki nauyin yaɗa harkar. Ta ba da haɗin kai musamman a tsakanin manoma don samun goyon bayansu. [2] Tavarwisa ta kuma tabbatar da cewa ba a cin zarafin mata da ke sansanin ba. [3]
target2_text: Tavarwisa ta yi aiki a matsayin malamin makarantar firamare har sai da ta tafi ta shiga kungiyar 'yantar da 'yancin kai ta Zimbabwe (ZANLA) domin fafutukar kwato kasar. Ta kasance daya daga cikin jiga-jigan farko kuma mata na farko kwamandojin tafiyar. [1] Aikinta na farko shi ne ɗaukar makamai daga Zambiya zuwa Mozambique zuwa fagen daga a Zimbabwe (tsohon Rhodesia ). Ita ce kuma ta dauki nauyin yada harkar. Ta ba da hadin kai musamman a tsakanin manoma don samun goyon bayansu. [2] Tavarwisa ta kuma tabbatar da cewa ba a cin zarafin mata da ke sansanin ba. [3]

english_source: As Minister of Telecommunications, she tried to stop Strive Masiyiwa from establishing his independent cellphone network Econet.[6] Masiyiwa had been given an ultimatum by the cabinet to sell his imported equipment to his rivals. On 24 March 1997, Mujuru decided to issue Zimbabwe's second cellular telephone licence to the previously unknown Zairois consortium Telecel,[7] cutting out Masiyiwa. The Zairois consortium included her husband Solomon and President Robert Mugabe's nephew Leo. After many legal fights, Masiyiwa won his licence in December 1997.
target1_text: A matsayinta na ministar sadarwa, ta yi kokarin hana Strive Masiyiwa kafa cibiyar sadarwar wayar salula mai zaman kanta ta Econet. [1] Majalisar ministoci ta ba Masiyiwa wa'adin sayar da kayan aikin da ya shigo da su ga abokan hamayyarsa. A ranar 24 ga Maris 1997, Mujuru ya yanke shawarar ba da lasisin wayar salula na biyu na Zimbabwe ga ƙungiyar Zairois Telecel wanda ba a taɓa sani ba a baya, [2] yana yanke Masiyiwa. Kungiyar ta Zairois ta hada da mijinta Solomon da dan wan shugaba Robert Mugabe Leo. Bayan fadace-fadacen shari'a da yawa, Masiyiwa ya ci lasisinsa a watan Disamba 1997.

english_source: He was a leading trade union leader, who progressed on to become president of the banned National Democratic Party, and was jailed for ten years by Rhodesia's white minority government. After his release in 1974, ZAPU contributed to the fall of that government, along with the splinter rival ZANU, created in 1963.[1]
target1_text: Ya kasance babban shugaban kungiyar kwadago, wanda ya ci gaba har ya zama shugaban jam'iyyar National Democratic Party da aka dakatar, kuma gwamnatin tsiraru fararen fata ta Rhodesia ta ɗaure shi na tsawon shekaru goma. Bayan da aka sake shi a shekarar 1974, ZAPU ya ba da gudummawa ga faɗuwar waccan gwamnatin, tare da ɓangarorin abokin hamayyar ZANU, wanda aka ƙirƙira a shekarar 1963. [1]
target2_text: Ya kasance babban shugaban kungiyar kwadago, wanda ya ci gaba har ya zama shugaban jam'iyyar National Democratic Party da aka dakatar, kuma gwamnatin tsiraru fararen fata ta Rhodesia ta daure shi na tsawon shekaru goma. Bayan da aka sake shi a 1974, ZAPU ya ba da gudummawa ga faduwar waccan gwamnatin, tare da ɓangarorin abokin hamayyar ZANU, wanda aka ƙirƙira a 1963. [1]

english_source: In 1983, fearing for his life in the early stages of the Gukurahundi, Nkomo fled the country. Later in 1987, he controversially signed the Unity Accord allowing ZAPU to merge with ZANU to stop the genocide.[2]
target1_text: A cikin 1983, Nkomo, saboda tsoron rayuwarsa a farkon matakan Gukurahundi, ya gudu daga ƙasar. Daga baya a shekarar 1987, ya sanya hannu kan yarjejeniyar Unity Accord mai cike da cece-kuce inda ya baiwa ZAPU damar hadewa da ZANU domin dakatar da kisan kiyashin. [1]
target2_text: A cikin shekarar 1983, Nkomo, saboda tsoron rayuwarsa a farkon matakan Gukurahundi, ya gudu daga ƙasar. Daga baya a shekarar 1987, ya sanya hannu kan yarjejeniyar Unity Accord mai cike da cece-kuce inda ya baiwa ZAPU damar haɗewa da ZANU domin dakatar da kisan kiyashin. [1]

english_source: He was one of the founders and chief architect of Zimbabwe African National Union party in August 1963 in conjunction with Herbert Chitepo, Robert Mugabe and Edgar Tekere in the Highfields House of Enos Nkala. In 1964 there was a party Congress at Gwelo, where Sithole was elected president and appointed Robert Mugabe to be his secretary general. ZANU was banned in 1964 by Ian Smith's government. He spent 10 years in prison after being arrested on 22 June 1964[3] alongside Mugabe, Tekere, Nyagumbo and Takawira for his political activities. While in prison he specifically authorised Chitepo to continue the struggle from abroad as a representative of ZANU. Sithole was convicted on a charge of plotting to assassinate Ian Smith and released from prison in 1974.
target1_text: Ya kasance daya daga cikin wadanda suka kafa kuma shugaban gine-ginen jam'iyyar Zimbabwe African National Union a watan Agusta 1963 tare da Herbert Chitepo, Robert Mugabe da Edgar Tekere a Highfields House of Enos Nkala . A shekarar 1964 an yi taron jam'iyyar a Gwelo, inda aka zabi Sithole a matsayin shugaban kasa, aka nada Robert Mugabe a matsayin babban sakatarensa. Gwamnatin Ian Smith ta dakatar da ZANU a shekarar 1964. Ya shafe shekaru 10 a gidan yari bayan an kama shi a ranar 22 ga watan Yuni 1964 [1] tare da Mugabe, Tekere, Nyagumbo da Takawira saboda harkokin siyasa. A lokacin da yake gidan yari ya ba Chitepo izinin ci gaba da gwagwarmaya daga kasashen waje a matsayin wakilin ZANU. An yanke wa Sithole hukuncin kisa kan zargin yunkurin kashe Ian Smith kuma aka sake shi daga kurkuku a shekara ta 1974.
target2_text: Ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka kafa kuma shugaban gine-ginen jam'iyyar Zimbabwe African National Union a watan Agusta 1963 tare da Herbert Chitepo, Robert Mugabe da Edgar Tekere a Highfields House of Enos Nkala. A shekarar 1964 an yi taron jam'iyyar a Gwelo, inda aka zaɓi Sithole a matsayin shugaban ƙasa, aka naɗa Robert Mugabe a matsayin babban sakatarensa. Gwamnatin Ian Smith ta dakatar da ZANU a shekarar 1964. Ya shafe shekaru 10 a gidan yari bayan an kama shi a ranar 22 ga watan Yuni 1964 [1] tare da Mugabe, Tekere, Nyagumbo da Takawira saboda harkokin siyasa. A lokacin da yake gidan yari ya ba Chitepo izinin ci gaba da gwagwarmaya daga ƙasashen waje a matsayin wakilin ZANU. An yanke wa Sithole hukuncin kisa kan zargin yunkurin kashe Ian Smith kuma aka sake shi daga kurkuku a shekara ta 1974.

english_source: On 18 March 1975 Chitepo was assassinated in Lusaka, Zambia, with a car bomb. Mugabe, in Mozambique at the time, was unanimously chosen to be the first secretary of ZANU. Later that year there was a factional split, with many Ndebele following Joshua Nkomo into the equally militant ZAPU. Sithole eventually founded the moderate ZANU-Ndonga party, which renounced violent struggle, while the Shona-dominated ZANU (now called ZANU PF) followed Mugabe with a more militant agenda.[4]
target1_text: A ranar 18 ga Maris, 1975, an kashe Chitepo a Lusaka, Zambia, da wata mota da bam. An zabi Mugabe da ke Mozambique a wancan lokacin, a matsayin babban sakataren jam'iyyar ZANU na farko. Daga baya a waccan shekarar an sami rarrabuwar kawuna, inda Ndebele da yawa suka bi Joshua Nkomo cikin jam’iyyar ZAPU mai fafutuka. A karshe Sithole ya kafa jam'iyyar ZANU-Ndonga mai sassaucin ra'ayi, wacce ta yi watsi da gwagwarmayar tashin hankali, yayin da Shona - wacce ke da rinjaye a ZANU (wanda ake kira ZANU PF) ta bi Mugabe da wata manufa ta tsageru. [1]
target2_text: A ranar 18 ga watan Maris, 1975, an kashe Chitepo a Lusaka, Zambia, da wata mota da bam. An zaɓi Mugabe da ke Mozambique a wancan lokacin, a matsayin babban sakataren jam'iyyar ZANU na farko. Daga baya a waccan shekarar an sami rarrabuwar kawuna, inda Ndebele da yawa suka bi Joshua Nkomo cikin jam’iyyar ZAPU mai fafutuka. A ƙarshe Sithole ya kafa jam'iyyar ZANU-Ndonga mai sassaucin ra'ayi, wacce ta yi watsi da gwagwarmayar tashin hankali, yayin da Shona - wacce ke da rinjaye a ZANU (wanda ake kira ZANU PF) ta bi Mugabe da wata manufa ta tsageru. [1]

english_source: He was elected to parliament for his tribal stronghold of Chipinge in southeastern Zimbabwe in 1995, and was a candidate in the 1996 presidential election (though he withdrew shortly before the election after claiming that Mugabe's ZANU-PF was undermining his campaign).[7] In December 1997, a court tried and convicted him of conspiring with Chimwenje to assassinate Mugabe and the government disqualified him from attending parliament.[8] Sithole's small opposition group again won the Chipinge seat in the June 2000 elections.
target1_text: An zabe shi a matsayin dan majalisa a yankinsa na Chipinge da ke kudu maso gabashin Zimbabwe a shekarar 1995, kuma ya kasance dan takara a zaben shugaban kasa na 1996 (ko da yake ya janye jim kadan kafin zaben bayan ya yi ikirarin cewa jam'iyyar ZANU-PF ta Mugabe tana yi masa zagon kasa). [1] A watan Disambar 1997, wata kotu ta yi masa shari'a tare da samunsa da laifin hada baki da Chimwenje wajen kashe Mugabe kuma gwamnati ta hana shi halartar majalisar dokoki. [2] Ƙananan ƙungiyar adawa ta Sithole ta sake lashe kujerar Chipinge a zaɓen watan Yunin 2000 .

english_source: He was granted the right to appeal, appeal was filed, but the case was never heard by the Supreme Court. He was allowed bail because of his deteriorating health. He died on 12 December 2000, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States. The author of three books on African politics, he is survived by his wife, Vesta, and five adult children.

english_source: His farm, "Porta Farm" situated 25 kilometres (16 mi) from Harare on Bulawayo Road, was legally purchased in 1992 under "willing buyer – willing seller" arrangements. It was later confiscated by Robert Mugabe's ZANU-PF government, on the grounds that it harboured the "undesirables" of Harare. These were people who had been left homeless after being summarily evicted from shanties in Harare before the Commonwealth Heads of Government Meeting 1991. Sithole had felt compassion for them, and what he felt was the breach of their human rights; he therefore had invited some of them to stay on the farm. This incensed the government, which then carried out an eviction operation. This was co-ordinated by the Ministry of Local Government and National Housing as well as the City of Harare. Pre-dawn raids were carried out and, in the aftermath, Porta Farm was confiscated.[9][10]
target1_text: Gonansa, "Porta Farm" mai nisan 25 kilometres (16 mi) daga Harare a kan titin Bulawayo, an siya ta bisa doka a cikin 1992 a ƙarƙashin shirye-shiryen "mai siye - mai sayarwa". Daga baya kuma gwamnatin Robert Mugabe ta ZANU-PF ta kwace shi, bisa hujjar cewa tana dauke da abubuwan da ba a so na Harare. Wadannan mutane ne da aka bar su ba tare da matsuguni ba bayan an kore su daga gidajen zama a Harare kafin taron shugabannin Commonwealth na 1991 . Sithole ya tausaya musu, kuma abin da yake ji shi ne tauye hakkinsu na dan Adam ; don haka ya gayyaci wasu daga cikinsu su zauna a gona. Hakan dai ya harzuka gwamnati, inda daga nan ne ta gudanar da aikin korar mutanen. Ma’aikatar kananan hukumomi da gidaje ta kasa da kuma birnin Harare ne suka hada kai. An kai hare-hare kafin wayewar gari kuma, bayan haka, an kwace gonar Porta. [1] [2]

Daga baya kuma gwamnatin Robert Mugabe ta ZANU-PF ta kwace shi, bisa hujjar cewa tana ɗauke da abubuwan da ba a so na Harare. Waɗannan mutane ne da aka bar su ba tare da matsuguni ba bayan an kore su daga gidajen zama a Harare kafin taron shugabannin Commonwealth na shekarar 1991. An kai hare-hare kafin wayewar gari kuma, bayan haka, an kwace gonar Porta. [1] [2]

english_source: Julia Tukai Zvobgo (born Julia Tukai Whande; 8 November 1937 – 16 February 2004) was a Zimbabwean activist and politician.[1]
target1_text: Julia Tukai Zvobgo (an haife shi Julia Tukai Whande; 8 ga Nuwamba 1937 – 16 ga Fabrairu 2004) 'yar gwagwarmaya ce kuma 'yar siyasa 'yar ƙasar Zimbabwe. [1]
target2_text: Julia Tukai Zvobgo (an haife shi Julia Tukai Whande; 8 ga Nuwamba 1937 – 16 ga Fabrairu 2004) yar gwagwarmaya ce kuma ɗan siyasa ɗan Zimbabwe . [1]

english_source: Julia Zvobgo's earliest experience with racist repression was when she witnessed the arrest of her husband, then returning from the United States.[3] Her husband was subsequently sentenced to 18 months’ imprisonment. Having become a member of Zanu at its formation in August 1963, Zvobgo and other young women bore the brunt of suppressive racist colonial rule which peaked under the Rhodesian Front.[3] The banning of Zanu in 1964 saw her husband detained and restricted for six years at Sikombela and other camps of incarceration across the country.[3] As a result, she went to the UK. From 1968 -1971 she studied in the United Kingdom and at Hillcroft in Surrey. Later, on a United Nations scholarship, she completed a diploma in Institutional Management at Leeds Polytechnic.[2] She then continued her higher education in 1975 in the United States where her husband was studying and teaching. In 1977, she obtained a BA in Political Science from Lewis University in Illinois, USA. When her husband left for Mozambique to join others in the liberation struggle, Zvobgo moved to study at the University of Notre Dame in Indiana. In August 1978 she obtained a Master of Science degree in Administration.[4]
target1_text: Farkon abin da Julia Zvobgo ta fuskanta game da zaluncin wariyar launin fata shine lokacin da ta ga yadda aka kama mijinta, sannan ta dawo daga Amurka. [1] Daga baya aka yankewa mijinta hukuncin ɗaurin watanni 18 a gidan yari. Bayan zama memba na Zanu a lokacin kafuwarta a watan Agustan 1963, Zvobgo da sauran 'yan mata sun ɗauki nauyin mulkin wariyar launin fata na 'yan mulkin mallaka wanda ya kai kololuwa a ƙarƙashin Rhodesian Front. [1] Haramcin Zanu a shekarar 1964 ya sa aka tsare mijinta kuma aka tsare shi tsawon shekaru shida a Sikombela da sauran sansanonin ɗauri a faɗin ƙasar. [1] A sakamakon haka, ta tafi Birtaniya. Daga shekarar 1968-1971 ta yi karatu a Burtaniya da Hillcroft a Surrey. Daga baya, a kan tallafin karatu na Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya, ta kammala difloma a cikin Gudanar da Gudanarwa a Leeds Polytechnic. [2] Daga nan ta ci gaba da karatunta na gaba a shekarar 1975 a ƙasar Amurka inda mijinta yake karatu da koyarwa. A shekarar 1977 ta samu digirin digirgir (BA) a fannin kimiyyar siyasa daga jami'ar Lewis dake Illinois ta ƙasar Amurka. Sa’ad da mijinta ya tafi Mozambique don ya shiga cikin gwagwarmayar ’yanci, Zvobgo ta koma karatu a Jami’ar Notre Dame da ke Indiana. A watan Agusta 1978 ta sami digiri na biyu na Kimiyya a Gudanarwa. [3]

english_source: Zvobgo's commitment to her family and nationalist values made her endure the constant harassment and torture at the hands of the Rhodesian security agents who accused her of smuggling political messages to and from her detained husband and his colleagues.[1] From 1968-1978 Julia studied abroad and later joined her husband in the armed struggle in Mozambique where she was elected Administrative Secretary for Women's Affairs.[3] She attended problems of women in military and refugee camps and was one of the pioneers of the Women's League.[3]
target1_text: Yunkurin da Zvobgo ta yi ga danginta da kimar kishin ƙasa ya sa ta jimre da cin zarafi da azabtarwa a hannun jami’an tsaro na Rhodesia waɗanda ke zarginta da safarar saƙon siyasa zuwa da kuma daga mijinta da aka tsare da kuma abokan aikinsa. [1] Daga 1968-1978 Julia ta yi karatu a kasashen waje sannan daga baya ta shiga hannun mijinta a fagen gwagwarmaya a Mozambik inda aka zabe ta sakatariyar harkokin mata. [1] Ta halarci matsalolin mata a sansanonin soja da na ’yan gudun hijira kuma ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin majagaba na Ƙungiyar Mata. [1]

[1] Daga shekarar 1968-1978 Julia ta yi karatu a ƙasashen waje sannan daga baya ta shiga hannun mijinta a fagen gwagwarmaya a Mozambik inda aka zabe ta sakatariyar harkokin mata. [1] Ta halarci matsalolin mata a sansanonin soja da na ’yan gudun hijira kuma ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin majagaba na Ƙungiyar Mata. [1]

english_source: Maria da Luz Freire de Andrade (1934 – November 6, 2024), better known as Lilica Boal, was a historian, philosopher, educator, and anti-fascist activist in Cape Verde. She fought for the independence of Guinea-Bissau and Cape Verde, and against the Portuguese Estado Novo dictatorship.
target1_text: Maria da Luz Freire de Andrade (1934 - Nuwamba 6, 2024), wacce aka fi sani da Lilica Boal, ƴar tarihi ce, ƴan falsafa, malami, kuma mai fafutukar yaƙi da fascist a Cape Verde . Ta yi gwagwarmaya don samun 'yancin kai na Guinea-Bissau da Cape Verde, da kuma adawa da mulkin kama-karya na Portuguese Estado Novo .
target2_text: Maria da Luz Freire de Andrade (1934 - Nuwamba 6, 2024), wacce aka fi sani da Lilica Boal, masaniya a fannin tarihi ce, ƴar falsafa, malama, kuma mai fafutukar yaƙi da fascist a Cape Verde. Ta yi gwagwarmaya don samun 'yancin kai na Guinea-Bissau da Cape Verde, da kuma adawa da mulkin kama-karya na Portuguese Estado Novo.

english_source: After two years in Coimbra, she moved to Lisbon, where she enrolled in the history and philosophy program at the University of Lisbon. There, she began to frequent Casa dos Estudantes do Império, a meeting place for students from African colonies of Portugal. It was then that she began to identify herself with the liberation movement. The students discussed the situations in their different countries and what role they could play in the fight for freedom.[1][4]
target1_text: Bayan shekaru biyu a Coimbra, ta koma Lisbon, inda ta shiga cikin tsarin tarihi da falsafa a Jami'ar Lisbon. A can, ta fara yawan Casa dos Estudantes do Império, wurin taro na ɗalibai daga yankunan Afirka na Portugal. Daga nan ne ta fara bayyana kanta a cikin yunkurin kwato 'yanci. Ɗaliban sun tattauna batutuwan da ke faruwa a ƙasashen su daban-daban da irin rawar da za su taka wajen fafutukar kwato 'yanci. [1] [2]
target2_text: Bayan shekaru biyu a Coimbra, ta koma Lisbon, inda ta shiga cikin tsarin tarihi da falsafa a Jami'ar Lisbon . A can, ta fara yawan Casa dos Estudantes do Império, wurin taro na dalibai daga yankunan Afirka na Portugal. Daga nan ne ta fara bayyana kanta a cikin yunkurin kwato 'yanci. Daliban sun tattauna batutuwan da ke faruwa a kasashensu daban-daban da irin rawar da za su taka wajen fafutukar kwato 'yanci. [1] [2]

english_source: Boal later said of Cabral, who was a significant African anti-colonial leader until his assassination in 1973, "Amílcar cared about the issue of gender. He said that women had to fight for their freedom. He chose women for all aspects of the struggle: education, health, information, logistics.[1]
target1_text: Daga baya Boal ya ce game da Cabral, wanda ya kasance babban jagoran adawa da mulkin mallaka na Afirka har zuwa lokacin da aka kashe shi a 1973, "Amílcar ya damu da batun jinsi. Ya ce dole ne mata su yi fafutuka don kwato musu 'yanci. Ya zavi mata a kowane fanni na gwagwarmaya: ilimi, lafiya, bayanai, dabaru. [1]
target2_text: Daga baya Boal yia ce game da Cabral, wanda ya kasance babban jagoran adawa da mulkin mallaka na Afirka har zuwa lokacin da aka kashe shi a shekarar 1973, "Amílcar ta damu da batun jinsi. Ta ce dole ne mata su yi fafutuka don kwato musu 'yanci. Ta zaɓi mata a kowane fanni na gwagwarmaya: ilimi, lafiya, bayanai, dabaru. [1]

english_source: In this period, Boal joined the leadership of the Women's Democratic Union (UDEMU), the party's women's wing, taking responsibility for international relations. She participated in international women's conferences that dealt with the situation of women in Africa and the world.
target1_text: A wannan lokaci Boal ya shiga shugabancin kungiyar mata ta UDEMU, reshen mata na jam’iyyar, inda ya dauki nauyin hulda da kasashen duniya. Ta halarci tarukan mata na kasa da kasa da suka shafi yanayin mata a Afirka da ma duniya baki daya.
target2_text: A wannan lokaci Boal ta shiga shugabancin kungiyar mata ta UDEMU, reshen mata na jam’iyyar, inda ta ɗauki nauyin hulɗa da ƙasashen duniya. Ta halarci tarukan mata na ƙasa da ƙasa da suka shafi yanayin mata a Afirka da ma duniya baki daya.
