english_source: From 1974 to 1979 she was the director of the party's Instituto Amizade in Guinea-Bissau, and she was later appointed to the No. 2 spot at the Ministry of Education, serving as director-general of coordination from 1979 until the end of 1980.[1][2]
target1_text: Daga 1974 zuwa 1979 ta kasance darakta na Instituto Amizade na jam'iyyar a Guinea-Bissau, kuma daga baya aka nada ta a matsayi na 2 a ma'aikatar ilimi, ta kasance babban darakta na daidaitawa daga 1979 har zuwa karshen 1980. [1] [2]
target2_text: Daga shekarun 1974 zuwa 1979 ta kasance darakta na Instituto Amizade na jam'iyyar a Guinea-Bissau, kuma daga baya aka naɗa ta a matsayi na 2 a ma'aikatar ilimi, ta kasance babbar darakta na daidaitawa daga shekarun 1979 har zuwa karshen 1980. [1] [2]

english_source: At the University of Coimbra, she met Manuel Boal, an Angolan medical student and later a fellow freedom fighter. The couple married in 1958 and had two daughters, Sara and Baluka, who were raised in part by Lilica Boal's mother during the height of the liberation fight.[1][2]
target1_text: A Jami'ar Coimbra, ta haɗu da Manuel Boal, ɗalibin likitancin Angola kuma daga baya abokin gwagwarmayar 'yanci. Ma'auratan sun yi aure a shekara ta 1958 kuma suna da 'ya'ya mata biyu, Sara da Baluka, waɗanda mahaifiyar Lilica Boal ta girma a wani ɓangare na yakin neman 'yanci. [1] [2]
target2_text: A Jami'ar Coimbra, ta sadu da Manuel Boal, dalibin likitancin Angola kuma daga baya abokin gwagwarmayar 'yanci. Ma'auratan sun yi aure a shekara ta 1958 kuma suna da 'ya'ya mata biyu, Sara da Baluka, wadanda mahaifiyar Lilica Boal ta girma a wani bangare na yakin neman 'yanci. [1] [2]

english_source: Hostilities ceased in April 1958 (although small skirmishes still occurred) with the Treaty of Angra de Cintra, signed by the Spanish and Moroccan governments, by which Cape Juby and most of the Ifni territory were transferred to Morocco. The city of Sidi Ifni remained in Spanish possession until 1969, when, under international pressure, it was relinquished to Morocco.
target1_text: An daina tashin hankali a watan Afrilun 1958 (ko da yake ana ci gaba da samun ƙananan ɓangarorin) tare da Yarjejeniyar Angra de Cintra, wanda gwamnatocin Spain da na Morocco suka sanya hannu, wanda Cape Juby da yawancin yankin Ifni suka koma Maroko. Birnin Sidi Ifni ya ci gaba da zama a hannun Sipaniya har zuwa shekara 1969, lokacin da, a ƙarƙashin matsin lamba na ƙasa da kasa, aka mika shi ga Morocco.
target2_text: An daina tashin hankali a watan Afrilun 1958 (ko da yake ana ci gaba da samun ƙananan ɓangarorin) tare da Yarjejeniyar Angra de Cintra, wanda gwamnatocin Spain da na Morocco suka sanya hannu, wanda Cape Juby da yawancin yankin Ifni suka koma Maroko. Birnin Sidi Ifni ya ci gaba da zama a hannun Sipaniya har zuwa 1969, lokacin da, a karkashin matsin lamba na kasa da kasa, aka mika shi ga Morocco.

english_source: When Morocco regained independence from France and Spain in 1956, the country expressed a keen interest in all of Spain’s remaining colonial possessions in Morocco, claiming that they were historically and geographically all part of Moroccan territory. Sultan Mohammed V encouraged efforts to re-capture the land and personally funded anti-Spanish guerillas to claim Ifni back for Morocco.[10]
target1_text: A lokacin da kasar Maroko ta sami 'yencin kanta daga hannun Faransa da Spain a shekarar 1956, kasar ta nuna matukar sha'awarta ga daukacin sauran yankunan da Spain ta yi wa mulkin mallaka a kasar Maroko, inda ta ce a tarihi da kuma yanayin kasa duk wani yanki ne na kasar Morocco. Sultan Mohammed V ya karfafa yunƙurin sake kwace ƙasar kuma da kansa ya ba wa 'yan tawayen Spain kuɗi don neman Ifni ga Maroko. [1]
target2_text: A lokacin da ƙasar Maroko ta sami 'yancin kanta daga hannun Faransa da Spain a shekarar 1956, ƙasar ta nuna matukar sha'awarta ga ɗaukacin sauran yankunan da Spain ta yi wa mulkin mallaka a ƙasar Maroko, inda ta ce a tarihi da kuma yanayin ƙasa duk wani yanki ne na ƙasar Morocco. Sultan Mohammed V ya karfafa yunƙurin sake kwace ƙasar kuma da kansa ya ba wa 'yan tawayen Spain kuɗi don neman Ifni ga Maroko. [1]

english_source: Violent demonstrations against Spanish rule erupted in Ifni on 10 April 1957, followed by civil strife and widespread killings of those loyal to Spain. In response, Spanish dictator Francisco Franco dispatched two battalions of the Spanish Legion, Spain's elite fighting force, to El Aaiún in Saguia el-Hamra in June.
target1_text: Zanga-zangar adawa da mulkin Spain ta ɓarke a Ifni a ranar 10 ga watan Afrilun 1957, sannan tashe-tashen hankula da kashe-kashe da dama na masu biyayya ga Spain. Dangane da martani, 'yan mulkin kama karya na Spain Francisco Franco ya aike da bataliya biyu na Legion Spaniya , ƙwararrun sojojin Spain, zuwa El Aaiún a Saguia el-Hamra a watan Yuni.
target2_text: Zanga-zangar adawa da mulkin Spain ta barke a Ifni a ranar 10 ga Afrilun 1957, sannan tashe-tashen hankula da kashe-kashe da dama na masu biyayya ga Spain. Dangane da martani, dan mulkin kama karya na Spain Francisco Franco ya aike da bataliya biyu na Legion Mutanen Espanya, ƙwararrun sojojin Spain, zuwa El Aaiún a Saguia el-Hamra a watan Yuni.

english_source: On 21 November, Spanish intelligence in Ifni reported that attacks were imminent by Moroccans and local tribes operating out of Tafraout. Two days later, Spanish lines of communication were cut, and a force of 2,000 Moroccans stormed Spanish garrisons and armories in and around Ifni.
target1_text: A ranar 21 ga watan Nuwamba, jami'an leken asirin Spain a Ifni sun ba da rahoton cewa 'yan Moroko da ƙabilun yankin da ke aiki a Tafraout na gab da kaiwa hari. Bayan kwana biyu an yanke layukan sadarwa na ƙasar Spain, sannan dakaru 2,000 'yan kasar Morocco sun kai hari a sansanin sojojin Spain da ke cikin garin Ifni da kewaye.
target2_text: A ranar 21 ga Nuwamba, jami'an leken asirin Spain a Ifni sun ba da rahoton cewa 'yan Moroko da kabilun yankin da ke aiki a Tafraout na gab da kaiwa hari. Bayan kwana biyu an yanke layukan sadarwa na kasar Spain, sannan dakaru 2,000 'yan kasar Morocco sun kai hari a sansanin sojojin Spain da ke cikin garin Ifni da kewaye.

english_source: The outbreak of the First World War proved significant, with the withdrawal of troops for service in France compounded by the loss of more than 600 French killed at the Battle of El Herri. Lyautey reorganised his available forces into a "living barricade", consisting of outposts manned by his best troops protecting the perimeter of French territory with lower quality troops manning the rear-guard positions. Over the next four years the French retained most of their territory despite intelligence and financial support provided by the Central Powers to the Zaian Confederation and continual raids and skirmishes reducing scarce French manpower.
target1_text: Ɓarkewar yakin duniya na farko ya kasance mai matukar muhimmanci, tare da janye sojojin da aka yi don hidima a Faransa tare da asarar fiye da Faransawa 600 da aka kashe a yakin El Herri. Lyautey ya sake tsara rundunan da yake da su zuwa wani “shinge mai rai”, wanda ya kunshi sansanonin da sojojinsa mafi kyawu ke kula da su da ke kare kewayen ƙasar Faransa tare da dakaru masu ƙaramin karfi da ke riƙe da mukaman gadin baya. A cikin shekaru huɗu masu zuwa Faransawa sun ci gaba da riƙe mafi yawan yankunansu duk da bayanan sirri da tallafin kudi da gwamnatin tsakiya ta baiwa kungiyar ta Zaian da ci gaba da kai hare-hare da faɗace-faɗac na rage ƙarancin ma'aikatan Faransa.
target2_text: Barkewar yakin duniya na farko ya kasance mai matukar muhimmanci, tare da janye sojojin da aka yi don hidima a Faransa tare da asarar fiye da Faransawa 600 da aka kashe a yakin El Herri . Lyautey ya sake tsara rundunan da yake da su zuwa wani “shinge mai rai”, wanda ya kunshi sansanonin da sojojinsa mafi kyawu ke kula da su da ke kare kewayen kasar Faransa tare da dakaru masu karamin karfi da ke rike da mukaman gadin baya. A cikin shekaru hudu masu zuwa Faransawa sun ci gaba da rike mafi yawan yankunansu duk da bayanan sirri da tallafin kudi da gwamnatin tsakiya ta baiwa kungiyar ta Zaian da ci gaba da kai hare-hare da fadace-fadace na rage karancin ma'aikatan Faransa.

english_source: After the signing of the Armistice with Germany in November 1918, significant forces of tribesmen remained opposed to French rule. The French resumed their offensive in the Khénifra area in 1920, establishing a series of blockhouses to limit the Zaians' freedom of movement. They opened negotiations with Hammou's sons, persuading three of them, along with many of their followers, to submit to French rule. A split in the Zaian Confederation between those who supported submission and those still opposed led to infighting and the death of Hammou in Spring 1921. The French responded with a strong, three-pronged attack into the Middle Atlas that pacified the area. Some tribesmen, led by Moha ou Said, fled to the High Atlas and continued a guerrilla war against the French well into the 1930s.
target1_text: Bayan rattaba hannu kan Sojan Sama da Jamus a watan Nuwamba 1918, manyan dakarun kabilu sun kasance masu adawa da mulkin Faransa. Faransawa sun ci gaba da kai hare-hare a yankin Khénifra a cikin 1920, inda suka kafa jerin gidaje don iyakance 'yancin walwala na Zaiians. Sun bude tattaunawa da ’ya’yan Hammou, inda suka shawo kan uku daga cikinsu, tare da da yawa daga cikin mabiyansu, su mika wuya ga mulkin Faransa. Rarraba a cikin kungiyar ta Zaian tsakanin wadanda suka goyi bayan mika wuya da wadanda har yanzu suke adawa da shi ya haifar da fadace-fadace da kuma mutuwar Hammou a lokacin bazara na 1921. Faransawa sun mayar da martani da kakkausan kai hari mai matakai uku a cikin tsakiyar Atlas wanda ya daidaita yankin. Wasu 'yan kabilar, karkashin jagorancin Moha ou Said, sun gudu zuwa High Atlas kuma suka ci gaba da yakin basasa da Faransanci a cikin 1930s.
target2_text: Bayan rattaba hannu kan Sojan Sama da Jamus a watan Nuwamba 1918, manyan dakarun kabilu sun kasance masu adawa da mulkin Faransa. Faransawa sun ci gaba da kai hare-hare a yankin Khénifra a cikin t 1920, inda suka kafa jerin gidaje don iyakance 'yancin walwala na Zaiians. Sun buɗe tattaunawa da ’ya’yan Hammou, inda suka shawo kan uku daga cikinsu, tare da da yawa daga cikin mabiyansu, su miƙa wuya ga mulkin Faransa. Rarraba a cikin kungiyar ta Zaian tsakanin waɗanda suka goyi bayan mika wuya da waɗanda har yanzu suke adawa da shi ya haifar da faɗace-faɗace da kuma mutuwar Hammou a lokacin bazara na shekarar 1921. Faransawa sun mayar da martani da kakkausan kai hari mai matakai uku a cikin tsakiyar Atlas wanda ya ɗaiɗaita yankin. Wasu 'yan ƙabilar, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Moha ou Said, sun gudu zuwa High Atlas kuma suka ci gaba da yakin basasa da Faransa a cikin shekarar 1930s.

english_source: A popular idea among the public in France was to possess an unbroken stretch of territory from Tunis to the Atlantic Ocean, including expansion into the "Taza corridor" in the Moroccan interior.[7] Lyautey was in favour of this and advocated French occupation of the Middle Atlas mountains near Taza, through peaceful means where possible.[8] This French expansion into the Middle Atlas was strongly opposed by the "powerful Berber trinity" of Mouha ou Hammou Zayani, leader of the Zaian Confederation; Moha ou Said, leader of the Aït Ouirra; and Ali Amhaouch, a religious leader of the Darqawa variant of Islam prevalent in the region.[9][10]
target1_text: Shahararriyar ra'ayi tsakanin jama'a a Faransa shi ne mallakar wani yanki mai nisa daga Tunis zuwa Tekun Atlantika, gami da fadada hanyar " Taza corridor" a cikin cikin Moroccan. [1] Lyautey ya goyi bayan wannan kuma ya ba da shawarar mamaye tsaunukan Atlas na tsakiya kusa da Taza, ta hanyar lumana inda zai yiwu. [2] Wannan faɗaɗa Faransa zuwa tsakiyar Atlas ya kasance mai tsananin adawa da "mafi karfi na Berber Trinity" na Mouha ou Hammou Zayani, shugaban kungiyar Zaian; Moha ou Said, shugaban kungiyar Aït Ouirra; da Ali Amhaouch, shugaban addini na Darqawa bambancin Musulunci da ke da yawa a yankin. [3] [4]
target2_text: Shahararriyar ra'ayi tsakanin jama'a a Faransa shi ne mallakar wani yanki mai nisa daga Tunis zuwa Tekun Atlantika, gami da fadada hanyar " Taza corridor" a cikin cikin Moroccan. [1] Lyautey ya goyi bayan wannan kuma ya ba da shawarar mamaye tsaunukan Atlas na tsakiya kusa da Taza, ta hanyar lumana inda zai yiwu. [2] Wannan fadada Faransanci zuwa tsakiyar Atlas ya kasance mai tsananin adawa da "mafi karfi na Berber Trinity" na Mouha ou Hammou Zayani, shugaban kungiyar Zaian ; Moha ou Said, shugaban kungiyar Aït Ouirra ; da Ali Amhaouch, shugaban addini na Darqawa bambancin Musulunci da ke da yawa a yankin. [3] [4]

english_source: Lyautey's plans for taking Taza also extended to capturing Khénifra, Hammou's headquarters. He had been advised by his political officer, Maurice Le Glay that doing so would "finish him off definitively" and cut the Zaians off from support of other tribes.[1] The French outpost at nearby Kasbah Tadla had recently been attacked by Said and subsequent peace negotiations led by Lyautey's head of intelligence, Colonel Henri Simon, had achieved little.[19] As a result, Mangin was authorised to lead a retaliatory raid to Said's camp at El Ksiba but, despite inflicting heavy casualties, was forced to withdraw with the loss of 60 killed, 150 wounded and much equipment abandoned.[19] Having failed to make any impression on the Zaians through negotiation in May 1914, Lyautey authorised General Paul Prosper Henrys to take command of all French troops in the area and launch an attack on Taza and Khénifra.[3][4] Henrys captured Taza within a few days using units drawn from garrisons in Fez, Meknes, Rabat and Marrakesh and then turned his attention to Khénifra.[5][20]
target1_text: Shirye-shiryen Lyautey na ɗaukar Taza kuma ya ƙara zuwa kama Khénifra, hedkwatar Hammou. Jami’in siyasarsa, Maurice Le Glay, ya ba shi shawarar cewa yin hakan zai “kare shi da gaske” kuma ya yanke Za’awa daga goyon bayan wasu kabilu. [1] Kwanan nan Said ya kai wa sansanin Faransa hari a Kasbah Tadla, kuma tattaunawar zaman lafiya karkashin jagorancin shugaban leken asirin Lyautey, Kanar Henri Simon, bai cimma komai ba. [2] Sakamakon haka, an ba Mangin izinin jagorantar harin ramuwar gayya zuwa sansanin Said da ke El Ksiba amma, duk da cewa ya yi munanan raunuka, an tilasta masa janyewa tare da asarar rayuka 60, 150 da suka samu raunuka, an kuma yi watsi da kayan aiki da yawa. [2] Bayan da ya kasa yin wani ra'ayi a kan Zaians ta hanyar yin shawarwari a watan Mayu 1914, Lyautey ya ba Janar Paul Prosper Henrys izini ya jagoranci dukan sojojin Faransa a yankin da kuma kaddamar da hari a Taza da Khénifra. [3] [4] Henrys ya kama Taza a cikin 'yan kwanaki ta hanyar amfani da sassan da aka zana daga garrisons a Fez, Meknes, Rabat da Marrakesh sannan ya mai da hankalinsa ga Khénifra. [5] [6]

english_source: Ibas was born in Nko, Cross River State, South South Nigeria.[10] He enlisted into the Nigerian Defence Academy as a member of 26 Regular Course on 20 June 1979 and was commissioned sub-lieutenant on 1 January 1983. He began his primary education at Nko Primary School, Nko, in 1966 and completed at Big Qua Primary School, Calabar in 1971. He then proceeded to the Hope Waddell Training Institute, Calabar from 1972 to 1976. Between 1977 and 1979, he attended the School of Basic Studies Ogoja before proceeding to the Nigerian Defence Academy in 1979.
target1_text: An haifi Ibas a Nko, Jihar Cross River, Kudancin Kudancin Najeriya . [1] Ya shiga cikin Kwalejin Tsaro ta Najeriya a matsayin memba na 26 Regular Course a ranar 20 ga Yuni 1979 kuma an ba shi izini a ranar 1 ga Janairun 1983. Ya fara karatun firamare a makarantar firamare ta Nko, Nko, a shekarar 1966 kuma ya kammala a makarantar firimare ta Big Qua, Calabar a shekarar 1971. Daga nan sai ya ci gaba zuwa Cibiyar Horar da Hope Waddell, Calabar daga 1972 zuwa 1976. Tsakanin 1977 da 1979, ya halarci Makarantar Nazarin asali ta Ogoja kafin ya ci gaba zuwa Kwalejin Tsaro ta Najeriya a 1979.

english_source: The First Frontier War broke out in 1779 between Boer frontiersmen and the amaXhosa. In December 1779, an armed clash occurred, resulting from allegations of cattle theft by Xhosa people. In November 1780, the Cape governor, Baron van Plettenberg declared that the eastern border of the Cape colony was the entire length of the Great Fish river despite many amaXhosa polities being already established west of the river, and no negotiations involving this decision were made with them beforehand.[7] Van Plettenberg appointed Adreaan Van Jaarsveld to lead commandoes to force the Xhosa to move east of the river, if they were unresponsive to requests to do so. This led to multiple attacks by the commandoes to forcefully remove Xhosa polities out of the area. When the imiDange refused to move, Van Jaarsveld and his commandoes had their chief, Jalamba, agree to another meeting for discussions. During the meeting he scattered large amounts of tobacco around and let the Xhosa have it. While some were distracted picking up the tobacco, Van Jaarsveld and his gunmen proceeded to shoot at them leading to a death toll of anywhere from 100 to 200, including Jalamba.[8][7] Soon after this, the Van Jaarsveld commandoes began attacking and looting the cattle of multiple other chiefdoms in the Zuurveld which included the amaGwali, amaNtinde, and amaMbalu. A large amount of the Xhosa population west of the river became dispersed, and Van Jaarsveld disbanded his commandoes on July 19, 1781, feeling he had fulfilled his job of expelling the Xhosa although many of them were able to move back into the area soon after.[8][7]
target1_text: Yakin Farko na Farko ya ɓarke a cikin shekarar 1779 tsakanin Boer frontiersmen da amaXhosa. A cikin watan Disamba 1779, an yi artabu da makamai, sakamakon zargin satar shanu da mutanen Xhosa suka yi. A cikin watan Nuwamba 1780, gwamnan Cape, Baron van Plettenberg ya bayyana cewa iyakar gabas na yankin Cape shine tsayin babban kogin Kifi duk da yawancin amaXhosa da aka riga aka kafa a yammacin kogin, kuma babu wata tattaunawa da ta shafi wannan shawarar da aka yi da su tukuna. [1] Van Plettenberg ya naɗa Adreaan Van Jaarsveld ya jagoranci kwamandojin don tilastawa Xhosa matsawa gabas da kogin, idan ba su amsa buƙatun yin hakan ba. Wannan ya haifar da hare-hare da yawa daga kwamandojin don kawar da siyasar Xhosa da karfi daga yankin. Lokacin da imiDange ya ƙi motsawa, Van Jaarsveld da kwamandojinsa sun sa shugabansu, Jalamba, ya amince da wani taro don tattaunawa. A yayin taron ya watsar da taɓa da yawa kuma ya bar Xhosa ya samu. Yayin da wasu suka shagaltu da karɓar taba, Van Jaarsveld da ‘yan bindigarsa sun ci gaba da harbe su wanda ya yi sanadiyar mutuwar mutane 100 zuwa 200 ciki har da Jalamba. [2] [1] Ba da daɗewa ba bayan wannan, kwamandojin Van Jaarsveld suka fara kai hari tare da kwashe shanun wasu masarautu da yawa a cikin Zuurveld waɗanda suka haɗa da amaGwali, amaNtinde, da amaMbalu. Yawancin mutanen Xhosa da ke yammacin kogin sun watse, kuma Van Jaarsveld ya wargaza kwamandojinsa a ranar 19 ga watan Yuli, 1781, yana jin ya cika aikinsa na korar Xhosa ko da yake da yawa daga cikinsu sun sami damar komawa yankin ba da daɗewa ba. [2] [1]

english_source: The Wahehe War (1891–1898)[2][3] was a major engagement between the Hehe people of southern Tanzania, led by Chief Mkwawa, and Germany in colonial German East Africa. The Wahehe war began with a decisive Hehe victory at the Battle of Lugalo near Iringa in 1891, when Mkwawa's forces ambushed and destroyed a German column led by Emil von Zelewski. The Germans then conducted sustained military campaigns against the Hehe until they finally captured Mkwawa’s fortress in 1894. Mkwawa was able to continue a guerrilla resistance against the Germans until his death in 1898. The Wahehe War became a symbol of African resistance to colonial authority.
target1_text: Yaƙin Wahehe (1891-1898) [1] [2] ya kasance babban haɗin gwiwa tsakanin mutanen Hehe na kudancin Tanzaniya, wanda Cif Mkwawa ya jagoranta, da Jamus a Jamus ta Gabashin Afirka ta 'yan mulkin mallaka. Yakin Wahehe ya fara ne da gagarumin nasarar Hehe a yakin Lugalo kusa da Iringa a shekarar 1891, lokacin da sojojin Mkwawa suka yi kwanton ɓauna tare da lalata wani ruƙunin Jamus ƙarƙashin jagorancin Emil von Zelewski. Daga nan ne Jamusawa suka ci gaba da kai hare-hare na soji a kan Hehe har sai da suka kwace sansanin Mkwawa a shekarar 1894. Mkwawa ya iya ci gaba da gwagwarmaya da Jamusawa har zuwa rasuwarsa a shekara ta 1898. Yaƙin Wahehe ya zama alama ce ta juriyar Afirka ga ikon 'yan mulkin mallaka.

english_source: German colonial expansion was apparent conflict with the emerging power of the Hehe people who since the 1860's consolidated the highlands of the south under their chiefs Munyigumba Muyinga and Mkwawa. In military operations the Hehe were reaching into areas along the caravan routes and attacking groups that were associated with the colonial authority by means of treaties. As a result, the officials in the recently established center of administrative power in Dar es Salaam made the decision to use force and established a campaign of punishment against the Hehe.[4]
target1_text: Fadayda mulkin mallaka na Jamus ya kasance a fili karo na gaba da ikon mutanen Hehe wanda tun shekarun 1860 suka haɗe tsaunukan kudu ƙarƙashin sarakunansu Munyigumba Muyinga da Mkwawa. A cikin ayyukan soji Hehe na kai hare-hare zuwa yankunan da ke kan hanyoyin ayari da kai hari ga kungiyoyin da ke da alaka da 'yan mulkin mallaka ta hanyar yarjejeniyoyin. A sakamakon haka, jami'ai a cibiyar gudanarwar da aka kafa kwanan nan a Dar es Salaam sun yanke shawarar yin amfani da karfi tare da kafa yakin hukunta Hehe. [1]

A cikin ayyukan soji Hehe na kai hare-hare zuwa yankunan da ke kan hanyoyin ayari da kai hari ga kungiyoyin da ke da alaka da mulkin mallaka ta hanyar yarjejeniyoyin. english_source: On October 28, 1894, German troops, commanded by Colonel Freiherr Friedrich von Schele, attacked Chief Mkwawa's stronghold at Kalenga.[7] Although the fort was captured, Mkwawa escaped and launched a guerrilla campaign against the Germans. He continued this campaign until July 19, 1898, when he committed suicide at the Mlambalasi Rock Shelter to evade capture. He was buried near there. Mkwawa's brother Chambila was also courageous and fought with him to the end.[8][9]
target1_text: A ranar 28 ga Oktoba, 1894, sojojin Jamus, karkashin jagorancin Kanar Freiherr Friedrich von Schele, sun kai hari ga sansanin Cif Mkwawa a Kalenga. [1] Ko da yake an kame sansanin, amma Mkwawa ya tsere ya kaddamar da yakin neman zabe a kan Jamusawa. Ya ci gaba da wannan kamfen har zuwa ranar 19 ga Yuli, 1898, lokacin da ya kashe kansa a sansanin Dutsen Mlambalasi don gujewa kama shi. An binne shi kusa da wurin. Shi ma dan’uwan Mkwawa Chambila ya yi jajircewa, ya yi yaki da shi har karshe. [2] [3]

english_source: In July 1891, Emil von Zelewski commanded a battalion of German Schutztruppe troops from the East African coast and into Hehe territory, which he proceeded to destroy using a scorched earth policy that resulted in the destruction of many settlements.[5] On 17 August near Lugalo, Zelewski's men lacked reconnaissance and were ambushed by approximately 3,000 Hehe warriors under Chief Mkwawa. Within minutes, Zelewski and most of his men were dead, with only a few managing to escape. A memorial was later placed on the site.[6]
target1_text: A cikin watan Yulin 1891, Emil von Zelewski ya umarci bataliyar sojojin Jamus Schutztruppe daga gabar tekun gabashin Afirka da kuma yankin Hehe, wanda ya ci gaba da lalata shi ta hanyar amfani da wata ƙazamin ƙasƙanci wanda ya haifar da lalata ƙauyuka da yawa. [1] A ranar 17 ga Agusta kusa da Lugalo, mutanen Zelewski ba su da leken asiri kuma mayakan Hehe kusan 3,000 ne suka yi musu kwanton bauna a karkashin Cif Mkwawa . A cikin 'yan mintoci kaɗan, Zelewski da yawancin mutanensa sun mutu, wasu kaɗan ne kawai suka sami nasarar tserewa. Daga baya aka sanya abin tunawa a wurin. [2]

english_source: Following Basutoland's transformation into a British territory on 12 March 1868, it became the target of rapid westernization efforts by the Cape Colony administration. In 1879, the Cape Parliament extended the Peace Preservation Act to Basutoland, with the aim of disarming the Basuto people. The immense significance of guns in Basuto society, compounded with past grievances, resulted in a rebellion led by chiefs Lerotholi and Masopha, which erupted on 13 September 1880. Heavily outnumbered and stretched thin by the simultaneous outbreak of other revolts, the Cape Colonial Forces failed to achieve a decisive military victory.
target1_text: Bayan da Basutoland ya rikiɗe zuwa yankin Biritaniya a ranar 12 ga watan Maris 1868, ya zama abin da gwamnatin Cape Colony ta yi niyyar mayar da shi cikin gaggawa. A shekara ta 1879, majalisar dokokin Cape ta tsawaita dokar kiyaye zaman lafiya zuwa Basutoland, da nufin kwance damarar mutanen Basuto. Babban mahimmancin bindigogi a cikin al'ummar Basuto, tare da koke-koke na baya, ya haifar da tawaye ƙarƙashin jagorancin sarakuna Lerotholi da Masopha, wanda ya ɓarke a ranar 13 ga watan Satumba 1880. Da yawa sun fi yawa kuma sun miƙe ta hanyar fashewar wasu tawaye a lokaci guda, Sojojin mulkin mallaka na Cape sun ƙasa cimma gaggarumar nasarar soji.

Da yawa sun fi yawa kuma sun miƙe ta hanyar fashewar wasu tawaye a lokaci guda, Sojojin mulkin mallaka na Cape sun kasa cimma gaggarumar nasarar soji.

english_source: The ensuing military stalemate and the high cost of conducting the war in made it increasingly unpopular among Cape politicians. On 29 April 1881, High Commissioner for Southern Africa, Sir Hercules Robinson announced the peaceful settlement of the conflict. The Cape's subsequent efforts to enforce disarmament and re-establish the rule of law in Basutoland met with stiff resistance from Masopha and his supporters. Unable to control the Basuto, the Cape Parliament passed the Disannexation Act in September 1883. The Basuto Gun War represents a rare example of an African nation's military victory against a colonial power, whereby the Basuto were able to retain their guns. Under the terms of the Disannexation Act, Basutoland was transformed into a British High Commission Territory, and thus not later incorporated into the Union of South Africa.
target1_text: Rikicin soji da ya biyo baya da kuma kuɗin da ake kashewa wajen gudanar da yakin, ya sa ya zama bashi da farin jini a tsakanin 'yan siyasar Cape. A ranar 29 ga watan Afrilu 1881, Babban Kwamishinan Kudancin Afirka, Sir Hercules Robinson ya ba da sanarwar sasanta rikicin cikin lumana. Yunkurin da Cape ta yi a baya na tabbatar da kwance ɗamara da sake tabbatar da doka a Basutoland ya fuskanci turjiya daga Masopha da magoya bayansa. Ba za a iya sarrafa Basuto ba, Majalisar Cape Cape ta zartar da Dokar Dissannexation a watan Satumba 1883. Yakin Bindiga na Basuto yana wakiltar wani misali da ba kasafai ba na nasarar da sojojin ƙasar Afirka suka samu a kan 'yan mulkin mallaka, inda Basuto suka sami damar riƙe bindigoginsu. Ƙarƙashin sharuɗɗan Dokar Kashe Basutoland, ta rikiɗe zuwa Babban Babban Hukumar Biritaniya, don haka daga baya ba a haɗa shi cikin Tarayyar Afirka ta Kudu ba.

english_source: Following a prior defeat at Beerdhiga, the British regrouped their forces in the Horn of Africa under new leadership, focusing their efforts against Sayid Muhammad Abdullah Hassan, a figure they referred to as the "Mad Mullah." The British devised a plan to launch a three-pronged attack on the Daraawiish. The first front, from Hobyo, consisted of 5,296 soldiers, including British and Boer troops from South Africa, as well as Somali, Yao, and Sikh fighters. The second front moved from Berbera, passing through Buhodle, with a force of 3,745 soldiers, which included Somalis, Sudanese, Sikhs, and Yaos, alongside British Royal Engineers. The third front advanced from Jigjiga via Dhagahbur, consisting mostly of Ethiopian troops under British leadership. These three groups were supposed to converge at Agarweyne by mid-October 1903.[3]
target1_text: Bayan shan kaye da aka yi a Beerdhiga, Turawan mulkin mallaka sun sake hada rundunoninsu a Kahon Afirka karkashin sabon jagoranci, inda suka mai da hankali kan kokarinsu kan Sayyid Muhammad Abdullah Hassan, wani adadi da suka kira "Mad Mullah." Turawan ingila sun tsara wani shiri na kaddamar da hari ta fuskoki uku a kan Daraawiish. Gaban farko, daga Hobyo, ya ƙunshi sojoji 5,296, ciki har da sojojin Birtaniya da na Boer daga Afirka ta Kudu, da kuma mayakan Somaliya, da Yao, da na Sikh. Gaba na biyu ya taso daga Berbera, ya ratsa ta Buhodle, tare da dakaru 3,745, wadanda suka hada da Somaliya, Sudan, Sikhs, da Yaos, tare da Injiniyoyin Sarauta na Burtaniya. Gaba na uku ya ci gaba daga Jigajiga ta hanyar Dutsen, wanda ya kunshi yawancin sojojin Habasha karkashin jagorancin Birtaniya . Wadannan rukunoni guda uku yakamata su hadu a Agarweyne a tsakiyar Oktoba 1903. [1]

Turawan ingila sun tsara wani shiri na kaddamar da hari ta fuskoki uku a kan Daraawiish. Gaban farko, daga Hobyo, ya ƙunshi sojoji 5,296, ciki har da sojojin Birtaniya da na Boer daga Afirka ta Kudu, da kuma mayakan Somaliya, da Yao, da na Sikh. Gaba na biyu ya taso daga Berbera, ya ratsa ta Buhodle, tare da dakaru 3,745, waɗanda suka haɗa da Somaliya, Sudan, Sikhs, da Yaos, tare da Injiniyoyin Sarauta na Burtaniya. Gaba na uku ya ci gaba daga Jigajiga ta hanyar Dutsen, wanda ya kunshi yawancin sojojin Habasha ƙarƙashin jagorancin Birtaniya. Waɗannan ruƙunoni guda uku yakamata su haɗu a Agarweyne a tsakiyar watan Oktoba 1903. [1]

english_source: The Dervishes had prior knowledge of the approaching three columns of British troops and had already prepared for battle, while the British, unaware of this, intended to launch a surprise attack. On the afternoon of April 14th, the column from Hobyo arrived at the Geledi well, where they encountered a Dervish man with a water-carrying camel. When interrogated, he claimed, "I am not aware of any Dervishes here". They detained him, but he escaped at night and alerted the Dervishes about the British army’s strength, weapons, conversations, and overall situation. On April 15th, the British column reached Agaarweyne and set up a large defensive encampment, unaware that the Dervishes, led by Isman Boos, were preparing for a jihad to be launched at dawn. The Dervishes split their forces into two groups and attacked the British from four directions at first light, following a well-coordinated plan. The first Dervish forces fought until around 11:00 A.M. on April 16th, after which they were replaced by the second shift as planned. The fighting, fierce and continuous, lasted until late in the day. Meanwhile, the British government had coordinated efforts with Italy on the Hobyo front and Ethiopia on the Jigjiga front, as the colonial powers sought to crush the Dervish threat. However, the Dervishes, fully aware of the British maneuverers, had prepared meticulously, even deciding the type of horses to deploy during the heat of the day and the cooler hours of the morning.[4][5]
target1_text: Dervishes sun riga sun san ginshiƙai uku na sojojin Biritaniya da ke gabatowa kuma sun riga sun shirya yaƙi, yayin da Birtaniyya, ba su san da hakan ba, sun yi niyyar kai harin ba-zata. Da yammacin ranar 14 ga watan Afrilu, ginshiƙin Hobyo ya isa rijiyar Geledi, inda suka ci karo da wani Bature da wani raƙumi mai ɗauke da ruwa. Lokacin da aka yi masa tambayoyi, ya yi iƙirarin, "Ban san wani Dervishes a nan ba". Suka tsare shi, amma ya tsere da daddare, ya sanar da Derwish irin ƙarfin da sojojin Birtaniya suke da shi, da makamansu, da hirarrakinsu, da halin da suke ciki. A ranar 15 ga watan Afrilu, ruƙunin Birtaniya ya isa Agaarweyne, suka kafa wani babban sansanin tsaro, ba tare da sanin cewa Derwish, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Isman Boos, suna shirin yin jihadi da za a kaddamar da wayewar gari ba. Dervishes sun raba sojojinsu gida biyu, suka far wa Ingila daga wurare huɗu a farkon haske, suna bin tsari mai kyau. Sojojin Dervish na farko sun yi fafatawa har zuwa karfe 11:00 na safe a ranar 16 ga watan Afrilu, bayan da aka maye gurbinsu da sauyi na biyu kamar yadda aka tsara. Faɗan, mai tsanani da ci gaba, ya ci gaba da kasancewa har dare ya yi. A halin da ake ciki dai gwamnatin Burtaniya ta haɗa kai da Italiya a fagen daga Hobyo da Habasha a ɓangaren Jigaji, yayin da turawan mulkin mallaka suka nemi murkushe barazanar Derwish. Duk da haka, Dervishes, suna da cikakkiyar masaniya game da ma'aikatan Birtaniya, sun yi shiri sosai, har ma da yanke shawarar nau'in dawakai da za su yi amfani da su a lokacin zafi na rana da kuma lokacin sanyi na safe. [1] [2]
target2_text: Dervishes sun riga sun san ginshiƙai uku na sojojin Biritaniya da ke gabatowa kuma sun riga sun shirya yaƙi, yayin da Birtaniyya, ba su san da hakan ba, sun yi niyyar kai harin ba-zata. Da yammacin ranar 14 ga Afrilu, ginshiƙin Hobyo ya isa rijiyar Geledi, inda suka ci karo da wani Bature da wani raƙumi mai ɗauke da ruwa. Lokacin da aka yi masa tambayoyi, ya yi iƙirarin, "Ban san wani Dervishes a nan ba". Suka tsare shi, amma ya tsere da daddare, ya sanar da Derwish irin ƙarfin da sojojin Birtaniya suke da shi, da makamansu, da hirarrakinsu, da halin da suke ciki. A ranar 15 ga Afrilu, rukunin Birtaniya ya isa Agaarweyne, suka kafa wani babban sansanin tsaro, ba tare da sanin cewa Derwish, karkashin jagorancin Isman Boos, suna shirin yin jihadi da za a kaddamar da wayewar gari ba. Dervishes sun raba sojojinsu gida biyu, suka far wa Ingila daga wurare hudu a farkon haske, suna bin tsari mai kyau. Sojojin Dervish na farko sun yi fafatawa har zuwa karfe 11:00 na safe a ranar 16 ga Afrilu, bayan da aka maye gurbinsu da sauyi na biyu kamar yadda aka tsara. Fadan, mai tsanani da ci gaba, ya ci gaba da kasancewa har dare ya yi. A halin da ake ciki dai gwamnatin Burtaniya ta hada kai da Italiya a fagen daga Hobyo da Habasha a bangaren Jigaji, yayin da turawan mulkin mallaka suka nemi murkushe barazanar Derwish. Duk da haka, Dervishes, suna da cikakkiyar masaniya game da ma'aikatan Birtaniya, sun yi shiri sosai, har ma da yanke shawarar nau'in dawakai da za su yi amfani da su a lokacin zafi na rana da kuma lokacin sanyi na safe. [1] [2]

english_source: The Battle of Berea was a battle between British forces under Sir George Cathcart and Basuto-Taung forces under King Moshoeshoe I that took place on 20 December 1852. The battle began when British forces broke into three columns and crossed the Caledon River in southern Africa, with the goal of seizing Basuto cattle as a form of punishment for past Basuto cattle raiding.
target1_text: Yakin Berea yaki ne tsakanin sojojin Birtaniya karkashin Sir George Cathcart da Basuto - Taung sojojin karkashin Sarki Moshoeshoe I wanda ya faru a ranar 20 ga Disamba 1852. An fara yakin ne a lokacin da sojojin Birtaniya suka balle ginshikan uku suka tsallaka kogin Caledon da ke kudancin Afirka, da nufin kwace shanun Basuto a matsayin wani nau'i na ukuba kan hare-haren Basuto da suka wuce.
target2_text: Yakin Berea yaki ne tsakanin sojojin Birtaniya ƙarƙashin Sir George Cathcart da Basuto - Taung sojojin ƙarƙashin Sarki Moshoeshoe I wanda ya faru a ranar 20 ga watan Disamba 1852. An fara yakin ne a lokacin da sojojin Birtaniya suka balle ginshikan uku suka tsallaka kogin Caledon da ke kudancin Afirka, da nufin kwace shanun Basuto a matsayin wani nau'i na ukuba kan hare-haren Basuto da suka wuce.

english_source: During the early 19th century, a diverse group of Sotho, Nguni and Tswana speaking tribes settled in the Caledon River region in southern Africa. The latter two formed the minority of the population and were gradually assimilated by the culturally dominant Sotho. King Moshoeshoe I united the various Sotho speaking chieftainships into a single nation during a period of political turbulence known as Lifaqane. By approximately 1828, Moshoeshoe's act had transformed the denigratory exonym of Sotho into the name of the nascent Basuto nation.[1][2][3] In the region's African societies cattle raiding played a crucial societal role in increasing a chief's prestige. By stealing cattle from rival tribes and then redistributing it to his followers under the mafisa system, the chief retained its nominal ownership while strengthening his relationship with his subjects.[4]
target1_text: A farkon karni na 19, gungun kabilu daban-daban na Sotho, Nguni da Tswana sun zauna a yankin kogin Caledon a kudancin Afirka. Na biyun sun zama tsirarun jama'a kuma a hankali Sotho mai rinjaye a al'adu sun hade su. Sarki Moshoeshoe na I ya haɗa manyan sarakunan Sotho da ke magana a cikin al'umma guda a lokacin rikicin siyasa da aka sani da Lifaqane . A kusan 1828, aikin Moshoeshoe ya canza sunan Sotho mai wulakantacce zuwa sunan al'ummar Basuto . [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] A cikin al'ummomin Afirka na yankin, sace-sacen shanu ya taka muhimmiyar rawa wajen kara daukaka martabar sarki. Ta hanyar satar shanu daga kabilun da ke hamayya da juna sannan kuma a sake rabawa mabiyansa a karkashin tsarin mafisa, basaraken ya ci gaba da rike matsayinsa na suna tare da karfafa dangantakarsa da talakawansa. [ 4 ]
target2_text: A farkon ƙarni na 19, gungun ƙabilu daban-daban na Sotho, Nguni da Tswana sun zauna a yankin kogin Caledon a kudancin Afirka. Na biyun sun zama tsirarun jama'a kuma a hankali Sotho mai rinjaye a al'adu sun haɗe su. Sarki Moshoeshoe na I ya haɗa manyan sarakunan Sotho da ke magana a cikin al'umma guda a lokacin rikicin siyasa da aka sani da Lifaqane. A kusan shekarar 1828, aikin Moshoeshoe ya canza sunan Sotho wulaƙantacce zuwa sunan al'ummar Basuto. [ 1 ] [ 2 ] [ 3 ] A cikin al'ummomin Afirka na yankin, sace-sacen shanu ya taka muhimmiyar rawa wajen ƙara ɗaukaka martabar sarki. Ta hanyar satar shanu daga ƙabilun da ke hamayya da juna sannan kuma a sake rabawa mabiyansa a ƙarƙashin tsarin mafisa, basaraken ya ci gaba da riƙe matsayinsa na suna tare da karfafa dangantakarsa da talakawansa. [ 4 ]

english_source: The Battle of Erego (also known as Beerdhiga) occurred on October 6, 1902, in Hodayo, about 70 miles north of Galkacyo. The battle involved British colonial forces, led by Colonel Swayne, and Somali troops (known as Dervishes) under the command of Haji Muhammad Abdullah Hassan. The Dervishes won by ambushing the British forces.[6] The battle was an early conflict of the Somaliland campaign.
target1_text: Yakin Erego (wanda aka fi sani da Beerdhiga ) ya faru ne a ranar 6 ga Oktoba, 1902, a Hodayo, kimanin mil 70 daga arewacin Galkacyo . Yakin ya hada da sojojin mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya karkashin jagorancin Kanar Swayne da sojojin Somaliya (wanda aka fi sani da Dervishes ) karkashin jagorancin Haji Muhammad Abdullah Hassan . Derwishes sun ci nasara ta hanyar yi wa sojojin Ingila kwanton bauna. [1] Yakin ya kasance farkon rikicin yakin neman zaben Somaliland .
target2_text: Yakin Erego (wanda aka fi sani da Beerdhiga) ya faru ne a ranar 6 ga watan Oktoba, 1902, a Hodayo, kimanin mil 70 daga arewacin Galkacyo. Yakin ya haɗa da sojojin mulkin mallaka na Burtaniya ƙarƙashin jagorancin Kanar Swayne da sojojin Somaliya (wanda aka fi sani da Dervishes) ƙarƙashin jagorancin Haji Muhammad Abdullah Hassan. Derwishes sun ci nasara ta hanyar yi wa sojojin Ingila kwanton ɓauna. [1] Yakin ya kasance farkon rikicin yakin kamfen na Somaliland.

english_source: The British forces were on a mission to locate Hassan, who was known as "the Mad Mullah" for his resistance to colonial rule. This search led them to Erego, where they were ambushed by Hassan's forces.[7]
target1_text: Sojojin Birtaniyya na cikin wani aiki na neman gano Hassan wanda aka fi sani da "Mad Mullah " saboda tsayin daka da ya yi ga mulkin mallaka. Wannan bincike ya kai su Erego, inda sojojin Hassan suka yi musu kwanton bauna. [1]
target2_text: Sojojin Birtaniyya na cikin wani aiki na neman gano Hassan wanda aka fi sani da "Mad Mullah" saboda tsayin daka da ya yi ga 'yan mulkin mallakai. Wannan bincike ya kai su Erego, inda sojojin Hassan suka yi musu kwanton ɓauna. [1]

english_source: The Bizerte crisis (French: Crise de Bizerte; Arabic: أحداث بنزرت, romanized: ʾAḥdāth Bīzart) occurred in July 1961 when Tunisia imposed a blockade on the French naval base at Bizerte, Tunisia, hoping to force its evacuation. The crisis culminated in a three-day battle between French and Tunisian forces that left 630 Tunisians and 24 French dead.
target1_text: Rikicin Bizerte ya faru ne a cikin watan Yulin 1961 lokacin da Tunisiya ta ƙaƙabawa sansanin sojin ruwan Faransa da ke Bizerte, a ƙasar Tunisiya takunkumi, da fatan tilastawa ficewa daga ƙasar. Rikicin dai ya kawo karshe ne a faɗan da aka kwashe kwanaki uku ana gwabza tsakanin dakarun Faransa da na Tunisiya wanda ya yi sanadin mutuwar 'yan Tunisiya 630 da Faransawa 24.
target2_text: Rikicin Bizerte ( French ; Arabic ) ya faru ne a cikin watan Yulin 1961 lokacin da Tunisiya ta kakaba wa sansanin sojin ruwan Faransa da ke Bizerte, a kasar Tunisiya takunkumi, da fatan tilastawa ficewa daga kasar. Rikicin dai ya kawo karshe ne a fadan da aka kwashe kwanaki uku ana gwabza tsakanin dakarun Faransa da na Tunisiya wanda ya yi sanadin mutuwar 'yan Tunisiya 630 da Faransawa 24.

xcomet_error_spans_target2.text: ya kawo karshe ne a fadan

english_source: However, when the transport planes with the paratroopers landed on the airfield, Tunisian troops engaged them with targeted machine gun fire. In response, French jets supported by troops armed with 105 mm howitzers attacked the Tunisian roadblocks, destroying them completely. French tanks and armoured cars then rolled into Tunisian territory, and fired into the town of Ferryville, killing 27 soldiers and civilians. The following day, the French launched a full-scale invasion of the town of Bizerte. The Tunisians' few artillery posts were destroyed by rockets fired by French planes. Tanks and paratroopers penetrated into the city from the south, while marines stormed the harbour from landing craft. Three French cruisers were positioned offshore. Tunisian soldiers, paramilitaries,[3] and hastily organised civilian volunteers engaged the French in heavy street fighting, but were forced back by vastly superior French forces. The French overran the town on 23 July 1961.
target1_text: Sai dai a lokacin da jiragen saman jigilar kayayyaki tare da ma'aikatan suka sauka a filin jirgin saman, sojojin Tunisiya sun yi musu luguden wuta da bindiga. A martanin da aka mayar, jiragen Faransa da ke samun goyon bayan sojoji dauke da makamai 105 'Yan ta'addar mm sun kai hari kan shingayen hanyar Tunisiya, inda suka lalata su gaba daya. Tankunan Faransa da motoci masu sulke daga nan ne suka yi birgima cikin yankin Tunisiya, suka yi luguden wuta a cikin garin Ferryville, inda suka kashe sojoji 27 da fararen hula. Washegari ne Faransawa suka kai wani gagarumin farmaki a garin Bizerte. Rokokin da jiragen Faransa suka harbawa 'yan Tunisiya sun lalata wasu ƴan matsugunan bindigu. Tankuna da jami'an tsaro sun kutsa cikin birnin daga kudu, yayin da ma'aikatan ruwa suka mamaye tashar jiragen ruwa daga jiragen ruwa na sauka. An ajiye jiragen ruwa na Faransa guda uku a teku. Sojojin Tunisiya, ƴan sa-kai, [1] da masu aikin sa kai cikin gaggawar shirya farar hula sun tsunduma Faransa cikin mummunan fadan titi, amma manyan sojojin Faransa sun tilasta musu komawa baya. Faransa ta mamaye garin a ranar 23 ga Yuli 1961.

english_source: After Tunisia gained independence from France in 1956, France remained in control of the city and its naval base, a strategic port on the Mediterranean, which played an important part in French operations during the Algerian War. France had promised to negotiate the future of the base, but had so far refused to remove it. Tunisia was further infuriated upon learning that France planned to expand the airbase.
target1_text: Bayan da Tunisiya ta sami 'yancin kai daga Faransa a shekara ta 1956, Faransa ta ci gaba da rike birnin da sansanin sojojin ruwa, tashar jiragen ruwa mai mahimmanci a tekun Bahar Rum, wadda ta taka muhimmiyar rawa a ayyukan Faransa a lokacin yakin Aljeriya . Faransa ta yi alkawarin tattaunawa kan makomar sansanin, amma kawo yanzu ta ki cire shi. Tuni Tunisiya ta kara fusata da jin labarin cewa Faransa na shirin fadada sansanin sojin sama.
target2_text: Bayan da Tunisiya ta sami 'yancin kai daga Faransa a shekara ta 1956, Faransa ta ci gaba da riƙe birnin da sansanin sojojin ruwa, tashar jiragen ruwa mai mahimmanci a tekun Bahar Rum, wacce ta taka muhimmiyar rawa a ayyukan Faransa a lokacin yakin Aljeriya. Faransa ta yi alkawarin tattaunawa kan makomar sansanin, amma kawo yanzu ta ki cire shi. Tuni Tunisiya ta ƙara fusata da jin labarin cewa Faransa na shirin faɗaɗa sansanin sojin sama.

english_source: Initially the United Nations was unable to carry out any sort of substantial action against the French, which angered the Tunisian authorities.[4] The French finally handed Bizerte over on 15 October 1963, after the conclusion of the Algerian War.
target1_text: Da farko Majalisar Dinkin Duniya ta kasa aiwatar da wani gagarumin mataki kan Faransawa, lamarin da ya fusata mahukuntan Tunisiya. [1] A karshe Faransa ta mika Bizerte a ranar 15 ga Oktoban 1963, bayan kammala yakin Aljeriya.
target2_text: Da farko Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya ta ƙasa aiwatar da wani gagarumin mataki kan Faransawa, lamarin da ya fusata mahukuntan Tunisiya. [1] A ƙarshe Faransa ta miƙa Bizerte a ranar 15 ga watan Oktoban 1963, bayan kammala yakin Aljeriya.

english_source: The movement was founded in western Ethiopia, and included fighters such as the Shewan Ras[nb 1] Abebe Aregai,[citation needed] and a number of intellectuals who included the sons of Hakim Workneh Eshete and Heruy Welde Sellase, and Yilma Deressa.[5] Its chairman was Alemework Beyene, a veterinary surgeon educated in Britain. The organization had a constitution consisting of ten points, which included: asserting the supremacy of the political sphere over the military, injunctions against mistreating peasants and prisoners of war, forbidding its members from seeking exile and urging them to prefer death to capture by the enemy.[6]
target1_text: An kafa kungiyar ne a yammacin Habasha, kuma ta hada da mayaka irin su Shewan Ras [ nb 1 ] Abebe Aregai ,  da hazikai da dama wadanda suka hada da 'ya'yan Hakim Workneh Eshete da Heruy Welde Sellase, da Yilma Deressa . [1] Shugabanta shine Alemework Beyene, likitan likitan dabbobi da ya yi karatu a Burtaniya. Kungiyar dai tana da kundin tsarin mulki da ya kunshi abubuwa goma, wadanda suka hada da: tabbatar da fifikon fagen siyasa a kan sojoji, umarnin hana cin zalin manoma da fursunonin yaki, da hana mambobinta neman gudun hijira da kuma bukace su da su gwammace mutuwa maimakon makiya. [2]

[2]

english_source: The group was effectively disbanded following the surrender of the Ras Imru Haile Selassie 18 December 1936.[7] The majority of its members were killed by the Italians following the unsuccessful attempt on Rodolfo Graziani's life on 19 February 1937.[8] The few survivors included Alemework and Yilma.
target1_text: An wargaza kungiyar sosai bayan mika wuya na Ras Imru Haile Selassie a ranar 18 ga Disamba 1936. [1] Yawancin mambobinta Italiyawa ne suka kashe bayan yunkurin da Rodolfo Graziani ya yi bai yi nasara ba a ranar 19 ga Fabrairun 1937 . [2] Wadanda suka tsira sun hada da Alemework da Yilma.
target2_text: An wargaza kungiyar sosai bayan miƙa wuya na Ras Imru Haile Selassie a ranar 18 ga watan Disamba 1936. [1] Yawancin mambobinta Italiyawa ne suka kashe bayan yunkurin da Rodolfo Graziani ya yi bai yi nasara ba a ranar 19 ga watan Fabrairun 1937. [2] Waɗanda suka tsira sun haɗa da Alemework da Yilma.

english_source: The Black Lions convinced Ras Imru Haile Selassie to join them in the armed struggle since he was part of the dynamics that created the movement. Ras Imru was appointed by Emperor Haile Selassie as prince regent in his absence. Ras Imru was to reorganize and continue to resist the Italians. To do this, he fell back to Gore in southern Ethiopia. On 19 December 1936, after the Italians pinned him down on the north bank of the Gojeb River, Ras Imru surrendered. The Black Lions organization then collapsed, and many of its members were murdered.[9]
target1_text: Bakar Lions sun shawo kan Ras Imru Haile Selassie ya shiga cikin su a gwagwarmayar makami tun yana cikin sauye-sauyen da suka haifar da harkar. Sarkin sarakuna Haile Selassie ne ya nada Ras Imru a matsayin yarima mai jiran gado a lokacin da ba ya nan. Ras Imru zai sake tsarawa kuma ya ci gaba da adawa da Italiya. Don yin haka, ya koma Gore a kudancin Habasha. A ranar 19 ga Disamba, 1936, bayan da Italiyanci suka kama shi a arewacin gabar kogin Gojeb, Ras Imru ya mika wuya. Daga nan ne kungiyar Black Lions ta ruguje, kuma aka kashe da yawa daga cikin mambobinta. [1]
target2_text: Black Lions sun shawo kan Ras Imru Haile Selassie ya shiga cikin su a gwagwarmayar makami tun yana cikin sauye-sauyen da suka haifar da harkar. Sarkin sarakuna Haile Selassie ne ya naɗa Ras Imru a matsayin yarima mai jiran gado a lokacin da ba ya nan. Ras Imru zai sake tsarawa kuma ya ci gaba da adawa da Italiya. Don yin haka, ya koma Gore a kudancin Habasha. A ranar 19 ga watan Disamba, 1936, bayan da Italiya suka kama shi a arewacin gabar kogin Gojeb, Ras Imru ya miƙa wuya. Daga nan ne kungiyar Black Lions ta ruguje, kuma aka kashe da yawa daga cikin mambobinta. [1]

english_source: The Libyan Arab Force, also known as the Sanusi Army, consisting of five infantry battalions made up of volunteers, was established to aid the British war effort. With the exception of one military engagement near Benghazi, this force's role did not extend beyond support and gendarmerie duties.[1] It was initially known as the British Arab Force and was renamed the Cyrenaica Defence Force in March 1943.
target1_text: Dakarun Larabawa na Libya, wanda kuma aka fi sani da Sunusi Army, wanda ya kunshi bataliyoyin sojan ƙasa biyar waɗanda suka haɗa da masu aikin sa kai, an kafa su don taimakawa yakin na Burtaniya. Ban da wani aikin soja a kusa da Benghazi, aikin wannan rundunar bai wuce aikin tallafi da jandarmomi ba. [ 1 ] Da farko an san shi da Sojojin Larabawa na Burtaniya kuma an sake masa suna Rundunar Tsaro ta Cyrenaica a cikin watan Maris 1943.
target2_text: Dakarun Larabawa na Libya, wanda kuma aka fi sani da Sunusi Army, wanda ya kunshi bataliyoyin sojan kasa biyar wadanda suka hada da masu aikin sa kai, an kafa su don taimakawa yakin na Burtaniya. Ban da wani aikin soja a kusa da Benghazi, aikin wannan rundunar bai wuce aikin tallafi da jandarmomi ba. [ 1 ] Da farko an san shi da Sojojin Larabawa na Burtaniya kuma an sake masa suna Rundunar Tsaro ta Cyrenaica a cikin Maris 1943.

english_source: Following the outbreak of World War II in 1939, Idris of Libya supported the United Kingdom—which was now at war with Italy—in the hope of ridding his country of Italian occupation. He argued that even if the Italians were victorious, the situation for the Libyan people would be no different than before the war. Delegates from both the Cyrenaicans and Tripolitanians agreed that Idris should conclude agreements with the British that they would gain independence in return for support during the war.[1] Vladimir Peniakoff was commissioned as a second lieutenant and served in the Libyan Arab Force,[2] before creating a unit known as Popski's Private Army.
target1_text: Bayan barkewar yakin duniya na biyu a shekara ta 1939, Idris na Libya ya goyi bayan Burtaniya —wanda yanzu ke yaki da Italiya—da fatan kawar da kasarsa daga mamayar Italiya. Ya kara da cewa, ko da Italiyawa sun yi nasara, lamarin da al'ummar kasar Libya ke ciki ba zai sha bamban da kafin yakin. Wakilai daga duka mutanen Kireneka da na Tripoli sun amince cewa Idris ya kulla yarjejeniya da Birtaniya cewa za su sami 'yancin kai don samun goyon baya a lokacin yakin. [ 1 ] Vladimir Peniakoff an ba shi izini a matsayin mukaddashin na biyu kuma ya yi aiki a cikin Sojojin Larabawa na Libya, [1] kafin ƙirƙirar rukunin da aka sani da Sojoji masu zaman kansu na Popski .
target2_text: Bayan ɓarkewar yakin duniya na biyu a shekara ta 1939, Idris na Libya ya goyi bayan Burtaniya —wanda yanzu ke yaki da Italiya—da fatan kawar da ƙasar sa daga mamayar Italiya. Ya kara da cewa, ko da Italiyawa sun yi nasara, lamarin da al'ummar ƙasar Libya ke ciki ba zai sha bamban da kafin yakin. Wakilai daga duka mutanen Kireneka da na Tripoli sun amince cewa Idris ya kulla yarjejeniya da Birtaniya cewa za su sami 'yancin kai don samun goyon baya a lokacin yakin. [ 1 ] Vladimir Peniakoff an ba shi izini a matsayin mukaddashin na biyu kuma ya yi aiki a cikin Sojojin Larabawa na Libya, [1] kafin ƙirƙirar ruƙunin da akafi sani da Sojoji masu zaman kansu na Popski.

english_source: The Malagasy Uprising (French: Insurrection malgache; Malagasy: Tolom-bahoaka tamin' ny 1947) was a Malagasy nationalist rebellion against French colonial rule in Madagascar, lasting from March 1947 to February 1949. Starting in late 1945, Madagascar's first French National Assembly deputies, Joseph Raseta, Joseph Ravoahangy [mg; ru] and Jacques Rabemananjara of the Mouvement démocratique de la rénovation malgache (MDRM) political party, led an effort to achieve independence for Madagascar through legal channels. The failure of this initiative and the harsh response it drew from the Socialist Ramadier administration radicalized elements of the Malagasy population, including leaders of several militant nationalist secret societies.[4]
target1_text: Tashin hankali na Malagasy Tawayen kishin ƙasa ne na Malagasy akan 'yan mulkin mallaka na Faransa a Madagascar, wanda ya kasance daga watan Maris 1947 zuwa watan Fabrairu 1949. Tun daga ƙarshen 1945, Mataimakin Majalisar Faransa na farko na Madagascar, Joseph Raseta, Joseph Ravoahangy [ mg ; ru ] da Jacques Rabemananjara na jam'iyyar siyasa ta Mouvement démocratique de la rénovation malgache (MDRM), sun jagoranci yunkurin samun 'yancin kai ga Madagascar ta hanyar doka. Rashin nasarar wannan shiri da kuma martani mai zafi da ya samu daga gwamnatin Socialist Ramadier ya janyo tsatsauran ra'ayi na al'ummar Malagasy, gami da shugabannin kungiyoyin asiri na 'yan kishin ƙasa da dama. [1]

[1]

english_source: On the evening of 29 March 1947, coordinated surprise attacks were launched by Malagasy nationalists, armed mainly with spears, against military bases and French-owned plantations in the eastern part of the island concentrated around Moramanga and Manakara. The nationalist cause was rapidly adopted in the south and spread to the central highlands and the capital of Antananarivo by the following month, with the number of Malagasy nationalist fighters estimated at over one million.[5]
target1_text: Da yammacin ranar 29 ga Maris, 1947, masu kishin kasar Malagasy, dauke da makamai, suka kaddamar da hare-haren ba-zata, a kan sansanonin soji da gonaki mallakar Faransa a gabashin tsibirin dake kewayen Moramanga da Manakara . An amince da manufar kishin kasa cikin sauri a kudanci kuma ta bazu zuwa tsakiyar tsaunuka da babban birnin Antananarivo a cikin wata mai zuwa, inda aka kiyasta adadin mayakan kishin kasa na Malagasy sama da miliyan daya. [1]
target2_text: Da yammacin ranar 29 ga watan Maris, 1947, masu kishin ƙasar Malagasy, ɗauke da makamai, suka kaddamar da hare-haren ba-zata, a kan sansanonin soji da gonakin 'yan mulkin mallakar Faransa a gabashin tsibirin dake kewayen Moramanga da Manakara. An amince da manufar kishin ƙasa cikin sauri a kudanci kuma ta bazu zuwa tsakiyar tsaunuka da babban birnin Antananarivo a cikin wata mai zuwa, inda aka kiyasta adadin mayakan kishin ƙasa na Malagasy sama da miliyan ɗaya. [1]

english_source: By May 1947, the French began to counter the nationalists. The French tripled the number of troops on the island to 18,000, primarily by transferring soldiers from French colonies elsewhere in Africa. The colonial authorities sought to fight on the physical and psychological fronts and engaged in a variety of terror tactics designed to demoralize the population. The French military force carried out mass execution, torture, war rape, torching of entire villages, collective punishment and other atrocities such as throwing live Malagasy prisoners out of airplanes (death flights).
target1_text: A watan Mayun 1947, Faransawa sun fara yaƙi da masu kishin ƙasa. Faransawa sun ninka adadin dakaru a tsibirin har sau uku zuwa 18,000, musamman ta hanyar tura sojoji daga ƙasashen da Faransa ta yi wa mulkin mallaka a wasu wurare a Afirka. Hukumomin mulkin mallaka sun nemi yin yaki ta fuskar zahiri da tunani tare da shiga dabaru iri-iri na ta'addanci da aka tsara don kashe mutane. Sojojin Faransa sun aiwatar da hukuncin kisa da yawa, azabtarwa, fyaɗen yaki, kona daukacin ƙauyuka, azabtar da jama'a da sauran ta'addanci kamar jefa fursunonin Malagasy daga cikin jiragen sama (jirgin mutuwa).
target2_text: A watan Mayun 1947, Faransawa sun fara yaƙi da masu kishin ƙasa. Faransawa sun ninka adadin dakaru a tsibirin har sau uku zuwa 18,000, musamman ta hanyar tura sojoji daga kasashen da Faransa ta yi wa mulkin mallaka a wasu wurare a Afirka. Hukumomin mulkin mallaka sun nemi yin yaki ta fuskar zahiri da tunani tare da shiga dabaru iri-iri na ta'addanci da aka tsara don kashe mutane. Sojojin Faransa sun aiwatar da hukuncin kisa da yawa, azabtarwa, fyaden yaki, kona daukacin kauyuka, azabtar da jama'a da sauran ta'addanci kamar jefa fursunonin Malagasy daga cikin jiragen sama ( jirgin mutuwa ).

english_source: The violent repression of the nationalist insurgency left deep scars in Malagasy society. A generation of the managerial class was wiped out, creating challenges for the country when it achieved independence in 1960. Madagascar's first three deputies were arrested, tortured and kept in prison until they were given amnesty in 1958. Another leader who survived the conflict, Monja Jaona, was also jailed for nine years and then founded the Madagascar for the Malagasy Party (MONIMA), which has had considerable influence on Malagasy politics. France classified most documents related to the Uprising, and the French government maintained silence on the subject until French president Jacques Chirac termed it "unacceptable" during an official visit to Madagascar in 2005. Several Malagasy directors have set films in the period of the Uprising. In 1967, the Malagasy government declared 29 March an annual holiday, and in 2012, a museum dedicated to the Uprising was inaugurated in Moramanga.
target1_text: Mummunan danniya da 'yan tawaye masu kishin ƙasa suka yi ya bar taɓo sosai a cikin al'ummar Malagasy. An shafe tsararraki na masu mulki, wanda ya haifar da ƙalubale ga ƙasar lokacin da ta sami 'yancin kai a shekarar 1960. An kama mataimakan Madagascar guda uku na farko, an azabtar da su tare da tsare su a kurkuku har sai da aka yi musu afuwa a shekarar 1958. Wani shugaban da ya tsira daga rikicin, Monja Jaona, shi ma an ɗaure shi na tsawon shekaru tara sannan ya kafa jam'iyyar Madagascar ta Jam'iyyar Malagasy (MONIMA), wacce ta yi tasiri sosai a siyasar Malagasy. Faransa ta ware mafi yawan takardu masu alaka da tashe tashen hankula, kuma gwamnatin Faransa ta yi shiru kan batun har sai da shugaban Faransa Jacques Chirac ya ce ba za a amince da shi ba a wata ziyarar aiki da ya kai Madagascar a shekara ta 2005. Wasu daraktocin Malagasy da dama sun shirya fina-finai a lokacin tashin hankali. A cikin shekarar 1967, gwamnatin Malagasy ta ayyana ranar 29 ga watan Maris a matsayin hutun shekara, kuma a cikin shekarar 2012, an buɗe gidan kayan gargajiya da aka sadaukar don tayar da hankali a Moramanga.
target2_text: Mummunan danniya da 'yan tawaye masu kishin kasa suka yi ya bar tabo sosai a cikin al'ummar Malagasy. An shafe tsararraki na masu mulki, wanda ya haifar da kalubale ga kasar lokacin da ta sami 'yancin kai a 1960. An kama mataimakan Madagascar guda uku na farko, an azabtar da su tare da tsare su a kurkuku har sai da aka yi musu afuwa a shekarar 1958. Wani shugaban da ya tsira daga rikicin, Monja Jaona, shi ma an daure shi na tsawon shekaru tara sannan ya kafa jam'iyyar Madagascar ta Jam'iyyar Malagasy (MONIMA), wacce ta yi tasiri sosai a siyasar Malagasy. Faransa ta ware mafi yawan takardu masu alaka da tashe tashen hankula, kuma gwamnatin Faransa ta yi shiru kan batun har sai da shugaban Faransa Jacques Chirac ya ce ba za a amince da shi ba a wata ziyarar aiki da ya kai Madagascar a shekara ta 2005. Wasu daraktocin Malagasy da dama sun shirya fina-finai a lokacin tashin hankali. A cikin 1967, gwamnatin Malagasy ta ayyana ranar 29 ga Maris a matsayin hutun shekara, kuma a cikin 2012, an buɗe gidan kayan gargajiya da aka sadaukar don tayar da hankali a Moramanga.

english_source: By the close of the 19th century, Madagascar was largely under the control of the Kingdom of Imerina, with its royal palaces at its capital in Antananarivo. Although the kingdom had existed since the early 16th century, it expanded its control beyond its traditional borders in the 1820s under King Radama I, who the British government officially recognized as the sovereign over the entire island of Madagascar. After several failed attempts to impose its authority over the island, France used military force to capture the royal palace in September 1894 and exiled Prime Minister Rainilaiarivony upon officially colonizing the island in February 1895. Queen Ranavalona III was allowed to remain as a figurehead until the emergence of a popular uprising, termed the Menalamba rebellion, for which the queen was held responsible. The rebellion was harshly crushed, and the queen was exiled in 1897.[7][8]
target1_text: A ƙarshen ƙarni na 19, Madagascar tana ƙarƙashin ikon Masarautar Imerina, tare da manyan gidajen sarauta a babban birninta a Antananarivo. Duk da cewa Masarautar ta wanzu tun farkon ƙarni na 16, amma ta faɗaɗa ikonta fiye da iyakokinta na gargajiya a cikin shekarar 1820s ƙarƙashin Sarki Radama I, wanda gwamnatin Burtaniya ta amince da shi a matsayin mai mulki a kan ɗaukacin tsibirin Madagascar. Bayan da aka yi yunƙuri da yawa na ƙaddamar da ikonta a kan tsibirin, Faransa ta yi amfani da ƙarfin soji don kame gidan sarauta a watan Satumba na 1894 kuma ta kori Firayim Minista Rainilaiarivony a kan mulkin mallaka a hukumance a watan Fabrairun 1895. An bar Sarauniya Ranavalona III ta ci gaba da kasancewa a matsayin jagora har zuwa ɓullar wani boren jama'a, wanda ake kira tawayen Menalamba, wanda Sarauniyar ke da alhakinsa. An murkushe tawayen da kakkausar murya, kuma an kai sarauniyar gudun hijira a shekara ta 1897. [ 7 ] [ 8 ]
target2_text: A ƙarshen karni na 19, Madagascar tana ƙarƙashin ikon Masarautar Imerina, tare da manyan gidajen sarauta a babban birninta a Antananarivo . Duk da cewa Masarautar ta wanzu tun farkon karni na 16, amma ta fadada ikonta fiye da iyakokinta na gargajiya a cikin 1820s karkashin Sarki Radama I, wanda gwamnatin Burtaniya ta amince da shi a matsayin mai mulki a kan daukacin tsibirin Madagascar. Bayan da aka yi yunƙuri da yawa na ƙaddamar da ikonta a kan tsibirin, Faransa ta yi amfani da ƙarfin soji don kame gidan sarauta a watan Satumba na 1894 kuma ta kori Firayim Minista Rainilaiarivony a kan mulkin mallaka a hukumance a watan Fabrairun 1895. An bar Sarauniya Ranavalona III ta ci gaba da kasancewa a matsayin jagora har zuwa bullar wani boren jama'a, wanda ake kira tawayen Menalamba, wanda Sarauniyar ke da alhakinsa. An murkushe tawayen da kakkausar murya, kuma an kai sarauniyar gudun hijira a shekara ta 1897. [ 7 ] [ 8 ]

english_source: The Menalamba rebellion was only the first manifestation of ongoing opposition to French rule that occasionally erupted in violent clashes between the Malagasy and the colonial authorities in Madagascar. Secret nationalist societies began to form in the 1910s. Conscription of Malagasy soldiers to fight for France in World War I strengthened resentment of foreign rule, and in the interwar period these nationalist organizations proliferated. Germany's defeat of the French army and occupation of France in 1940, the imposition of a Vichy regime in Madagascar and the subsequent capture of the island by the British in 1942 further tarnished the colonial government's image. Popular anger was especially aroused by its policies of forced labor in lieu of taxes, involuntary conscription into the army to fight in World War II, and the required contribution of large quantities of rice per head annually.[1]
target1_text: Tawayen Menalamba ita ce farkon bayyanar adawar da ake ci gaba da yi wa mulkin Faransa wanda a wasu lokuta yakan barke a tashin hankali tsakanin Malagasy da hukumomin mulkin mallaka a Madagascar. Ƙungiyoyin masu kishin ƙasa na sirri sun fara samuwa a cikin 1910s. Dakatar da sojojin Malagasy don yaƙar Faransa a Yaƙin Duniya na ɗaya ya ƙarfafa ɓacin ran mulkin ƙasashen waje, kuma a lokacin tsaka-tsakin waɗannan ƙungiyoyin masu kishin ƙasa sun yaɗu. Kashin da Jamus ta yi wa sojojin Faransa da mamayar Faransa a shekarar 1940, da kafa gwamnatin Vichy a Madagascar da kuma kwace tsibirin da turawan Ingila suka yi a shekarar 1942 ya kara bata sunan gwamnatin mulkin mallaka. Babban hasashe ya taso musamman saboda manufofinta na aikin tilastawa maimakon haraji, shiga aikin soja ba tare da son rai ba don yaƙi a yakin duniya na biyu, da kuma gudummawar da ake buƙata na yawan shinkafa kowace shekara. [1]

Ƙungiyoyin masu kishin ƙasa na sirri sun fara samuwa a cikin shekarar 1910s. Kashin da Jamus ta yi wa sojojin Faransa da mamayar Faransa a shekarar 1940, da kafa gwamnatin Vichy a Madagascar da kuma kwace tsibirin da turawan Ingila suka yi a shekarar 1942 ya kara ɓata sunan gwamnatin mulkin mallaka. [1]

english_source: Following the end of the Second World War, several key Malagasy nationalist leaders attempted to achieve independence for Madagascar through legal means.[12] At the first post-war constituent assembly convened in Paris in November 1945 to draft the constitution of the French Fourth Republic, Madagascar was represented by two doctors named Joseph Raseta and Joseph Ravoahangy. Together with future writer Jacques Rabemananjara, in early 1946 they formed the Mouvement démocratique de la rénovation malgache (MDRM) political party, whose platform was built on national independence from France.[1]
target1_text: Bayan karshen yakin duniya na biyu, wasu manyan jagororin kishin kasa na Malagasy da dama sun yi yunkurin samun 'yancin kai ga Madagascar ta hanyar doka. [ 12 ] A babban taro na farko bayan yaƙin da aka yi a birnin Paris a watan Nuwamba 1945 don tsara kundin tsarin mulkin jamhuriya ta huɗu ta Faransa, likitoci biyu masu suna Joseph Raseta da Joseph Ravoahangy ne suka wakilci Madagascar. Tare da marubucin nan gaba Jacques Rabemananjara, a farkon 1946 sun kafa jam'iyyar siyasa ta Mouvement démocratique de la rénovation malgache (MDRM), wadda aka gina dandalinta akan 'yancin kai na kasa daga Faransa. [1]
target2_text: Bayan ƙarshen yakin duniya na biyu, wasu manyan jagororin kishin ƙasa na Malagasy da dama sun yi yunkurin samun 'yancin kai ga Madagascar ta hanyar doka. [ 12 ] A babban taro na farko bayan yaƙin da aka yi a birnin Paris a watan Nuwamba 1945 don tsara kundin tsarin mulkin jamhuriya ta huɗu ta Faransa, likitoci biyu masu suna Joseph Raseta da Joseph Ravoahangy ne suka wakilci Madagascar. Tare da marubucin nan gaba Jacques Rabemananjara, a farkon shekara ta 1946 sun kafa jam'iyyar siyasa ta Mouvement démocratique de la rénovation malgache (MDRM), wadda aka gina dandalinta akan 'yancin kai na ƙasa daga Faransa. [1]

english_source: In the aftermath of Samaya, some of the leaders of Bamako began making overtures to Toure. The French, eager to possess this key strategic town on the Niger, rushed a force to establish a fort there on February 1, 1883.[1]: 76  Kebe Brema, Samori's brother, led a force to Bamako to lure the French out of their defenses. They fought two battles at Woyo Wayanko creek in early April, with Kebe Brema winning the first but eventually being forced to retreat.[4]
target1_text: Bayan Samaya, wasu daga cikin shugabannin Bamako sun fara zagayawa zuwa Toure. Faransawa, suna son mallakar wannan muhimmin gari mai mahimmanci a Nijar, sun garzaya da wata runduna don kafa katanga a can ranar 1 ga Fabrairu, 1883. [1] : 76 Kebe Brema, dan uwan Samori, ya jagoranci wata rundunar soji zuwa Bamako domin kwato Faransawa daga kariyar da suke yi. Sun gwabza fada biyu a kogin Woyo Wayanko a farkon watan Afrilu, inda Kebe Brema ya yi nasara a karon farko amma daga karshe aka tilasta masa ja da baya. [2]
target2_text: Bayan Samaya, wasu daga cikin shugabannin Bamako sun fara zagayawa zuwa Toure. Faransawa, suna son mallakar wannan muhimmin gari mai mahimmanci a Nijar, sun garzaya da wata runduna don kafa katanga a can ranar 1 ga watan Fabrairu, 1883. [1] : 76 Kebe Brema, ɗan uwan Samori, ya jagoranci wata rundunar soji zuwa Bamako domin kwato Faransawa daga kariyar da suke yi. Sun gwabza faɗa biyu a kogin Woyo Wayanko a farkon watan Afrilu, inda Kebe Brema ya yi nasara a karon farko amma daga karshe aka tilasta masa ja da baya. [2]

english_source: When an 1885 French expedition under Col. A. V. A. Combes attempted to seize the Buré gold fields by capturing Niagassola, Toure counter-attacked. Dividing his army into three mobile columns, he worked his way around the French lines of communication and quickly forced them to withdraw.[5] Already embroiled in conflict with Mahmadu Lamine and the Toucouleur Empire, the French were compelled to negotiate the Treaty of Kenieba Koura, signed on March 28, 1886. This pact recognized French hegemony over the left bank of the Niger as far upstream as Siguiri, and Samory's control of Bure and the Manding region.[2]: 80–1  As part of the agreement, Samory's eldest son and heir Djaoulen-Karamo was sent on a diplomatic/fact finding/goodwill mission to France.[6][4]
target1_text: Lokacin da wani balaguron faransa a shekara ta 1885 a ƙarƙashin Col. AVA Combes yayi ƙoƙarin kwace filayen gwal na Buré ta hanyar kama Niagassola, Toure ya kai hari. Ya raba sojojinsa zuwa ginshiƙan wayar hannu guda uku, ya yi aiki da hanyarsa ta hanyar sadarwa ta Faransa kuma cikin sauri ya tilasta musu janyewa. [1] Tuni aka yi rikici da Mahmadu Lamine da Daular Toucouleur, Faransawa sun tilastawa yin shawarwari kan yarjejeniyar Kenieba Koura, da aka sanya hannu a ranar 28 ga watan Maris, 1886. Wannan yarjejeniya ta amince da mulkin Faransa a kan bankin hagu na Nijar har zuwa Siguiri, da ikon Samory na Bure da yankin Manding. [2] : 80-1 A matsayin wani ɓangare na yarjejeniyar, an aika da babban ɗan Samory kuma magaji Djaoulen-Karamo zuwa aikin diflomasiya/gano gaskiya/fatan alheri zuwa Faransa. [3] [4]

Ya raba sojojinsa zuwa ginshiƙan wayar hannu guda uku, ya yi aiki da hanyarsa ta hanyar sadarwa ta Faransa kuma cikin sauri ya tilasta musu janyewa. [1] Tuni aka yi rikici da Mahmadu Lamine da Daular Toucouleur, Faransawa sun tilastawa yin shawarwari kan yarjejeniyar Kenieba Koura, da aka sanya hannu a ranar 28 ga Maris, 1886. Wannan yarjejeniya ta amince da mulkin Faransa a kan bankin hagu na Nijar har zuwa Siguiri, da ikon Samory na Bure da yankin Manding . english_source: Knowing this setback would prompt an aggressive British response, the French again sent Braulot, at the head of an armed column, to try to acquire Bouna by negotiation. Saranken Mori initially accepted.[1]: 117–9  But when Braulot arrived at Bouna, he was killed and his column destroyed outside the city on August 20, 1897, restarting the war between the French and Samory Toure.[8]
target1_text: Sanin wannan koma baya zai haifar da martani mai tsanani na Birtaniyya, Faransawa sun sake aika Braulot, a shugaban rukunin masu dauke da makamai, ya yi kokarin sayen Bouna ta hanyar shawarwari. Saranken Mori ya karɓa da farko. [1] : 117–9 Amma lokacin da Braulot ya isa Bouna, an kashe shi kuma aka lalata shi a wajen birnin a ranar 20 ga Agusta, 1897, inda aka sake fara yakin Faransa da Samory Toure. [2]

Saranken Mori ya karɓa da farko. [1] : 117–9 Amma lokacin da Braulot ya isa Bouna, an kashe shi kuma aka lalata shi a wajen birnin a ranar 20 ga watan Agusta, 1897, inda aka sake fara yakin Faransa da Samory Toure. [2]

english_source: It all began around 8 a.m., when the insurgents reached Bou Jaad. By 8:30, groups of Beni Khirane entered the city by truck and horseback. Around 9 a.m., the Smaala, Bani Smir, and Beni Khirane tribes stormed the city.[7] Over 20,000 men attacked the city, similar to razzias, even attacking the hospital.[8] At 11 a.m., the 2nd Battalion of the 4th R.E.I was alerted to the atrocities in Oued Zem.[9] Armed with axes, sticks, stones, and rifles, Moroccans shot at and stoned the French gendarmes in Oued Zem. One of them, gendarme Soumagne, was fatally wounded.[4] For several hours, Lieutenant Bach and his men attempted to hold off the Smaala forces, both on foot and horseback, most armed with rifles, from the European quarter until reinforcements arrived. The gendarmerie on site reported between 50 and 75 Europeans killed (over 77 according to the Foreign Legion[9]).[1][10][11] Additionally, 19 security force members were killed.[9]

english_source: Among the leaders of the massacre was caïd Bel Hajj [al-Smaali], from the Smaala tribe and an influential caïd.[12] Also leading was chief Bendaoud ben al-Ghazwani al-Smiri from the Bani Smir, who led part of the massacre and killed five French citizens, fighting to the end and refusing to surrender.[13]
target1_text: Daga cikin jagororin kisan kiyashin har da caïd Bel Hajj [al-Smaali], dan kabilar Smaala kuma mai fada a ji . [2]

english_source: On August 30, 1955, a large portion of the massacre participants surrendered and requested aman (a traditional act of clemency), offering their submission in exchange for peace. Their plea was accepted, and they sacrificed 12 young cattle.[14]
target1_text: A ranar 30 ga Agusta, 1955, babban ɓangare na mahalarta kisan kiyashin sun mika wuya kuma suka nemi aman (aikin jin kai na al'ada), suna ba da biyayyarsu don musanya zaman lafiya. An karɓi roƙonsu, kuma suka yi hadaya da shanu 12. [1]

english_source: On August 20, 2023, for the 68th anniversary of the events, a group of 2,000 descendants of martyrs sent a letter regarding the crimes of August 19, 1955 to the President of the French Republic, Emmanuel Macron, but it went unanswered.[15]

english_source: Despite the Brussels Conference Act of 1890, which made it illegal to sell gun and ammunition to Africans, traders from both Germany and Portugal continued to smuggle in weapons, alcohol, ivory, and cattle into Ovamboland (the area made up of ethnic Ovambo). Ovambo leaders sought guns above all else in their dealings with merchants since they needed them for their raids. Due to decades of these illegal arms trades, many of the Ovambo kingdoms owned large amounts of guns and their military capacity was not to be underestimated. Almost every Ovambo owned a gun, and a revolt even broke out there a decade before. The German and Portuguese had tried to stop the trading of arms but were unable to do so. This all changed when Mandume rose to power in 1911. Mandume expelled all traders from his kingdom because of the colonial intrusion which threatened his sovereignty, while other Kingdoms were still welcoming to traders.[10]
target1_text: Duk da Dokar Taro na Brussels na shekarar 1890, wanda ya haramta sayar da bindigogi da harsasai ga 'yan Afirka, 'yan kasuwa daga Jamus da Portugal sun ci gaba da yin safarar makamai, barasa, hauren giwa, da shanu zuwa Ovamboland (yankin da ke da 'yan ƙabilar Ovambo). Shugabannin Ovambo sun nemi bindigogi fiye da komai a cikin mu'amalarsu da 'yan kasuwa tunda suna buƙatar su don kai farmaki. Saboda shekaru da dama da aka yi ana sayar da makamai ba bisa ka'ida ba, yawancin masarautun Ovambo sun mallaki bindigogi masu yawan gaske kuma ba za a raina karfinsu na soja ba. Kusan kowane Ovambo ya mallaki bindiga, kuma tawaye ma ya ɓarke a can shekaru goma da suka wuce. Jamusawa da Portuguese sun yi ƙoƙarin hana cinikin makamai amma sun kasa yin hakan. Wannan duk ya canza lokacin da Mandume ya hau mulki a shekarar 1911. Mandume ya kori dukkan ‘yan kasuwa daga masarautarsa saboda kutsen da Turawan mulkin mallaka suka yi masa wanda ke barazana ga mulkinsa, yayin da sauran masarautu ke maraba da ‘yan kasuwa. [ 10 ]

english_source: Mandume rejected the idea of Portuguese colonial rule and demanded to be on equal terms with the colonial rulers in their distant capitals. Mandume also sought close relations with the Germans despite them owning the southern half of his kingdom. He even as far as to describe the governor of German South West Africa, Theodor Seitz, as his "brother in Windhuk."[11]
target1_text: Mandume ya ki amincewa da ra'ayin 'yan mulkin mallaka na Portugal kuma ya buƙaci su kasance daidai da masu mulkin mallaka a manyan biranensu masu nisa. Mandume ya kuma nemi kusanci da Jamusawa duk da cewa sun mallaki rabin kudancin mulkinsa. Har ma ya kwatanta gwamnan Jamus ta Kudu maso Yammacin Afirka, Theodor Seitz, a matsayin "ɗan'uwansa a Windhuk." [ 11 ]

english_source: He is the only traditional chief in Zimbabwe to have been accorded the status of being a national hero, and he is buried at the National Heroes' Acre in Harare.[2]

english_source: The war started after the 1915 rainy season when a group of representatives from around a dozen villages gathered at Bona where they resolved to take up arms against the French occupiers.[3] This took place in the context of World War I and introduction of conscription for the French Army. There was also widespread optimism that the colonial government could be beaten at this moment of weakness. It went through various phases as the colonial army organised two suppression campaigns but initially failed in its purpose, in the face of fierce opposition and superior tactics. The Volta-Bani War is one of the most significant armed oppositions to colonial government anywhere in Africa. It was the main reason for the creation of the colony of Haute Volta (now Burkina Faso) after World War I, by splitting off seven districts from the large colony of Haut-Sénégal and Niger.[4]
target1_text: Yakin dai ya faro ne bayan damina ta shekarar 1915 inda wasu wakilai daga ƙauyuka kusan goma sha biyu suka taru a Bona inda suka kuduri aniyar ɗaukar makamai domin yakar 'yan mamaya na Faransa. [ 3 ] Wannan ya faru ne a yanayin yakin duniya na ɗaya da shigar da sojojin Faransa. An kuma yi hasashen cewa za a iya doke gwamnatin 'yan mulkin mallaka a wannan lokaci na rauni. An shiga matakai daban-daban yayin da sojojin 'yan mulkin mallaka suka shirya yakin murkushe su guda biyu amma da farko sun ƙasa cimma manufarsu, ta fuskar adawa mai tsanani da dabaru masu kyau. Yaƙin Volta-Bani na ɗaya daga cikin manyan masu adawa da gwamnatin 'yan mulkin mallaka a ko'ina cikin Afirka. Wannan shi ne babban dalilin da ya sa aka samar da mulkin mallaka na Haute Volta (yanzu Burkina Faso) bayan yakin duniya na ɗaya, ta hanyar raba gundumomi bakwai daga babban yankin Haut-Sénégal da Nijar. [ 4 ]
