english_source: Afterwards, Josina and other women combatants combined defensive roles in guarding supplies and facilities behind the lines of combat with community organizing roles in which they explained FRELIMO's history, goals, and purposes to the local liberated populations in the effort to win their moral and material support. This division of labor freed up additional men for direct military actions.
target1_text: Bayan haka, Josina da sauran mata masu fada a ji sun hada aikin tsaro wajen kula da kayayyaki da kayan aiki a bayan fagen fama tare da ayyukan tsara al'umma inda suka bayyana tarihin FRELIMO, manufofinsa, da manufofinsa ga al'ummar yankin da aka 'yantar da su a kokarinsu na samun goyon bayansu na dabi'a da abin duniya. Wannan rabon aiki ya 'yantar da ƙarin maza don ayyukan soja kai tsaye.
target2_text: Bayan haka, Josina da sauran mata masu faɗa a ji sun haɗa aikin tsaro wajen kula da kayayyaki da kayan aiki a bayan fagen fama tare da ayyukan tsara al'umma inda suka bayyana tarihin FRELIMO, manufofinsa, ga al'ummar yankin da aka 'yantar da su a kokarinsu na samun goyon bayansu na ɗabi'a da abin duniya. Wannan rabon aiki ya 'yantar da ƙarin maza don ayyukan soja kai tsaye.

english_source: In mid-1968, Josina was named a delegate to the Second FRELIMO Congress, where she was a strong advocate for the full inclusion of women within all aspects of the liberation struggle. She was then appointed head of the Women's Section in FRELIMO's Department of International Relations. In this position, she traveled periodically to international meetings on women's rights and the role of women in development where she uses examples of FRELIMO experiences to advocate for women's equal participation in all aspects of the development process. She was then 24 years old.
target1_text: A tsakiyar 1968, an nada Josina a matsayin wakiliyar FRELIMO Congress ta biyu, inda ta kasance mai ba da shawara ga cikakken shigar da mata a cikin kowane bangare na gwagwarmayar 'yanci. Daga nan aka nada ta shugabar sashin mata a sashen hulda da kasashen duniya na FRELIMO. A cikin wannan matsayi, ta yi tafiya lokaci-lokaci zuwa tarurrukan kasa da kasa game da yancin mata da kuma rawar da mata ke takawa wajen ci gaba inda ta yi amfani da misalan abubuwan da FRELIMO ta samu don ba da shawara ga mata su kasance daidai da su a kowane bangare na ci gaba. Tana da shekara 24 a lokacin.
target2_text: A tsakiyar shekarun 1968, an naɗa Josina a matsayin wakiliyar FRELIMO Congress ta biyu, inda ta kasance mai ba da shawara ga cikakken shigar da mata a cikin kowane ɓangare na gwagwarmayar 'yanci. Daga nan aka naɗa ta shugabar sashin mata a sashen hulɗa da ƙasashen duniya na FRELIMO. A cikin wannan matsayi, ta yi tafiya lokaci-lokaci zuwa tarurrukan ƙasa da ƙasa game da yancin mata da kuma rawar da mata ke takawa wajen ci gaba inda ta yi amfani da misalan abubuwan da FRELIMO ta samu don ba da shawara ga mata su kasance daidai da su a kowane ɓangare na ci gaba. Tana da shekara 24 a lokacin.

english_source: 1969 proved an eventful year for Josina. She was appointed head of FRELIMO's Department of Social Affairs where she actively develops child care and educational centers in northern Mozambique and advocates with local populations for the importance of sending girls to school. When FRELIMO President Eduardo Mondlane is assassinated in Tanzania by Portuguese agents, Josina moves in with his wife, Janet, to provide comfort and company. In May she marries Samora Machel at the Educational Center of Tunduru in southern Tanzania, a facility she had helped to develop. At the end of November, Josina and Samora's only child, named Samora Junior and called Samito, is born.
target1_text: A shekarar 1969 ta tabbatar da shekara mai ban mamaki ga Josina. An naɗa ta shugabar Sashen Harkokin Zamantakewa na FRELIMO inda ta himmatu wajen bunƙasa cibiyoyin kula da yara da ilimi a arewacin Mozambik tare da bayar da shawarwari tare da jama'ar yankin kan mahimmancin tura yara mata zuwa makaranta. Lokacin da wakilan Portugal suka kashe shugaban FRELIMO Eduardo Mondlane a Tanzaniya, Josina ta shiga tare da matarsa, Janet, don ba da ta'aziyya da kamfani. A watan Mayu ta auri Samora Machel a Cibiyar Ilimi ta Tunduru a kudancin Tanzaniya, wurin da ta taimaka wajen bunƙasa wa. A ƙarshen watan Nuwamba, an haifi Josina da Samora tilo, mai suna Samora Junior da ake kira Samito.
target2_text: 1969 ta tabbatar da shekara mai ban mamaki ga Josina. An nada ta shugabar Sashen Harkokin Zamantakewa na FRELIMO inda ta himmatu wajen bunkasa cibiyoyin kula da yara da ilimi a arewacin Mozambik tare da bayar da shawarwari tare da jama'ar yankin kan mahimmancin tura yara mata zuwa makaranta. Lokacin da wakilan Portugal suka kashe shugaban FRELIMO Eduardo Mondlane a Tanzaniya, Josina ya shiga tare da matarsa, Janet, don ba da ta'aziyya da kamfani. A watan Mayu ta auri Samora Machel a Cibiyar Ilimi ta Tunduru a kudancin Tanzaniya, wurin da ta taimaka wajen bunkasa. A ƙarshen Nuwamba, an haifi Josina da Samora tilo, mai suna Samora Junior da ake kira Samito.

english_source: In Dar es Salaam, Josina became seriously ill on April 5. She was taken to Muhimbili Hospital and died on April 7, 1971, at the age of 25. She was buried in Kinondoni Cemetery, where her uncle Mateus Muthemba, who was assassinated by Portuguese agents in 1968, is also interred.
target1_text: A Dar es Salaam, Josina ta kamu da rashin lafiya a ranar 5 ga watan Afrilu. An kai ta asibitin Muhimbili kuma ta rasu a ranar 7 ga watan Afrilu, 1971, tana da shekaru 25 a duniya. An binne ta a makabartar Kinondoni, inda aka shiga tsakanin kawunta Mateus Muthemba, wanda jami'an Portugal suka ƙashe a shekarar 1968.
target2_text: A Dar es Salaam, Josina ta kamu da rashin lafiya a ranar 5 ga Afrilu. An kai ta asibitin Muhimbili kuma ta rasu a ranar 7 ga Afrilu, 1971, tana da shekaru 25 a duniya. An binne ta a makabartar Kinondoni, inda aka shiga tsakanin kawunta Mateus Muthemba, wanda jami'an Portugal suka kashe a 1968.

english_source: FRELIMO opposed multi-party elections. The post-1974 Portuguese government handed over sole power to FRELIMO and Mozambique gained its independence on 25 June 1975. Machel and dos Santos took over as its first president and vice-president. Graça Machel was appointed as Minister of Education and Joaquim Chissano as Minister of Foreign Affairs. Uria Simango was arrested and forced to make a 20-page public confession on 12 May 1975 at the FRELIMO base in Nachingwea, recanting and requesting re-education. He was then obliged to read it aloud in front of thousands of FRELIMO fighters. Simango's confession includes claims, accusing colleagues of being agents of Portuguese secret services, and of involvement in Mondlane's murder. These "confessions" are no longer seen as credible, even among the present Mozambican leadership.
target1_text: FRELIMO ya yi adawa da zaɓen jam'iyyu da yawa. Bayan 1974 gwamnatin Portugal ta mika mulki ga FRELIMO ita kadai kuma Mozambik ta sami 'yencin kanta a ranar 25 ga Yuni 1975. Machel da dos Santos sun zama shugabanta na farko da mataimakin shugaban kasa. An nada Graça Machel a matsayin Ministan Ilimi da Joaquim Chissano a matsayin Ministan Harkokin Waje. An kama Uria Simango kuma an tilasta masa yin ikirari mai shafuka 20 na jama'a a ranar 12 ga Mayu 1975 a sansanin FRELIMO a Nachigwea, yana mai da martani da neman sake karatu. Daga nan sai ya zama dole ya karanta ta a bayyane a gaban dubban mayakan FRELIMO. Furucin Simango ya hada da da'awar, zargin abokan aikinsu da kasancewa wakilan hidimomin sirri na Portugal, da kuma hannu a kisan Mondlane. Wadannan "ikirari" ba a ganin su a matsayin abin dogaro, har ma a cikin shugabancin Mozambique na yanzu.
target2_text: FRELIMO ya yi adawa da zaɓen jam'iyyu da yawa. Bayan shekarar 1974 gwamnatin Portugal ta miƙa mulki ga FRELIMO ita kaɗai kuma Mozambik ta sami 'yancin kanta a ranar 25 ga watan Yuni 1975. Machel da dos Santos sun zama shugabanta na farko da mataimakin shugaban ƙasa. An naɗa Graça Machel a matsayin Ministan Ilimi da Joaquim Chissano a matsayin Ministan Harkokin Waje. An kama Uria Simango kuma an tilasta masa yin ikirari mai shafuka 20 na jama'a a ranar 12 ga watan Mayu 1975 a sansanin FRELIMO a Nachigwea, yana mai da martani da neman sake karatu. Daga nan sai ya zama dole ya karanta ta a bayyane a gaban dubban mayakan FRELIMO. Furucin Simango ya haɗa da da'awar, zargin abokan aikinsu da kasancewa wakilan hidimomin sirri na Portugal, da kuma hannu a kisan Mondlane. Waɗannan "ikirari" ba a ganin su a matsayin abin dogaro, har ma a cikin shugabancin Mozambique na yanzu.

english_source: Cristina Jeremias Tembe (died 24 June 2017) was a Mozambican independence activist and politician. In 1977 she was one of the first group of women elected to the People's Assembly.
target1_text: Cristina Jeremias Tembe (ya mutu 24 ga Yuni 2017) yar gwagwarmayar 'yancin kai ta Mozambique ce kuma 'yar siyasa. A shekarar 1977 ta kasance daya daga cikin rukunin mata na farko da aka zaba a Majalisar Jama'a .
target2_text: Cristina Jeremias Tembe (ya mutu 24 ga Yuni 2017) 'yar gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin kai ta Mozambique ce kuma 'yar siyasa. A shekarar 1977 ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin ruƙunin mata na farko da aka zaɓa a Majalisar Jama'a.

english_source: Ali Amhaouch was born in 1844 and became widely known as a religious figure, of the Darqawa sufi order, who commanded respect across Morocco and was one of the few people capable of bringing peace to warring tribes.[3][4] He made his own prophecies and considered the Jbel Toujjit mountain, the source of the Moulouya River, to be a sacred site.[5] Amhaouch supported the Ait Sukhman tribe against the rival Zaian Confederation in intermittent warfare lasting from 1877 to 1909.[6] Amhaouch was also a key backer of Si Mhand Laârbi, a member of the Alaouite dynasty, against Moroccan government forces in the 1880s.[7] Laârbi's men were able to defeat a force commanded by Moulay Srou, the uncle of Sultan Hassan I, in battle in 1888.[8]
target1_text: An haifi Ali Amhaouch a shekara ta 1844 kuma ya zama sananne a matsayin mai addini, na darikar Sufaye na Darqawa, wanda ya ba da umarnin girmamawa a duk fadin kasar Maroko kuma yana daya daga cikin mutane kalilan da ke iya samar da zaman lafiya ga kabilun da ke fada. [1] [2] Ya yi nasa annabce-annabce kuma ya ɗauki dutsen Jbel Toujjit, tushen kogin Moulouya, wuri mai tsarki. [3] Amhaouch ya goyi bayan kabilar Ait Sukhman a kan 'yan adawar Zaian Confederation a yakin da ya dauki tsawon lokaci daga 1877 zuwa 1909. [4] Amhaouch ya kasance babban mai goyon bayan Si Mhand Laârbi, memba na daular Alaouite, a kan sojojin gwamnatin Morocco a cikin 1880s. [5] Mutanen Laârbi sun sami nasarar fatattakar rundunar da Moulay Srou, kawun Sultan Hassan I, ya umarta a yaƙi a shekara ta 1888. [6]
target2_text: An haifi Ali Amhaouch a shekara ta 1844 kuma ya zama sananne a matsayin mai addini, na ɗarikar Sufaye na Darqawa, wanda ya ba da umarnin girmamawa a duk faɗin ƙasar Maroko kuma yana ɗaya daga cikin mutane kalilan da ke iya samar da zaman lafiya ga ƙabilun da ke faɗa. [1] [2] Ya yi nasa annabce-annabce kuma ya ɗauki dutsen Jbel Toujjit, tushen kogin Moulouya, wuri mai tsarki. [3] Amhaouch ya goyi bayan ƙabilar Ait Sukhman a kan 'yan adawar Zaian Confederation a yakin da ya ɗauki tsawon lokaci daga shekarun 1877 zuwa 1909. [4] Amhaouch ya kasance babban mai goyon bayan Si Mhand Laârbi, memba na daular Alaouite, a kan sojojin gwamnatin Morocco a cikin shekarar 1880s. [5] Mutanen Laârbi sun sami nasarar fatattakar rundunar da Moulay Srou, kawun Sultan Hassan I, ya umarta a yaƙi a shekara ta 1888. [6]

english_source: Following the declaration of the French protectorate over Morocco after the signing of the Treaty of Fes in 1912 French troops began occupying the inland portion of Morocco. Following the 1914 fall of Khenifra, he joined forces with his former enemy, Mouha ou Hammou Zayani (leader of the Zaian Confederation), and tribal leader Moha ou Said to form a "powerful Berber trinity" that contested the Zaian War against the French.[1][10] Amhaouch declared a defensive jihad against the French upon the outbreak of the First World War. This extended from the Dadès Gorges to the desert beyond the Anti-Atlas mountains and was part of a plan to exploit the withdrawal of French troops from Morocco for the defence of France.[11] Amhaouch's men were engaged and defeated by French columns commanded by Colonels Noël Garnier-Duplessix and Henri Claudel in late 1914.[12] Amhaouch himself died of natural causes in 1918.[13] Hammou and Said continued to fight the French and, though they lost the Zaian War in 1921, pacification of Morocco was not completed until 1934 - years after their deaths.[14]
target1_text: Bayan da Faransa ta ayyana kare martabar ƙasar Maroko bayan rattaba hannu kan yerjejeniyar Fes a shekara ta 1912 sojojin Faransa sun fara mamaye yankin na Moroko. Bayan faɗuwar Khenifra a shekara ta 1914, ya haɗa gwiwa da tsohon abokin gaba, Mouha ou Hammou Zayani (shugaban kungiyar Zayyaan), da kuma shugaban ƙabilar Moha ou Said don kafa "Triniti Berber" mai karfi wanda ya fafata da Yakin Zaian da Faransawa. [1] [2] Amhaouch ya ayyana jihad na kariya ga Faransawa a lokacin ɓarkewar yakin duniya na farko. Hakan dai ya taso ne daga kogin Dadès zuwa hamadar tsaunukan Anti-Atlas kuma wani bangare ne na wani shiri na amfani da janyewar sojojin Faransa daga Maroko domin kare Faransa. [3] Mutanen Amhaouch sun yi yaƙi da ginshiƙan Faransa waɗanda Colonels Noël Garnier-Duplessix da Henri Claudel suka umarta a ƙarshen shekarar 1914. [4] Amhaouch da kansa ya mutu saboda dalilai na halitta a cikin shekarar 1918. [5] Hammou da Said sun ci gaba da yakar Faransawa, kuma duk da cewa sun yi rashin nasara a yakin Zaian a shekarar 1921, ba a kammala sulhun da Maroko ba sai a shekarar 1934 - shekaru bayan rasuwarsu. [6]

Hakan dai ya taso ne daga kogin Dadès zuwa hamadar tsaunukan Anti-Atlas kuma wani bangare ne na wani shiri na amfani da janyewar sojojin Faransa daga Maroko domin kare Faransa. [3] Mutanen Amhaouch sun yi yaƙi da ginshiƙan Faransanci waɗanda Colonels Noël Garnier-Duplessix da Henri Claudel suka umarta a ƙarshen 1914. english_source: In the war against the Derg regime the GPLM would ally itself with the Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Democratic Front (EPRDF), joining the joint anti-Derg offensive in western Ethiopia in 1989.[1][10] However, the alliance had an uneasy start. The GPLM discourse on 'Highlanders' differed from the other ethno-nationalist movements, whose discourse focused specifically on Amhara domination.[3]
target1_text: A yakin da ake yi da gwamnatin Dergi jam'iyyar GPLM za ta hada kai da jam'iyyar People's Revolutionary Democratic Front (EPRDF) ta kasar Habasha, tare da shiga yakin da ake yi na yaki da Dergi a yammacin kasar Habasha a shekarar 1989. [1] [2] Koyaya, ƙawancen ya fara rashin jin daɗi. Jawabin GPLM akan 'Highlanders' ya sha bamban da sauran kungiyoyin 'yan kabilanci, wadanda jawabinsu ya mayar da hankali musamman kan mamayar Amhara. [3]
target2_text: A yakin da ake yi da gwamnatin Dergi jam'iyyar GPLM za ta hada kai da jam'iyyar People's Revolutionary Democratic Front (EPRDF) ta ƙasar Habasha, tare da shiga yakin da ake yi na yaki da Dergi a yammacin ƙasar Habasha a shekarar 1989. [1] [2] Koyaya, ƙawancen ya fara rashin jin daɗi. Jawabin GPLM akan 'Highlanders' ya sha bamban da sauran kungiyoyin 'yan ƙabilu, wadanda jawabinsu ya mayar da hankali musamman kan mamayar Amhara. [3]

english_source: On 25 September the WTRF seized control of an armoury and then proceeded to blockade various roads leading into Ghana's Volta Region. Aveyime and Mepe police stations were also attacked, freeing inmates as well as seizing weapons of the police, shooting and injuring the Divisional Police Commander, the seizure of Police pick-up vehicles amid the firing of gunshots. The rebels made off with at least 15 AK47 and four pump action guns at Aveyime Police station. Two more weapons were taken at Mepe Police Station. They also disarmed the reinforcement team, taking their weapons including the Police Commander's pistol.[1][5][6] In response to the attacks on the police stations a joint Military-Police Team, in conjunction with other security agencies deployed to the affected areas and succeeded in apprehending 31 members of the WTRF. Later that day fire exchanged between the WTRF and security agencies led to the death of one member of the WTRF and the injury to three others.[7]
target1_text: A ranar 25 ga Satumba WTRF ta kwace iko da wani ma'ajiyar makamai sannan ta ci gaba da toshe hanyoyin da ke shiga yankin Volta na Ghana. Hakazalika an kai hari a ofisoshin ‘yan sanda na Aveyime da Mepe, inda aka sako fursunonin tare da kwace makaman ‘yan sandan, harbi da raunata kwamandan ‘yan sandan shiyya, da kwace motocin ‘yan sanda da ke dauke da su a yayin da ake harbe-harbe. ‘Yan tawayen sun yi taho-mu-gama da akalla AK47 guda 15 da kuma bindigogi guda hudu a ofishin ‘yan sanda na Aveyime. An kama wasu makamai biyu a ofishin ‘yan sanda na Mepe. Har ila yau, sun kwance wa tawagar dakarun hadin gwiwa makamai, inda suka kwashe makamansu ciki har da bindigar kwamandan ‘yan sanda. [1] [2] [3] Dangane da harin da aka kai kan ofisoshin ‘yan sanda tawagar hadin gwiwa ta Sojoji da ‘yan sanda, tare da hadin gwiwar wasu jami’an tsaro da aka tura yankunan da abin ya shafa sun yi nasarar cafke mambobin WTRF 31. A wannan ranar ne aka yi musayar wuta tsakanin WTRF da jami’an tsaro, lamarin da ya yi sanadin mutuwar wani ma’aikacin WTRF da kuma jikkata wasu uku. [4]

english_source: After 29 September blockades were still set up and at least 82 people were arrested for being suspected WTRF members. The WTRF has also claimed to have 4,300 military men being trained in a nearby country. According to them, those troops will invade Western Togoland on 3 November[clarification needed] and join up with the guerrilla troops.[10]
target1_text: Bayan 29 ga watan Satumba har yanzu an kafa shingen shinge kuma an kama aƙalla mutane 82 da ake zargi da kasancewa membobin WTRF. Hukumar ta WTRF ta kuma yi ikirarin cewa tana da sojoji 4,300 da ake horar da su a wata ƙasa da ke kusa. A cewarsu, sojojin za su mamaye yammacin Togoland a ranar 3 ga watan Nuwamba  da kuma haɗa kai da sojojin ƴan daba. [1]
target2_text: Bayan 29 ga Satumba har yanzu an kafa shingen shinge kuma an kama aƙalla mutane 82 da ake zargi da kasancewa membobin WTRF. Hukumar ta WTRF ta kuma yi ikirarin cewa tana da sojoji 4,300 da ake horar da su a wata kasa da ke kusa. A cewarsu, sojojin za su mamaye yammacin Togoland a ranar 3 ga Nuwamba  da kuma haɗa kai da sojojin ƴan daba. [1]

english_source: The 2015 local authority election was won by the SWAPO party which gained three seats (326 votes). One seat each was won by the Congress of Democrats (CoD, 96 votes) and the Democratic Turnhalle Alliance (DTA, 36 votes).[10] The 2020 local authority election was won by the newly formed Landless People's Movement (LPM) which scored well all over Hardap. LPM gained 347 votes and three seats in the village council. SWAPO gained only one seat (147 votes), and the likewise new Independent Patriots for Change (IPC) won the remaining seat with 108 votes.[11]
target1_text: Zaben kananan hukumomi na 2015 jam'iyyar SWAPO ta lashe kujeru uku (kuri'u 326). Kujeru daya kowanne ya samu nasara a hannun Congress of Democrats (CoD, kuri'u 96) da Democratic Turnhalle Alliance (DTA, kuri'u 36). [1] Zaben kananan hukumomi na 2020 ya samu nasara ne a hannun sabuwar jam'iyyar LPM wacce ta samu nasara a duk fadin Hardap. LPM ya samu kuri'u 347 da kujeru uku a majalisar dokokin kauyen. SWAPO ta samu kujeru daya kacal (kuri’u 147), haka kuma sabuwar jam’iyyar masu fafutukar neman sauyi (IPC) ta lashe sauran kujera da kuri’u 108. [2]
target2_text: Zaɓen ƙananan hukumomi na shekarar 2015 jam'iyyar SWAPO ta lashe kujeru uku (kuri'u 326). Kujeru ɗaya kowanne ya samu nasara a hannun Congress of Democrats (CoD, kuri'u 96) da Democratic Turnhalle Alliance (DTA, kuri'u 36). [1] Zaɓen ƙananan hukumomi na shekarar 2020 ya samu nasara ne a hannun sabuwar jam'iyyar LPM wacce ta samu nasara a duk faɗin Hardap. LPM ya samu kuri'u 347 da kujeru uku a majalisar dokokin ƙauyen. SWAPO ta samu kujeru ɗaya kacal (kuri’u 147), haka kuma sabuwar jam’iyyar masu fafutukar neman sauyi (IPC) ta lashe sauran kujera da kuri’u 108. [2]

english_source: In September 1961, ELF head Hamid Idris Awate launched the Eritrean armed struggle for independence. During 1962, the federation was dissolved by the imperial government and Eritrea was formally annexed by the Ethiopian Empire. The dissolution of the federation resulted in many Eritreans supporting the ELF's armed struggle to achieve freedom. Ethiopian imperial army counterinsurgency campaigns against the ELF during the 1960s terrorized the civilian population, leading to greater local support for the insurgency and great international attention being brought to the war.[1] Following the Ethiopian Revolution in 1974, the Derg, led by Mengistu, abolished the Ethiopian Empire and established a Marxist-Leninist communist state. The Derg enjoyed support from the Soviet Union and other communist nations in fighting against the Eritreans. The ELF was also supported diplomatically and militarily by various countries. During the Eritrean Civil Wars, the Eritrean People's Liberation Front (EPLF) emerged as the primary liberation group in 1977, after expelling the ELF from Eritrea. The EPLF then took advantage of the Ogaden War to intensify its war of attrition against Ethiopia.
target1_text: A watan Satumban 1961, shugaban ELF Hamid Idris Awate ya kaddamar da gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin kai na Eritrea. A shekarar 1962, gwamnatin Masarautar ta rushe tarayyar, kuma daular Habasha ta mamaye kasar Eritrea a hukumance. Rushe tarayyar ya haifar da da yawa daga cikin 'yan Eritriya suna goyon bayan gwagwarmayar ELF don samun 'yanci. Yakin da sojojin Masarautar Habasha suka yi na yakar 'yan tawayen ELF a cikin shekarun 1960 sun tsoratar da fararen hula, wanda ya haifar da babban goyon bayan gida ga 'yan tawaye da kuma jawo hankalin duniya ga yakin. [1] Bayan juyin juya halin Habasha a shekarar 1974, Dergi karkashin jagorancin Mengistu ya kawar da daular Habasha tare da kafa daular gurguzu ta Marxist-Lenin . Dergi ya samu goyon bayan Tarayyar Soviet da sauran kasashen gurguzu wajen yakar 'yan Eritrea. ELF kuma ta sami goyon bayan diflomasiyya da ta hanyar soja daga kasashe daban-daban. A lokacin yakin basasa na Eritriya, EPLF ta fito a matsayin kungiyar 'yantar da kasa ta farko a 1977, bayan ta kori ELF daga Eritrea. Daga nan ne EPLF ta yi amfani da damar da aka yi a yakin Ogaden ta kara zafafa yakin da take yi da Habasha.

english_source: During the 1960s, the Eritrean independence struggle was led by the Eritrean Liberation Front (ELF) in resistance to Ethiopia's annexation of Eritrea long after Italian control ended. The Ethiopian Monarchy's actions against Muslims in the Eritrean government also contributed to the revolution.[46] At first, this group factionalized the liberation movement along ethnic and geographic lines. The initial four zonal commands of the ELF were all lowland areas and primarily Muslim. Few Christians joined the organization in the beginning, fearing Muslim domination.[47]
target1_text: A cikin shekarun 1960, gwagwarmayar samun 'yancin kai na Eritiriya ta kasance karkashin jagorancin kungiyar 'yantar da 'yancin kai ta Eritrea (ELF) a kokarin da take yi na kalubalantar mamayar da Habasha ta yi wa Eritrea tun bayan kare mulkin Italiya. Haka nan irin matakan da Masarautar Habasha ta dauka kan musulmi a gwamnatin Eritriya ya taimaka wajen juyin juya hali. [1] Da farko dai wannan kungiya ta sanya kungiyar ta ‘yantar da kungiyar ta hanyar kabilanci da yanki. Dokokin shiyya guda huɗu na farko na ELF duk yankunan ƙasa ne kuma musulmi. Kiristoci kadan ne suka shiga kungiyar tun farko, saboda tsoron mamayar musulmi. [2]

english_source: The war started on 1 September 1961 with the Battle of Adal, when Hamid Idris Awate and his companions engaged the occupying Ethiopian Army and police.[49] In 1962, Emperor Haile Selassie unilaterally dissolved the federation and the Eritrean parliament and annexed the country.[50][51]

[1] A shekarar 1962, Sarkin sarakuna Haile Selassie ya rusa tarayya da majalisar dokokin Eritiriya ba tare da izini ba tare da mamaye kasar. [2] [3]

english_source: The village of Besikdira hosted the only school within the entire Sekwina region, built in 1962 by Father Gebrekudos Meskel. The primary school was shut for 20 years after the war, but rebuilt by an Italian aid organisation in 2004.
target1_text: Kauyen Besikdira ya karbi bakuncin makaranta daya tilo a cikin dukkan yankin Sekwina, wanda Uba Gebrekudos Meskel ya gina a shekarar 1962. An rufe makarantar firamare na tsawon shekaru 20 bayan yakin, amma wata kungiyar agaji ta Italiya ce ta sake gina shi a shekarar 2004.
target2_text: Ƙauyen Besikdira ya karɓi bakuncin makaranta ɗaya tilo a cikin dukkan yankin Sekwina, wanda Uba Gebrekudos Meskel ya gina a shekarar 1962. An rufe makarantar firamare na tsawon shekaru 20 bayan yakin, amma wata kungiyar agaji ta Italiya ce ta sake gina ta a shekarar 2004.

english_source: The Dogon's spiritual leader is called hogon. According to Dogon cosmogony, there were four pairs of twins, four females and four males. They were ancestors of humans. Of these, Griaule M. (1970, p. 223) refer to the seventh as "The Master of Speech"—alluding to its "masculine" characteristics. In the Dogon tradition, the seventh ancestor's gift to humankind included weaving, music, dress and language.[26]
target1_text: Ana kiran jagoran ruhaniya Dogon hogon . A cewar Dogon cosmogony, akwai tagwaye guda hudu, mata hudu, maza hudu. Kakannin mutane ne. Daga cikin waɗannan, Griaule M. (1970, p. 223) koma na bakwai a matsayin "Mai Jagoran Magana" - yana magana da halayen "namiji". A al'adar Dogon, kyautar kakanni na bakwai ga bil'adama sun hada da saƙa, kiɗa, sutura da harshe.

(1970, p. 223) koma na bakwai a matsayin "Mai Jagoran Magana" - yana magana da halayen "namiji". A al'adar Dogon, kyautar kakanni na bakwai ga bil'adama sun hada da saƙa, kiɗa, sutura da harshe. [1]

english_source: The Ethiopian garrison was reorganized as Task Force 507, while the Ethiopian Air Force deployed their F-5Es in Mekelle and began using their air superiority to their advantage. This close air support inflicted heavy casualties on the forces of the ELF and EPLF who were conducting their first major joint operation. The failure of this joint operation would have significant consequences later in the War of Independence.[2]
target1_text: An sake tsara sojojin Habasha a matsayin Task Force 507, yayin da sojojin saman Habasha suka jibge F-5E a Mekelle kuma suka fara amfani da karfinsu na sama don amfanin su. Wannan tallafin na kurkusa ya yi sanadin jikkatar sojojin ELF da EPLF waɗanda ke gudanar da babban aikin haɗin gwiwa na farko. Rashin nasarar wannan aiki na haɗin gwiwa zai haifar da gagarumin sakamako daga baya a yakin neman'yancin kai. [1]
target2_text: An sake tsara sojojin Habasha a matsayin Task Force 507, yayin da sojojin saman Habasha suka jibge F-5E a Mekelle kuma suka fara amfani da karfinsu na sama don amfanin su. Wannan tallafin na kurkusa ya yi sanadin jikkatar sojojin ELF da EPLF wadanda ke gudanar da babban aikin hadin gwiwa na farko. Rashin nasarar wannan aiki na hadin gwiwa zai haifar da gagarumin sakamako daga baya a yakin 'yancin kai. [1]

english_source: The First Battle of Massawa took place from 1977 to 1978 in and around the coastal city of Massawa. The port was besieged by the Eritrean People's Liberation Front (EPLF) against the forces of Ethiopia and was one of two battles in and around the city.
target1_text: Yakin Massawa na farko ya faru ne daga shekarun 1977 zuwa 1978 a ciki da wajen birnin Massawa da ke gaɓar teku. Rundunar ‘yan tawayen ƙasar Eritiriya (EPLF) ce ta yi wa tashar jiragen ruwan kawanya da dakarun Habasha, kuma ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin faɗace-faɗacen da aka yi a birnin da kewaye.
target2_text: Yakin Massawa na farko ya faru ne daga 1977 zuwa 1978 a ciki da wajen birnin Massawa da ke gabar teku. Rundunar ‘yan tawayen kasar Eritiriya (EPLF) ce ta yi wa tashar jiragen ruwan kawanya da dakarun Habasha, kuma ta kasance daya daga cikin fadace-fadacen da aka yi a birnin da kewaye.

english_source: On 9 December 1977, the Ethiopian garrison launched a strong counterattack against the EPLF positions on the coastal lowlands near Mai Antal, however this attack ended in failure and the Ethiopians were forced to retreat to Massawa, allowing the EPLF to take control of Dogali. On 21st December 1977, the EPLF managed to overrun the city's main defensive perimeter, forcing the Ethiopian defenders to pull back to the Abd-el Kader and Gherar peninsulas and the islands, where they were protected by naval support.[1][1] On December 23rd, the EPLF launched a massive frontal assault on the final Ethiopian positions on the peninsulas. When the EPLF fighters attempted to march through the evaporation ponds of the Salina saltworks, the Ethiopian naval artillery initiated a devastating slaughter that killed over 2,000 EPLF fighters and wounded 400. The EPLF was forced to pull back for a long siege, before completely withdrawing to Semhar in July 1978.[5][1]
target1_text: A ranar 9 ga watan Disamban shekarar 1977, sojojin Habasha sun kaddamar da wani gagarumin farmaki kan mayakan EPLF a lungu da sako na gabar teku da ke kusa da Mai Antal, duk da haka wannan harin ya kawo karshe ba tare da nasara ba, aka tilasta wa 'yan Habasha komawa Massawa, lamarin da ya baiwa EPLF damar karbe ikon Dogali. A ranar 21 ga Disamban 1977, EPLF ta yi nasarar mamaye babban birnin na tsaro, lamarin da ya tilasta wa masu tsaron Habasha komawa yankin Abd-el Kader da Gherar da tsibiran, inda aka ba su kariya daga tallafin ruwa. [1] A ranar 23 ga Disamba, EPLF ta kaddamar da wani gagarumin hari na gaba a kan matsayi na karshe na Habasha a tsibirin. A lokacin da mayakan na EPLF suka yi yunkurin tafiya ta cikin tafkunan da aka kwashe na Salina saltworks, sojojin ruwa na Habasha sun kaddamar da wani mummunan kisa wanda ya kashe mayakan EPLF sama da 2,000 tare da raunata 400. An tilastawa EPLF ja da baya na dogon zango, kafin daga bisani ta fice zuwa Semhar a watan Yuli 1978. [2]

english_source: Mesfin Hagos left the ELF in 1970 with Isaias Afwerki, Major General Asmerom Gerezgiher, Solomon Weldemariam, and Tewelde Eyob. Hagos was a part of the founding leadership of the EPLF. Mesfin Hagos briefly served as the Chief of Staff in the EPLF. He was one of the commanders of the Battle of Af'abet that destroyed the backbone of the Ethiopian army.
target1_text: Mesfin Hagos ya bar ELF a shekarar 1970 tare da Isaias Afwerki, Major General Asmerom Gerezgiher, Solomon Weldemariam, da Tewelde Eyob. Hagos ya kasance wani ɓangare na kafa kungiyar EPLF. Mesfin Hagos ya zama shugaban ma'aikata na EPLF a takaice. Yana ɗaya daga cikin kwamandojin yakin Af'abet da ya ruguza ƙashin bayan sojojin Habasha.
target2_text: Mesfin Hagos ya bar ELF a 1970 tare da Isaias Afwerki, Major General Asmerom Gerezgiher, Solomon Weldemariam, da Tewelde Eyob. Hagos ya kasance wani bangare na kafa kungiyar EPLF. Mesfin Hagos ya zama shugaban ma'aikata na EPLF a takaice. Yana daya daga cikin kwamandojin yakin Af'abet da ya ruguza kashin bayan sojojin Habasha.

english_source: After the Italians were completely pushed out of Eritrea, Hamid settled in western Eritrea but eventually recruited an army of 50 people and began to raid the Kunama and Nara tribes from 1942 to 1948. His actions eventually attracted the attention of the British authorities, who offered a considerable award for his capture, dead or alive. Afterwards, Hamid and his armed faction surrendered to British in 1951 after they agreed not to prosecute him for his crimes.[5]
target1_text: Bayan da aka kori Italiya gaba daya daga Eritriya, Hamid ya zauna a yammacin Eritrea amma daga karshe ya dauki sojoji 50 ya kuma fara kai farmaki kan kabilar Kunama da Nara daga 1942 zuwa 1948. Ayyukansa sun jawo hankalin hukumomin Biritaniya, waɗanda suka ba da kyauta mai yawa don kama shi, a mace ko a raye. Bayan haka, Hamid da kungiyarsa dauke da makamai sun mika wuya ga kasar Burtaniya a shekarar 1951 bayan sun amince ba za su gurfanar da shi a gaban kuliya ba. [1]
target2_text: Bayan da aka kori Italiya gaba ɗaya daga Eritriya, Hamid ya zauna a yammacin Eritrea amma daga ƙarshe ya ɗauki sojoji 50 ya kuma fara kai farmaki kan ƙabilar Kunama da Nara daga shekarun 1942 zuwa 1948. Ayyukansa sun jawo hankalin hukumomin Biritaniya, waɗanda suka ba da kyauta mai yawa don kama shi, a mace ko a raye. Bayan haka, Hamid da kungiyarsa ɗauke da makamai sun miƙa wuya ga ƙasar Burtaniya a shekarar 1951 bayan sun amince ba za su gurfanar da shi a gaban kuliya ba. [1]

english_source: In September 2001 he was detained indefinitely along with other politicians who were known as the G-15, a group which opposes the rule of Eritrean president Isaias Afewerki. Solomon along with 15 other ministers were arrested by the ruling front and detained in unknown location ever since. The ministers were criticizing the border war of the then president, Isaias and signed an open letter. He was fired along with other opposing members and was detained on 18 September 2001. He has not been seen or heard from since.[4] He was considered a prisoner of conscience by Amnesty International.[7]
target1_text: A watan Satumban 2001 an tsare shi har abada tare da wasu 'yan siyasa da aka fi sani da G-15, kungiyar da ke adawa da mulkin shugaban Eritrea Isaias Afewerki . Sulemanu tare da wasu ministoci 15 ne bangaren masu mulki suka kama tare da tsare su a inda ba a san ko wane lokaci ba. Ministocin na sukar yakin kan iyaka na shugaban kasar na lokacin, Isaias tare da sanya hannu kan wata budaddiyar wasika. An kore shi tare da wasu membobin da ke adawa da shi kuma an tsare shi a ranar 18 ga Satumba 2001. Tun daga lokacin ba a gan shi ko jin duriyarsa ba. [1] Amnesty International ta dauke shi a matsayin fursuna. [2]

english_source: Jackson was born in the borough of Queens, New York City, and raised in its South Jamaica neighborhood[1] by his mother Sabrina. Sabrina, a drug dealer, raised Jackson until she died in a fire when Jackson was eight years old.[13][14] Jackson revealed in an interview that his mother was a lesbian.[15][16] After his mother's death and his father's departure, Jackson was raised by his grandparents.[17]
target1_text: An haifi Jackson a cikin garin Queens, Birnin New York, kuma mahaifiyarsa Sabrina ce ta girma a unguwar ta Kudancin Jamaica [1] . Sabrina, dillaliyar miyagun ƙwayoyi ce, ta haifi Jackson har sai da ta mutu a wuta (Gobara) lokacin da Jackson ke da shekaru takwas.[2][3] Jackson ya bayyana a cikin wata hira cewa mahaifiyarsa 'yar luwaɗi ce.[4][5] Bayan mutuwar mahaifiyarsa da tafiyar mahaifinsa, kakanninsa ne suka rene shi wajen tasowarsa Jackson.[6]
target2_text: An haifi Jackson a cikin garin Queens, Birnin New York, kuma mahaifiyarsa Sabrina ce ta girma a unguwar ta Kudancin Jamaica [1] . Sabrina, dillalin miyagun ƙwayoyi, ta haifi Jackson har sai da ta mutu a wuta lokacin da Jackson ke da shekaru takwas.[2][3] Jackson ya bayyana a cikin wata hira cewa mahaifiyarsa 'yar luwaɗi ce.[4][5] Bayan mutuwar mahaifiyarsa da tafiyar mahaifinsa, kakanninsa ne suka haifi Jackson.[6]

english_source: Saleh Meki died on Friday, October 2, 2009, following a heart attack at the age of 62.[1] He was buried in the Martyrs’ Cemetery in Asmara, the capital of Eritrea.[1]
target1_text: Saleh Meki ya rasu ne a ranar Juma’a, 2 ga Oktoba, 2009, sakamakon bugun zuciya yana da shekaru 62. [1] An binne shi a makabartar Shahidai da ke Asmara babban birnin kasar Eritrea. [1]
target2_text: Saleh Meki ya rasu ne a ranar Juma’a, 2 ga watan Oktoba, 2009, sakamakon bugun zuciya yana da shekaru 62. [1] An binne shi a makabartar Shahidai da ke Asmara babban birnin ƙasar Eritrea. [1]

english_source: He opposed the coup d'etat of 19 June 1965, by Houari Boumedienne, which led him to prison before being placed under house arrest in the south from 1965 to 1971. He went into exile in France after 1973 and returned to his country after the death of Algerian President Houari Boumédiène.[6]
target1_text: Ya yi adawa da juyin mulkin ranar 19 ga watan Yunin 1965, da Houari Boumedienne ya yi, wanda ya kai shi gidan yari kafin a tsare shi a gidan yari a kudancin ƙasar daga shekarun 1965 zuwa 1971. Ya tafi gudun hijira a Faransa bayan shekarun 1973 kuma ya koma ƙasarsa bayan mutuwar shugaban Aljeriya Houari Boumédiène. [1]
target2_text: Ya yi adawa da juyin mulkin ranar 19 ga watan Yunin 1965, da Houari Boumedienne ya yi, wanda ya kai shi gidan yari kafin a tsare shi a gidan yari a kudancin kasar daga 1965 zuwa 1971. Ya tafi gudun hijira a Faransa bayan 1973 kuma ya koma kasarsa bayan mutuwar shugaban Aljeriya Houari Boumédiène. [1]

english_source: Upon his return to Algeria, Inal became a teacher at the Tlemcen College in Slane (now named Ibn Khaldoun) and joined the National Liberation Army (ALN); he became an officer and secretary of the command of the fifth wilaya (Oran) in the maquis in Algeria.[2] While he was with the fifth wilaya maquis, he was injured in combat in the Battle of Tadjmout, before being captured by the French army. He was tortured and then killed by French soldiers on November 1, 1956.
target1_text: Bayan ya koma Aljeriya, Inal ya zama malami a Kwalejin Tlemcen da ke Slane (wanda ake kira Ibn Khaldoun a yanzu) kuma ya shiga rundunar 'yantar da kasa (ALN); ya zama hafsa kuma sakataren kwamandan wilaya (Oran) na biyar a maquis a Aljeriya. [1] Yayin da yake tare da wilaya maquis na biyar, ya ji rauni a yakin Tadjmout, kafin sojojin Faransa su kama shi. Sojojin Faransa sun azabtar da shi sannan suka kashe shi a ranar 1 ga Nuwamba, 1956.

[1] Yayin da yake tare da wilaya maquis na biyar, ya ji rauni a yakin Tadjmout, kafin sojojin Faransa su kama shi. english_source: Then he was elected Municipal Councillor and Deputy Mayor of Tiaret from 1951 to 1954. He became secretary of the UDMA journalist and a daily Oran in August 1953, and moderated the region of Tiaret an awareness campaign on the situation in the country and local elections, as well as arrange for three Tagdempt days, the congress of the youth of UDMA.[2]

english_source: Amirouche Aït Hamouda (Arabic: عميروش آيت حمودة), better known by his nom de guerre Colonel Amirouche, was an Algerian military leader and revolutionary during the Algerian War. He organized the irregular military of the Wilaya III and is considered a national hero in Algeria.
target1_text: Amirouche Aït Hamouda ( Arabic ), wanda aka fi sani da sunan sa Kanar Amirouche, shi ne shugaban sojojin Aljeriya kuma mai juyin juya hali a lokacin yakin Aljeriya . Ya shirya sojojin da ba bisa ka'ida ba na Wilaya III kuma ana daukarsa a matsayin gwarzo na kasa a Aljeriya.
target2_text: Amirouche Aït Hamouda ( Arabic ), wanda aka fi sani da sunan sa Kanar Amirouche, shi ne shugaban sojojin Aljeriya kuma ɗan juyin juya hali a lokacin yakin Aljeriya. Ya shirya sojojin da ba bisa ka'ida ba na Wilaya III kuma ana ɗaukarsa a matsayin gwarzo na ƙasa a Aljeriya.

english_source: Hassiba Ben Bouali (Arabic: حسيبة بن بوعلي) (18 January 1938 – 9 October 1957) was an Algerian militant and revolutionary figure of the Algerian War.

target2_text: Hassiba Ben Bouali ( Arabic ) (18 Janairu 1938 - 9 Oktoba 1957) ɗan gwagwarmayar Aljeriya ne kuma ɗan juyin juya hali na Yaƙin Aljeriya .

english_source: Baya Hocine, also known as Baya Mamadi (born 20 May 1940, in the Casbah of Algiers, died 1 May 2000) was an Algerian independence fighter.
target1_text: Baya Hocine, wanda kuma aka fi sani da Baya Mamadi (an haife ta a ranar 20 ga watan Mayu 1940, a cikin Casbah na Algiers, ta mutu 1 ga watan Mayu 2000) 'yar gwagwarmayar neman 'yancin kai ta Aljeriya ce.
target2_text: Baya Hocine, wanda kuma aka fi sani da Baya Mamadi (an haife shi a ranar 20 ga Mayu 1940, a cikin Casbah na Algiers, ya mutu 1 ga Mayu 2000) ɗan gwagwarmayar 'yancin kai na Aljeriya ne.

english_source: After the war, she returned to her studies, becoming a journalist. In the 1977 Algerian legislative election, she was elected to the People's National Assembly, one of 9 women elected. She held her seat until 1982.[5]

english_source: After the dissolution of the Revolutionary Committee of Unity and Action on 5 July 1954, Zabana was commissioned by Larbi Ben M'hidi to prepare for the revolution by obtaining weapons and personnel. Zabana's tasks were to structure revolutionary forces and train them, and also to visit strategic locations to choose places that could be made centers of revolution. Zabana succeeded in forming revolutionary cadres in Zahana, Oran, Aïn Témouchent, Hammam Bou Hadjar, Hassi El Ghella, and Chaabet El Ham. he then ordered the men of the cadres to gather subscriptions for buying weapons and ammunition. With Abdulmalek Ramadan, Zabana supervised the military training of the cadres. At a meeting on 30 October 1954, chaired by Ben M'hidi, the organizers of the revolution determined that it would begin with a series of attacks on the night of 1 November. The following day, 31 October, Zabana met with his units and assigned specific targets as well as a rendezvous point on Jabal al-Qada.
target1_text: Bayan rusa kwamitin juyin juya hali na hadin kai da aiki a ranar 5 ga Yulin 1954, Larbi Ben M'hidi ya ba wa Zabana umarnin shirya juyin juya hali ta hanyar samun makamai da ma'aikata. Ayyukan Zabana sune tsara dakarun juyin juya hali da horar da su, da kuma ziyartar wurare masu mahimmanci don zabar wuraren da za a iya zama cibiyar juyin juya hali. Zabana ya yi nasarar kafa 'yan gwagwarmayar juyin juya hali a Zahana, Oran, Aïn Témouchent, Hammam Bou Hadjar, Hassi El Ghella, da Chaabet El Ham . Daga nan sai ya umurci mutanen ’yan bangar da su tattara kudin sayen makamai da alburusai. Tare da Abdulmalek Ramadan, Zabana ya kula da horar da jami'an soji. A wani taro da aka yi a ranar 30 ga Oktoban 1954, karkashin jagorancin Ben M'hidi, masu shirya juyin juya halin Musulunci sun kuduri aniyar cewa za a fara ne da jerin hare-hare a daren 1 ga watan Nuwamba. Washegari, 31 ga Oktoba, Zabana ya gana da rukuninsa kuma ya sanya takamaiman hari da kuma wani batu kan Jabal al-Qada.

Daga nan sai ya umurci mutanen ’yan bangar da su tattara kuɗin sayen makamai da alburusai. Tare da Abdulmalek Ramadan, Zabana ya kula da horar da jami'an soji. english_source: The Pan Africanist Movement is a minor South African political party founded by Thami ka Plaatjie and others from a faction in the Pan Africanist Congress. After a year of in-fighting between supporters of Ka Plaatjie and PAC president Letlapa Mphahlele, the high court ruled that ka Plaatjie's faction could not organise under the name or colours of the Pan Africanist Congress, and a new party was formed to accommodate the Ka Plaatjie faction.[1]
target1_text: Ƙungiyar Pan Africanist wata ƙaramar jam'iyyar siyasa ce ta Afirka ta Kudu wadda Thami ka Plaatjie da wasu daga wani bangare a cikin Pan Africanist Congress suka kafa. Bayan shafe shekara guda ana gwabza fada tsakanin magoya bayan Ka Plaatjie da shugaban PAC Letlapa Mphahlele, babbar kotu ta yanke hukuncin cewa bangaren ka Plaatjie ba zai iya yin shiri da suna ko launin jam'iyyar Pan Africanist Congress ba, an kuma kafa wata sabuwar jam'iyya wadda za ta dauki nauyin bangaren Ka Plaatjie. [1]

english_source: As a lecturer at the Faculty of Medicine of the University of Lisbon, Helena coordinated an extracurricular course on sutures organised by students, the ‘AEFMUL Sutures Workshop’, which she continued to coordinate on a pro-bono basis even after she retired.[6] She was a member of the College of Surgery Speciality of the Portuguese Medical Association from 1993[2][3] and also kept in constant contact and collaborated with the Cape Verdean Medical Association and the country's health system.[7] She was also a member of the AEFMUL's Medical Association.
target1_text: A matsayinta na malami a tsangayar koyar da aikin likitanci ta Jami'ar Lisbon, Helena ta hada wani kwas na musamman kan dinkin da dalibai suka shirya, 'AEFMUL Sutures Workshop', wanda ta ci gaba da hadawa bisa tsarin bono ko da bayan ta yi ritaya. [1] Ta kasance memba a kwalejin tiyata ta kwashe ta hanyar kungiyar kwallon kafa ta Portugal daga 1993 [2] [3] kuma suna aiki a cikin saduwa ta Cape Verdean da tsarin kiwon lafiya na kasar. [4] Ta kasance mamba a kungiyar likitoci ta AEFMUL.

english_source: Clash occurred a few weeks after the forces of British General Henry Bartle Frere led a successful campaign against the Gcaleka forces, who joined the Xhosha resistance against the British rule. Bartle's forces, under their commander Veldman Bikitsha, managed to engage and finally defeat the Gcaleka on 13 January (near Nyumaxa).The imperial troops assisted, but were tired, short of rations and unable to follow up on the victory.
target1_text: Rikici ya faru ne 'yan makonni bayan da sojojin Birtaniya Janar Henry Bartle Frere ya jagoranci yakin nasara a kan sojojin Gcaleka, waɗanda suka shiga gwagwarmayar Xhosha a kan 'yan mulkin mallaka na Birtaniya. Sojojin Bartle, ƙarƙashin kwamandan su Veldman Bikitsha, sun yi nasarar yin galaba a kan Gcaleka a ranar 13 ga watan Janairu (kusa da Nyumaxa). Sojojin Masarautar sun taimaka, amma sun gaji, ƙarancin abinci kuma sun ƙasa bin diddigin nasarar.

Sojojin Bartle, karkashin kwamandan su Veldman Bikitsha, sun yi nasarar yin galaba a kan Gcaleka a ranar 13 ga Janairu (kusa da Nyumaxa). Sojojin Masarautar sun taimaka, amma sun gaji, karancin abinci kuma sun kasa bin diddigin nasarar.

english_source: Following the end of the war in 1962, extensive efforts were made by the new Algerian authorities to clear and dismantle the Morice Line. They included the forced employment of captured harkis and other Muslim loyalists who had served with the French Army, many of whom were killed by landmines.[2] Decades after the confrontation came to an end, the Morice Line, which had been heavily mined by the French, continued to cause casualties among local Algerian populations.[3][4] Algeria eventually joined the Ottawa Treaty, which bans the use of landmines, and in 2017, Algeria announced that after decades of work, it had fulfilled its mine clearance obligation under the treaty. It announced the clearing of the last 93 mined or suspected mined areas, including 78 former mine barrages[5] in the Morice Line.
target1_text: Bayan kawo ƙarshen yakin a shekarar 1962, sabbin mahukuntan Aljeriya sun yi kokarin kawar da tare da wargaza layin Morice. Sun haɗa da aikin tilasta wa harkis da aka kama da kuma sauran musulmi masu biyayya da suka yi aiki da Sojojin Faransa, waɗanda aka kashe da yawa daga cikinsu ta hanyar nakiyoyi. [1] Shekaru goma bayan kawo ƙarshen arangamar, Layin Morice, wanda Faransa ta yi ta hakowa sosai, ya ci gaba da haddasa asarar rayuka a tsakanin al'ummar ƙasar Aljeriya. [2] [3] Daga ƙarshe Aljeriya ta shiga yarjejeniyar Ottawa, wacce ta haramta amfani da nakiyoyi, kuma a cikin shekarar 2017, Aljeriya ta sanar da cewa, bayan shekaru da dama na aiki, ta cika hakkinta na kawar da nakiyoyin a ƙarƙashin yarjejeniyar. Ya sanar da share wuraren hakar ma'adinai na 93 na ƙarshe ko waɗanda ake zargin, ciki har da 78 tsoffin ma'adanai [4] a cikin Layin Morice.
target2_text: Bayan kawo karshen yakin a shekarar 1962, sabbin mahukuntan Aljeriya sun yi kokarin kawar da tare da wargaza layin Morice. Sun hada da aikin tilasta wa harkis da aka kama da kuma sauran musulmi masu biyayya da suka yi aiki da Sojojin Faransa, wadanda aka kashe da yawa daga cikinsu ta hanyar nakiyoyi. [1] Shekaru goma bayan kawo karshen arangamar, Layin Morice, wanda Faransa ta yi ta hakowa sosai, ya ci gaba da haddasa asarar rayuka a tsakanin al'ummar kasar Aljeriya. [2] [3] Daga karshe Aljeriya ta shiga yarjejeniyar Ottawa, wadda ta haramta amfani da nakiyoyi, kuma a cikin 2017, Aljeriya ta sanar da cewa, bayan shekaru da dama na aiki, ta cika hakkinta na kawar da nakiyoyin a karkashin yarjejeniyar. Ya sanar da share wuraren hakar ma'adinai na 93 na ƙarshe ko waɗanda ake zargin, ciki har da 78 tsoffin ma'adanai [4] a cikin Layin Morice.

english_source: The start of the Algerian War in 1954 emerged from a growing Algerian nationalist movement. The population was asked to fight in the Second World War alongside the French. In exchange for their duty, they demanded more political and economic rights which were refused.[3] The tensions between the two parties rose when the National Liberation Front (FLN) called for independence in their Declaration of 1 November 1954.[4] The French Government led by Pierre Mendès France declined their requests because of the pressure established by the pieds-noirs and the political context in France.[5]
target1_text: Farkon yakin Aljeriya a shekara ta 1954 ya fito daga wani yunkuri na kishin kasa na Aljeriya. An bukaci jama'ar da su yi yaki a yakin duniya na biyu tare da Faransa. A madadin aikinsu, sun bukaci ƙarin haƙƙoƙin siyasa da tattalin arziki waɗanda aka ƙi. [1] Rikicin da ke tsakanin bangarorin biyu ya taso ne a lokacin da jam'iyyar National Liberation Front (FLN) ta yi kira ga 'yancin kai a cikin sanarwar da ta yi na 1 ga Nuwamba 1954 . [2] Gwamnatin Faransa karkashin jagorancin Pierre Mendès Faransa ta ki amincewa da bukatunsu saboda matsin lamba da masu fafutuka suka kafa da kuma yanayin siyasa a Faransa. [3]
target2_text: Farkon yakin Aljeriya a shekara ta 1954 ya fito daga wani yunkuri na kishin ƙasa na Aljeriya. An buƙaci jama'ar da su yi yaki a yakin duniya na biyu tare da Faransa. A madadin aikinsu, sun buƙaci ƙarin haƙƙoƙin siyasa da tattalin arziki waɗanda aka ƙi. [1] Rikicin da ke tsakanin ɓangarori biyu ya taso ne a lokacin da jam'iyyar National Liberation Front (FLN) ta yi kira ga 'yancin kai a cikin sanarwar da ta yi na 1 ga Nuwamba 1954 . [2] Gwamnatin Faransa ƙarƙashin jagorancin Pierre Mendès Faransa ta ki amincewa da bukatunsu saboda matsin lamba da masu fafutuka suka kafa da kuma yanayin siyasa a Faransa. [3]

english_source: Chapter Two covered the specifics of Algeria's independence, and what its cooperation with France would entail. It declared that upon a vote of self-determination, the Algerian State would in its own rights exercise full and complete sovereignty.[1] This section also guaranteed the interests of France in exchange for France's provision of technical and cultural assistance, and social and economic aid. These interests referred specifically to the exercise of mining titles granted by France, preference in granting new mining titles to French companies, and the purchase of Saharan hydrocarbons to be conducted in francs.
target1_text: Babi na biyu ya tabo batun ‘yancin kai na Aljeriya, da abin da hadin gwiwarta da Faransa zai kunsa. Ta bayyana cewa, bayan kada kuri'ar cin gashin kai, kasar Aljeriya za ta gudanar da cikakken 'yancin kanta. [1] Har ila yau, wannan sashe ya tabbatar da muradun Faransa don musaya ga samar da taimakon fasaha da al'adu na Faransa, da taimakon zamantakewa da tattalin arziki. Wadannan bukatu sun yi tsokaci ne musamman kan yadda ake gudanar da ayyukan hakar ma'adinai da Faransa ta ba da, fifiko wajen bai wa kamfanonin kasar Faransa sabbin mukaman hakar ma'adinai, da kuma sayan iskar gas na Saharan da za a gudanar da shi a cikin francs.
target2_text: Babi na biyu ya tabo batun ‘yancin kai na Aljeriya, da abin da haɗin gwiwarta da Faransa zai kunsa. Ta bayyana cewa, bayan kaɗa kuri'ar cin gashin kai, ƙasar Aljeriya za ta gudanar da cikakken samun 'yancin kanta. [1] Har ila yau, wannan sashe ya tabbatar da muradun Faransa don musaya ga samar da taimakon fasaha da al'adu na Faransa, da taimakon zamantakewa da tattalin arziki. Waɗannan buƙatu sun yi tsokaci ne musamman kan yadda ake gudanar da ayyukan hakar ma'adinai da Faransa ta ba da, fifiko wajen bai wa kamfanonin ƙasar Faransa sabbin muƙaman hakar ma'adinai, da kuma sayan iskar gas na Saharan da za a gudanar da shi a cikin francs.

english_source: Chapter Five outlined the consequences of self-determination as the following:[1] Algeria's Independence from France would be recognised by France immediately, the transfer of jurisdiction would be realised, any regulations would come into force simultaneously, and that an election for the Algerian National Assembly would be organised by the provisional executive within a period of three weeks.

Manazarta

english_source: Larbi Tebessi was arrested in 1943 and then released. Then he was imprisoned in 1945 after the Sétif and Guelma massacre on May 8, 1945. Larbi Tebessi managed to create a school and he spread his anti-colonial ideas.
target1_text: An kama Larbi Tebessi a 1943 sannan aka sake shi. Sannan an daure shi a shekara ta 1945 bayan kisan kiyashin Setif da Guelma a ranar 8 ga Mayu, 1945. Larbi Tebessi ya sami nasarar ƙirƙirar makaranta kuma ya yada tunaninsa na adawa da mulkin mallaka.
target2_text: An kama Larbi Tebessi a shekarar 1943 sannan aka sake shi. Sannan an ɗaure shi a shekara ta 1945 bayan kisan kiyashin Setif da Guelma a ranar 8 ga watan Mayu, 1945. Larbi Tebessi ya sami nasarar ƙirƙirar makaranta kuma ya yaɗa tunaninsa na adawa da 'yan mulkin mallaka.

english_source: Sheikh Larbi Tebessi represented the main current of the ulema association who rallied the principles of the National Liberation Front in 1956. This was instigated by Zighoud Youcef head of the department of Constantinois and founding member of the FLN and after insurgency of August 20, 1955.
target1_text: Sheikh Larbi Tebessi shi ne ya wakilci babban jigo na kungiyar malamai da suka hada ka’idojin kungiyar ‘yanci ta kasa a shekarar 1956. Zighoud Youcef shugaban sashen Constantinois kuma memba na FLN ne ya ingiza wannan kuma bayan tawaye na Agusta 20, 1955.
target2_text: Sheikh Larbi Tebessi shi ne ya wakilci babban jigo na kungiyar malamai da suka haɗa ka’idojin kungiyar ‘yanci ta kasa a shekarar 1956. Zighoud Youcef shugaban sashen Constantinois kuma memba na FLN ne ya ingiza wannan kuma bayan tawaye na watan Agusta 20, 1955.

english_source: On 6 July 1629, the survivors and authorities wrote a letter to King Christian IV to ask for his protection against the pirates. When informed about the women and children abducted, the king ordered the Faroese population to collect a ransom for the prisoners to save them from slavery. However, the Faroese replied that the poverty caused by several years of piracy on the island, had made it impossible to collect the money necessary to buy the prisoners back.[1]
target1_text: A ranar 6 ga Yuli 1629, waɗanda suka tsira da hukumomi sun rubuta wasiƙa zuwa ga Sarki Christian IV don neman kariyarsa daga masu fashin teku. Da aka samu labarin matan da yaran da aka sace, sarkin ya umarci al’ummar Farowa da su karbi kudin fansa ga fursunonin domin kubutar da su daga bauta. Duk da haka, Faroese ya amsa cewa talaucin da ake fama da shi na shekaru da yawa na fashin teku a tsibirin, ya sa ba a iya tattara kudaden da ake bukata don sayen fursunoni ba. [1]

english_source: The cause of the raid was the a theft committed against the entourage of Ferhat ben Said, a local leader in South Constantinois who was seeking common cause with France against Ahmad Bey, though none of the people killed in the raid were responsible for the theft but were instead thought by the French to have been from the same tribe.[6]
target1_text: Dalilin harin dai shi ne satar da aka yi wa tawagar Ferhat ben Said, wani shugaban yankin Kudancin Constantinois wanda ke neman hadin kan kasar Faransa kan Ahmad Bey, duk da cewa babu daya daga cikin mutanen da aka kashe a harin da ya dauki alhakin satar, amma Faransawa sun dauka cewa ya fito daga kabila daya. [1]

[1]

english_source: In 1982 Zimbabwean police arrested Masuku and Dumiso Dabengwa, the ZIPRA intelligence chief, for allegedly planning a coup d'état against then-Prime Minister Robert Mugabe. The Supreme Court found Masuku, Dabengwa, and four others not guilty in 1983, but police detained them again under emergency regulations, holding them for four years. The government released Masuku because of poor health and Vote Moyo, a ZAPU official, on 11 March 1986.[1][2]
target1_text: A cikin 1982 'yan sandan Zimbabwe sun kama Masuku da Dumiso Dabengwa, babban jami'in leken asiri na ZIPRA, bisa zarginsu da shirya juyin mulkin da aka yi wa firaminista Robert Mugabe na lokacin. Kotun kolin kasar ta samu Masuku, Dabengwa, da wasu mutane hudu a shekarar 1983, ba su da laifi, amma ‘yan sanda sun sake tsare su a karkashin dokar ta-baci, inda suka tsare su na tsawon shekaru hudu. Gwamnati ta saki Masuku saboda rashin lafiya da kuma Vote Moyo, jami'in ZAPU, a ranar 11 ga Maris 1986. [1] [2]
target2_text: A cikin shekarar 1982 'yan sandan Zimbabwe sun kama Masuku da Dumiso Dabengwa, babban jami'in leken asiri na ZIPRA, bisa zarginsu da shirya juyin mulkin da aka yi wa firaminista Robert Mugabe na lokacin. Kotun kolin ƙasar ta samu Masuku, Dabengwa, da wasu mutane huɗu a shekarar 1983, ba su da laifi, amma ‘yan sanda sun sake tsare su a ƙarƙashin dokar ta-ɓaci, inda suka tsare su na tsawon shekaru huɗu. Gwamnati ta saki Masuku saboda rashin lafiya da kuma Vote Moyo, jami'in ZAPU, a ranar 11 ga watan Maris 1986. [1] [2]

english_source: Masuku arrived in Rhodesia with Dumiso Dabengwa on 24 December 1979. Dabengwa had a meeting arranged with an informant from the country's Central Intelligence Organisation, but could not attend so sent Masuku in his stead. They judged this meeting very important, as the informant claimed that a few weeks earlier that Josiah Tongogara was killed in an ambush in Mozambique. The meeting took place in the Wimpy Bar in Salisbury (Harare), organised by "The Senator", which was his codename.
target1_text: Masuku ya isa Rhodesia tare da Dumiso Dabengwa a ranar 24 ga Disamba 1979. Dabengwa ya yi wani taro da wani mai ba da labari daga Hukumar Leken Asiri ta kasar, amma bai samu halartar taron ba, ya aika Masuku a madadinsa. Sun ɗauki wannan taro da muhimmanci sosai, kamar yadda mai ba da labarin ya yi iƙirarin cewa ‘yan makonnin da suka gabata an kashe Josiah Tongogara a wani harin kwantan bauna da aka kai a Mozambique. Taron ya gudana ne a mashaya mai suna Wimpy da ke Salisbury (Harare), wanda “The Senator” ya shirya, wanda shine sunan sa.
target2_text: Masuku ya isa Rhodesia tare da Dumiso Dabengwa a ranar 24 ga watan Disamba 1979. Dabengwa ya yi wani taro da wani mai ba da labari daga Hukumar Leken Asiri ta ƙasar, amma bai samu halartar taron ba, ya aika Masuku a madadinsa. Sun ɗauki wannan taro da muhimmanci sosai, kamar yadda mai ba da labarin ya yi iƙirarin cewa ‘yan makonnin da suka gabata an kashe Josiah Tongogara a wani harin kwantan ɓauna da aka kai a Mozambique. Taron ya gudana ne a mashaya mai suna Wimpy da ke Salisbury (Harare), wanda “The Senator” ya shirya, wanda shine sunan sa.

english_source: Born in Uzumba in Mashonaland East, Nyamubaya left secondary school at the age of 15 to join the Zimbabwe African National Liberation Army (ZANLA) during its insurgency against Rhodesia's predominantly white government.[5] She travelled to a ZANLA training camp in Mozambique, believing she could "change something".[6] During the Rhodesian Bush War, she was one of the few female field operation commanders; although after the war, she felt let down by the way demobilised guerrillas were treated. She went on to become Secretary for Education at the first conference of the Zimbabwe African National Union (ZANU) Women’s League.[6]
target1_text: An haife shi a garin Uzumba da ke yankin Mashonaland ta Gabas, Nyamubaya ya bar makarantar sakandare yana da shekaru 15 ya shiga kungiyar ‘yantar da ‘yancin kai ta Zimbabwe (ZANLA) a lokacin da take tada kayar baya da gwamnatin Rhodesia wadda galibin farar fata ne. [1] Ta yi tafiya zuwa sansanin horar da ZANLA da ke Mozambique, ta yi imanin cewa za ta iya "canza wani abu". [2] A lokacin Yaƙin Bush na Rhodesian, ta kasance ɗaya daga cikin ƴan kwamandojin fage mata; ko da yake bayan yakin, ta ji takaicin yadda ake yi wa ‘yan daba da aka kora. Ta ci gaba da zama Sakatariyar Ilimi a taron farko na kungiyar Mata ta Afirka ta Zimbabwe (ZANU). [2]

Ta ci gaba da zama Sakatariyar Ilimi a taron farko na kungiyar Mata ta Afirka ta Zimbabwe (ZANU). [2]

english_source: Freedom Nyamubaya has two published collections of poems, On the Road Again: Poems During and After the National Liberation of Zimbabwe (Zimbabwe Publishing House, 1985), and Dusk of Dawn (College Press, 1995).[1][8] She co-authored Ndangariro with Irene Ropa Rinopfuka Mahamba (Zimbabwe Foundation for Education with Production, 1987).[3] Her short story “Special Place” is published in the anthology Writing Still: New Stories from Zimbabwe (Weaver Press, 2003).[5]

[1] [2] Ta haɗu da Ndangariro tare da Irene Ropa Rinopfuka Mahamba (Zimbabwe Foundation for Education with Production, 1987). [3] An buga gajeriyar labarinta "Wuri na Musamman" a cikin littafin tarihin Rubutun Har yanzu: Sabbin Labarun daga Zimbabwe (Weaver Press, 2003). [1]

english_source: Shortly after the British Parliament outlawed British participation in the slave trade in 1807, the Royal Navy started to patrol the African coast and high seas, seizing British vessels suspected of engaging in the slave trade. After the Congress of Vienna and the ratification of various international agreements to restrict or outlaw the transatlantic trade, the West Africa Squadron, and to a lesser extent maritime patrols flying under the flags of Spain, Portugal, the Netherlands, Brazil, and the United States, also intercepted ships suspected of trafficking slaves in contravention of treaty provisions. In addition to the courts established in Freetown, tribunals to judge ships seized by anti-slaving patrols also operated in Havana, Rio de Janeiro, Luanda, Cape Verde, and St. Helena.
target1_text: Jim kadan bayan da Majalisar Biritaniya ta haramta shigar Birtaniya shiga cinikin bayi a shekara ta 1807, rundunar sojojin ruwa ta Royal Navy ta fara sintiri a gabar tekun Afirka da manyan tekuna, tare da kwace jiragen ruwa na Burtaniya da ake zargi da yin cinikin bayi. Bayan Majalisar Vienna da kuma amincewa da yarjejeniyoyin kasa da kasa daban-daban don takura ko haramta cinikayyar tekun Atlantika, Rundunar Sojin Afirka ta Yamma, da kuma wasu ‘yan sintiri na teku da ke shawagi a karkashin tutocin Spain, Portugal, Netherlands, Brazil, da Amurka, sun kuma katse jiragen ruwa da ake zargi da safarar bayi da suka saba wa tanadin yarjejeniya. Baya ga kotunan da aka kafa a Freetown, kotunan shari'ar da za ta yi shari'ar jiragen ruwa da jami'an sintiri na yaki da bautar suka kama suna aiki a Havana, Rio de Janeiro, Luanda, Cape Verde, da St. Helena.

Bayan Majalisar Vienna da kuma amincewa da yarjejeniyoyin ƙasa da ƙasa daban-daban don takura ko haramta cinikayyar tekun Atlantika, Rundunar Sojin Afirka ta Yamma, da kuma wasu ‘yan sintiri na teku da ke shawagi a ƙarƙashin tutocin Spain, Portugal, Netherlands, Brazil, da Amurka, sun kuma katse jiragen ruwa da ake zargi da safarar bayi da suka saɓa wa tanadin yarjejeniya. Baya ga kotunan da aka kafa a Freetown, kotunan shari'ar da za ta yi shari'ar jiragen ruwa da jami'an sintiri na yaki da bautar suka kama suna aiki a Havana, Rio de Janeiro, Luanda, Cape Verde, da St. Helena.

english_source: More than 80,000 Africans rescued from the illegal trade between Africa and the Americas were emancipated before courts operating in Freetown between 1808 and 1871, when the last remaining mixed commission was shuttered. Upon emancipation, most liberated Africans were registered with a Christian name, but a large number of registries also listed African names, based on information given by the liberated African or a translator. Many registries also record estimated age, height, brands, and body modifications.[1]
target1_text: Fiye da 'yan Afirka 80,000 da aka ceto daga cinikin haramtacciyar hanya tsakanin Afirka da Amurka an 'yantar da su a gaban kotunan da ke aiki a Freetown tsakanin shekarun 1808 zuwa 1871, lokacin da aka rufe sauran haɗaɗɗiyar hukumar. Bayan samun 'yanci, yawancin 'yan Afirka masu 'yanci an yi musu rajista da sunan Kirista, amma yawancin rajista kuma sun jera sunayen Afirka, bisa bayanan da aka samu 'yan Afirka ko mai fassara. Rijista da yawa kuma suna yin rikodin kiyasin shekaru, tsayi, tambura, da gyare-gyaren jiki. [1]
target2_text: Fiye da 'yan Afirka 80,000 da aka ceto daga cinikin haramtacciyar hanya tsakanin Afirka da Amurka an 'yantar da su a gaban kotunan da ke aiki a Freetown tsakanin 1808 zuwa 1871, lokacin da aka rufe sauran hadaddiyar hukumar. Bayan samun 'yanci, yawancin 'yan Afirka masu 'yanci an yi musu rajista da sunan Kirista, amma yawancin rajista kuma sun jera sunayen Afirka, bisa bayanan da aka samu 'yan Afirka ko mai fassara. Rijista da yawa kuma suna yin rikodin kiyasin shekaru, tsayi, tambura, da gyare-gyaren jiki. [1]

english_source: Manuel Pinto da Costa ran as the MLSTP–PSD candidate in the 1996 presidential election. In the first round, he came in second behind the incumbent President Miguel Trovoada, winning 39% of the vote to Trovoada's 41%. In the second round he was defeated by Trovoada who captured 52.7% of the vote to his 47.3%.
target1_text: Manuel Pinto da Costa ya yi takara a matsayin ɗan takarar MLSTP-PSD a zaɓen shugaban ƙasa na shekarar 1996. A zagayen farko, ya zo na biyu bayan shugaban ƙasar mai ci Miguel Trovoada, inda ya samu kashi 39% na kuri'un da aka kaɗa, yayin da Trovoada ta samu kashi 41%. A zagaye na biyu ya sha kaye a hannun Trovoada wanda ya samu kashi 52.7% na kuri'un da aka kaɗa inda ya samu kashi 47.3%.
target2_text: Manuel Pinto da Costa ya yi takara a matsayin dan takarar MLSTP-PSD a zaben shugaban kasa na 1996. A zagayen farko, ya zo na biyu bayan shugaban kasar mai ci Miguel Trovoada, inda ya samu kashi 39% na kuri'un da aka kada, yayin da Trovoada ta samu kashi 41%. A zagaye na biyu ya sha kaye a hannun Trovoada wanda ya samu kashi 52.7% na kuri'un da aka kada inda ya samu kashi 47.3%.

english_source: The SPDM advocated for greater representation of the Saho people in the EPLF, as well as for the recognition of Saho as an official language in Eritrea. The organization also demanded an end to the forced conscription of young men into the EPLF, and for greater democracy and human rights in the country.[6][7]
target1_text: SPDM ta ba da shawarar samun wakilcin al'ummar Saho a cikin EPLF, da kuma amincewa da Saho a matsayin harshen hukuma a Eritrea. Ƙungiyar ta kuma buƙaci a kawo ƙarshen tilasta wa matasa shiga cikin kungiyar ta EPLF, da kuma inganta dimokuraɗiyya da kare hakkin ɗan Adam a ƙasar. [1] [2]
target2_text: SPDM ta ba da shawarar samun wakilcin al'ummar Saho a cikin EPLF, da kuma amincewa da Saho a matsayin harshen hukuma a Eritrea. Kungiyar ta kuma bukaci a kawo karshen tilasta wa matasa shiga cikin kungiyar ta EPLF, da kuma inganta dimokuradiyya da kare hakkin dan Adam a kasar. [1] [2]

english_source: The SPDM has been critical of the government of President Isaias Afwerki, accusing it of being undemocratic and repressive. The party has also expressed concern over the government's handling of the border dispute with Ethiopia, which has led to a protracted conflict between the two countries. While the SPDM's official position is that it seeks a peaceful and democratic resolution to the conflict between the Saho people and the Eritrean government, some members of the party have expressed support for greater autonomy or even independence for the Saho region.[9] The Saho people have historically faced marginalization and discrimination,[10] and the SPDM has been a vocal advocate for their rights and interests.[11] However, the party leadership has emphasized the importance of national unity and cohesion, and has emphasized that any changes to the country's political structure must be achieved through peaceful and democratic means.
target1_text: Jam'iyyar SPDM dai na sukar gwamnatin shugaba Isaias Afwerki, inda ta zarge ta da rashin bin tafarkin demokraɗiyya da danniya. Jam'iyyar ta kuma bayyana damuwarta kan yadda gwamnatin ƙasar ke tafiyar da rikicin kan iyaka da ƙasar Habasha, wanda ya haifar da daɗewar rikici tsakanin ƙasashen biyu. Yayin da matsayin SPDM a hukumance shi ne na neman ganin an sasanta rikicin Saho da gwamnatin Eritriya cikin lumana da Dimokuraɗiyya, wasu 'yan jam'iyyar sun nuna goyon bayansu ga samun 'yancin cin gashin kai ko ma 'yancin cin gashin kai ga yankin Saho. [1] Mutanen Saho a tarihi sun fuskanci wariya da nuna bambanci, [2] kuma SPDM ta kasance mai fafutukar kare hakkinsu da muradun su. [3] Sai dai shugabannin jam’iyyar sun bayyana muhimmancin haɗin kan ƙasa da haɗin kan kasa, kuma sun jaddada cewa duk wani sauyi da za a yi a tsarin siyasar ƙasar dole ne a samu ta hanyar lumana da dimokuraɗiyya.

english_source: In 1958, the Eritrean Liberation Movement (ELM) was founded.[1] The ELM, which was composed primarily of students and laborers, focused on organizing demonstrations against Ethiopian occupation. ELM strongholds were located in the urban central highlands, where a large proportion of Christians lived.[2] It organized Eritreans clandestinely and played a significant role in awakening nationalists sentiments in urban areas until a major police crackdown. While the ELM had played a positive role in working towards self-determination, the organization proved incapable of escalating to armed struggle against the Ethiopian Empire.[1]
target1_text: A cikin shekarar 1958, an kafa ƙungiyar 'yanci ta Eritrea (ELM). [1] ELM, wacce ta ƙunshi ɗalibai da ma'aikata, ta mayar da hankali kan shirya zanga-zangar adawa da mamayar Habasha. Wuraren ELM suna cikin tsaunukan tsakiyar birane, inda yawancin kiristoci ke zama. [2] Ta shirya 'yan Eritriya a ɓoye tare da taka rawar gani wajen tada ra'ayin 'yan kishin ƙasa a cikin birane har sai da wani babban jami'in 'yan sanda. Yayin da ELM ta taka rawar gani wajen yin aiki don tabbatar da kai, ƙungiyar ta nuna ba ta da ƙarfin haɓaka zuwa gwagwarmayar makami da Daular Habasha. [1] Manazarta
target2_text: A cikin 1958, an kafa ƙungiyar 'yanci ta Eritrea (ELM). [1] ELM, wadda ta ƙunshi ɗalibai da ma'aikata, ta mayar da hankali kan shirya zanga-zangar adawa da mamayar Habasha. Wuraren ELM suna cikin tsaunukan tsakiyar birane, inda yawancin kiristoci ke zama. [2] Ta shirya 'yan Eritriya a boye tare da taka rawar gani wajen tada ra'ayin 'yan kishin kasa a cikin birane har sai da wani babban jami'in 'yan sanda. Yayin da ELM ta taka rawar gani wajen yin aiki don tabbatar da kai, ƙungiyar ta nuna ba ta da ƙarfin haɓaka zuwa gwagwarmayar makami da Daular Habasha. [1]

english_source: In December 1966, the General Assembly of the United Nations adopted a resolution and proposed an UN-supervised self-determination referendum in Western Sahara.[2]
target1_text: A watan Disambar 1966, babban taron Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya ya zartas da wani kuduri tare da ba da shawarar gudanar da zaɓen raba gardama na cin gashin kai ƙarƙashin kulawar Majalisar Ɗinkin Duniya a yammacin Sahara. [1]
target2_text: A watan Disambar 1966, babban taron Majalisar Dinkin Duniya ya zartas da wani kuduri tare da ba da shawarar gudanar da zaben raba gardama na cin gashin kai karkashin kulawar Majalisar Dinkin Duniya a yammacin Sahara. [1]

english_source: In 1971, university students began to organize the Movement for the Liberation of Saguia el Hamra and Wadi el Dhahab, formally constituted as the Polisario Front in 1973. Ten days after its founding, the Polisario Front launched a guerilla war against the Spanish.[1]
target1_text: A cikin shekarar 1971, ɗaliban jami'a sun fara shirya ƙungiyoyin 'Yancin Saguia el Hamra da Wadi el Dhahab, waɗanda aka kafa a matsayin Polisario Front a shekarar 1973. Kwanaki 10 bayan kafuwarta, kungiyar Polisario Front ta kaddamar da kamfen da ƙasar Spain. [1]
target2_text: A cikin 1971, ɗaliban jami'a sun fara shirya ƙungiyoyin 'Yancin Saguia el Hamra da Wadi el Dhahab, waɗanda aka kafa a matsayin Polisario Front a 1973. Kwanaki 10 bayan kafuwarta, kungiyar Polisario Front ta kaddamar da yakin neman zabe da kasar Spain. [1]
