english_source: On 24 May, French paratroopers from the Algerian corps landed on Corsica and took the French island in a bloodless action, Opération Corse.[1][2] Operation Resurrection would be implemented if de Gaulle was not approved as leader by the French Parliament, if he asked for military assistance to take power, or if any organised attempt by the French Communist Party to seize power or to stall his return needed to be thwarted.
target1_text: A ranar 24 ga Mayu, sojojin Faransa daga cikin gawarwakin Aljeriya sun sauka a Corsica kuma suka dauki tsibirin Faransa a wani mataki na rashin jini, Operation Corse. [1] [2] Za a aiwatar da Operation Resurrection idan majalisar dokokin Faransa ba ta amince da de Gaulle a matsayin shugaban kasa ba, idan ya nemi taimakon soja don ya karbi mulki, ko kuma duk wani yunkuri na jam'iyyar gurguzu ta Faransa na kwace mulki ko hana dawowarsa yana bukatar a dakile.
target2_text: A ranar 24 ga watan Mayu, sojojin Faransa daga cikin gawarwakin Aljeriya sun sauka a Corsica kuma suka ɗauki tsibirin Faransa a wani mataki na rashin jini, Operation Corse. [1] [2] Za a aiwatar da Operation Resurrection idan majalisar dokokin Faransa ba ta amince da de Gaulle a matsayin shugaban ƙasa ba, idan ya nemi taimakon soja don ya karɓi mulki, ko kuma duk wani yunkuri na jam'iyyar gurguzu ta Faransa na kwace mulki ko hana dawowarsa yana buƙatar a dakile.

english_source: On 26 March, a crowd of Pied-Noirs marched in the Algerian capital of Algiers in opposition to the Évian Accords, as they did not wish for Algeria to become independent of French colonial rule.[2] The French Army, anticipating violent confrontations with anti-independence Pied-Noirs, had installed roadblocks throughout the city, including one on the Rue d'Isly. As the crowd was attempting to march towards the neighbourhood of Bab El Oued, they were confronted on the Rue d'Isly by 45 soldiers from the French Army's 4th Tirailleur Regiment, which was composed mainly of conscripted Algerian Muslims. This unit was one of the remaining mostly (80%) Muslim infantry regiments of the French Army of Africa. On 17 March 1962 it had been brought into Algiers from active service in the Algerian countryside (bled) to take up urban pacification duties for which the young tirailleurs were not trained or prepared.[6][5]
target1_text: A ranar 26 ga watan Maris, taron Pied-Noirs ya yi maci a babban birnin Algiers na Aljeriya domin nuna adawa da yarjejeniyar Évian, saboda ba sa fatan Aljeriya ta samu 'yancin kai daga turawan mulkin mallaka na Faransa. [ 2 ] Sojojin Faransa, suna tsammanin fuskantar tashin hankali tare da adawa da 'yancin kai Pied-Noirs, sun sanya shingen hanya a ko'ina cikin birnin, ciki har da daya a kan Rue d'Isly. A daidai lokacin da jama'a ke yunkurin yin tattaki zuwa unguwar Bab El Oued, sun yi arangama da su a kan Rue d'Isly da sojoji 45 daga runduna ta 4 ta Tirailleur ta sojojin Faransa wadda ta kunshi musulmin Aljeriya da aka tilasta musu shiga aikin. Wannan ruƙunin ya kasance ɗaya daga cikin mafi yawan (80%) na sojojin sojojin Faransa na Sojojin Faransa na Afirka. A ranar 17 ga watan Maris 1962 an kawo shi cikin Algiers daga sabis na aiki a cikin karkarar Aljeriya ( bled) don gudanar da ayyukan samar da zaman lafiya a cikin birane wanda ba a horar da matasan tirailleurs ko shirya don su ba. [1] [ 5 ]

english_source: The 4th Tirailleurs was disbanded on 31 May, two months after the massacre.[11] It was concluded that to deploy exhausted and demoralised Muslim troops untrained for police duties, under only one junior officer, to control a large and excited crowd of European demonstrators had been a serious error of judgement.[12]

[2]

english_source: Smith apparently deemed the incident minor in nature and did not report it to his superiors. However, Deighton did report the incident.[1] The governor of Natal, Sir Henry Ernest Gascoyne Bulwer, regarded it as a minor affair, one expected to occur on a border between a European power and a tribal people.[1] Frere initially agreed with this assessment, writing: "I concur with you in attributing no special importance to the seizure and temporary arrest of the surveyors, which was partly due to their own indiscretion, and was evidently in no way sanctioned by the Zulu authorities." [4]

english_source: Some weeks after the battle, a larger British force made up of White and Native troops came to a standstill with the same Ashanti army that defeated McCarthy's force. Casualties on the British side included 176 dead and 677 men wounded. After the battle, the British army along with their regular troops withdrew back the coast.[5]

Waɗanda suka mutu a ɓangaren Birtaniyya sun haɗa da mutuwar mutane 176 da kuma wasu mutane 677 da suka jikkata. Bayan yakin, sojojin Birtaniya tare da sojojinsu na yau da kullum sun janye daga bakin teku. [1]

english_source: The Battle of Amoaful was fought on 31 January 1874 during the Third Anglo-Ashanti War when Sir Garnet Wolseley defeated the Ashantis after strong resistance.[2] The attack was led by the 42nd Regiment of Foot.[2] At Amoaful, one combat post-mortem pays tribute to the Ashanti commander: "The great Chief Amanquatia was among the killed. Admirable skill was shown in the position selected by Amanquatia, and the determination and generalship he displayed in the defence fully bore out his great reputation as an able tactician and gallant soldier."[3] Lance-Sergeant Samuel McGaw was awarded the Victoria Cross for action during the battle.[4]
target1_text: An yi yakin Amoaful ne a ranar 31 ga Janairun 1874 a lokacin yakin Anglo-Ashanti na uku lokacin da Sir Garnet Wolseley ya ci Ashantis bayan turjiya mai karfi. [1] Rundunar ta 42 ce ta jagoranci harin. [1] A Amoaful, daya daga cikin wadanda aka kashe a cikin fada ya ba da lambar yabo ga kwamandan Ashanti: "Babban Cif Amanquatia yana cikin wadanda aka kashe. An nuna fasaha mai ban sha'awa a matsayin da Amanquatia ya zaba, kuma jajircewa da jajircewar da ya nuna a cikin tsaro ya haifar da babban suna a matsayinsa na ƙwararren mai dabara da soja mai jajircewa." [2] Lance-Sergeant Samuel McGaw an ba shi kyautar Victoria Cross don aiki a lokacin yakin. [3]

english_source: The militants herded men, women and children into huts and set fire to them, hacking down with machetes anyone who attempted escape, before throwing them back into the burning huts. The attack at Lari was so extreme that "African policemen who saw the bodies of the victims ... were physically sick and said 'These people are animals. If I see one now I shall shoot with the greatest eagerness'", and it "even shocked many Mau Mau supporters, some of whom would subsequently try to excuse the attack as 'a mistake'."[8][9][4] The colonial government used the attack as propaganda and showed the massacre to journalists.[1] The massacre prompted retaliatory attacks.[10] 400 Mau Mau rebels were reputedly killed by colonial troops, including the King's African Rifles, in revenge.[1]

english_source: Abdellah Belhouchet (1924 – September 16, 2003) was an Algerian military officer and nationalist activist, best known for his role during the Algerian War of Independence and in the development of the Algerian People's National Army (ANP).[1] Belhouchet assumed various positions throughout his military career, including chief of staff of the People's National Army from 1986 to 1988, and served as deputy minister of National Defense.[2] He was also a member of the National Council of the Algerian Revolution and the Revolutionary Council and military advisor to president Chadli Bendjedid.[3]
target1_text: Abdellah Belhouchet (1924 - Satumba 16, 2003) hafsan sojan Aljeriya ne kuma mai fafutukar kishin ƙasa, wanda aka fi sani da rawar da ya taka a lokacin yakin neman 'yancin kai na Aljeriya da kuma ci gaban rundunar sojojin ƙasar Aljeriya (ANP). [1] Belhouchet ya riƙe muƙamai daban-daban a tsawon aikinsa na soja, ciki har da babban hafsan hafsoshin sojojin ƙasar daga shekarun 1986 zuwa 1988, kuma ya kasance mataimakin ministan tsaro na ƙasa . [2] Har ila yau, ya kasance memba na majalisar ƙasa ta juyin juya halin Aljeriya da majalisar juyin juya hali kuma mai bai wa shugaba Chadli Bendjedid shawara kan harkokin soji. [3]
target2_text: Abdellah Belhouchet (1924 - Satumba 16, 2003) hafsan sojan Aljeriya ne kuma mai fafutukar kishin kasa, wanda aka fi sani da rawar da ya taka a lokacin yakin 'yancin kai na Aljeriya da kuma ci gaban rundunar sojojin kasar Aljeriya (ANP). [1] Belhouchet ya rike mukamai daban-daban a tsawon aikinsa na soja, ciki har da babban hafsan hafsoshin sojojin kasar daga 1986 zuwa 1988, kuma ya kasance mataimakin ministan tsaro na kasa . [2] Har ila yau, ya kasance memba na majalisar kasa ta juyin juya halin Aljeriya da majalisar juyin juya hali kuma mai ba shugaba Chadli Bendjedid shawara kan harkokin soji . [3]

english_source: Following Algeria's independence in 1962, Belhouchet focused on structuring and organizing the ANP, the successor to the ALN. He held several key military positions, including serving as the chief of staff of the ANP from November 22, 1986, until November 1988. In addition, he was appointed deputy minister of National Defense and oversaw the General Inspectorate of the ANP, which underscored his influence within the military hierarchy.[1]

Ya riƙe manyan muƙamai na soja da dama, ciki har da zama shugaban ma’aikatan jam’iyyar ANP daga ranar 22 ga watan Nuwamba, 1986, har zuwa Nuwamba 1988. Bugu da ƙari, an naɗa shi mataimakin ministan tsaro na ƙasa da kuma kula da babban sufeton jam’iyyar ANP, wanda hakan ya nuna tasirinsa a cikin muƙamin soja. [1]

english_source: Colonel Saïd Mohammedi (Arabic: السعيد محمدي; 27 December 1912 – 6 December 1994), also known as Si Nacer, was an Algerian nationalist, soldier and politician.

english_source: Mohammedi was elected at the Congress of Tripoli to be a member of the Political Bureau, responsible for the Education and Public Health sector. Deputy of Tizi Ouzou on 20 September 1962, and he was appointed Minister of Former Mujahedin and War Victims in the first government of Ahmed Ben Bella. On 16 May 1963, he became 2nd vice-president of the Council, and member of the Central Committee and the Political Bureau of the FLN on 24 April 1964. He was dismissed by Ben Bella and lost his ministerial post during the reshuffle of 2 December 1964.
target1_text: An zaɓi Mohammedi a Majalisar Tarabulus don zama memba na Ofishin Siyasa, mai alhakin sashen Ilimi da Kiwon Lafiyar Jama'a. Mataimakin Tizi Ouzou a ranar 20 ga Satumbar 1962, kuma an nada shi ministan tsofin Mujahedin da wadanda yaki ya shafa a gwamnatin farko ta Ahmed Ben Bella . A ranar 16 ga Mayu 1963, ya zama mataimakin shugaban majalisa na 2, kuma memba na kwamitin tsakiya da ofishin siyasa na FLN a ranar 24 ga Afrilu 1964. Ben Bella ya kore shi kuma ya rasa mukaminsa na minista a lokacin sake fasalin 2 Disamba 1964.

english_source: In the 1991 documentary The Algerian Years, Mohammedi detailed the activities of his soldiers who took part in the massacre of Melouza, against the messalists. At the end of his life, he was a supporter of the Islamic Salvation Front, which he saw as a popular movement capable of changing the regime in place.

A karshen rayuwarsa ya kasance mai goyon bayan jam'iyyar ceto ta Musulunci, wadda yake ganin wata kungiya ce ta jama'a da za ta iya sauya tsarin mulki a wurin.

english_source: Ahmed Boumendjel ( born on 22 April 1908[1][2] in Beni Yenni, Tizi Ouzou Province and died on 19 November 1982[3][4]) was an Algerian politician and nationalist.

english_source: He became a member of the Federation of France's National Liberation Front from 1957, then member of the National Council of the Algerian Revolution from 1957 to 1962[6] He then went to Tunisia where he led the newspaper El Moudjahid which appeared in the French language. He is the author of the article known as "The information poisoned", which was a source of controversy between the Tunisian Government and the Provisional Government of the Algerian Republic. It represented the Provisional Government along with Mohamed Seddik Benyahia in Melun talks at June 1960 and participated in the first negotiations in Evian.[7] During the internal crisis that occurred after independence, Boumendjel rallied with Ferhat Abbas to form the Ben Bella group. He was appointed Minister of Public Works in September 1962 to 1963.
target1_text: Ya zama memba na Tarayyar Jam'iyyar 'Yancin Kasar Faransa daga shekarar 1957, sannan ya zama memba na Majalisar kasa ta juyin juya halin Aljeriya daga 1957 zuwa 1962 [1] Daga nan ya tafi Tunisiya inda ya jagoranci jaridar El Moudjahid wadda ta fito cikin harshen Faransanci. Shi ne ya rubuta labarin da aka fi sani da "Bayanan da aka kashe", wanda ya haifar da cece-kuce tsakanin gwamnatin Tunisiya da gwamnatin wucin gadi ta Jamhuriyar Aljeriya. Ta wakilci gwamnatin wucin gadi tare da Mohamed Seddik Benyahia a tattaunawar Melun a watan Yuni 1960 kuma ta shiga cikin tattaunawar farko a Evian . [2] A lokacin rikicin cikin gida da ya faru bayan samun 'yancin kai, Boumendjel ya hada kai da Ferhat Abbas don kafa kungiyar Ben Bella . An nada shi Ministan Ayyukan Jama’a a watan Satumba 1962 zuwa 1963.
target2_text: Ya zama memba na Tarayyar Jam'iyyar 'Yancin Ƙasar Faransa daga shekarar 1957, sannan ya zama memba na Majalisar ƙasa ta juyin juya halin Aljeriya daga shekarun 1957 zuwa 1962 [1] Daga nan ya tafi Tunisiya inda ya jagoranci jaridar El Moudjahid wacce ta fito cikin harshen Faransanci. Shi ne ya rubuta labarin da aka fi sani da "Bayanan da aka kashe", wanda ya haifar da cece-kuce tsakanin gwamnatin Tunisiya da gwamnatin wucin gadi ta Jamhuriyar Aljeriya. Ta wakilci gwamnatin wucin gadi tare da Mohamed Seddik Benyahia a tattaunawar Melun a watan Yuni 1960 kuma ta shiga cikin tattaunawar farko a Evian. [2] A lokacin rikicin cikin gida da ya faru bayan samun 'yancin kai, Boumendjel ya haɗa kai da Ferhat Abbas don kafa kungiyar Ben Bella. An naɗa shi Ministan Ayyukan Jama’a a watan Satumba 1962 zuwa 1963.

english_source: Boulahrouf was also a reader of al-Umma newspaper, organ of the Star of North Africa party, and contributed to the formation of the first groups of Muslim Scouts in the region of Annaba.[3] He also participated in organizing a demonstration of solidarity with the Tunisian Destour Party and was first arrested in 1938. As soon as the Algerian People's Party was dissolved, Boulahrouf's activity took place underground and he worked to broaden the grassroots of the party dissolved. He participated in the founding of the Movement of Friends of the Manifesto and Liberty. He was one of the organizers of the events of May 8, 1945, which earned him to be arrested again to be released after the proclamation of amnesty for political prisoners.
target1_text: Boulahrouf ya kuma kasance mai karanta jaridar al-Umma, kungiyar jam'iyyar Star of North Africa, kuma ya ba da gudunmawa wajen kafa kungiyoyin musulmin Scout na farko a yankin Annaba. [1] Ya kuma shiga cikin shirya zanga-zangar nuna goyon baya da Jam'iyyar Destour ta Tunisiya kuma an kama shi a shekara ta 1938. Da aka ruguje jam'iyyar Aljeriya, Boulahrouf ya fara gudanar da ayyukansa a ƙarƙashin ƙasa, inda ya yi kokarin faɗaɗa tushen jam'iyyar. Ya shiga cikin kafa ƙungiyar Abokan Manifesto da 'Yanci. Yana ɗaya daga cikin waɗanda suka shirya abubuwan da suka faru a ranar 8 ga watan Mayu, 1945, wanda ya sa aka sake kama shi don a sake shi bayan ayyana yin afuwa ga fursunonin siyasa.
target2_text: Boulahrouf ya kuma kasance mai karanta jaridar al-Umma, kungiyar jam'iyyar Star of North Africa, kuma ya ba da gudunmawa wajen kafa kungiyoyin musulmin Scout na farko a yankin Annaba. [1] Ya kuma shiga cikin shirya zanga-zangar nuna goyon baya da Jam'iyyar Destour ta Tunisiya kuma an kama shi a shekara ta 1938. Da aka ruguje jam'iyyar Aljeriya, Boulahrouf ya fara gudanar da ayyukansa a karkashin kasa, inda ya yi kokarin fadada tushen jam'iyyar. Ya shiga cikin kafa kungiyar Abokan Manifesto da 'Yanci . Yana daya daga cikin wadanda suka shirya abubuwan da suka faru a ranar 8 ga Mayu, 1945, wanda ya sa aka sake kama shi don a sake shi bayan ayyana yin afuwa ga fursunonin siyasa.

english_source: At the outbreak of the Revolution, Boulahrouf was in France and joined the ranks of the Front as part of the Federation of France's National Liberation Front to publicize and disseminate the objectives and principles of the Revolution with the French public opinion. To this end, He worked to establish contacts with communist personalities in France, trying to obtain the support of the Communist Party of France, but he failed in his efforts. He also collaborated in the Journal of the Algerian resistance in France and Switzerland.
target1_text: A lokacin ɓullar juyin juya hali, Boulahrouf ya kasance a ƙasar Faransa kuma ya shiga sahun sahun gaba a matsayin wani ɓangare na kungiyar 'yantar da 'yancin ƙasar Faransa don yaɗa da kuma yaɗa manufofin juyin juya halin da ra'ayin al'ummar Faransa. Don haka, ya yi aiki don kulla tuntuɓar mutane masu ra'ayin gurguzu a Faransa, yana ƙoƙarin samun goyon bayan Jam'iyyar Kwaminisanci ta Faransa, amma ya gaza a ƙoƙarinsa. Ya kuma yi aiki tare a cikin Jaridar gwagwarmayar Aljeriya a Faransa da Switzerland.
target2_text: A lokacin bullar juyin juya halin Musulunci, Boulahrouf ya kasance a kasar Faransa kuma ya shiga sahun sahun gaba a matsayin wani bangare na kungiyar 'yantar da 'yancin kasar Faransa don yada da kuma yada manufofin juyin juya halin Musulunci da ra'ayin al'ummar Faransa. Don haka, ya yi aiki don kulla tuntuɓar mutane masu ra'ayin gurguzu a Faransa, yana ƙoƙarin samun goyon bayan Jam'iyyar Kwaminisanci ta Faransa, amma ya gaza a ƙoƙarinsa. Ya kuma yi aiki tare a cikin Jaridar gwagwarmayar Aljeriya a Faransa da Switzerland.

english_source: In 1951, his parliamentary mandate ended, and three years later, an armed rebellion for Algeria's independence erupted led by the Front de libération nationale (FLN), a PPA/MTLD splinter group. In 1956, Lamine Debaghine was made a member of the FLN's exterior delegation (i.e. outside the country) and its shadow parliament, the CNRA, later CCE.[5] Lamine Debaghine was elected minister of foreign affairs in the first lineup of the FLN's government-in-exile, GPRA, under Ferhat Abbas's presidency, holding the post for the period 1958-1960. In this role, he served as a primary spokesman of the FLN to the outside world, and worked to build alliances with the newly independent countries of the Arab world and other regions. However, being outside the country, he had limited authority over the actual armed rebellion of the FLN's armed wing, the Armée de libération nationale (ALN). A Time Magazine article from 1957 described him as Abbas's close collaborator, "Dr. Mohammed Lamine-Debaghine, 40, [the] bitterly anti-French veteran nationalist who is subject to bouts of depression caused by attacks of neuralgia that partially paralyze his face."[6] As an ally of Abane Ramdane, he was later sidelined by Ramdane's rivals, including Ahmed Ben Bella and others, and he was excluded from the GPRA's two following ministerial lineups, as well as from any important role in post-independence politics.[3]
target1_text: A shekara ta 1951, wa'adinsa na majalisa ya ƙare, kuma bayan shekaru uku, tawaye da makamai don 'yancin kai na Aljeriya ya ɓarke a ƙarƙashin jagorancin Front de Liberation Nationale (FLN), ƙungiyar PPA/MTLD. A cikin shekarar 1956, Lamine Debaghine ya zama memba na wakilan FLN na waje (watau a wajen ƙasar) da majalisar inuwarta, CNRA, daga baya CCE. [1] An zaɓi Lamine Debaghine a matsayin ministar harkokin waje a cikin jerin gwano na farko na gwamnatin FLN na gudun hijira, GPRA, ƙarƙashin shugabancin Ferhat Abbas, tana riƙe da muƙamin na tsawon lokaci 1958-1960. A cikin wannan rawar, ya yi aiki a matsayin mai magana da yawun FLN na farko ga ƙasashen waje, kuma ya yi aiki don kulla kawance da sabbin ƙasashen Larabawa masu cin gashin kansu da sauran yankuna. Duk da haka, kasancewarsa a wajen ƙasar, yana da iyakacin iko kan ainihin tawayen da ke ɗauke da makamai na reshen FLN, Armée de Liberation nationale (ALN). Wani labarin da Mujallar Time ta buga a shekarar 1957 ta bayyana shi a matsayin na kusa da Abbas, "Dr. Mohammed Lamine-Debaghine, mai shekaru 40, [wanda] tsohon sojan kishin ƙasa na Faransa wanda ke fama da tsananin damuwa sakamakon hare-haren neuralgia wanda wani ɓangare ya gurgunta fuskarsa." [2] A matsayinsa na aminin Abane Ramdane, daga baya abokan hamayyar Ramdane, ciki har da Ahmed Ben Bella da sauran su suka yi watsi da shi, kuma an cire shi daga jerin ministoci biyu na GPRA, da kuma shiga duk wata muhimmiyar rawa a siyasar bayan samun 'yancin kai. [3]
target2_text: A shekara ta 1951, wa'adinsa na majalisa ya ƙare, kuma bayan shekaru uku, tawaye da makamai don 'yancin kai na Aljeriya ya barke a karkashin jagorancin Front de Liberation Nationale (FLN), ƙungiyar PPA/MTLD. A cikin 1956, Lamine Debaghine ya zama memba na wakilan FLN na waje (watau a wajen ƙasar) da majalisar inuwarta, CNRA, daga baya CCE. [1] An zabi Lamine Debaghine a matsayin ministar harkokin waje a cikin jerin gwano na farko na gwamnatin FLN na gudun hijira, GPRA, karkashin shugabancin Ferhat Abbas, tana rike da mukamin na tsawon lokaci 1958-1960. A cikin wannan rawar, ya yi aiki a matsayin mai magana da yawun FLN na farko ga kasashen waje, kuma ya yi aiki don kulla kawance da sabbin kasashen Larabawa masu cin gashin kansu da sauran yankuna. Duk da haka, kasancewarsa a wajen ƙasar, yana da iyakacin iko kan ainihin tawayen da ke ɗauke da makamai na reshen FLN, Armée de Liberation nationale (ALN). Wani labarin da Mujallar Time ta buga a shekarar 1957 ta bayyana shi a matsayin na kusa da Abbas, "Dr. Mohammed Lamine-Debaghine, mai shekaru 40, [wanda] tsohon sojan kishin kasa na Faransa wanda ke fama da tsananin damuwa sakamakon hare-haren neuralgia wanda wani bangare ya gurgunta fuskarsa." [2] A matsayinsa na aminin Abane Ramdane, daga baya abokan hamayyar Ramdane, ciki har da Ahmed Ben Bella da sauran su suka yi watsi da shi, kuma an cire shi daga jerin ministoci biyu na GPRA, da kuma shiga duk wata muhimmiyar rawa a siyasar bayan samun yancin kai. [3]

english_source: In 1921 Latif founded the United Tribes Society; an organisation that called for an independent Sudan in which power would be shared by tribal and religious leaders. Latif gained prominence in 1922, after he wrote an article for the al-Hadarah newspaper supporting the cause of sedition and Sudanese nationalism. In the article, titled "Claim of the Sudanese Nation," Latif pressed for Sudanese self-determination, more education, an end to the sugar monopoly, and higher posts for Sudanese in the Anglo-Egyptian administration.[4]
target1_text: A cikin 1921 Latif ya kafa United Tribes Society ; kungiyar da ta yi kira ga kasar Sudan mai cin gashin kanta wacce shugabannin kabilu da na addini za su raba madafun iko. A shekarar 1922 ne Latif ya yi fice, bayan ya rubuta wata kasida ga jaridar al-Hadarah da ke goyon bayan yunkurin tayar da fitina da kishin kasar Sudan. A cikin labarin, mai taken "Da'awar al'ummar Sudan," Laf ya matsa don cin gashin kai na Sudan, ƙarin ilimi, kawo karshen tsarin sukari, da manyan mukamai ga Sudan a cikin gwamnatin Anglo-Masar . [1]
target2_text: A cikin shekarar 1921 Latif ya kafa United Tribes Society ; kungiyar da ta yi kira ga ƙasar Sudan mai cin gashin kanta wacce shugabannin ƙabilu da na addini za su raba madafun iko. A shekarar 1922 ne Latif ya yi fice, bayan ya rubuta wata kasida ga jaridar al-Hadarah da ke goyon bayan yunkurin tayar da fitina da kishin ƙasar Sudan. A cikin labarin, mai taken "Da'awar al'ummar Sudan," Laf ya matsa don cin gashin kai na Sudan, ƙarin ilimi, kawo karshen tsarin sukari, da manyan muƙamai ga Sudan a cikin gwamnatin Anglo-Masar. [1]

english_source: Latif's background, as both a soldier and a member of Sudan's black African community, meant he was able to reach out, through personal contacts, with a massive swath of the population, particularly the segments needed to for a political struggle. His military background meant he was able to spread his message of anti-colonialism to officers and soldiers, whilst his black African background meant he could politicize the de-tribalised and growing urban black community in the Khartoum-Khartoum North-Omdurman area. This section of the population; the newly urbanised and de-triblaised southern Sudanese black community, had been seen by the British administration as a segment as especially vulnerable to politicization.[1]
target1_text: Asalin Latif, a matsayinsa na soja da kuma memba na al'ummar Afirka baƙaƙen fata na ƙasar Sudan, na nufin ya iya tuntuɓar juna, ta hanyar tuntuɓar juna, tare da ɗimbin jama'a, musamman sassan da ake buƙata domin gwagwarmayar siyasa. Tarihinsa na soja yana nufin ya iya isar da sakonsa na kin jinin mulkin mallaka ga hafsoshi da sojoji, alhali baƙar fata na Afirka na nufin zai iya siyasantar da al'ummar baƙaƙen fata na birane masu ƙabilu da karuwa a yankin Khartoum - Khartoum North - Omdurman. Wannan ɓangare na yawan jama'a; sabuwar al'ummar baƙaƙen fata na kudancin Sudan da aka yi birane da ƙabilu, gwamnatin Birtaniyya ta ɗauka a matsayin wani ɓangare da ke da rauni musamman ga siyasa. [1]
target2_text: Asalin Latif, a matsayinsa na soja da kuma memba na al'ummar Afirka bakaken fata na kasar Sudan, na nufin ya iya tuntubar juna, ta hanyar tuntubar juna, tare da dimbin jama'a, musamman sassan da ake bukata domin gwagwarmayar siyasa. Tarihinsa na soja yana nufin ya iya isar da sakonsa na kin jinin mulkin mallaka ga hafsoshi da sojoji, alhali bakar fata na Afirka na nufin zai iya siyasantar da al'ummar bakaken fata na birane masu kabilanci da karuwa a yankin Khartoum - Khartoum North - Omdurman . Wannan bangare na yawan jama'a; sabuwar al'ummar bakaken fata na kudancin Sudan da aka yi birane da kabilanci, gwamnatin Birtaniyya ta dauka a matsayin wani bangare da ke da rauni musamman ga siyasa. [1]

english_source: For his part in the 1924 Khartoum revolt Latif was sentenced to 7 years imprisonment. Following the completion of his sentence he was not released, but transferred to a mental hospital in Cairo, where he died years later in 1948.[5]
target1_text: A nasa bangare a cikin tawayen Khartoum a 1924 an yanke wa Latif hukuncin daurin shekaru 7 a gidan yari. Bayan kammala hukuncin da aka yanke masa ba a sake shi ba, amma an mayar da shi asibitin tabin hankali a birnin Alkahira, inda ya rasu bayan shekaru a 1948. [1]
target2_text: A nasa ɓangare a cikin tawayen Khartoum a shekarar 1924 an yanke wa Latif hukuncin ɗaurin daurin shekaru 7 a gidan yari. Bayan kammala hukuncin da aka yanke masa ba a sake shi ba, amma an mayar da shi asibitin tabin hankali a birnin Alkahira, inda ya rasu bayan shekaru a 1948. [1]

english_source: The protest was immediately and bloodily suppressed by the colonial forces. The massacre and ensuing disturbances has been named the Zemla Intifada, or uprising, after the place the demonstration was held. A nationwide hunt for members of the movement followed: Bassiri himself was arrested and "disappeared" in Spanish custody. He is assumed to have been killed by his jailors, and is counted by the present-day Sahrawi nationalist movement as its first modern-day martyr (Morocco, which claims Western Sahara as its own province, has also similarly attempted to appropriate his legacy, arguing that the Harakat Tahrir was primarily interested in ejecting Spain, not in achieving independence as a nation separate from Morocco).
target1_text: Nan take sojojin 'yan mulkin mallaka suka murkushe zanga-zangar. An sanya wa kisan kiyashi da hargitsin sunan Zemla Intifada, ko tayar da zaune tsaye, bayan wurin da aka gudanar da zanga-zangar. Farautar 'yan kungiyar a duk faɗin ƙasar ya biyo baya: An kama Bassiri da kansa kuma "ya bace" a hannun sipanya. Ana kyautata zaton cewa fursunonin gidan yari ne suka kashe shi, kuma kungiyar ‘yan kishin ƙasa ta Sahrawi a yau ta kirga shi a matsayin shahidin farko na wannan zamani (Moroco, wacce ke ikirarin yammacin Sahara a matsayin lardinta, ita ma ta yi yunƙurin dacewa da gadonsa, yana mai cewa Harakat Tahrir ya fi sha’awar korar Spain, ba don samun ‘yancin kai a matsayin al’ummar da ta rabu da Maroko ba).
target2_text: Nan take sojojin mulkin mallaka suka murkushe zanga-zangar. An sanya wa kisan kiyashi da hargitsin sunan Zemla Intifada, ko tayar da zaune tsaye, bayan wurin da aka gudanar da zanga-zangar. Farautar 'yan kungiyar a duk fadin kasar ya biyo baya: An kama Bassiri da kansa kuma " ya bace " a hannun Mutanen Espanya. Ana kyautata zaton cewa fursunonin gidan yari ne suka kashe shi, kuma kungiyar ‘yan kishin kasa ta Sahrawi a yau ta kirga shi a matsayin shahidin farko na wannan zamani (Moroco, wacce ke ikirarin yammacin Sahara a matsayin lardinta, ita ma ta yi yunƙurin dacewa da gadonsa, yana mai cewa Harakat Tahrir ya fi sha’awar korar Spain, ba don samun ‘yancin kai a matsayin al’ummar da ta rabu da Maroko ba).

english_source: In U.S, Ojike lectured extensively[7] about his experience living in an African cultural environment and his views about colonialism and racism. He wrote rejoinders to articles that portrayed Africa in a negative light[8] in addition to writing two books and a pamphlet on African culture. His books explained cultural practices and debunked the notion of African inferiority.[9] In My Africa, he introduced Americans to his culture partly as a way to promote a cultural relationship between the two cultures. In America, he embraced and learned about a democratic system of governance. He was also passionate about cultural and political nationalism, he rejected colonialism as detrimental to democracy and the idea that African society is a passing culture.[8] Though a cultural nationalist, Ojike did not believe in rejection of all forms of Western culture but the notion of 'cultural plasticity' where Africans borrow certain aspects of a foreign culture but still retain the core social and political values that promotes stability, progress and dignity.[9]
target1_text: A Amurka, Ojike ya yi lacca sosai [ 7 ] game da kwarewarsa ta rayuwa a cikin yanayin al'adun Afirka da ra'ayinsa game da 'yan mulkin mallaka da wariyar launin fata. Ya rubuta sake haɗawa zuwa labaran da ke nuna Afirka a cikin mummunan haske [ 8 ] ban da rubuta littattafai biyu da ƙasida kan al'adun Afirka. Littattafansa sun bayyana ayyukan al'adu kuma sun yi watsi da ra'ayi na kasan Afirka. [ 9 ] A cikin Afirka tawa, ya gabatar da jama'ar Amirka ga al'adunsa wani ɓangare a matsayin hanyar inganta dangantakar al'adu tsakanin al'adun biyu. A Amurka, ya rungumi kuma ya koyi tsarin mulkin dimokradiyya. Ya kuma kasance mai kishin al'adu da siyasa, ya ki amincewa da 'yan mulkin mallaka a matsayin illa ga dimokuradiyya da ra'ayin cewa al'ummar Afirka al'ada ce mai wucewa. [ 8 ] Ko da yake ɗan kishin ƙasa na al'adu, Ojike bai yarda da kin amincewa da duk wani nau'i na al'adun Yammacin Turai ba amma ra'ayi na 'al'adar al'ada' inda 'yan Afirka ke aro wasu al'amuran al'adun ƙasashen waje amma har yanzu suna riƙe da ainihin dabi'un zamantakewa da siyasa waɗanda ke inganta zaman lafiya, ci gaba da mutunci. [ 9 ]

english_source: Ojike believed in selective importation and imitation. He wanted Africa to be economical free and politically independent. One of his slogans was "boycott the boycottables",[15] a reduction in consumption of Western goods but investments in education and other economically productive ventures.[15] He preferred palm wine to imported gin and promoted the wearing of African clothes among elites civil servants. He voiced support for the introduction of an African national costume and supported African music and dance, his interest in African music led the founding of the All African Dance Association.
target1_text: Ojike ya yi imani da shigo da zaɓaɓɓu da kwaikwayo. Ya so Afirka ta kasance mai 'yanci ta fuskar tattalin arziki da siyasa. Ɗaya daga cikin takensa shine "kauracewa ƙauracewa ƙauracewa", [ 15 ] rage yawan amfani da kayayyakin Yammacin Turai amma saka hannun jari a fannin ilimi da sauran harkokin tattalin arziki. [ 15 ] Ya fi son giyar dabino fiye da gin da ake shigo da shi daga kasashen waje kuma ya inganta sanya tufafin Afirka a tsakanin manyan ma'aikatan gwamnati. Ya nuna goyon bayansa ga bullo da wata rigar kasa ta Afirka tare da tallafawa kade-kade da raye-rayen Afirka, sha'awarsa ga wakokin Afirka ne ya jagoranci kafa kungiyar raye-rayen Afirka ta Duka.

english_source: In December 1934, a small group of nationalist leaders formed the Moroccan Action Committee. They submitted the Plan of Reforms to the sultan, resident general and the French foreign ministry, calling for a return to indirect rule, unification of judicial systems of Morocco, admission of Moroccans to government positions, elimination of the judicial powers of qaids and pashas, and the establishment of representative councils. The Plan of Reforms was rejected by the French government, causing a split in the nationalist movement. A number of violent incidents in September 1937 caused the French administration to suppress the Istiqlal Party and arrest its leaders, including Allal al-Fassi.[1]
target1_text: A cikin watan Disamba 1934, wani ƙaramin rukuni na shugabannin kishin ƙasa sun kafa kwamitin Aiki na Moroccan. Sun gabatar da shirin gyare-gyare ga Sarkin Musulmi, Janar mazauna da ma'aikatar harkokin wajen Faransa, suna kira da a mayar da mulkin kai tsaye, haɗewar tsarin shari'a na Maroko, shigar da 'yan Morocco a muƙaman gwamnati, kawar da ikon shari'a na Qaids da Pashas, da kafa majalisar wakilai. Gwamnatin Faransa ta ki amincewa da shirin na sake fasalin, wanda ya haifar da rarrabuwar kawuna a harkar kishin ƙasa. Tashin hankali da dama a cikin watan Satumban 1937 ya sa gwamnatin Faransa ta danne jam'iyyar Istiqlal tare da kame shugabanninta ciki har da Allal al-Fassi. [1]

Gwamnatin Faransa ta ki amincewa da shirin na sake fasalin, wanda ya haifar da rarrabuwar kawuna a harkar kishin kasa. Tashin hankali da dama a cikin watan Satumban 1937 ya sa gwamnatin Faransa ta danne jam'iyyar Istiqlal tare da kame shugabanninta ciki har da Allal al-Fassi. [1]

english_source: The Massacre of April 7, 1947 (popularly in Moroccan Arabic: ضربة ساليغان darbat saligan 'Strike of the Senegalese,' more officially: مجزرة 7 أبريل 'Massacre of April 7' or أحداث 7 أبريل 'Events of April 7') was a massacre of working-class Moroccan civilians in Casablanca committed by Senegalese Tirailleurs in the service of the French colonial empire.[2][3] The attack was instigated by the French authorities in an attempt to disrupt the visit of Sultan Mohammad V to the Tangier International Zone to deliver the Tangier Speech demanding the independence of Morocco and the unification of its territories.[4]
target1_text: Kisan Kisan 7 ga Afrilu, 1947 (wanda aka fi sani da Moroccan darbat saligan 'Yajin Senegal,' a hukumance: مجزرة 7 أبريل 'Kisan Kisan 7 ga watan Afrilu' ko أحداث 7 أبريل 'Abubuwan da suka faru a ranar 7 ga watan Afrilu') kisan kiyashi ne na fararen hula 'yan Morocco masu aiki a Casablanca da Tirailleurs na Senegal suka yi a cikin hidimar daular Faransa ta mulkin mallaka. [1] [2] Hukumomin Faransa ne suka kaddamar da harin da nufin kawo cikas ga ziyarar da Sultan Mohammad V ya kai yankin Tangier na ƙasa da ƙasa domin gabatar da jawabin Tangier na neman ‘yancin kan ƙasar Maroko da kuma haɗe yankunanta. [3]
target2_text: Kisan Kisan 7 ga Afrilu, 1947 (wanda aka fi sani da Moroccan Arabic darbat saligan 'Yajin Senegal,' a hukumance: مجزرة 7 أبريل 'Kisan Kisan 7 ga Afrilu' ko أحداث 7 أبريل 'Abubuwan da suka faru a ranar 7 ga Afrilu') kisan kiyashi ne na fararen hula 'yan Morocco masu aiki a Casablanca da Tirailleurs na Senegal suka yi a cikin hidimar daular Faransa ta mulkin mallaka . [1] [2] Hukumomin Faransa ne suka kaddamar da harin da nufin kawo cikas ga ziyarar da Sultan Mohammad V ya kai yankin Tangier na kasa da kasa domin gabatar da jawabin Tangier na neman ‘yancin kan kasar Maroko da kuma hade yankunanta. [3]

english_source: In the days leading up to the sultan's speech, French colonial forces in Casablanca, specifically Senegalese Tirailleurs serving the French colonial empire, carried out a massacre of working class Moroccans. The massacre lasted for about 24 hours from 7–8 April 1947, as the tirailleurs fired randomly into residential buildings in working-class neighborhoods, killing 180 Moroccan civilians. The conflict was instigated in attempt to sabotage the Sultan's journey to Tangier, though after having returned to Casablanca to comfort the families of the victims, the Sultan then proceeded to Tangier to deliver the historic speech.[5][6]
target1_text: A kwanakin baya gabanin jawabin Sarkin, sojojin Faransa na mulkin mallaka a Casablanca, musamman Tirailleurs na Senegal da ke yiwa daular Faransa mulkin mallaka, sun aiwatar da kisan kiyashi kan 'yan Morocco masu aiki. Kisan kiyashin ya dauki kusan awanni 24 daga 7-8 ga Afrilu 1947, yayin da ‘yan tirailleurs suka yi harbi ba kakkautawa a cikin gine-ginen zama a unguwannin masu aiki, inda suka kashe farar hula 180 na Morocco. Rikicin dai ya taso ne da nufin yi wa tafiyar Sarkin Musulmi zagon kasa zuwa Tangier, ko da yake bayan ya koma Casablanca domin ta'aziyyar iyalan wadanda lamarin ya shafa, Sarkin Musulmi ya zarce zuwa Tangier don gabatar da jawabi mai cike da tarihi. [1] [2]
target2_text: A kwanakin baya gabanin jawabin Sarkin, sojojin Faransa na mulkin mallaka a Casablanca, musamman Tirailleurs na Senegal da ke yiwa daular Faransa ta 'yan mulkin mallaka aiki , sun aiwatar da kisan kiyashi kan 'yan Morocco masu aiki. Kisan kiyashin ya ɗauki kusan awanni 24 daga ranakun 7-8 ga watan Afrilu 1947, yayin da ‘yan tirailleurs suka yi harbi ba kakkautawa a cikin gine-ginen zama a unguwannin masu aiki, inda suka kashe farar hula 180 na Morocco. Rikicin dai ya taso ne da nufin yi wa tafiyar Sarkin Musulmi zagon ƙasa zuwa Tangier, ko da yake bayan ya koma Casablanca domin ta'aziyyar iyalan waɗanda lamarin ya shafa, Sarkin Musulmi ya zarce zuwa Tangier don gabatar da jawabi mai cike da tarihi. [1] [2]

english_source: Assou Oubasslam was born in 1890[1][2][3] in Ksar Taghya, south of Tinghir. His full name was Aissa Ou Ali n Ait Baslam. His father was the leader (amghar n-tmazirt) of the Ilimshan clan of the Ait Atta.[4] He was a Sufi, a charismatic leader, influenced by the leadership role of his father. In 1919, he was appointed as the tribal leader of "Ilm Chan". As the French colonial occupation advanced and posed a threat to the eastern High Atlas, he took command of the Amazigh resistance against the French colonizers and their collaborators. Assou Oubasslam engaged in numerous battles, most notably the Battle of Bougafer in 1933, where he achieved a significant victory against the French.
target1_text: An haifi Assou Oubasslam a shekara ta 1890 [1] [2] [3] a Ksar Taghya, kudu da Tinghir . Cikakken sunansa Aissa Ou Ali n Ait Baslam . Mahaifinsa shi ne shugaban ( amghar n-tmazirt ) na gidan Ilimshan na Ait Atta. [4] Shi Sufi ne, shugaba mai kwarjini, wanda aikin mahaifinsa ya rinjayi shi. A 1919, an nada shi a matsayin shugaban kabilar "Ilm Chan". Yayin da mulkin mallaka na Faransa ya ci gaba kuma yana yin barazana ga Gabashin High Atlas, ya dauki kwamandan tsayin daka na Amazigh a kan masu mulkin mallaka na Faransa da masu haɗin gwiwa. Assou Oubasslam ya sha fadace-fadace da dama, musamman yakin Bougafer a shekarar 1933, inda ya samu gagarumar nasara a kan Faransawa.

A shekarar 1919, an naɗa shi a matsayin shugaban kabilar "Ilm Chan". Assou Oubasslam ya sha faɗace-faɗace da dama, musamman yakin Bougafer a shekarar 1933, inda ya samu gagarumar nasara a kan Faransawa.

english_source: In 1932, the Ait Atta tribes gathered at Ksar Taghya and elected Assou Oubasslam as the overall leader of the jihad. With much of Morocco under French occupation, colonial forces attempted to infiltrate southeastern Morocco and subjugate the Saghro region and Ait Atta tribes. The resistance of Assou Oubasslam served as a barrier to their expansion. Assou Oubslam led the Islamic resistance against French colonization, engaging in battles that decisively favored the resistance. He inflicted significant losses on the occupying forces and lured the invaders into exhausting battles at locations such as "Taouza", "Al Nif", "Tazarin" and "Naqoub."[5] In 1933, after multiple confrontations, the Battle of Bogafar erupted in the Saghro, Asef Mulul, and Mount Baddou regions in the eastern High Atlas. It ended with the victory of the resistance over the French colonizers.
target1_text: A cikin shekarar 1932, kabilun Ait Atta sun taru a Ksar Taghya suka zaɓi Assou Oubasslam a matsayin babban jagoran jihadi. Da akasarin ƙasar Maroko ƙarƙashin mamayar Faransa, sojojin ‘yan mulkin mallaka sun yi yunkurin kutsawa kudu maso gabashin Maroko tare da fatattakar yankin Saghro da kuma ƙabilun Ait Atta. Juriyar da Assou Oubasslam ya yi ya zama shinge ga faɗaɗa su. Assou Oubslam ya jagoranci gwagwarmayar Islama a kan turawan mulkin mallaka na Faransa, inda ya shiga faɗace-faɗacen da suka nuna goyon baya ga tsayin daka. Ya yi hasarar gagarumar hasarar sojojin mamaya tare da jan hankalin maharan zuwa ga gumurzun faɗace-faɗace a wurare kamar "Taouza", "Al Nif", "Tazarin" da "Naqoub." [1] A cikin shekarar 1933, bayan fafatawar da yawa, yakin Bogafar ya ɓarke a yankunan Saghro, Asef Mulul, da Dutsen Baddou a gabashin High Atlas. Ya kare ne da nasarar tirjiya a kan Turawan mulkin mallaka na Faransa.

english_source: Thousands of Moroccans lost their lives in this battle, and the French forces employed systematic genocide. The civilian casualties in Bougafer were estimated at four thousand, including children and women.[1] The resistance of Assou Oubasslam only surrendered on March 25, 1933,[2] after enduring a prolonged siege by land and air. The resistance of Assou Oubasslam came to an end.
target1_text: Dubban 'yan Moroko ne suka rasa rayukansu a wannan yakin, kuma sojojin Faransa sun yi amfani da kisan kare dangi. Fararen hula da aka kashe a Bougafer sun kai dubu huɗu, da suka haɗa da yara da mata. [1] Juriya na Assou Oubasslam ya miƙa wuya ne kawai a ranar 25 ga watan Maris, 1933, [2] bayan ya jimre da tsayin daka ta ƙasa da iska. Juriyar Assou Oubasslam ta zo ƙarshe.

english_source: Mehdi Bennouna was born in Tetouan, Morocco. His father was Hajj Abdelsalam, the legendary "father of Moroccan nationalism". He left Morocco for Nablus in Palestine at the age of eleven, without his parents, and began high school in 1929 at the Najah School.
target1_text: An haifi Mehdi Bennouna a Tetouan, Morocco. Mahaifinsa shi ne Hajj Abdelsalam, mashahurin "uban kishin ƙasa na Moroko". Ya bar Maroko zuwa Nablus a ƙasar Falasɗinu yana ɗan shekara sha ɗaya, ba tare da iyayensa ba, ya fara makarantar sakandare a shekarar 1929 a makarantar Najah.
target2_text: An haifi Mehdi Bennouna a Tetouan, Morocco. Mahaifinsa shi ne Hajj Abdelsalam, mashahurin "uban kishin kasa na Moroko". Ya bar Maroko zuwa Nablus a kasar Falasdinu yana dan shekara sha daya, ba tare da iyayensa ba, ya fara makarantar sakandare a shekarar 1929 a makarantar Najah.

english_source: The Union Leagues promoted militia-like organizations in which the Black people banded together to protect themselves from being picked off one-by-one by harassers. Members were not allowed to vote the Democratic ticket.[15] The Union Leagues and similar groups came under violent assault from the KKK after 1869, and largely collapsed. Later efforts to revive the Union League failed.[16]
target1_text: Kungiyoyin Tarayyar Tarayyar sun inganta kungiyoyi masu kama da 'yan bindiga inda baƙar fata suka haɗu don kare kansu daga masu tayar da hankali. Ba a yarda membobin su jefa kuri'a kan tikitin Democrat ba.[1] Kungiyar Tarayyar Tarayya da irin waɗannan kungiyoyi sun fuskanci mummunan hari daga KKK bayan 1869, kuma sun rushe. Ƙoƙarin da aka yi daga baya don farfado da Union League ya gaza.[2]

english_source: He settled in Casablanca in 1952 and co-founded the Moroccan Secret Organization. Armed with a revolver, he had a reputation for being merciless with the French and those loyal to them. He was arrested in 1954, but was able to escape after 40 days of torture.

english_source: Passionate about soccer, Zarqtuni played for the Mawludiat Bou Tawiil Club (نادي مولودية بوطويل) in 1948 and recruited the youth of the medina. He was made the manager of a championship tournament for clubs representing different neighborhoods in Casablanca. Certain athletic organizations, such as the Free Soccer League, which organized the neighborhood championship, had nationalist leanings. From this league, many notable nationalists, such as Abdeslam Bennani (fr), Abderrahman el-Youssoufi, Abderrahman Belmejdoub (fr), and others rose up.
target1_text: Mai sha'awar ƙwallon ƙafa, Zarqtuni ya taka leda a Mawludiat Bou Tawiil Club ( نادي مولودية بوطويل ) a 1948 kuma ya dauki matasan madina aiki. An nada shi manajan gasar zakarun kungiyoyin da ke wakiltar unguwanni daban-daban a Casablanca. Wasu kungiyoyin wasanni, irin su Free Soccer League, wadanda suka shirya gasar zakarun unguwanni, suna da kishin kasa. Daga wannan gasar, manyan masu kishin kasa da yawa, irin su Abdeslam Bennani ( fr ), Abderrahman el-Youssoufi, Abderrahman Belmejdoub ( fr ), da sauransu sun tashi.
target2_text: Mai sha'awar ƙwallon ƙafa, Zarqtuni ya taka leda a Mawludiat Bou Tawiil Club ( نادي مولودية بوطويل ) a shekarar 1948 kuma ya ɗauki matasan madina aiki. An naɗa shi manajan gasar zakarun kungiyoyin da ke wakiltar unguwanni daban-daban a Casablanca. Wasu kungiyoyin wasanni, irin su Free Soccer League, waɗanda suka shirya gasar zakarun unguwanni, suna da kishin ƙasa. english_source: After the revolution of 1969 many Libyan nationals fled from Libya, resulting in the establishment of a Libyan diaspora across the world in North America, Europe and the MENA region, In particular, Libyan immigration to Tunisia is a long-term phenomenon.[15][16] During the 2011 revolution, there was support for and part taking in the revolution by Libyan people across the world.[17] The diaspora shared a common feeling of one nation, of connectedness and of belonging to one community.[18] Social media was an important factor in making this possible.[18]
target1_text: Bayan juyin juya hali na shekarar 1969 'yan ƙasar Libya da dama sun yi gudun hijira daga ƙasar Libya, lamarin da ya haifar da kafa 'yan gudun hijirar Libya a faɗin duniya a Arewacin Amirka, Turai da kuma yankin MENA, musamman shige da ficen Libya zuwa Tunisiya wani lamari ne na dogon lokaci. [1] [2] A lokacin juyin juya halin 2011, an sami goyon baya da kuma shiga cikin juyin juya halin da mutanen Libya suka yi a faɗin duniya. [3] Mutanen da ke zaune a waje suna da ra'ayi iri ɗaya na al'umma ɗaya, haɗin kai da kasancewar al'umma ɗaya. [4] Kafofin watsa labarun sun kasance muhimmin al'amari don tabbatar da hakan. [4]

english_source: He fought for the Ottoman cause against the Italians did during the Italo-Turkish War, but after the conclusion of the 1912 peace treaty, he led a revolt against an Italian column at Sirte. With outbreak of World War I, the Italians withdrew from Misrata. Seeing the advantage, he later took part in the battle of Gasr Bu Hadi against the Italians. For several years, he succeeded of strengthening the town of Misrata as a safe haven for Ottoman forces and an autonomous political district. In 1916, his troops clashed with Senussi forces sent to Sirte to collect taxes from the local population.[2] He is an ancestor of Abdulrahman Sewehli.
target1_text: Ya yi yaƙi da Daular Usmaniyya da Italiyanci a lokacin Yaƙin Italo-Turkiyya, amma bayan kammala yarjejeniyar zaman lafiya ta 1912, ya jagoranci tawaye ga rukunin Italiyanci a Sirte. Da barkewar yakin duniya na daya, Italiyawa sun janye daga Misrata. Ganin wannan fa'ida, daga baya ya shiga yakin Gasr Bu Hadi da Italiya. Shekaru da dama, ya yi nasarar karfafa garin Misrata a matsayin mafaka ga dakarun Ottoman da gundumar siyasa mai cin gashin kanta. A cikin 1916, sojojinsa sun yi arangama da sojojin Senussi da aka aika zuwa Sirte don karbar haraji daga jama'ar yankin. [1] Kakan Abdulrahman Sewehli ne .

Da ɓarkewar yakin duniya na ɗaya, Italiyawa sun janye daga Misrata. Ganin wannan fa'ida, daga baya ya shiga yakin Gasr Bu Hadi da Italiya. Shekaru da dama, ya yi nasarar karfafa garin Misrata a matsayin mafaka ga dakarun Ottoman da gundumar siyasa mai cin gashin kanta. A cikin shekarar 1916, sojojinsa sun yi arangama da sojojin Senussi da aka aika zuwa Sirte don karɓar haraji daga jama'ar yankin. [1] Kakan Abdulrahman Sewehli ne.

english_source: Leftist military officers overthrew the Caetano government in Portugal in the Carnation Revolution on 25 April 1974. The MPLA, FNLA and UNITA all negotiated peace agreements with the transitional Portuguese government and began to fight one another for control of the Angolan capital, Luanda, and for the rest the country. Holden Roberto, Agostinho Neto, and Jonas Savimbi met in Bukavu, Zaire, in July and agreed to negotiate with the Portuguese as one political entity. They met again in Mombasa, Kenya, on 5 January 1975, agreed to stop fighting one another, and outlined a joint negotiating position on a new constitution. They met for a third time in Alvor, Portugal from January 10–15 and signed what became known as the Alvor Agreement.[1]
target1_text: Jami'an soji na hagu sun hambarar da gwamnatin Caetano a Portugal a cikin juyin juya halin Carnation a ranar 25 ga watan Afrilu 1974. MPLA, FNLA da UNITA duk sun yi shawarwari kan yarjejeniyoyin zaman lafiya da gwamnatin rikon kwarya ta Portugal tare da fara fafatawa da juna domin samun iko da babban birnin Angola, Luanda, da ma sauran ƙasar. Holden Roberto, Agostinho Neto, da Jonas Savimbi sun haɗu a Bukavu, Zaire, a watan Yuli kuma sun amince su yi shawarwari tare da Portuguese a matsayin ƙungiya ɗaya na siyasa. Sun sake haɗuwa a birnin Mombasa na ƙasar Kenya a ranar 5 ga watan Janairun 1975, sun amince su daina faɗa da juna, tare da bayyana matsayar yin shawarwarin haɗin gwiwa kan sabon kundin tsarin mulki. Sun haɗu a karo na uku a Alvor, Portugal daga watan Janairu 10–15 kuma sun sanya hannu kan abin da aka sani da Yarjejeniyar Alvor. [1]
target2_text: Jami'an soji na hagu sun hambarar da gwamnatin Caetano a Portugal a cikin juyin juya halin Carnation a ranar 25 ga Afrilu 1974. MPLA, FNLA da UNITA duk sun yi shawarwari kan yarjejeniyoyin zaman lafiya da gwamnatin rikon kwarya ta Portugal tare da fara fafatawa da juna domin samun iko da babban birnin Angola, Luanda, da ma sauran kasar. Holden Roberto, Agostinho Neto, da Jonas Savimbi sun hadu a Bukavu, Zaire, a watan Yuli kuma sun amince su yi shawarwari tare da Portuguese a matsayin ƙungiya ɗaya na siyasa. Sun sake haduwa a birnin Mombasa na kasar Kenya a ranar 5 ga Janairun 1975, sun amince su daina fada da juna, tare da bayyana matsayar yin shawarwarin hadin gwiwa kan sabon kundin tsarin mulki. Sun hadu a karo na uku a Alvor, Portugal daga Janairu 10–15 kuma sun sanya hannu kan abin da aka sani da Yarjejeniyar Alvor. [1]

english_source: The parties agreed to hold elections for the National Assembly of Angola in October 1975. From 31 January 1975 to independence, a transitional government consisting of the Portuguese High Commissioner Admiral Rosa Coutinho and a Prime Ministerial Council (PMC) would rule. The PMC consisted of three representatives, one from each Angolan party to the agreement, with a rotating premiership among the representatives. Every PMC decision required two-thirds support. The twelve ministries were divided among the Angolan parties and the Portuguese government, three for each. The author Witney Wright Schneidman criticised that provision in Engaging Africa: Washington and the Fall of Portugal's Colonial Empire for ensuring a "virtual paralysis in executive authority". The Bureau of Intelligence and Research cautioned that an excessive desire to preserve the balance of power in the agreement restricted the transitional Angolan government's ability to function.[1][2][3]
target1_text: Jam’iyyun sun amince da gudanar da zaɓen ‘yan majalisar dokokin Angola a watan Oktoban shekarar 1975. Daga ranar 31 ga watan Janairu 1975 zuwa 'yancin kai, gwamnatin riƙon kwarya da ta kunshi Babban Kwamishinan Portugal Admiral Rosa Coutinho da Majalisar Firayim Minista (PMC) za ta yi mulki. PMC ta ƙunshi wakilai uku, ɗaya daga kowace jam'iyyar Angola da ke kan yarjejeniyar, tare da shugabancin karɓa-karɓa tsakanin wakilan. Kowane shawarar PMC na buƙatar goyon bayan kashi biyu bisa uku. An raba ma'aikatun goma sha biyu a tsakanin jam'iyyun Angola da gwamnatin Portugal, uku na kowanne. Marubucin Witney Wright Schneidman ya soki wannan tanadi a cikin Haɗakar da Afirka: Washington da Faɗuwar Daular Mulkin Mallaka ta Portugal don tabbatar da "gurguwar dabi'a a cikin ikon zartarwa". Ofishin leken asiri da bincike ya yi gargadin cewa wuce gona da iri na son kiyaye daidaiton iko a cikin yarjejeniyar ta hana gwamnatin riƙon kwarya ta Angola damar yin aiki. [1] [2] [3]

PMC ta ƙunshi wakilai uku, ɗaya daga kowace jam'iyyar Angola da ke kan yarjejeniyar, tare da shugabancin karba-karba tsakanin wakilan. Kowane shawarar PMC na buƙatar goyon bayan kashi biyu bisa uku. Ofishin leken asiri da bincike ya yi gargadin cewa wuce gona da iri na son kiyaye daidaiton iko a cikin yarjejeniyar ta hana gwamnatin rikon kwarya ta Angola damar yin aiki. [1] [2] [3]

english_source: The agreement did not establish a mechanism to verify the number of fighters from each force. All three parties soon had forces greater in number than the Portuguese did, which endangered the colonial power's ability to keep the peace. Factional fighting resumed and reached new heights as foreign supplies of arms increased. In February, the Cuban government warned the Eastern Bloc that the Alvor Agreement would not succeed. By spring, the African National Congress and SWAPO echoed Cuba's warning.[6] Leaders of the Organization of African Unity organised a peace conference, moderated by Kenyan President Jomo Kenyatta, with the three leaders in Nakuru, Kenya, in June. The Angolan leaders issued the Nakuru Declaration on 21 June,[7] agreeing to abide by the provisions of the Alvor Agreement while they acknowledged that a mutual lack of trust had led to violence.[3]
target1_text: Yarjejeniyar ba ta samar da hanyar tabbatar da adadin mayakan daga kowace runduna ba. Ba da ɗewa ba dukkan ɓangarorin uku suka sami dakaru da suka fi na Portugal yawansu, wanda hakan ya yi barazana ga ikon mulkin mallaka na kiyaye zaman lafiya. Yakin ɓangaranci ya sake komawa inda ya kai wani matsayi yayin da kayan yaki na ƙasashen waje ke karuwa. A cikin watan Fabrairu, gwamnatin Cuba ta gargaɗi kungiyar Gabashin ƙasar cewa yarjejeniyar Alvor ba za ta yi nasara ba. A lokacin bazara, Majalisar Wakilan Afirka da SWAPO sun yi na'am da gargaɗin Cuba. [1] Shugabannin kungiyar haɗin kan Afrika sun shirya taron zaman lafiya, wanda shugaban ƙasar Kenya Jomo Kenyatta ya jagoranta, tare da shugabannin uku a Nakuru, Kenya, a watan Yuni. Shugabannin Angolan sun ba da sanarwar Nakuru a ranar 21 ga watan Yuni, [2] sun amince da yin biyayya ga tanadin yarjejeniyar Alvor yayin da suka yarda cewa rashin amincewa da juna ya haifar da tashin hankali. [3]

Shugabannin Angolan sun ba da sanarwar Nakuru a ranar 21 ga Yuni, [2] sun amince da yin biyayya ga tanadin yarjejeniyar Alvor yayin da suka yarda cewa rashin amincewa da juna ya haifar da tashin hankali. [3]

english_source: Many analysts have criticised the transitional government in Portugal for the violence that followed the Alvor Agreement in terms of a lack of concern for internal Angolan security and favoritism towards the MPLA. High Commissioner Coutinho, one of the seven leaders of the National Salvation Junta, openly distributed ex-Portuguese arms and military equipment to MPLA forces.[1][8][3] Edward Mulcahy, Acting Assistant Secretary of State for African Affairs in the United States State Department, told Tom Killoran, the US Consul General in Angola, to congratulate the PMC, rather than the FNLA and the UNITA on their own and Coutinho, for Portugal's "untiring and protracted efforts" at a peace agreement.[3][9] US Secretary of State Henry Kissinger considered any government involving the pro-Soviet, communist MPLA, to be unacceptable, but US President Gerald Ford oversaw heightened aid to the FNLA.[10]
target1_text: Manazarta da dama sun soki gwamnatin riƙon kwarya a ƙasar Portugal da tashe-tashen hankula da suka biyo bayan yarjejeniyar Alvor dangane da rashin nuna damuwa ga tsaron cikin gida na Angola da kuma nuna kyama ga jam'iyyar MPLA. Babban Kwamishina Coutinho, ɗaya daga cikin jagororin kungiyar ceto ta ƙasa bakwai, ya fito fili ya raba wa dakarun MPLA makamai da kayan aikin soja na tsohon ɗan Portugal. [1] [2] [3] Edward Mulcahy, Mukaddashin Mataimakin Sakataren Harkokin Wajen Amurka kan Harkokin Afirka a Ma'aikatar Harkokin Wajen Amurka, ya gaya wa Tom Killoran, ƙaramin jakadan Amurka a Angola, ya taya PMC murna, maimakon FNLA da UNITA da kansu da kuma Coutinho, saboda "kokarin da Portugal ta yi ba tare da gajiyawa ba" a yarjejeniyar zaman lafiya. [3] [4] Sakataren harkokin wajen Amurka Henry Kissinger ya yi la'akari da duk wata gwamnati da ta shafi 'yan Soviet masu ra'ayin gurguzu, MPLA, a matsayin abin da ba za a amince da su ba, amma shugaban Amurka Gerald Ford ya sa ido kan kara ba da taimako ga FNLA. [5]

[5]

english_source: The territory of the Congo was created by Belgian colonial rulers that borrowed the name used by the historic Kongo Kingdom. At the time there was no concept of a Congolese people however, as the people living within the region were divided into ethnic groups.[1] Congolese nationalism first erupted in 1959 during riots against Belgian colonial rule.[1] Attempts to solidify the country quickly collapsed after independence when Mobutu Sese Seko rebelled against the government of Patrice Lumumba in 1960.[1] After several years in power Mobutu renamed the country Zaire in 1971 and sought to define and forge a united Zairian nation through his policy of authenticity, that included efforts to purge Christianity from Zaire – for it was deemed colonial.[1] There have been critics of Zairian/Congolese nationalism who believe that it was a manipulative ploy by Mobutu to gain legitimacy for his rule, though this criticism has been challenged by the persistence of a post-Mobutu nationalism after the fall of Mobutu from power and the renaming of the country back to the Democratic Republic of Congo.[1]

english_source: More information about the incident emerged in the weeks that followed the initial reports. An investigation into the deaths ensued and it was discovered that the 11 detainees did not die of drinking foul water, but as a result of violence. The medical examiner said, "They had died from either lung congestion or shock and hemorrhage following multiple bruises and other injuries." The coroner reported, "The injuries of a number of Mau Maus apparently were consistent with their allegations that uncooperative prisoners had been beaten by guards, apparently with the consent of the commandant."[6] A report in the June 1959 edition of Time magazine entitled "The Hola Scandal" described the events. The report stated that, on 3 March 1959, 85 prisoners were marched outside and ordered to work but "dozens of the prisoners fell to the ground, refusing to work" and were beaten by the guards. When the assault had concluded, according to the magazine, 11 prisoners lay dying and another 23 needed hospital treatment.[7]
target1_text: An samu ƙarin bayani game da lamarin a cikin makonnin da suka biyo bayan rahotannin farko. An gudanar da bincike kan mutanen da suka mutu, inda aka gano cewa fursunonin 11 ba su mutu ne da shan ruwa ba, amma sakamakon tashin hankali. Likitan ya ce, "Sun mutu ne daga cunkoson huhu ko firgita da zubar jini sakamakon raunuka da dama da suka samu." Jami’in binciken ya ruwaito cewa, “Raunukan da dama na Mau Maus ya yi daidai da zargin da suke yi na cewa jami’an gadi sun yi wa fursunonin da ba su haɗin kai ba, bisa ga amincewar kwamandan. [1] Wani rahoto a cikin bugu na Yuni 1959 na mujallar Time mai suna "The Hola Scandal" ya bayyana abubuwan da suka faru. Rahoton ya bayyana cewa, a ranar 3 ga watan Maris, 1959, fursunoni 85 ne aka fita waje, aka umurce su da su yi aiki amma “da yawa daga cikin fursunonin sun faɗi ƙasa, sun ki yin aiki” kuma masu gadi suka yi musu duka. Lokacin da aka kawo ƙarshen harin, a cewar mujallar, fursunoni 11 suna mutuwa, wasu 23 kuma suna buƙatar kulawa a asibiti. [2]

english_source: American historian Caroline Elkins covered the Massacre in her 2005 book, Imperial Reckoning: The Untold Story of Britain's Gulag in Kenya. According to Elkins, much of the story of the British and Colonial administration was covered-up during the transition to independence in Kenya, and many official documents had been intentionally destroyed during the transition. Elkins, by carefully tracing available original documents and interviews with surviving Kenyans and colonial staff, indicates that part of Hola Prison was used as a remote punishment camp for 'hard core' Mau Mau insurgents who refused to recant their oaths or affiliation to the movement. Physical and psychological abuse were used to 'break' detainees, so they could be 'rehabilitated' and moved out of the concentration camp pipeline and back to Kikuyu reservations.[8]
target1_text: Masanin tarihin Amurka Caroline Elkins ya rufe Kisan Kisa a cikin littafinta na 2005 mai suna Imperial Reckoning: The Untold Story of Britain's Gulag in Kenya . A cewar Elkins, yawancin tarihin mulkin Birtaniya da na mulkin mallaka an rufe su ne a lokacin mika mulkin kasar Kenya, kuma an lalata wasu takardu da dama da gangan a lokacin mika mulki. Elkins, ta hanyar bin diddigin takardu na asali da kuma hirarraki da 'yan Kenya da suka tsira da ma'aikatan mulkin mallaka, ya nuna cewa an yi amfani da wani yanki na kurkukun Hola a matsayin sansanin horo na nesa don 'hard core' 'yan tawayen Mau Mau wadanda suka ki yin watsi da rantsuwarsu ko alakarsu da yunkurin. An yi amfani da cin zarafi ta jiki da ta hankali don 'karye' fursunonin, don haka za a iya 'gyara' su fita daga bututun sansanin taro a mayar da su wuraren ajiyar Kikuyu. [1]
target2_text: Masanin tarihin Amurka Caroline Elkins ya rufe Kisan Kisa a cikin littafinta na 2005 mai suna Imperial Reckoning: The Untold Story of Britain's Gulag in Kenya. A cewar Elkins, yawancin tarihin 'yan mulkin Birtaniya da na mulkin mallaka an rufe su ne a lokacin miƙa mulkin ƙasar Kenya, kuma an lalata wasu takardu da dama da gangan a lokacin miƙa mulki. Elkins, ta hanyar bin diddigin takardu na asali da kuma hirarraki da 'yan Kenya da suka tsira da ma'aikatan mulkin mallaka, ya nuna cewa an yi amfani da wani yanki na kurkukun Hola a matsayin sansanin horo na nesa don 'hard core' 'yan tawayen Mau Mau waɗanda suka ki yin watsi da rantsuwarsu ko alakarsu da yunkurin. An yi amfani da cin zarafi ta jiki da ta hankali don 'karye' fursunonin, don haka za a iya 'gyara' su fita daga bututun sansanin taro a mayar da su wuraren ajiyar Kikuyu. [1]

english_source: The negative publicity put pressure on the British parliament to take action to salvage Britain's deteriorating image. Colonial detention camps were closed throughout Kenya, and the prisoners were freed soon after.[12] Attempts were then made to find a solution to maintaining British interests in Africa without the use of force, indirectly leading to a hastening of independence across British colonies in Africa.[13] In British novelist Graham Greene's 1960 novel A Burnt-Out Case, "Hola Camp" is listed alongside Sharpeville and Algiers as a site which had justified Africans in "all possible belief in European cruelty."
target1_text: Wannan mummunar tallar ta sanya matsin lamba ga majalisar dokokin Biritaniya da ta ɗauki matakin ceto martabar Burtaniya da ke kara taɓarɓarewa. An rufe sansanonin tsare ‘yan mulkin mallaka a duk faɗin Kenya, kuma an sako fursunonin ba da jimawa ba. [1] Daga nan ne aka yi ƙoƙarin samar da mafita don kiyaye muradun Birtaniyya a Afirka ba tare da amfani da karfin tuwo ba, wanda hakan ya kai ga gaggauta samun ‘yancin kai a duk faɗin ƙasashen Afirka da Birtaniya ta yi wa mulkin mallaka. [2] A cikin littafin marubuci ɗan Burtaniya Graham Greene na 1960 A Burnt-Out Case, "Hola Camp" an jera shi tare da Sharpeville da Algiers a matsayin wani shafi wanda ya ba da hujjar 'yan Afirka a cikin "dukkan yiwuwar yarda da zalunci na Turai."

An rufe sansanonin tsare ‘yan mulkin mallaka a duk fadin Kenya, kuma an sako fursunonin ba da jimawa ba. [1] Daga nan ne aka yi kokarin samar da mafita don kiyaye muradun Birtaniyya a Afirka ba tare da amfani da karfin tuwo ba, wanda hakan ya kai ga gaggauta samun ‘yancin kai a duk fadin kasashen Afirka da Birtaniya ta yi wa mulkin mallaka. english_source: The novel concerns the conflict between the fictional General Haraka, a leader of the Mau Mau, and British forces representing the colonial government, led by Captain Kingsley. Haraka is a former village chief whose disagreement with Kingsley, before the conflict, causes him to consider rebelling against the British.
target1_text: Littafin ya shafi rikicin da ke tsakanin almara Janar Haraka, shugaban Mau Mau, da sojojin Birtaniya da ke wakiltar gwamnatin mulkin mallaka, karkashin jagorancin Kyaftin Kingsley. Haraka tsohon hakimin kauye ne wanda rashin jituwarsa da Kingsley, kafin rikicin, ya sa ya yi tunanin yin tawaye ga Birtaniya.
target2_text: Littafin ya shafi rikicin da ke tsakanin a Janar Haraka, shugaban Mau Mau, da sojojin Birtaniya da ke wakiltar gwamnatin 'yan mulkin mallaka, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Kyaftin Kingsley. Haraka tsohon hakimin ƙauye ne wanda rashin jituwarsa da Kingsley, kafin rikicin, ya sa ya yi tunanin yin tawaye ga Birtaniya.

english_source: Members of the group have taken several foreign citizens hostage in Cabinda. In May 2000, FLEC-FAC kidnapped three foreign and one local employee of a Portuguese contractor who were released in two months.[1]
target1_text: Mambobin kungiyar sun yi garkuwa da wasu ‘yan kasashen waje a Cabinda. A watan Mayun 2000, FLEC-FAC ta yi garkuwa da wasu 'yan kasashen waje uku da ma'aikacin gida daya na wani dan kwangila na kasar Portugal wadanda aka sako cikin watanni biyu. [1]
target2_text: Mambobin ƙungiyar sun yi garkuwa da wasu ‘yan ƙasashen waje a Cabinda. A watan Mayun 2000, FLEC-FAC ta yi garkuwa da wasu 'yan ƙasashen waje uku da ma'aikacin gida ɗaya na wani ɗan kwangila na ƙasar Portugal waɗanda aka sako cikin watanni biyu. [1]

english_source: France has had a large interest in Angola. The French oil giant TotalEnergies which made a new offshore oil discovery in October 2009, has been expanding its presence in Angola. The country is the second largest contributor for production of TotalEnergies after Nigeria.[7] According to Angolan media, France and Portugal will allow extradition of leaders of the separatist movement in the wake of the 2010 attacks on Togo's football team for which FLEC claimed the responsibility.[8]
target1_text: Faransa na da sha'awar Angola sosai. Katafaren kamfanin mai na ƙasar Faransa TotalEnergies wanda ya yi wani sabon binciken mai a teku a watan Oktoban 2009, yana ƙara faɗaɗa kasancewarsa a ƙasar Angola. Ƙasar ita ce kasa ta biyu mafi yawan bayar da gudummawar samar da makamashin TotalEnergies bayan Najeriya. [1] Kafofin yaɗa labaran Angola sun ce Faransa da Portugal za su ba da izinin miƙa shugabannin kungiyar 'yan aware bayan harin da aka kai wa kungiyar kwallon kafa ta Togo a shekara ta 2010 wanda FLEC ta ɗauki alhakinsa. [2]

Kasar ita ce kasa ta biyu mafi yawan bayar da gudummawar samar da makamashin TotalEnergies bayan Najeriya . english_source: As a member of the African Advisory Council, Kaggia campaigned actively against the Nairobi municipal Council apartheid by-laws, which had created separate European, Asian and African areas in Nairobi. Kaggia considered it as one of his biggest achievements that these by-laws were repealed by the Municipal Council.[11]
target1_text: A matsayinta na memba na Majalisar Ba da Shawarwari ta Afirka, Kaggia ta yi kamfen sosai don adawa da dokokin wariyar launin fata na Majalisar karamar hukumar Nairobi, wadda ta haifar da yankuna daban-daban na Turai, Asiya da Afirka a Nairobi. Kaggia ya dauki hakan a matsayin daya daga cikin manyan nasarorin da ya samu cewa majalisar karamar hukumar ta soke wadannan dokokin. [1]
target2_text: A matsayinta na memba na Majalisar Ba da Shawarwari ta Afirka, Kaggia ya yi kamfen sosai don adawa da dokokin wariyar launin fata na Majalisar ƙaramar hukumar Nairobi, wadda ta haifar da yankuna daban-daban na Turai, Asiya da Afirka a Nairobi. Kaggia ya ɗauki hakan a matsayin ɗaya daga cikin manyan nasarorin da ya samu cewa majalisar ƙaramar hukumar ta soke waɗannan dokokin. [1]

english_source: DAG provides demining and anti-poaching services to customers around the world.[4] From 2019, DAG became active in Cabo Delgado, Mozambique, where they helped to fight a local Islamist insurgency. The company was hired by police chief Bernardino Rafael to help train local policemen and fight the rebels.[2][5] Its troops operate and charter out several Bat Hawk light aircraft,[6] and have deployed three Aérospatiale Gazelles, two Eurocopter AS350 Écureuils and one Aérospatiale Alouette III in Cabo Delgado.[7]
target1_text: DAG tana ba da sabis na lalata da hana farauta ga abokan ciniki a duk duniya.[1] Daga 2019, DAG ta zama mai aiki a Cabo Delgado, Mozambique, inda suka taimaka wajen yaki da tayar da kayar baya na Islama. Shugaban 'yan sanda Bernardino Rafael ne ya hayar kamfanin don taimakawa horar da' yan sanda na cikin gida da yaki da 'yan tawaye.[2][3] Sojojinsa suna aiki kuma suna ba da hayar jiragen sama masu sauƙi na Bat Hawk, kuma sun tura Aérospatiale Gazelles guda uku, Eurocopter AS350 Écureuils guda biyu da Aérospaiale Alouette III guda ɗaya a Cabo Delgado.[4][5]
target2_text: DAG tana ba da aiyuka na lalata da hana farauta ga abokan ciniki a duk duniya.[1] Daga 2019, DAG ta zama mai aiki a Cabo Delgado, Mozambique, inda suka taimaka wajen yaki da tayar da kayar baya na Islama. Shugaban 'yan sanda Bernardino Rafael ne ya hayar kamfanin don taimakawa horar da' yan sanda na cikin gida da yaki da 'yan tawaye.[2][3] Sojojinsa suna aiki kuma suna ba da hayar jiragen sama masu sauƙi na Bat Hawk, kuma sun tura Aérospatiale Gazelles guda uku, Eurocopter AS350 Écureuils guda biyu da Aérospaiale Alouette III guda ɗaya a Cabo Delgado.[4][5]

english_source: The Capture of Touggourt was a military operation carried out by the Chaamba tribe against the city of Touggourt during the Mokrani Revolt, in which the French garrison of the city and its commander were massacred. It occurred from May 14–15, 1871.
target1_text: Kame Touggourt wani farmakin soji ne da 'yan ƙabilar Chaamba suka kai wa birnin Touggourt a lokacin tawayen Mokrani, inda aka kashe sojojin Faransa na birnin da kwamandojinsa. Ya faru daga watan Mayu 14-15, 1871.
target2_text: Kame Touggourt wani farmakin soji ne da 'yan kabilar Chaamba suka kai wa birnin Touggourt a lokacin tawayen Mokrani, inda aka kashe sojojin Faransa na birnin da kwamandojinsa. Ya faru daga Mayu 14-15, 1871.

english_source: Bouchoucha was a simple Algerian shepherd who got in trouble with the French for stealing. He managed to escape to Ain Salah, where he joined forces with a tribe called Chaamba, led by Bennacer Benchohra, with them they started a resistance, capturing N’Goussa on 5 March 1871[1] before attacking Ouargla somewhere in March of the same year.[2] their main enemy was a certain Ali Bey, Agha of Touggourt[3] under the French, who had captured the city in 1854, After Ali recognized their authority.[4] After that, they head to the French controlled Touggourt to Capture it, joined by the Chaamba leader Benchohra.[5]
target1_text: Bouchoucha makiyayi ne mai sauki dan ƙasar Aljeriya wanda ya samu matsala da Faransa saboda sata. Ya yi nasarar tserewa zuwa Ain Salah, inda ya haɗa kai da wata ƙabila mai suna Chaamba, ƙarƙashin jagorancin Bennacer Benchohra, tare da su suka fara turjiya, inda suka kame N'Goussa a ranar 5 ga watan Maris 1871 [1] kafin su kai wa Ouargla hari a cikin watan Maris na wannan shekarar. [2] Babban makiyinsu shi ne wani Ali Bey, Agha na Touggourt [3] a ƙarƙashin Faransa, wanda ya kame birnin a shekara ta 1854, Bayan Ali ya gane ikonsu. [4] Bayan haka, sun nufi Touggourt na Faransa da ke iko da shi don kama shi, tare da shugaban Chaamba Benchohra. [5]
target2_text: Bouchoucha makiyayi ne mai sauki dan kasar Aljeriya wanda ya samu matsala da Faransanci saboda sata. Ya yi nasarar tserewa zuwa Ain Salah, inda ya hada kai da wata kabila mai suna Chaamba, karkashin jagorancin Bennacer Benchohra, tare da su suka fara turjiya, inda suka kame N'Goussa a ranar 5 ga Maris 1871 [1] kafin su kai wa Ouargla hari a cikin watan Maris na wannan shekarar. [2] Babban makiyinsu shi ne wani Ali Bey, Agha na Touggourt [3] a karkashin Faransa, wanda ya kame birnin a shekara ta 1854, Bayan Ali ya gane ikonsu. [4] Bayan haka, sun nufi Touggourt na Faransa da ke iko da shi don kama shi, tare da shugaban Chaamba Benchohra. [5]

english_source: According to EASF, completing a first cycle of exercise, the Force reached its Initial Operating Capability (IOC) in late 2009. Parts of this cycle were a Command Post Exercise (CPX) in Nairobi, Kenya in 2008, and a Field Training Exercise (FTX) in Djibouti in November 2009.[15] In the second cycle, EASF first conducted a Logistics Mapping Exercise (LogMAPEX) in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia in November 2010,[16] followed by a second CPX in Khartoum, Sudan in November 2011[17] and a second FTX in Jinja, Uganda in May 2013.[18] The latter involved 1,290 participants (military, police, civilian) and was intended to test EASF's deployment and mission implementation capability.[16] EASF further conducted a CPX in Ethiopia in December 2014, after which its Full Operational Capability was declared. A third FTX took place in November 2017 in Port Sudan, Republic of The Sudan for 1,029 participants drawn from the 10 Member States.
target1_text: A cewar EASF, kammala zagaye na farko na motsa jiki, Sojojin sun kai ga Ikon Ayyuka na Farko (IOC) a ƙarshen 2009. Sashe na wannan sake zagayowar sun kasance Kwamandan Post Exercise (CPX) a Nairobi, Kenya a cikin 2008, da kuma Field Training Exercise,FTX a Djibouti a watan Nuwamba 2009.[1] A cikin sake zagayowar ta biyu, EASF ta fara gudanar da Ayyukan Taswirar Hanyoyi (LogMAPEX) a Addis Ababa, Habasha a watan Nuwamba na shekara ta 2010, sannan CPX na biyu a Khartoum, Sudan a watan Nuwambar shekara ta 2011 [2] da FTX na biyu na Jinja, Uganda a watan Mayu na shekara ta 2013.[3][4] Wannan na ƙarshe ya haɗa da mahalarta 1,290 (soja, 'yan sanda, farar hula) kuma an yi niyyar gwada turawar EASF da ikon aiwatar da manufa.[2] EASF ta ci gaba da gudanar da CPX a Habasha a watan Disamba na shekara ta 2014, bayan haka aka ayyana Cikakken Kwarewar Ayyuka. FTX na uku ya faru a watan Nuwamba na shekara ta 2017 a Port Sudan, Jamhuriyar Sudan don mahalarta 1,029 da aka samo daga kasashe 10 .
